Some((Date(1,January,1772),The first [[traveler's cheque]]s, which can be used in 90 European cities, go on sale in London, England.))

Some((Date(1,January,1949),[[United Nations]] cease-fire takes effect in [[Kashmir]] from one minute before midnight. War between India and [[Pakistan]] stops accordingly.))

Some((Date(2,January,1999),A [[North American blizzard of 1999|brutal snowstorm]] smashes into the [[Midwestern United States]], causing 14 inches (359&nbsp;mm) of snow in [[Milwaukee|Milwaukee, Wisconsin]], and 19 inches (487&nbsp;mm) in [[Chicago]], where temperatures plunge to -13&nbsp;°F (-25&nbsp;°C); 68 deaths are reported.))

Some((Date(2,January,2006),An [[Sago Mine disaster|explosion]] in a coal mine in [[Sago, West Virginia]] traps and kills 12 miners, while leaving one miner in critical condition.))

Some((Date(4,January,1990),In Pakistan's deadliest train accident an overloaded passenger train [[Sukkur rail disaster|collides with an empty freight train]], resulting in 307 deaths and 700 injuries.))

Some((Date(8,January,1961),In France a [[referendum]] supports [[Charles de Gaulle]]'s policies in [[Algeria]].))

Some((Date(8,January,1975),[[Ella T. Grasso]] becomes [[List of Governors of Connecticut|Governor of Connecticut]], the first woman to serve as a Governor in the United States other than by succeeding her husband.))
Some((Date(8,January,1977),[[1977 Moscow bombings|Three bombs]] explode in [[Moscow|Moscow, Russia, Soviet Union]] within 37 minutes, killing seven. The bombings are attributed to an [[Armenians|Armenian]] separatist group.))
Some((Date(8,January,1979),The [[Whiddy Island Disaster|tanker ''Betelgeuse'' explodes]] in [[Bantry Bay]], Ireland.))
Some((Date(8,January,1981),A local farmer reports a [[Trans-en-Provence Case|UFO sighting]] in [[Trans-en-Provence|Trans-en-Provence, France]], claimed to be "perhaps the most completely and carefully documented sighting of all time".))
Some((Date(8,January,1982),[[Breakup of the Bell System]]: [[AT&T Corporation|AT&T]] agrees to divest itself of twenty-two subdivisions.))
Some((Date(8,January,1989),[[Kegworth air disaster]]: [[British Midland International|British Midland]] Flight 92, a [[Boeing 737 Classic|Boeing 737-400]], crashes into the [[M1 motorway]], killing 47 of the 126 people on board.))
Some((Date(8,January,1994),Russian [[Astronaut#Russian|cosmonaut]] [[Valeri Polyakov]] on ''[[Soyuz TM-18]]'' leaves for [[Mir]]. He would stay on the [[space station]] until March 22, 1995, for a record 437 days in space.))
Some((Date(8,January,1996),An [[Antonov An-32]] cargo aircraft [[1996 Air Africa crash|crashes into a crowded market]] in [[Kinshasa]], [[Zaire]], killing up to 237 on the ground; the aircraft's crew of six survive the crash.))

Some((Date(8,January,2003),[[Turkish Airlines Flight 634]] crashes near [[Diyarbakır Airport]], [[Turkey]], killing the entire crew and 70 of 75 passengers.))
Some((Date(8,January,2004),The {{RMS|Queen Mary 2}}, the largest [[passenger ship]] ever built, is christened by her namesake's granddaughter, [[Elizabeth II|Queen Elizabeth II]].))
Some((Date(8,January,2005),The nuclear sub {{USS|San Francisco|SSN-711|6}} collides at full speed with an undersea mountain south of [[Guam]]. One man is killed, but the sub surfaces and is repaired.))
Some((Date(8,January,2009),A 6.1-magnitude [[2009 Costa Rica earthquake|earthquake]] in northern [[Costa Rica]] kills 15 people and injures 32.))
Some((Date(8,January,2010),Gunmen from an offshoot the [[Front for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda]] [[Togo national football team attack|attacked]] the bus carrying the [[Togo national football team]] on its way to the [[2010 Africa Cup of Nations]], killing three.))

Some((Date(16,January,1964),[[Hello, Dolly! (musical)]] starring Carol Channing opened on Broadway, beginning a run of 2,844 performances.))
Some((Date(16,January,1969),[[Czechs|Czech]] student [[Jan Palach]] commits suicide by [[self-immolation]] in [[Prague|Prague, Czechoslovakia]], in protest against the [[Soviet Union|Soviet]]s' crushing of the [[Prague Spring]] the year before.))
Some((Date(16,January,1970),[[Buckminster Fuller]] receives the [[AIA Gold Medal|Gold Medal]] award from the [[American Institute of Architects]].))
Some((Date(16,January,1979),The [[Mohammad Reza Pahlavi|last Iranian Shah]] flees [[Iran]] with his family for good and relocates to [[Egypt]].))
Some((Date(16,January,1986),First meeting of the [[Internet Engineering Task Force]].))
Some((Date(16,January,1991),The Coalition Forces go to war with [[Iraq]], beginning the [[Gulf War]] (U.S. Time).))
Some((Date(16,January,1992),[[El Salvador]] officials and rebel leaders sign the [[Chapultepec Peace Accords]] in [[Mexico City|Mexico City, Mexico]] ending the 12-year [[Salvadoran Civil War]] that claimed at least 75,000 lives.))
Some((Date(16,January,2001),[[Democratic Republic of the Congo|Congolese]] President [[Laurent-Désiré Kabila]] is assassinated by one of his own bodyguards.))
Some((Date(16,January,2002),The [[United Nations Security Council|UN Security Council]] unanimously establishes an arms embargo and the freezing of assets of [[Osama bin Laden]], [[al-Qaeda]], and the remaining members of the [[Taliban]].))
Some((Date(16,January,2003),The [[Space Shuttle Columbia|Space Shuttle ''Columbia'']] takes off for mission [[STS-107]] which would be its final one. ''Columbia'' disintegrated 16 days later on re-entry.))
Some((Date(16,January,2005),Romanian university lecturer and novelist [[Adriana Iliescu]] gives birth at 66 to her daughter Eliza, breaking the record for the oldest birth mother in the world))
Some((Date(16,January,2006),[[Ellen Johnson Sirleaf]] is sworn in as [[Liberia]]'s new [[president]]. She becomes Africa's first female elected head of state.))
Some((Date(16,January,2013),An estimated 41 international workers are [[In Aménas hostage crisis|taken hostage]] in an attack in the town of [[In Aménas]], Algeria.

Some((Date(17,January,1377),[[Pope Gregory XI]] moves the Papacy back to Rome from [[Avignon]].))
Some((Date(17,January,1524),[[Giovanni da Verrazzano]] sets sail westward from [[Madeira]] to find a sea route to the Pacific Ocean.))

Some((Date(17,January,1595),[[Henry IV of France]] declares war on Spain.))
Some((Date(17,January,1608),Emperor [[Susenyos I]] of Ethiopia surprises an [[Oromo people|Oromo]] army at Ebenat; his army reportedly kills 12,000 Oromo at the cost of 400 of his men.))
Some((Date(17,January,1648),England's [[Long Parliament]] passes the "[[Vote of No Addresses]]", breaking off negotiations with [[Charles I of England|King Charles I]] and thereby setting the scene for the second phase of the [[English Civil War]].))
Some((Date(17,January,1773),Captain [[James Cook]] and his crew become the first Europeans to sail below the [[Antarctic Circle]].))
Some((Date(17,January,1799),[[Malta|Maltese]] patriot [[Dun Mikiel Xerri]], along with a number of other patriots, is executed.))
Some((Date(17,January,1811),[[Mexican War of Independence]]: In the [[Battle of Calderón Bridge]], a heavily outnumbered [[History of Spain (1814–73)|Spanish]] force of 6,000 troops defeats nearly 100,000 Mexican revolutionaries.))

Some((Date(17,January,1873),A group of [[Modoc people|Modoc]] warriors defeats the [[United States Army]] in the [[First Battle of the Stronghold]], part of the [[Modoc War]].))
Some((Date(17,January,1885),A British force defeats a large [[Dervish]] army at the [[Battle of Abu Klea]] in the [[Sudan]].))
Some((Date(17,January,1899),The United States takes possession of [[Wake Island]] in the Pacific Ocean.))
Some((Date(17,January,1903),[[El Yunque National Forest]] in [[Puerto Rico]] becomes part of the United States [[National Forest System]] as the Luquillo Forest Reserve.))
Some((Date(17,January,1904),[[Anton Chekhov]]'s ''[[The Cherry Orchard]]'' receives its premiere performance at the [[Moscow Art Theatre]].))

Some((Date(17,January,1917),The United States pays Denmark {{$}}25 million for the [[United States Virgin Islands|Virgin Islands]].))
Some((Date(17,January,1918),[[Finnish Civil War]]: The first serious battles take place between the [[Red Guards (Finland)|Red Guards]] and the [[White Guard (Finland)|White Guard]].))

Some((Date(17,January,1943),[[World War II]]: [[Greek submarine Papanikolis (Y-2)|Greek submarine Papanikolis]] captures the 200-ton sailing vessel ''Agios Stefanos'' and mans her with part of her crew.))
Some((Date(17,January,1944),World War II: [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] forces launch the first of [[Battle of Monte Cassino|four assaults]] on [[Monte Cassino]] with the intention of breaking through the [[Winter Line]] and seizing Rome, an effort that would ultimately take four months and cost 105,000 Allied casualties.))
Some((Date(17,January,1945),World War II: [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] forces capture the almost completely destroyed Polish city of [[Warsaw]].))
Some((Date(17,January,1946),The [[UN Security Council]] holds its first session.))
Some((Date(17,January,1949),''[[The Goldbergs (broadcast series)|The Goldbergs]]'', the first [[Situation comedy|sitcom]] on American television, airs for the first time.))
Some((Date(17,January,1950),The [[Great Brink's Robbery]]: Eleven thieves steal more than {{$}}2 million from an armored car company's offices in [[Boston]].))
Some((Date(17,January,1961),U.S. President [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]] delivers a televised [[Eisenhower's farewell address|farewell address to the nation]] three days before leaving office, in which he warns against the accumulation of power by the "[[military–industrial complex]]" as well as the dangers of massive spending, especially deficit spending.))
Some((Date(17,January,1966),[[1966 Palomares B-52 crash|Palomares incident]]: A [[B-52 Stratofortress|B-52]] bomber collides with a [[KC-135 Stratotanker]] over Spain, killing seven airmen, and dropping three 70-kiloton [[B28 nuclear bomb|nuclear bombs]] near the town of [[Palomares, Almería|Palomares]] and another one into the sea.))
Some((Date(17,January,1969),[[Black Panther Party]] members [[Bunchy Carter]] and [[John Huggins]] are killed during a meeting in Campbell Hall on the campus of [[UCLA]].))
Some((Date(17,January,1977),Convicted murderer [[Gary Gilmore]] is [[Execution by firing squad|executed by a firing squad]] in [[Utah]], ending a ten-year moratorium on [[capital punishment]] in the United States.))
Some((Date(17,January,1981),[[President of the Philippines]] [[Ferdinand Marcos]] lifts [[Martial law in the Philippines|martial law]] eight years and five months after declaring it.))
Some((Date(17,January,1982),"[[Cold Sunday]]": in numerous cities in the United States temperatures fall to their lowest levels in over 100 years.))
Some((Date(17,January,1983),The tallest department store in the world, [[Hudson's]] flagship store in downtown [[Detroit]], closes due to high cost of operating.))
Some((Date(17,January,1991),[[Gulf War]]: [[Operation Desert Storm]] begins early in the morning. [[Iraq]] fires eight [[Scud]] missiles into [[Israel]] in an unsuccessful bid to provoke Israeli retaliation.))
Some((Date(17,January,1992),During a visit to South Korea, [[Prime Minister of Japan|Japanese Prime Minister]] [[Kiichi Miyazawa]] apologizes for forcing Korean women into [[Comfort women|sexual slavery]] during World War II.))
Some((Date(17,January,1994),[[1994 Northridge earthquake]]: A magnitude 6.7 earthquake hits [[Northridge, California]].))
Some((Date(17,January,1995),The [[Great Hanshin earthquake]]: A magnitude 7.3 earthquake occurs near [[Kobe]], Japan, causing extensive property damage and killing 6,434 people.))
Some((Date(17,January,1996),The Czech Republic applies for membership of the [[European Union]].))
Some((Date(17,January,1997),Cape Canaveral Air Force Station: A [[Delta 2]] carrying a [[Global Positioning System|GPS2R]] satellite explodes 13 seconds after launch, dropping 250 tons of burning rocket remains around the launch pad.))
Some((Date(17,January,1998),[[Lewinsky scandal]]: [[Matt Drudge]] breaks the story of the [[Bill Clinton]]–[[Monica Lewinsky]] affair on his website ''[[The Drudge Report]]''.))
Some((Date(17,January,2002),[[Mount Nyiragongo]] erupts in the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]], displacing an estimated 400,000 people.))
Some((Date(17,January,2007),The [[Doomsday Clock]] is set to five minutes to midnight in response to [[North Korea]] nuclear testing.))
Some((Date(17,January,2008),[[British Airways Flight 38]] crash lands just short of [[London Heathrow Airport]] in England with no fatalities. It is the first complete [[Write-off|hull loss]] of a [[Boeing 777]].))
Some((Date(17,January,2010),[[2010 Jos riots|Rioting]] begins between Muslim and Christian groups in [[Jos]], [[Nigeria]], resulting in at least 200 deaths.

Some((Date(18,January,1981),Phil Smith and Phil Mayfield parachute off a Houston skyscraper, becoming the first two people to [[BASE jumping|BASE jump]] from objects in all four categories: buildings, antennae, spans (bridges), and earth (cliffs).))

Some((Date(20,January,1921),[[Turkish Constitution of 1921|The first Constitution of Turkey]] is adopted, making fundamental changes in the source and exercise of sovereignty by consecrating the principle of [[national sovereignty]].))
Some((Date(20,January,1929),''[[In Old Arizona]]'', the first full-length talking motion picture filmed outdoors, is released.))
Some((Date(20,January,1936),[[Edward VIII]] becomes King of the United Kingdom.))
Some((Date(20,January,1941),A German officer is murdered in [[Bucharest]], [[Romania]], sparking a [[Legionnaires' rebellion and Bucharest pogrom|rebellion and pogrom]] by the [[Iron Guard]], killing 125 Jews and 30 soldiers.))
Some((Date(20,January,1942),[[World War II]]: At the [[Wannsee Conference]] held in the Berlin suburb of [[Wannsee]], senior [[Nazi Germany|Nazi German]] officials discuss the implementation of the "[[Final Solution]] to the [[Jewish question]]".))
Some((Date(20,January,1945),World War II: The [[Béla Miklós|Miklós provisional government]] of Hungary agrees to an [[armistice]] with the [[Allies of World War II|Allies]].))
Some((Date(20,January,1949),[[Point Four Program]] a program for [[economic aid]] to poor countries announced by United States President [[Harry S. Truman]] in his [[inaugural address]] for a full term as President.))
Some((Date(20,January,1954),In the United States, the [[National Negro Network]] is established with 40 charter member radio stations.))
Some((Date(20,January,1959),The first flight of the [[Vickers Vanguard]].))
Some((Date(20,January,1960),[[Hendrik Verwoerd]] announces a plebiscite on whether South Africa should become a Republic.))
Some((Date(20,January,1969),[[East Pakistan]]i police kill student activist [[Amanullah Asaduzzaman]]. The resulting outrage is in part responsible for the [[Bangladesh Liberation War]].))
Some((Date(20,January,1972),Pakistan launched its [[Pakistan and weapons of mass destruction|Nuclear weapons program]] few weeks after its defeat in [[Bangladesh Liberation War]] and [[Indo-Pakistani War of 1971]].))
Some((Date(20,January,1981),Twenty minutes after [[Ronald Reagan]] is inaugurated, [[Iran]] releases 52 [[Iran hostage crisis|American hostages]].))
Some((Date(20,January,1986),In the United States, [[Martin Luther King, Jr.]] Day is celebrated as a [[Martin Luther King, Jr. Day|federal holiday]] for the first time.))
Some((Date(20,January,1987),[[Church of England]] envoy [[Terry Waite]] is kidnapped in [[Lebanon]].))
Some((Date(20,January,1990),The [[Red Army]] crackdown on civil protests in [[Baku]], [[Azerbaijan]] during [[dissolution of the Soviet Union|the dissolution of the Soviet Union]]. Also known as [[Black January]]. ))
Some((Date(20,January,1991),[[Sudan]]'s government imposes [[Sharia|Islamic law]] nationwide, worsening the [[Second Sudanese Civil War|civil war]] between the country's Muslim north and Christian south.))
Some((Date(20,January,1992),[[Air Inter Flight 148]], an [[Airbus A320-111]], crashes into a mountain near [[Strasbourg]], France killing 87 of the 96 people on board. A design flaw in the computer mode selection system resulted in the crew selecting the wrong rate of descent.))
Some((Date(20,January,1999),The [[China News Service]] announces new government restrictions on Internet use, aimed especially at [[Internet café]]s.))
Some((Date(20,January,2001),[[President of the Philippines]] [[Joseph Estrada]] is ousted in a [[2001 EDSA Revolution|nonviolent 4-day revolution]], and is succeeded by [[Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo]].))
Some((Date(20,January,2006),Witnesses report seeing a [[bottlenose whale]] [[River Thames whale|swimming in the River Thames]], the first time the species had been seen in the [[River Thames|Thames]] since records began in 1913.))
Some((Date(20,January,2007),A three-man team, using only [[kite skiing|skis and kites]], completes a {{convert|1093|mi|km|adj=on}} trek to reach the southern [[pole of inaccessibility]] for the first time since 1958 and for the first time ever without mechanical assistance.))
Some((Date(20,January,2009),A protest movement in [[Iceland]] culminates as the [[2009 Icelandic financial crisis protests]] start.

Some((Date(21,January,1525),The [[Switzerland|Swiss]] [[Anabaptist]] Movement is founded when [[Conrad Grebel]], [[Felix Manz]], [[George Blaurock]], and about a dozen others baptize each other in the home of Manz's mother in [[Zürich]], breaking a thousand-year tradition of church-state union.))
Some((Date(21,January,1535),Following the [[Affair of the Placards]], French Protestants are burned at the stake in front of the Cathedral of [[Notre Dame de Paris]]))
Some((Date(21,January,1720),Sweden and [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussia]] sign the [[Treaty of Stockholm (Great Northern War)|Treaty of Stockholm]].))
Some((Date(21,January,1749),The [[Teatro Filarmonico]] in Verona is destroyed by fire. It is rebuilt in 1754.))
Some((Date(21,January,1774),[[Abdul Hamid I]] became [[Sultan of the Ottoman Empire]] and [[Caliph of Islam]].))
Some((Date(21,January,1789),The first American novel, [[The Power of Sympathy|''The Power of Sympathy or the Triumph of Nature Founded in Truth'']], is printed in [[Boston]].))
Some((Date(21,January,1793),After being found guilty of treason by the French [[National Convention]], [[Louis XVI of France]] is executed by [[guillotine]].))

Some((Date(21,January,1861),[[American Civil War]]: [[Jefferson Davis]] resigns from the [[United States Senate]].))
Some((Date(21,January,1864),The [[Tauranga Campaign]] begins during the [[New Zealand Wars]].))
Some((Date(21,January,1887),A total of {{Convert|465|mm|in}} rain falls in [[Brisbane]], a record for any Australian capital city.))
Some((Date(21,January,1893),The [[Tati Concessions Land]], formerly part of [[Matabeleland]], is formally annexed to the [[Bechuanaland Protectorate]], now [[Botswana]].))
Some((Date(21,January,1899),[[Opel]] manufactures its first automobile.))
Some((Date(21,January,1908),New York City passes the [[Sullivan Ordinance]], making it illegal for women to smoke in public, only to have the measure vetoed by the mayor.))
Some((Date(21,January,1911),The first [[Monte Carlo Rally]] takes place.))
Some((Date(21,January,1915),[[Kiwanis International]] is founded in [[Detroit]].))
Some((Date(21,January,1919),Meeting of the First [[Dáil Éireann]] in the [[Mansion House, Dublin|Mansion House]] [[Dublin]]. [[Sinn Féin]] adopts Ireland's first constitution. The first engagement of [[Irish War of Independence]], [[Soloheadbeg Ambush]], [[County Tipperary]].))
Some((Date(21,January,1925),[[Albania]] declares itself a republic.))
Some((Date(21,January,1931),Sir [[Isaac Isaacs]] is sworn in as the first Australian-born [[Governor-General of Australia]].))
Some((Date(21,January,1941),Sparked by the murder of a German officer in [[Bucharest]], [[Romania]], the day before, members of the [[Iron Guard]] engaged in a [[Legionnaires' rebellion and Bucharest pogrom|rebellion and pogrom]] killing 125 Jews.))
Some((Date(21,January,1948),The [[Flag of Quebec]] is adopted and flown for the first time over the [[National Assembly of Quebec]]. The day is marked annually as Québec Flag Day.))
Some((Date(21,January,1950),American lawyer and government official [[Alger Hiss]] is convicted of [[perjury]].))
Some((Date(21,January,1954),The first [[nuclear marine propulsion|nuclear-powered]] submarine, the {{USS|Nautilus|SSN-571|6}}, is [[ceremonial ship launching|launched]] in [[Groton, Connecticut]] by [[Mamie Eisenhower]], the [[First Lady of the United States]].))
Some((Date(21,January,1958),The last [[Fokker C.X]] in military service, the [[Finnish Air Force]] FK-111 target tower, crashes, killing the pilot and winch-operator.))
Some((Date(21,January,1960),[[Little Joe 1B]], a [[Project Mercury|Mercury]] spacecraft, lifts off from [[Wallops Island]], [[Virginia]] with [[Miss Sam]], a female [[rhesus macaque|rhesus monkey]] on board.))
Some((Date(21,January,1961),Four hundred thirty-five workers are buried alive when a mine in [[Coalbrook, Free State]] collapses.))
Some((Date(21,January,1971),The current [[Emley Moor transmitting station]], the tallest free-standing structure in the United Kingdom, begins transmitting [[UHF]] broadcasts.))
Some((Date(21,January,1976),Commercial service of ''[[Concorde]]'' begins with the [[Concorde#Scheduled flights|London-Bahrain and Paris-Rio]] routes.))
Some((Date(21,January,1977),United States President [[Jimmy Carter]] pardons nearly all American [[Vietnam War]] draft evaders, some of whom had emigrated to Canada.))
Some((Date(21,January,1981),Production of the iconic [[DeLorean DMC-12]] sports car begins in [[Dunmurry]], [[Northern Ireland]].))
Some((Date(21,January,1997),The [[U.S. House of Representatives]] votes 395–28 to reprimand [[Newt Gingrich]] for ethics violations, making him the first Speaker of the House to be so disciplined.))
Some((Date(21,January,1999),[[War on Drugs]]: In one of the largest drug busts in American history, the [[United States Coast Guard]] intercepts a ship with over {{convert|4300|kg|lb}} of [[cocaine]] on board.))
Some((Date(21,January,2000),[[Ecuador]]: After the Ecuadorian Congress is seized by indigenous organizations, Col. [[Lucio Gutiérrez]], Carlos Solorzano and Antonio Vargas depose President [[Jamil Mahuad]].  Gutierrez is later replaced by Gen. Carlos Mendoza, who resigns and allows Vice-President [[Gustavo Noboa]] to succeed Mahuad.))
Some((Date(21,January,2003),A 7.6 magnitude [[2003 Colima earthquake|earthquake]] strikes the Mexican state of [[Colima]], killing 29 and leaving approximately 10,000 people homeless.))
Some((Date(21,January,2004),[[NASA]]'s [[MER-A]] (the Mars Rover ''Spirit'') ceases communication with mission control. The problem lies in the management of its [[flash memory]] and is fixed remotely from Earth on February 6.))
Some((Date(21,January,2005),In [[Belmopan]], [[Belize]], the [[Unrest in Belize in 2005|unrest over the government's new taxes]] erupts into [[riot]]s.

Some((Date(22,January,1824),The [[Ashantis]] defeat British forces in the [[Gold Coast (British colony)|Gold Coast]].))

Some((Date(22,January,1877),[[Arthur Tooth]], an [[Anglicanism|Anglican]] [[clergyman]] is taken into custody after being prosecuted for using [[Ritualism|ritualist]] practices.))

Some((Date(22,January,1906),{{SS|Valencia}} runs aground on rocks on [[Vancouver Island]], [[British Columbia]], killing more than 130.))
Some((Date(22,January,1915),Over 600 people are killed in [[Guadalajara]], Mexico, when a train [[Guadalajara train disaster|plunges off the tracks]] into a deep canyon.))

Some((Date(22,January,1924),[[Ramsay MacDonald]] becomes the first [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom]].))
Some((Date(22,January,1927),[[Teddy Wakelam]] gives the first live radio commentary of a [[association football|football]] match anywhere in the world, between [[Arsenal F.C.]] and [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] at [[Arsenal Stadium|Highbury]].))
Some((Date(22,January,1941),[[World War II]]: [[British Empire|British]] and [[Commonwealth of Nations|Commonwealth]] troops capture [[Tobruk]] from [[Regio Esercito|Italian forces]] during [[Operation Compass#Tobruk|Operation Compass]].))
Some((Date(22,January,1944),World War II: The [[Allies of World War II|Allies]] commence [[Operation Shingle]], an assault on [[Anzio]] and [[Nettuno]], Italy.))
Some((Date(22,January,1946),In [[Iran]], [[Qazi Muhammad]] declares the independent people's [[Republic of Mahabad]] at [[Chahar Cheragh Square]] in the Kurdish city of [[Mahabad]]. He is the new president and [[Haji Baba Sheikh]] is the [[prime minister]].))

Some((Date(22,January,1957),[[Israel]] withdraws from the [[Sinai Peninsula]].))
Some((Date(22,January,1959),[[Knox Mine disaster]]: Water breaches the River Slope Mine near [[Pittston, Pennsylvania]] in [[Port Griffith, Pennsylvania|Port Griffith]]; 12 miners are killed.))

Some((Date(22,January,1963),The [[Élysée Treaty]] of cooperation between France and Germany is signed by [[Charles de Gaulle]] and [[Konrad Adenauer]].))
Some((Date(22,January,1968),[[Apollo 5]] lifts off carrying the first [[Lunar module]] into space.))
Some((Date(22,January,1969),A gunman attempts to [[Brezhnev assassination attempt|assassinate Soviet leader Leonid Brezhnev]].))
Some((Date(22,January,1970),The [[Boeing 747]], the world's first "jumbo jet", enters commercial service for launch customer [[Pan American Airways]] with its maiden voyage from [[John F. Kennedy International Airport]] to [[London Heathrow Airport]].))
Some((Date(22,January,1971),The [[Singapore Declaration]], one of the two most important documents to the [[uncodified constitution]] of the [[Commonwealth of Nations]], is issued.))
Some((Date(22,January,1973),The [[Supreme Court of the United States]] delivers its decisions in [[Roe v. Wade]] and [[Doe v. Bolton]], legalizing elective [[abortion]] in all fifty states.))
Some((Date(22,January,1984),The [[Apple Macintosh]], the first consumer computer to popularize the [[computer mouse]] and the [[graphical user interface]], is introduced during Super Bowl XVIII with its famous ''"[[1984 (advertisement)|1984]]"'' [[television commercial]].))
Some((Date(22,January,1987),[[Pennsylvania]] politician [[R. Budd Dwyer]] shoots and kills himself during a televised [[press conference]], leading to debates on boundaries in journalism.))
Some((Date(22,January,1990),[[Robert Tappan Morris]] is convicted of releasing the [[Morris worm|1988 Internet Computer worm]].))
Some((Date(22,January,1991),[[Gulf War]]: Three [[Scud]]s and one [[Patriot missile]] hit [[Ramat Gan]] in [[Israel]], injuring 96 people. Three elderly people die of heart attacks.))
Some((Date(22,January,1992),Rebel forces occupy [[Zaire]]'s national radio station in [[Kinshasa]] and broadcast a demand for the government's resignation.))
Some((Date(22,January,1995),[[Israeli–Palestinian conflict]]: [[Beit Lid massacre]]: In central [[Israel]], near [[Netanya]], two [[suicide bomber]]s from the [[Gaza Strip]] blow themselves up at a military transit point killing 19 Israelis.))
Some((Date(22,January,1999),Australian missionary [[Graham Staines]] and his two sons are burned alive by radical Hindus while sleeping in their car in Eastern India.))
Some((Date(22,January,2002),[[Kmart]] becomes the largest retailer in United States history to file for [[Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection]].))
Some((Date(22,January,2006),[[Evo Morales]] is inaugurated as President of [[Bolivia]], becoming the country's first indigenous president.))
Some((Date(22,January,2006),[[Kobe Bryant]] of the [[Los Angeles Lakers]] scores 81 points in an NBA game versus the [[Toronto Raptors]], the second highest total in NBA history.))
Some((Date(22,January,2007),At least 88 people are killed when [[22 January 2007 Baghdad bombings|two car bombs]] explode in the [[Bab Al-Sharqi]] market in central [[Baghdad]], [[Iraq]].))
Some((Date(22,January,2010),[[Conan O'Brien]] performs his last [[Tonight Show]] on [[NBC]] as a part of the [[2010 Tonight Show conflict]].))
Some((Date(22,January,2015),An [[Donetsk bus shelling incident|explosion]] near a civilian trolleybus in the city of [[Donetsk]] kills at least thirteen people.

Some((Date(23,January,1264),In the conflict between King [[Henry III of England]] and his rebellious barons led by [[Simon de Montfort, 6th Earl of Leicester|Simon de Montfort]], King [[Louis IX of France]] issues the [[Mise of Amiens]], a one-sided decision in favour of Henry that later leads to the [[Second Barons' War]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1368),In a coronation ceremony, [[Zhu Yuanzhang]] ascends the [[Emperor of China|throne of China]] as the [[Hongwu Emperor]], initiating [[Ming dynasty]] rule over China that would last for three centuries.))
Some((Date(23,January,1546),Having published nothing for eleven years, [[François Rabelais]] publishes the ''Tiers Livre'', his sequel to ''[[Gargantua and Pantagruel]]''.))
Some((Date(23,January,1556),The deadliest [[earthquake]] in history, the [[1556 Shaanxi earthquake|Shaanxi earthquake]], hits [[Shaanxi]] province, China. The death toll may have been as high as 830,000.))
Some((Date(23,January,1570),[[James Stewart, 1st Earl of Moray]], [[regent]] for the infant King [[James VI of Scotland]], is assassinated by firearm, the first recorded instance of such.))
Some((Date(23,January,1571),The [[Royal Exchange, London|Royal Exchange]] opens in London.))
Some((Date(23,January,1579),The [[Union of Utrecht]] forms a [[Protestantism|Protestant]] republic in the Netherlands.))
Some((Date(23,January,1656),[[Blaise Pascal]] publishes the first of his ''[[Lettres provinciales]]''.))
Some((Date(23,January,1719),The [[Principality]] of [[Liechtenstein]] is created within the [[Holy Roman Empire]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1789),[[Georgetown University|Georgetown College]], the first [[Catholic university]] in the United States, is founded in [[Georgetown (Washington, D.C.)|Georgetown, Maryland]] (now a part of Washington, D.C.)))
Some((Date(23,January,1793),[[Second Partition of Poland]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1795), After an extraordinary charge across the frozen [[Zuiderzee]], the French cavalry [[Capture of the Dutch fleet at Den Helder|captured 14 Dutch ships and 850 guns]], in a rare occurrence of a battle between ships and cavalry))
Some((Date(23,January,1849),[[Elizabeth Blackwell]] is awarded her M.D. by the [[Geneva Medical College]] of [[Geneva, New York]], becoming the United States' first female doctor.))
Some((Date(23,January,1855),The [[1855 Wairarapa earthquake]] and tsunami leaves nine dead in New Zealand.))
Some((Date(23,January,1855),The first bridge over the [[Mississippi River]] opens in what is now [[Minneapolis]], a crossing made today by the [[Hennepin Avenue Bridge]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1870),In [[Montana]], U.S. cavalrymen kill 173 [[Native Americans in the United States|Native Americans]], mostly women and children, in what becomes known as the [[Marias Massacre]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1879),[[Anglo-Zulu War]]: the [[Battle of Rorke's Drift]] ends.))
Some((Date(23,January,1897),[[Elva Zona Heaster]] is found dead in [[Greenbrier County, West Virginia]]. The resulting murder trial of her husband is perhaps the only case in United States history where the alleged testimony of a ghost helped secure a conviction.))
Some((Date(23,January,1899),The [[Malolos Constitution]] is inaugurated, establishing the [[First Philippine Republic]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1900),[[Second Boer War]]: The [[Battle of Spion Kop]] between the forces of the [[South African Republic]] and the [[Orange Free State]] and British forces ends in a British defeat.))
Some((Date(23,January,1904),[[Ålesund Fire]]: the Norwegian coastal town [[Ålesund]] is devastated by fire, leaving 10,000 people homeless and one person dead. [[Kaiser]] [[Wilhelm II, German Emperor|Wilhelm II]] funds the rebuilding of the town in [[Art Nouveau|Jugendstil]] style.))
Some((Date(23,January,1909),{{RMS|Republic|1903|6}}, a passenger ship of the [[White Star Line]], becomes the first ship to use the [[CQD]] distress signal after colliding with another ship, the SS ''Florida'', off the Massachusetts coastline, an event that kills six people.  The ''Republic'' sinks the next day.))
Some((Date(23,January,1912),The [[International Opium Convention]] is signed at [[The Hague]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1920),The Netherlands refuses to surrender the exiled [[Wilhelm II, German Emperor|Kaiser Wilhelm II]] of Germany to the [[Allies of World War I|Allies]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1937),In Moscow, 17 leading [[Communist]]s go on trial accused of participating in a plot led by [[Leon Trotsky]] to overthrow [[Joseph Stalin]]'s regime and assassinate its leaders.))
Some((Date(23,January,1941),[[Charles Lindbergh]] testifies before the [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] and recommends that the United States negotiate a neutrality pact with [[Adolf Hitler]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1942),[[World War II]]: The [[Battle of Rabaul (1942)|Battle of Rabaul]] begins, the first fighting of the [[New Guinea campaign]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1943),World War II: Troops of [[Bernard Montgomery, 1st Viscount Montgomery of Alamein|Montgomery]]'s [[Eighth Army (United Kingdom)|Eighth Army]] capture [[Tripoli]] in [[Libya]] from the [[German–Italian Panzer Army]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1945),World War II: German admiral [[Karl Dönitz]] launches [[Operation Hannibal]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1950),The [[Knesset]] passes a resolution that states [[Jerusalem]] is the capital of [[Israel]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1957),American inventor [[Walter Frederick Morrison]] sells the rights to his [[flying disc]] to the [[Wham-O]] toy company, which later renames it the "Frisbee".))
Some((Date(23,January,1958),After a general uprising and rioting in the streets, [[President of Venezuela|President]] [[Marcos Pérez Jiménez]] leaves [[Venezuela]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1960),The [[bathyscaphe]] [[Bathyscaphe Trieste|USS ''Trieste'']] breaks a depth record by descending to {{Convert|10911|m|ft}} in the Pacific Ocean.))
Some((Date(23,January,1961),The Portuguese luxury [[cruise ship]] ''Santa Maria'' is [[Santa Maria hijacking|hijacked]] by opponents of the [[Estado Novo (Portugal)|Estado Novo]] regime with the intention of waging war until dictator [[António de Oliveira Salazar]] is overthrown.))
Some((Date(23,January,1963),The [[Guinea-Bissau War of Independence]] officially begins when [[PAIGC]] guerrilla fighters attack the Portuguese army stationed in [[Tite (Guinea-Bissau)|Tite]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1964),The [[Twenty-fourth Amendment to the United States Constitution|24th Amendment]] to the [[United States Constitution]], prohibiting the use of [[Poll tax (United States)|poll taxes]] in national elections, is ratified.))
Some((Date(23,January,1967),[[Diplomatic relations]] between the [[Soviet Union]] and [[Ivory Coast]] are established.))
Some((Date(23,January,1968),[[North Korea]] seizes the {{USS|Pueblo|AGER-2|6}}, claiming the ship had violated its [[territorial waters]] while spying.))
Some((Date(23,January,1973),United States President [[Richard Nixon]] announces that a peace accord has been reached in [[Vietnam]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1986),The [[Rock and Roll Hall of Fame]] inducts its first members: [[Little Richard]], [[Chuck Berry]], [[James Brown]], [[Ray Charles]], [[Fats Domino]], [[The Everly Brothers]], [[Buddy Holly]], [[Jerry Lee Lewis]] and [[Elvis Presley]].))
Some((Date(23,January,1997),[[Madeleine Albright]] becomes the first woman to serve as [[United States Secretary of State]].))
Some((Date(23,January,2001),Five people attempt to [[Tiananmen Square self-immolation incident|set themselves on fire]] in Beijing's [[Tiananmen Square]], an act that many people later claim is staged by the [[Communist Party of China]] to frame [[Falun Gong]] and thus escalate their [[persecution of Falun Gong|persecution]].))

Some((Date(23,January,2014),A [[L'Isle-Verte nursing home fire|fire breaks out]] in a [[L'Isle Verte, Quebec]] elderly home, killing 28 people.

Some((Date(24,January,1900),[[Second Boer War]]: [[Boer]]s stop a British attempt to break the [[Siege of Ladysmith]] in the [[Battle of Spion Kop]].))
Some((Date(24,January,1908),The first [[Boy Scout]] troop is organized in England by [[Robert Baden-Powell]].))
Some((Date(24,January,1911),Japanese anarchist [[Shūsui Kōtoku]] is hanged for treason in a case now considered a [[miscarriage of justice]].))
Some((Date(24,January,1915),[[World War One]]: British [[Grand Fleet]] battle cruisers under Vice-Admiral Sir [[David Beatty, 1st Earl Beatty|David Beatty]] engage Rear-Admiral [[Franz von Hipper]]'s battle cruisers in the [[Battle of Dogger Bank (1915)|Battle of Dogger Bank]].))
Some((Date(24,January,1916),In ''[[Brushaber v. Union Pacific Railroad Co.]]'', the [[Supreme Court of the United States]] declares the federal [[income tax]] constitutional.))
Some((Date(24,January,1918),The [[Gregorian calendar]] is introduced in Russia by decree of the [[Council of People's Commissars]] effective [[February 14]](NS)))
Some((Date(24,January,1933),The [[Twentieth Amendment to the United States Constitution|20th Amendment to the United States Constitution]] is ratified, changing the beginning and end of terms for all elected federal offices.))
Some((Date(24,January,1939),The [[1939 Chillán earthquake|deadliest earthquake in Chilean history]] strikes [[Chillán]], killing approximately 28,000 people.))
Some((Date(24,January,1942),[[World War II]]: The [[Allies of World War II|Allies]] bombard [[Bangkok]], leading [[Thailand]], then under Japanese control, to declare war against the United States and United Kingdom.))
Some((Date(24,January,1943),World War II: [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] and [[Winston Churchill]] conclude a [[Casablanca Conference|conference in Casablanca]].))
Some((Date(24,January,1946),The [[United Nations General Assembly]] passes its first resolution to establish the [[United Nations Atomic Energy Commission]].))
Some((Date(24,January,1947),Greek banker [[Dimitrios Maximos]] becomes [[Prime Minister of Greece]].))
Some((Date(24,January,1960),[[Algerian War]]: Some units of European volunteers in [[Algiers]] stage an insurrection known as the "barricades week", during which they seize government buildings and clash with local police.))
Some((Date(24,January,1961),[[1961 Goldsboro B-52 crash|Goldsboro B-52 crash]]: A bomber carrying two H-bombs breaks up in mid-air over North Carolina. The uranium core of one weapon remains lost.))
Some((Date(24,January,1968),[[Vietnam War]]: The [[1st Australian Task Force]] launches [[Operation Coburg]] against the [[People's Army of Vietnam|North Vietnamese Army]] and [[Viet Cong]] during wider fighting around [[Long Bình ward|Long Bình]] and [[Biên Hòa]]))
Some((Date(24,January,1972),Japanese Sgt. [[Shoichi Yokoi]] is found hiding in a [[Guam]] jungle, where he had been [[Japanese holdout|since the end of World War II]].))
Some((Date(24,January,1977),[[1977 Massacre of Atocha|Massacre of Atocha]] in Madrid, during the [[Spanish transition to democracy]].))
Some((Date(24,January,1978),[[Soviet Union|Soviet]] satellite [[Kosmos 954]], with a nuclear reactor on board, burns up in Earth's atmosphere, scattering radioactive debris over Canada's [[Northwest Territories]]. Only 1% is recovered.))
Some((Date(24,January,1984),The first [[Apple Macintosh]] goes on sale.))
Some((Date(24,January,1986),[[Voyager 2]] passes within {{convert|81500|km|mi}} of [[Uranus]].))
Some((Date(24,January,1990),Japan launches [[Hiten]], the country's first [[lunar probe]], the first robotic lunar probe since the [[Soviet Union]]'s [[Luna 24]] in 1976, and the first lunar probe launched by a country other than Soviet Union or the United States.))
Some((Date(24,January,1993),[[Turkey|Turkish]] journalist and writer [[Uğur Mumcu]] is assassinated by a [[car bomb]] in [[Ankara]].))
Some((Date(24,January,1996),Polish Prime Minister [[Józef Oleksy]] resigns amid charges that he spied for Moscow.))
Some((Date(24,January,2003),The [[United States Department of Homeland Security]] officially begins operation.))
Some((Date(24,January,2009),[[Cyclone Klaus]] makes landfall near [[Bordeaux]], France. It subsequently would cause 26 deaths as well as extensive disruptions to public transport and power supplies.))
Some((Date(24,January,2011),At least 35 die and 180 are injured in a [[Domodedovo International Airport bombing|bombing]] at Moscow's [[Domodedovo Airport]].))
Some((Date(24,January,2014),Three bombs [[January 2014 Cairo bombings|explode]] in the Egyptian capital, [[Cairo]], killing about seven people and injuring over 100 others.))
Some((Date(25,January,1348),A [[1348 Friuli earthquake|strong earthquake]] strikes the South Alpine region of [[Friuli]] in modern Italy, causing considerable damage to buildings as far away as Rome.))
Some((Date(25,January,1494),[[Alfonso II of Naples|Alfonso II]] becomes King of [[Naples]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1515),[[Coronation of the French monarch|Coronation]] of [[Francis I of France]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1533),[[Henry VIII of England]] secretly marries his second wife [[Anne Boleyn]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1554),Founding of [[São Paulo]] city, Brazil.))
Some((Date(25,January,1573),[[Battle of Mikatagahara]]: In Japan, [[Takeda Shingen]] defeats [[Tokugawa Ieyasu]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1575),[[Luanda]], the capital of [[Angola]], is founded by the Portuguese navigator [[Paulo Dias de Novais]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1704),The [[Battle of Ayubale]] results in the destruction of most of the [[Spanish missions in Florida]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1755),[[Moscow State University|Moscow University]] is established on [[Tatiana Day]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1765),[[Port Egmont]], the first British settlement in the [[Falkland Islands]] at the southern tip of South America, is founded.))
Some((Date(25,January,1787),[[Shays's Rebellion]]: The rebellion's largest confrontation, outside the [[Springfield Armory]], results in the killing of four rebels and the wounding of twenty.))
Some((Date(25,January,1791),The [[Parliament of Great Britain|British Parliament]] passes the [[Constitutional Act of 1791]] and splits the old [[Province of Quebec (1763–91)|Province of Quebec]] into [[Upper Canada]] and [[Lower Canada]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1792),The [[London Corresponding Society]] is founded.))
Some((Date(25,January,1858),The ''[[Wedding March (Mendelssohn)|Wedding March]]'' by [[Felix Mendelssohn]] is played at the marriage of [[Queen Victoria]]'s daughter, [[Victoria, Princess Royal|Victoria]], and [[Frederick III, German Emperor|Friedrich of Prussia]], and becomes a popular wedding recessional.))
Some((Date(25,January,1879),The [[Bulgarian National Bank]] is founded.))
Some((Date(25,January,1881),[[Thomas Edison]] and [[Alexander Graham Bell]] form the [[Oriental Telephone Company]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1890),[[Nellie Bly]] completes her round-the-world journey in 72 days.))
Some((Date(25,January,1909),[[Richard Strauss]]'s opera ''[[Elektra (opera)|Elektra]]'' receives its debut performance at the [[Semperoper|Dresden State Opera]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1915),[[Alexander Graham Bell]] inaugurates U.S. transcontinental telephone service, speaking from New York to [[Thomas A. Watson|Thomas Watson]] in San Francisco.))
Some((Date(25,January,1918),[[Ukraine]] declares independence from [[Bolshevik Russia]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1924),The [[1924 Winter Olympics]] opens in [[Chamonix]], in the [[French Alps]], inaugurating the [[Winter Olympic Games]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1932),[[Second Sino-Japanese War]]: The [[Republic of China (1912–49)|Chinese]] [[National Revolutionary Army]] [[Defense of Harbin|begins its defense]] of [[Harbin]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1937),''[[The Guiding Light]]'' debuts on NBC radio from Chicago. In 1952 it moves to CBS television, where it remains until September 18, 2009.))
Some((Date(25,January,1941),[[Pope Pius XII]] elevates the [[Apostolic Vicariate of the Hawaiian Islands]] to the dignity of a [[diocese]]. It becomes the [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Honolulu]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1942),[[World War II]]: [[Thailand]] declares war on the United States and United Kingdom.))
Some((Date(25,January,1944),[[Florence Li Tim-Oi]] is ordained in China, becoming the first woman Anglican priest.))
Some((Date(25,January,1945),World War II: The [[Battle of the Bulge]] ends.))
Some((Date(25,January,1946),The [[United Mine Workers]] rejoins the [[American Federation of Labor]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1947),[[Thomas T. Goldsmith, Jr.|Thomas Goldsmith Jr.]] files a patent for a "[[Cathode Ray Tube]] Amusement Device", the first ever electronic game.))
Some((Date(25,January,1949),At the Hollywood Athletic Club the first [[Emmy Award]]s are presented.))
Some((Date(25,January,1955),The [[Soviet Union]] ends the state of war with Germany.))
Some((Date(25,January,1960),The [[National Association of Broadcasters]] reacts to the "[[payola]]" scandal by threatening fines for any [[disc jockey]]s who accept money for playing particular records.))
Some((Date(25,January,1961),In Washington, D.C., President [[John F. Kennedy]] delivers the first live presidential television [[news conference]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1969),[[Brazilian Army]] captain [[Carlos Lamarca]] deserts in order to fight against the [[Brazilian military government|military dictatorship]], taking with him ten machine guns and 63 rifles.))
Some((Date(25,January,1971),[[Charles Manson]] and three female "Family" members are found guilty of the 1969 [[Tate–LaBianca murders]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1979),[[Pope John Paul II]] starts his first official papal visits outside Italy to [[The Bahamas]], [[Dominican Republic]] and Mexico.))
Some((Date(25,January,1980),[[Mother Teresa]] is honored with India's highest civilian award, the [[Bharat Ratna]]))
Some((Date(25,January,1981),[[Jiang Qing]], the widow of [[Mao Zedong]], is sentenced to death.))
Some((Date(25,January,1986),The [[National Resistance Movement]] topples the government of [[Tito Okello]] in [[Uganda]].))
Some((Date(25,January,1990),[[Avianca Flight 52]] crashes into [[Cove Neck, New York]] due to fuel exhaustion.))
Some((Date(25,January,1993),[[1993 shootings at CIA Headquarters|Five people are shot]] outside the [[CIA Headquarters]] in [[Langley, Virginia]]. Two are killed and three wounded.))
Some((Date(25,January,1994),The [[Clementine mission|Clementine]] space probe launches.))
Some((Date(25,January,1995),The [[Norwegian rocket incident]]: Russia almost launches a [[nuclear weapon|nuclear]] attack after it mistakes [[Black Brant XII]], a Norwegian research rocket, for a US [[Trident]] missile.))
Some((Date(25,January,1996),[[Billy Bailey]] becomes the last person to be hanged in the USA.))
Some((Date(25,January,1998),During a historic visit to Cuba, [[Pope John Paul II]] demands political reforms and the release of political prisoners while condemning US attempts to isolate the country.))
Some((Date(25,January,1999),A 6.0 [[Richter magnitude scale|Richter scale]] [[1999 Armenia, Colombia earthquake|earthquake]] hits western [[Colombia]] killing at least 1,000.))
Some((Date(25,January,2003),[[2003 invasion of Iraq|Invasion of Iraq]]: A group of people leave London, England, for [[Baghdad]], [[Iraq]], to [[Human shield action to Iraq|serve as human shields]], intending to prevent the U.S.-led [[coalition of the willing|coalition]] troops from bombing certain locations.))
Some((Date(25,January,2004),[[Opportunity (rover)|''Opportunity'' rover]] (MER-B) lands on surface of [[Mars]].))
Some((Date(25,January,2005),A [[Mandher Devi temple stampede|stampede]] at the [[Mandhradevi]] temple in [[Maharashtra]], India kills at least 258.))
Some((Date(25,January,2006),Three independent observing campaigns announce the discovery of [[OGLE-2005-BLG-390Lb]] through [[gravitational microlensing]], the first cool rocky/icy [[extrasolar planet]] around a main-sequence star.))
Some((Date(25,January,2010),[[Ethiopian Airlines Flight 409]] crashes into the Mediterranean. All 90 passengers and crew were killed.))
Some((Date(25,January,2011),The [[Timeline of the Egyptian Revolution of 2011|first wave]] of the [[Egyptian Revolution of 2011|Egyptian revolution]] begins in [[Egypt]], with a series of street demonstrations, marches, rallies, acts of civil disobedience, riots, labour strikes, and violent clashes in [[Cairo]], [[Alexandria]], and throughout other cities in Egypt.))
Some((Date(25,January,2013),At least 50 people are killed and 120 people are injured in a [[2013 Uribana prison riot|prison riot]] in [[Barquisimeto]], [[Venezuela]].))
Some((Date(25,January,2015),A [[2015 Mamasapano clash|clash]] in [[Mamasapano, Maguindanao]] in the Philippines killing 44 members of [[Special Action Force]] (SAF), at least 18 from [[Moro Islamic Liberation Front]] and five from [[Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters]].

Some((Date(26,January,1500),[[Vicente Yáñez Pinzón]] becomes the first European to set foot on [[Brazil]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1531),[[Lisbon]], Portugal is hit by an [[1531 Lisbon earthquake|earthquake]]—thousands die.))
Some((Date(26,January,1564),The [[Council of Trent]] issues its conclusions in the Tridentinum, establishing a distinction between [[Roman Catholicism]] and [[Protestantism]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1564),The [[Grand Duchy of Lithuania]] defeats the [[Tsardom of Russia]] in the [[Battle of Ula]] during the [[Livonian War]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1565),[[Battle of Talikota]], fought between the [[Vijayanagara Empire]] and the Islamic sultanates of the [[Deccan]], leads to the subjugation, and eventual destruction of the last Hindu kingdom in India, and the consolidation of Islamic rule over much of the [[Indian subcontinent]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1589),[[Patriarch Job of Moscow|Job]] is elected as [[Patriarch of Moscow and All Russia]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1699),[[Treaty of Karlowitz]] is signed.))
Some((Date(26,January,1700),The [[1700 Cascadia earthquake|Cascadia earthquake]] takes place off the west coast of North America, as evidenced by Japanese records.))
Some((Date(26,January,1736),[[Stanislaus I of Poland]] abdicates his throne.))
Some((Date(26,January,1788),The British [[First Fleet]], led by [[Arthur Phillip]], sails into [[Port Jackson|Port Jackson (Sydney Harbour)]] to establish Sydney, the first permanent European settlement on the continent. Commemorated as [[Australia Day]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1808),[[Rum Rebellion]], the only successful (albeit short-lived) armed takeover of the government in Australia.))
Some((Date(26,January,1837),[[Michigan]] is admitted as the 26th [[U.S. state]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1838),[[Tennessee]] enacts the first [[prohibition]] law in the United States))
Some((Date(26,January,1841),The United Kingdom formally occupies Hong Kong, which China later formally [[cession|cedes]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1855),[[Point No Point Treaty]] is signed in [[Washington Territory]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1856),First [[Battle of Seattle (1856)|Battle of Seattle]].  Marines from the {{USS|Decatur|1839|6}} drive off American Indian attackers after all day battle with settlers.))
Some((Date(26,January,1861),[[American Civil War]]: The state of [[Louisiana]] [[History of Louisiana#Secession and the Civil War (1860–1865)|secedes from the Union]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1863),American Civil War: General [[Ambrose Burnside]] is relieved of command of the [[Army of the Potomac]] after the disastrous [[Battle of Fredericksburg|Fredericksburg campaign]]. He is replaced by [[Joseph Hooker]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1870),American Civil War: [[Virginia]] [[History of Virginia#Reconstruction|rejoins the Union]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1885),Troops loyal to [[Muhammad Ahmad|The Mahdi]] conquer [[Siege of Khartoum|Khartoum]], killing the Governor-General [[Charles George Gordon]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1905),The world's largest [[diamond]] ever, the [[Cullinan Diamond|Cullinan]] weighing {{convert|3106.75|carat|kg}}, is found at the [[Premier Mine]] near [[Pretoria]] in South Africa.))
Some((Date(26,January,1907),The Short Magazine Lee–Enfield Mk III is officially introduced into British Military Service, and remains the second oldest military rifle still in official use.))
Some((Date(26,January,1911),[[Glenn H. Curtiss]] flies the first successful American [[seaplane]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1918),[[Finnish Civil War]]: A group of [[Red Guards (Finland)|Red Guards]] hangs a red lantern atop the tower of [[Helsinki Workers' Hall]] to symbolically mark the start of the war.))
Some((Date(26,January,1920),Former [[Ford Motor Company]] executive Henry Leland launches the [[Lincoln Motor Company]] which he later sold to his former employer.))
Some((Date(26,January,1924),[[Saint Petersburg]], Russia, is renamed Leningrad.))
Some((Date(26,January,1930),The [[Indian National Congress]] declares 26 January as Independence Day or as the day for [[Purna Swaraj|Poorna Swaraj]] ("Complete Independence") which occurred 17 years later.))
Some((Date(26,January,1934),The [[Apollo Theater]] reopens in [[Harlem]], New York City.))
Some((Date(26,January,1942),[[World War II]]: The first United States forces arrive in Europe landing in [[Northern Ireland]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1945),World War II: The [[Red Army]] [[Heiligenbeil Pocket|begins encircling]] the [[4th Army (Wehrmacht)|German Fourth Army]] near [[Heiligenbeil Pocket|Heiligenbeil]] in [[East Prussia]], which will end in destruction of the 4th Army two months later.))
Some((Date(26,January,1949),The [[Hale telescope]] at [[Palomar Observatory]] sees [[First light (astronomy)|first light]] under the direction of [[Edwin Hubble]], becoming the largest aperture optical telescope (until [[BTA-6]] is built in 1976).))
Some((Date(26,January,1950),The [[Constitution of India]] [[coming into force|comes into force]], forming a republic.  [[Rajendra Prasad]] is sworn in as its first [[President of India]]. Observed as [[Republic Day (India)|Republic Day]] in India.))
Some((Date(26,January,1952),[[Cairo Fire|Black Saturday]] in [[Egypt]]: rioters burn [[Cairo]]'s central business district, targeting British and upper-class Egyptian businesses.))
Some((Date(26,January,1956),Soviet Union hands [[Porkkala]] back to Finland.))
Some((Date(26,January,1958),Japanese ferry ''Nankai Maru'' capsizes off southern [[Awaji Island]], Japan, 167 killed.))
Some((Date(26,January,1960),[[Danny Heater]] sets a worldwide high school basketball scoring record when he records 135 points for Burnsville High School ([[West Virginia]])))
Some((Date(26,January,1961),[[John F. Kennedy]] appoints [[Janet G. Travell]] to be his physician. This is the first time a woman holds the appointment of [[Physician to the President]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1962),[[Ranger program]]: [[Ranger 3]] is launched to study the Moon. The [[space probe]] later misses the moon by 22,000 miles (35,400&nbsp;km).))
Some((Date(26,January,1965),[[Hindi]] becomes the official language of India.))
Some((Date(26,January,1966),The [[Beaumont children disappearance|Beaumont Children]] go missing from [[Glenelg, South Australia|Glenelg Beach]] near [[Adelaide]], [[South Australia]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1980),[[Israel]] and [[Egypt]] establish [[diplomacy|diplomatic relations]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1986),The Ugandan government of [[Tito Okello]] is overthrown by the [[National Resistance Army]], led by [[Yoweri Museveni]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1991),[[Siad Barre|Mohamed Siad Barre]] is removed from power in [[Somalia]], ending centralized government, and is succeeded by [[Ali Mahdi Muhammad|Ali Mahdi]].))
Some((Date(26,January,1992),[[Boris Yeltsin]] announces that Russia will stop targeting United States cities with [[nuclear weapon]]s.))
Some((Date(26,January,1998),[[Lewinsky scandal]]: On American television, U.S. President [[Bill Clinton]] denies having had "[[Lewinsky scandal|sexual relations]]" with former [[White House]] intern [[Monica Lewinsky]].))
Some((Date(26,January,2001),An [[earthquake]] hits [[2001 Gujarat earthquake|Gujarat]], India, causing more than 20,000 deaths.))
Some((Date(26,January,2004),President [[Hamid Karzai]] signs the new [[constitution of Afghanistan]].))
Some((Date(26,January,2005),[[Glendale train crash]]: Two trains derail killing 11 and injuring 200 in [[Glendale, California]], near Los Angeles.))
Some((Date(26,January,2009),Rioting breaks out in [[Antananarivo]], [[Madagascar]], sparking a [[2009 Malagasy political crisis|political crisis]] that will result in the replacement of [[President of Madagascar|President]] [[Marc Ravalomanana]] with [[Andry Rajoelina]].))
Some((Date(26,January,2015),A giant [[January 2015 nor'easter|snow storm]] hits much of the [[Northeastern United States]].))
Some((Date(27,January,1142),[[Song dynasty]] General [[Yue Fei]] is executed.))
Some((Date(27,January,1186),[[Henry VI, Holy Roman Emperor|Henry VI]], the son and heir of the [[Holy Roman Emperor]] [[Frederick I, Holy Roman Emperor|Frederick I]], marries [[Constance of Sicily]].))
Some((Date(27,January,1302),[[Dante Alighieri]], the poet and politician, is exiled from [[Florence]], Italy, where he served as one of six priors governing the city.))
Some((Date(27,January,1343),[[Pope Clement VI]] issues the [[papal bull]] ''[[Unigenitus]]'' to justify the power of the pope and the use of [[indulgence]]s. Nearly 200 years later, [[Martin Luther]] would protest this.))
Some((Date(27,January,1593),The [[Holy See|Vatican]] opens the seven-year trial of scholar [[Giordano Bruno]].))
Some((Date(27,January,1606),[[Gunpowder Plot]]: The trial of [[Guy Fawkes]] and other conspirators begins, ending with their execution on January 31.))
Some((Date(27,January,1695),[[Mustafa II]] becomes the [[Ottoman sultan]] and [[Caliph of Islam]] in [[Istanbul]] on the death of [[Ahmed II]]. Mustafa rules until his abdication in [[1703]].))
Some((Date(27,January,1776),[[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Henry Knox]]'s "[[noble train of artillery]]" arrives in [[Cambridge, Massachusetts]].))
Some((Date(27,January,1785),The [[University of Georgia]] is founded, the first public university in the United States.))
Some((Date(27,January,1825),The [[U.S. Congress]] approves [[Indian Territory]] (in what is present-day [[Oklahoma]]), clearing the way for forced relocation of the [[Five Civilized Tribes|Eastern Indians]] on the "[[Trail of Tears]]".))
Some((Date(27,January,1868),[[Boshin War]]: The [[Battle of Toba–Fushimi]] between forces of the [[Tokugawa shogunate]] and pro-[[Emperor of Japan|Imperial]] factions begins, which will end in defeat for the shogunate, and is a pivotal point in the [[Meiji Restoration]].))
Some((Date(27,January,1869),Boshin War: Tokugawa rebels establish the [[Ezo Republic]] in [[Hokkaidō]].))
Some((Date(27,January,1880),[[Thomas Edison]] receives the patent on the incandescent lamp. ))
Some((Date(27,January,1888),The [[National Geographic Society]] is founded in Washington, D.C.))
Some((Date(27,January,1909),The [[Young Left (Norway)|Young Left]] is founded in Norway.))
Some((Date(27,January,1927),[[Ibn Saud]] takes the title of [[Kingdom of Hejaz and Nejd|King of Nejd]].))
Some((Date(27,January,1939),First flight of the [[Lockheed P-38 Lightning]].))
Some((Date(27,January,1943),[[World War II]]: The VIII Bomber Command dispatched ninety-one B-17s and B-24s to attack the U-Boat construction yards at [[Wilhelmshaven]], Germany.  This was the first American bombing attack on Germany of the war.))
Some((Date(27,January,1944),World War II: The 900-day [[Siege of Leningrad]] is lifted.))
Some((Date(27,January,1945),World War II: The [[Red Army]] liberates the remained inmates of the [[Auschwitz concentration camp|Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration camp]] built by the Nazi Germans on the territory of Poland.))
Some((Date(27,January,1951),[[Nuclear test]]ing at the [[Nevada Test Site]] begins with a one-kiloton bomb dropped on [[Frenchman Flat]].))
Some((Date(27,January,1961),[[Soviet Union|Soviet]] submarine ''[[Soviet submarine S-80|S-80]]'' sinks with all hands lost.))
Some((Date(27,January,1967),[[Astronaut]]s [[Gus Grissom]], [[Edward Higgins White|Edward White]] and [[Roger Chaffee]] are killed in a fire during a test of their [[Apollo 1]] spacecraft at the [[Kennedy Space Center]], [[Florida]].))
Some((Date(27,January,1973),The [[Paris Peace Accords]] officially end the [[Vietnam War]]. Colonel [[William Nolde]] is killed in action becoming the conflict's last recorded American combat casualty.))
Some((Date(27,January,1974),The [[Brisbane River]] breaches its banks causing [[1974 Brisbane flood|the largest flood]] to affect the city of [[Brisbane]] in the 20th century.))
Some((Date(27,January,1980),Through cooperation between the U.S. and Canadian governments, six American diplomats secretly escape [[Iran hostage crisis|hostilities]] in [[Iran]] in the culmination of the [[Canadian Caper]].))
Some((Date(27,January,1983),The pilot shaft of the [[Seikan Tunnel]], the world's longest sub-aqueous tunnel (53.85&nbsp;km) between the Japanese islands of [[Honshū]] and [[Hokkaidō]], breaks through.))
Some((Date(27,January,1984),Pop singer [[Michael Jackson]] suffers second degree burns to his scalp during the filming of a [[Pepsi]] commercial in the [[Shrine Auditorium]].))
Some((Date(27,January,1993),American-born [[sumo]] wrestler [[Akebono Tarō]] becomes the first foreigner to be promoted to the sport's highest rank of ''[[yokozuna]]''.))
Some((Date(27,January,1996),In a [[coup d'état|military coup]] Colonel [[Ibrahim Baré Maïnassara]] deposes the first democratically elected president of [[Niger]], [[Mahamane Ousmane]].))
Some((Date(27,January,2002),[[Lagos armoury explosion|An explosion]] at a military storage facility in [[Lagos]], [[Nigeria]], kills at least 1,100 people and displaces over 20,000 others.))
Some((Date(27,January,2003),The first selections for the [[National Recording Registry]] are announced by the [[Library of Congress]].))
Some((Date(27,January,2006),[[Western Union]] discontinues its [[Telegraphy|Telegram]] and Commercial Messaging services.))
Some((Date(27,January,2010),The [[2009 Honduran constitutional crisis]] ends when [[Porfirio Lobo Sosa]] becomes the new [[President of Honduras]].))
Some((Date(27,January,2011),[[Arab Spring]]: The [[Yemeni Revolution]] begins as over 16,000 protestors demonstrate in [[Sana'a]].))
Some((Date(27,January,2013),Two hundred forty-two people die in a [[Kiss nightclub fire|nightclub fire]] in the city of [[Santa Maria, Rio Grande do Sul|Santa Maria]], [[Brazil]].

Some((Date(28,January,1077),[[Walk to Canossa]]: The [[excommunication]] of [[Henry IV, Holy Roman Emperor]] is lifted.))
Some((Date(28,January,1393),King [[Charles VI of France]] is nearly killed when [[Bal des Ardents|several dancers' costumes catch fire]] during a [[masquerade ball]].))
Some((Date(28,January,1521),The [[Diet of Worms]] begins, lasting until [[May 25]].))
Some((Date(28,January,1547),[[Henry VIII of England|Henry VIII]] dies. His nine-year-old son, [[Edward VI of England|Edward VI]] becomes King, and the first [[Protestant]] ruler of England.))

Some((Date(28,January,1624),[[Thomas Warner (explorer)|Sir Thomas Warner]] founds the first British colony in the Caribbean, on the island of [[Saint Kitts]].))

Some((Date(28,January,1724),The [[Russian Academy of Sciences]] is founded in [[St. Petersburg]] by [[Peter the Great]], and implemented by Senate decree. It is called the St. Petersburg Academy of Sciences until 1917.))
Some((Date(28,January,1754),[[Horace Walpole]] coins the word ''[[serendipity]]'' in a letter to Horace Mann.))
Some((Date(28,January,1760),[[Pownal, Vermont]], is created by [[Benning Wentworth]] as one of the [[New Hampshire Grants]].))
Some((Date(28,January,1813),[[Jane Austen]]'s ''[[Pride and Prejudice]]'' is first published in the United Kingdom.))
Some((Date(28,January,1820),A [[Russian Empire|Russia]]n expedition led by [[Fabian Gottlieb von Bellingshausen]] and [[Mikhail Petrovich Lazarev]] discovers the [[Antarctic]] continent, approaching the Antarctic coast.))
Some((Date(28,January,1821),[[Alexander Island]] is first discovered by Fabian Gottlieb von Bellingshausen.))
Some((Date(28,January,1846),The [[Battle of Aliwal]], India, is won by British troops commanded by [[Harry Smith (army)|Sir Harry Smith]].))
Some((Date(28,January,1851),[[Northwestern University]] becomes the first chartered university in Illinois.))
Some((Date(28,January,1855),A locomotive on the [[Panama Canal Railway]], runs from the Atlantic Ocean to the Pacific Ocean for the first time.))
Some((Date(28,January,1871),[[Franco-Prussian War]]: the [[Siege of Paris (1870–71)|Siege of Paris]] ends in French defeat and an armistice.))
Some((Date(28,January,1878),''[[Yale Daily News]]'' becomes the first daily [[Student newspaper|college newspaper]] in the United States.))
Some((Date(28,January,1887),In a snowstorm at [[Fort Keogh]], [[Montana]], the world's largest snowflakes are reported,  {{convert|15|in|cm}} wide and {{convert|8|in|cm}} thick.))
Some((Date(28,January,1896),Walter Arnold of [[East Peckham]], Kent, becomes the first person to be convicted of [[speed limit|speeding]]. He was fined one [[shilling (British coin)|shilling]], plus costs, for speeding at {{convert|8|mph|km/h|abbr=on}}, thereby exceeding the contemporary speed limit of {{convert|2|mph|km/h|abbr=on}}.))
Some((Date(28,January,1902),The [[Carnegie Institution for Science|Carnegie Institution of Washington]] is founded in Washington, D.C. with a $10 million gift from [[Andrew Carnegie]].))
Some((Date(28,January,1908),Members of the [[Portuguese Republican Party]] fail in their [[Municipal Library Elevator Coup|attempted coup d'état]] against the administrative dictatorship of Prime Minister [[João Franco]].))
Some((Date(28,January,1909),United States troops leave [[Cuba]] with the exception of [[Guantanamo Bay Naval Base]] after being there since the [[Spanish–American War]].))
Some((Date(28,January,1915),An act of the [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] creates the [[United States Coast Guard]] as a branch of the United States Armed Forces.))
Some((Date(28,January,1917),Municipally-owned [[streetcars]] take to the streets of [[San Francisco]].))
Some((Date(28,January,1918),[[Finnish Civil War]]: <!--The [[Red Guards (Finland)|Red Guards]]-->[[Rebellion|Rebels]] seize control of the capital, [[Helsinki]], and members of the [[Senate of Finland]] go underground.))
Some((Date(28,January,1922),[[Knickerbocker Storm]], Washington D.C.'s biggest snowfall, causes the city's greatest loss of life when the roof of the [[Knickerbocker Theatre (Washington, D.C.)|Knickerbocker Theatre]] collapses.))
Some((Date(28,January,1932),Japanese forces [[January 28 Incident|attack Shanghai]].))
Some((Date(28,January,1933),The name [[Pakistan]] is [[Neologism|coined]] by [[Choudhry Rahmat Ali]] Khan and is accepted by the [[Indian Muslims]] who then thereby adopted it further for the [[Pakistan Movement]] seeking independence.))

Some((Date(28,January,1935),[[Iceland]] becomes the first Western country to legalize therapeutic [[abortion]].))
Some((Date(28,January,1938),The [[World Land Speed Record]] on a [[public road]] is broken by [[Rudolf Caracciola]] in the [[Mercedes-Benz W195]] at a speed of {{convert|432.7|km/h|mph}}.))

Some((Date(28,January,1958),The [[Lego]] company patents the design of its Lego bricks, still compatible with bricks produced today.))
Some((Date(28,January,1964),An unarmed [[United States Air Force]] [[T-39 Sabreliner]] on a training mission is [[1964 T-39 shootdown incident|shot down]] over [[Erfurt]], [[East Germany]], by a [[Soviet Air Forces|Soviet]] [[MiG-19]].))
Some((Date(28,January,1965),The current design of the [[Flag of Canada]] is chosen by an act of [[Parliament of Canada|Parliament]].))
Some((Date(28,January,1977),The first day of the [[Great Lakes Blizzard of 1977]] which dumps {{convert|10|ft|m}} of snow in one-day in [[Upstate New York]], with [[Buffalo, New York|Buffalo]], [[Syracuse, New York|Syracuse]], [[Watertown, New York|Watertown]], and surrounding areas most affected.))
Some((Date(28,January,1979),[[CBS News Sunday Morning]] debuts with original host and cocreator [[Charles Kuralt]].))
Some((Date(28,January,1980),{{USCGC|Blackthorn|WLB-391|6}} collides with the tanker Capricorn while leaving Tampa, Florida and capsizes, killing 23 Coast Guard crewmembers.))
Some((Date(28,January,1981),[[Ronald Reagan]] lifts remaining domestic petroleum price and allocation controls in the United States helping to end the [[1979 energy crisis]] and begin the [[1980s oil glut]].))
Some((Date(28,January,1982),[[United States Army|US Army]] general [[James L. Dozier]] is rescued by Italian anti-[[terrorism]] forces from captivity by the [[Red Brigades]].))
Some((Date(28,January,1984),[[Tropical Storm Domoina]] makes landfall in southern [[Mozambique]], eventually causing 214 deaths and some of the most severe flooding so far recorded in the region.))
Some((Date(28,January,1985),Supergroup [[USA for Africa]] (United Support of Artists for Africa) records the hit single ''[[We Are the World]]'', to help raise funds for [[Ethiopia]]n [[famine relief]].))
Some((Date(28,January,1988),In ''[[R v Morgentaler]]'' the Supreme Court of Canada strikes down all anti-[[abortion law]]s, effectively allowing abortions in Canada in all 9 months of pregnancy.))

Some((Date(4,February,1967),[[Lunar Orbiter program]]: [[Lunar Orbiter 3]] lifts off from [[Cape Canaveral Air Force Station|Cape Canaveral's]] Launch Complex 13 on its mission to identify possible landing sites for the [[Surveyor program|Surveyor]] and [[Apollo program|Apollo]] spacecraft.))
Some((Date(4,February,1969),[[Yasser Arafat]] takes over as chairman of the [[Palestine Liberation Organization]].))
Some((Date(4,February,1974),The [[Symbionese Liberation Army]] kidnaps [[Patty Hearst]] in [[Berkeley, California]].))
Some((Date(4,February,1975),[[1975 Haicheng earthquake|Haicheng earthquake]] (magnitude 7.3 on the [[Richter magnitude scale|Richter scale]]) occurs in [[Haicheng, Liaoning]], China.))
Some((Date(4,February,1976),In [[Guatemala]] and [[Honduras]] an [[1976 Guatemala earthquake|earthquake]] kills more than 22,000.))
Some((Date(4,February,1977),A [[Chicago Transit Authority]] [[elevated train]] [[1977 Chicago Loop derailment|rear-ends another and derails]], killing 11 and injuring 180, the worst accident in the agency's history.))
Some((Date(4,February,1980),[[Ayatollah]] [[Ruhollah Khomeini]] names [[Abolhassan Banisadr]] as president of [[Iran]].))
Some((Date(4,February,1992),A [[1992 Venezuelan coup d'état attempts|coup d'état]] is led by [[Hugo Chávez]] against [[Venezuela]]n President [[Carlos Andrés Pérez]].))
Some((Date(4,February,1996),Major snowstorm paralyzes [[Midwestern United States]], [[Milwaukee|Milwaukee, Wisconsin]] and ties all-time record low temperature at −26&nbsp;°F (−32.2&nbsp;°C)))
Some((Date(4,February,1997),En route to [[Lebanon]], two Israeli [[Sikorsky CH-53 Sea Stallion|Sikorsky CH-53]] troop-transport helicopters [[1997 Israeli helicopter disaster|collide in mid-air]] over northern Galilee, [[Israel]] killing 73.))
Some((Date(4,February,1998),An [[February 4, 1998 Afghanistan earthquake|earthquake]] measuring 6.1 on the Richter Scale in northeast [[Afghanistan]] kills more than 5,000.))
Some((Date(4,February,1999),Unarmed West African immigrant [[Shooting of Amadou Diallo|Amadou Diallo is shot dead]] by four plainclothes New York City police officers on an unrelated stake-out, inflaming race relations in the city.))
Some((Date(4,February,2003),The [[Bengali Hindus]] declare the independence of the Republic of [[Bangabhumi]] from Bangladesh.))
Some((Date(4,February,2003),The [[Federal Republic of Yugoslavia]] is officially renamed [[Serbia and Montenegro]] and adopts a new constitution.))
Some((Date(4,February,2004),[[Facebook]], a mainstream online [[social networking site]], is founded by [[Mark Zuckerberg]].))
Some((Date(4,February,2006),A [[PhilSports Stadium stampede|stampede]] occurs in the [[PhilSports Arena]] near [[Manila]], killing 71 people.))
Some((Date(4,February,2015),A [[TransAsia Airways]] [[TransAsia Airways Flight 235|aircraft]] with 58 people on board, en route from the Taiwanese capital [[Taipei]] to [[Kinmen]], crashes into the [[Keelung River]] just after take-off, killing at least 31 people.

Some((Date(5,February,1852),The New [[Hermitage Museum]] in [[Saint Petersburg]], Russia, one of the largest and oldest museums in the world, opens to the public.))

Some((Date(5,February,1885),King [[Leopold II of Belgium]] establishes the [[Congo Free State|Congo]] as a personal possession.))
Some((Date(5,February,1900),The United States and the United Kingdom sign a treaty for the [[Panama Canal]].))
Some((Date(5,February,1905),in Mexico, the [[General Hospital of Mexico]] is inaugurated, started with 4 basic specialities.))
Some((Date(5,February,1909),Belgian chemist [[Leo Baekeland]] announces the creation of [[Bakelite]], the world's first synthetic [[plastic]].))
Some((Date(5,February,1913),[[Hellenic Air Force|Greek military aviators]], [[Michael Moutoussis]] and [[Aristeidis Moraitinis (aviator)|Aristeidis Moraitinis]] perform the first [[naval aviation|naval air]] mission in history, with a [[Farman MF.7]] hydroplane.))
Some((Date(5,February,1917),The [[Constitution of Mexico|current constitution]] of Mexico is adopted, establishing a [[federal republic]] with powers separated into independent executive, legislative, and judicial branches.))
Some((Date(5,February,1918),[[Stephen W. Thompson]] shoots down a German airplane. It is the [[first aerial victory by the U.S. military]].))
Some((Date(5,February,1919),[[Charlie Chaplin]], [[Mary Pickford]], [[Douglas Fairbanks]], and [[D. W. Griffith]] launch [[United Artists]].))
Some((Date(5,February,1924),The [[Royal Greenwich Observatory]] begins broadcasting the hourly time signals known as the [[Greenwich Time Signal]] or the "BBC pips".))
Some((Date(5,February,1937),United States President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] proposes a plan to enlarge the [[Supreme Court of the United States]].))
Some((Date(5,February,1939),Generalísimo [[Francisco Franco]] becomes the 68th "''Caudillo de España''", or Leader of Spain.))
Some((Date(5,February,1941),[[World War II]]: [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] forces begin the [[Battle of Keren]] to capture [[Keren, Eritrea]].))
Some((Date(5,February,1945),World War II: General [[Douglas MacArthur]] returns to [[Manila]].))
Some((Date(5,February,1946),The [[Chondoist Chongu Party]] is founded in [[North Korea]].))
Some((Date(5,February,1958),[[Gamal Abdel Nasser]] is nominated to be the first president of the [[United Arab Republic]].))
Some((Date(5,February,1962),[[President of the French Republic|French President]] [[Charles de Gaulle]] calls for [[Algeria]] to be granted independence.))
Some((Date(5,February,1963),The [[European Court of Justice]]'s ruling in ''[[Van Gend en Loos v Nederlandse Administratie der Belastingen]]'' establishes the principle of [[direct effect]], one of the most important, if not the most important, decisions in the development of [[European Union law]].))
Some((Date(5,February,1971),Astronauts land on the moon in the [[Apollo 14]] mission.))
Some((Date(5,February,1972),[[Bob Douglas]] becomes the first [[African American]] elected to the [[Basketball Hall of Fame]].))
Some((Date(5,February,1975),Riots break in [[Lima|Lima, Peru]] after the police forces go on strike [[February 4|the day before]]. The uprising (locally known as the ''Limazo'') is bloodily suppressed by the military dictatorship.))
Some((Date(5,February,1976),The [[1976 swine flu outbreak]] begins at Fort Dix, NJ.))
Some((Date(5,February,1985),Ugo Vetere, then the mayor of Rome, and [[Chedli Klibi]], then the mayor of [[Carthage]] meet in [[Tunis]] to sign a treaty of friendship officially ending the [[Third Punic War]] which lasted 2,131 years.))
Some((Date(5,February,1988),[[Manuel Noriega]] is indicted on [[Illegal drug trade|drug smuggling]] and [[money laundering]] charges.))
Some((Date(5,February,1994),[[Byron De La Beckwith]] is convicted of the 1963 murder of [[civil rights]] leader [[Medgar Evers]].))

Some((Date(5,February,2008),A [[2008 Super Tuesday tornado outbreak|major tornado outbreak]] across the [[Southern United States]] kills 57.

Some((Date(6,February,1649),The claimant King [[Charles II of England|Charles II of England and Scotland]] is declared King of Great Britain, by the [[Parliament of Scotland]]. This move was not followed by the [[Parliament of England]] nor the [[Parliament of Ireland]].))

Some((Date(6,February,1951),The [[Canadian Army]] enters combat in the [[Canada in the Korean War|Korean War]].))
Some((Date(6,February,1952),[[Elizabeth II]] becomes [[queen regnant]] of the United Kingdom and the other [[Commonwealth realm]]s upon the death of her father, [[George VI]]. At the exact moment of [[Order of succession|succession]], she was in a [[tree house]] at the [[Treetops Hotel]] in [[Kenya]].))
Some((Date(6,February,1958),Eight [[Manchester United F.C.]] players and 15 other passengers are killed in the [[Munich air disaster]].))

Some((Date(6,February,1975),[[Kankesanthurai Electoral District by-election, 1975|A crucial by-election]] is held in Kankesanthurai, Sri Lanka.<!-- Why is it "crucial" - if it really isn't, this entry shouldn't be here -->))
Some((Date(6,February,1976),In testimony before a [[United States Senate]] subcommittee, [[Lockheed Corporation]] president [[Carl Kotchian]] admits that the company had paid out approximately [[Lockheed bribery scandals|$3 million in bribes]] to the office of Japanese Prime Minister [[Kakuei Tanaka]].))
Some((Date(6,February,1978),The [[Northeastern United States blizzard of 1978|Blizzard of 1978]], one of the worst [[Nor'easter]]s in [[New England]] history, hit the region, with sustained winds of 65&nbsp;mph and snowfall of four inches an hour.))
Some((Date(6,February,1981),The [[National Resistance Army]] of [[Uganda]] launches an attack on a [[Uganda National Liberation Army|Ugandan Army]] installation in the central [[Mubende District]] to begin the [[Ugandan Bush War]].))

Some((Date(6,February,1988),[[Michael Jordan]] makes his signature [[slam dunk]] from the [[free throw line]] inspiring [[Air Jordan]] and the [[Jumpman (logo)|Jumpman]] logo.))
Some((Date(6,February,1989),The [[Polish Round Table Talks|Round Table Talks]] start in Poland, thus marking the beginning of overthrow of [[communism]] in Eastern Europe.))
Some((Date(6,February,1996),[[Willamette Valley Flood of 1996|Willamette Valley Flood]]: Floods in the [[Willamette Valley]] of [[Oregon]], United States, causes over US$500 million in property damage throughout the [[Pacific Northwest]].))
Some((Date(6,February,1998),Washington National Airport is renamed [[Ronald Reagan National Airport]].))
Some((Date(6,February,2000),[[Second Chechen War]]: Russia [[Battle of Grozny (1999–2000)|captures]] [[Grozny]], [[Chechnya]], forcing the separatist [[Chechen Republic of Ichkeria]] government into [[government in exile|exile]].))

Some((Date(6,February,2013),A [[2013 Solomon Islands earthquake|8.0 magnitude earthquake]] hits the [[Solomon Islands]] killing 10 people and injuring 17 others.
