Some((Date(7,February,1951),[[Korean War]]: 705 suspected communist sympathizers [[Sancheong-Hamyang massacre|are butchered]] by [[Republic of Korea Army|South Korean forces]].))
Some((Date(7,February,1962),The United States [[United States embargo against Cuba|bans]] all [[Cuba]]n imports and exports.))

Some((Date(8,February,1960),Queen Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom issues an [[Order-in-Council]], stating that she and her family would be known as the [[House of Windsor]], and that her descendants will take the name "[[Mountbatten-Windsor]]".))

Some((Date(8,February,1965),[[Eastern Air Lines Flight 663]] crashes into the Atlantic Ocean and explodes, killing everyone aboard.))
Some((Date(8,February,1968),[[American civil rights movement]]: The [[Orangeburg massacre]]: An attack on black students from [[South Carolina State University]] who are protesting [[racial segregation]] at the town's only bowling alley, leaves three or four dead in [[Orangeburg, South Carolina]].))
Some((Date(8,February,1969),[[Allende meteorite]] falls near Pueblito de Allende, [[Chihuahua (state)|Chihuahua]], Mexico.))
Some((Date(8,February,1971),The [[NASDAQ]] [[stock market index]] opens for the first time.))
Some((Date(8,February,1974),After 84 days in [[outer space|space]], the crew of [[Skylab 4]], the last crew to visit American [[space station]] [[Skylab]], returns to Earth.))
Some((Date(8,February,1978),Proceedings of the [[United States Senate]] are broadcast on radio for the first time.))
Some((Date(8,February,1981),Twenty-one [[association football]] spectators are [[Karaiskakis Stadium disaster|trampled to death]] at [[Karaiskakis Stadium]] in Neo [[Faliro]], Greece, after a football match between [[Olympiacos F.C.]] and [[AEK Athens F.C.]]))
Some((Date(8,February,1983),The [[Melbourne dust storm]] hits Australia's second largest city.  The result of the worst drought on record and a day of severe weather conditions, a {{convert|320|m|ft}} deep dust cloud envelops the city, turning day to night.))
Some((Date(8,February,1986),[[Hinton train collision]]: Twenty-three people are killed when a VIA Rail passenger train collides with a 118-car Canadian National freight train near the town of Hinton, Alberta, west of Edmonton. It is the worst rail accident in Canada until the Lac-Mégantic, Quebec derailment in 2013 which killed forty-seven people.))
Some((Date(8,February,1993),[[General Motors]] sues [[NBC]] after ''[[Dateline NBC]]'' allegedly rigs two crashes intended to demonstrate that some GM pickups can easily catch fire if hit in certain places. NBC settles the lawsuit the next day.))
Some((Date(8,February,1996),The [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] passes the [[Communications Decency Act]].))
Some((Date(8,February,2005),[[Sri Lankan Civil War]]: Sri Lankan Tamil politician and former MP [[A. Chandranehru]] dies of injuries sustained in an ambush the previous day.))
Some((Date(8,February,2010),A freak storm in the [[Hindu Kush]] mountains of [[Afghanistan]] triggers a series of at least [[2010 Salang avalanches|36 avalanches]], burying over two miles of road, killing at least 172 people and trapping over 2,000 travelers.))
Some((Date(8,February,2013),[[February 2013 nor'easter|A blizzard]] disrupts transportation and leaves hundreds of thousands of people without electricity in the Northeastern United States and parts of Canada.))
Some((Date(8,February,2014),A [[2014 Medina hotel fire|hotel fire]] in [[Medina, Saudi Arabia]] kills 15 [[Egypt]]ian pilgrims with 130 also injured.

Some((Date(9,February,1913),A group of [[meteor]]s [[Meteor procession of February 9, 1913|is visible]] across much of the eastern seaboard of North and South America, leading astronomers to conclude the source had been a small, short-lived [[natural satellite]] of the Earth.))

Some((Date(13,February,1692),[[Massacre of Glencoe]]: About 78 [[Clan Donald|Macdonalds]] at [[Glen Coe]], Scotland are killed early in the morning for not promptly pledging allegiance to the new king, [[William III of England|William of Orange]].))
Some((Date(13,February,1739),[[Battle of Karnal]]: The army of [[History of Iran#Before the First World War|Iranian]] ruler [[Nader Shah]] defeats the forces of the [[Mughal Empire|Mughal]] emperor of [[History of India#The Mughal era|India]], [[Muhammad Shah]].))
Some((Date(13,February,1849),The delegation headed by Metropolitan bishop [[Andrei Șaguna]] hands out to the Emperor [[Franz Joseph I of Austria]] the ''General Petition of Romanian leaders in [[Transylvania]], [[Banat]] and [[Bukovina]]'', which demands that the [[Romanians|Romanian nation]] be recognized.))
Some((Date(13,February,1861),In [[Gaeta]] the capitulation of the fortress decreeing the end of the [[Kingdom of the Two Sicilies]] is signed.))
Some((Date(13,February,1867),Work begins on the [[covering of the Senne]], burying [[Brussels]]'s primary river and creating the modern central boulevards.))
Some((Date(13,February,1880),[[Thomas Edison]] observes the [[Edison effect]].))
Some((Date(13,February,1881),The [[feminist]] newspaper ''[[La Citoyenne]]'' is first published in Paris by the activist [[Hubertine Auclert]].))
Some((Date(13,February,1913),The [[13th Dalai Lama]] proclaims [[Tibet]]an independence following a period of domination by Manchu Qing dynasty and initiated a period of almost [[Tibet (1912–51)|four decades of independence]].))
Some((Date(13,February,1914),[[Copyright]]: In New York City the [[American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers]] is established to protect the copyrighted musical compositions of its members.))
Some((Date(13,February,1920),The [[Negro National League (1920&ndash;31)|Negro National League]] is formed.))
Some((Date(13,February,1931),New Delhi becomes the capital of [[British Raj]].))
Some((Date(13,February,1934),The [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[steamship]] {{SS|Chelyuskin||2}} sinks in the Arctic Ocean.))
Some((Date(13,February,1935),A jury in [[Flemington, New Jersey]] finds [[Bruno Hauptmann]] guilty of the [[1932]] [[Lindbergh kidnapping|kidnapping and murder of the Lindbergh baby]], the son of [[Charles Lindbergh]].))
Some((Date(13,February,1945),[[World War II]]: The [[siege of Budapest]] concludes with the unconditional surrender of [[Nazi Germany|German]] and [[Kingdom of Hungary (1920&ndash;46)|Hungarian]] forces to the [[Red Army]].))
Some((Date(13,February,1951),[[Korean War]]: [[Battle of Chipyong-ni]], which represented the "high-water mark" of the Chinese incursion into South Korea, commences.))
Some((Date(13,February,1954),[[Frank Selvy]] becomes the only [[Division I (NCAA)|NCAA Division I]] basketball player ever to score 100 points in a single game.))
Some((Date(13,February,1955),[[Israel]] obtains four of the seven [[Dead Sea Scrolls]].))
Some((Date(13,February,1960),With the success of a [[nuclear test]] codenamed "[[Gerboise Bleue]]", France becomes the fourth country to possess nuclear weapons.))
Some((Date(13,February,1961),An allegedly [[Coso artifact|500,000-year-old rock]] is discovered near [[Olancha, California]], US, that appears to anachronistically encase a [[spark plug]].))
Some((Date(13,February,1967),American researchers discover the [[Codex Madrid (Leonardo)|Madrid Codices]] by [[Leonardo da Vinci]] in the [[Biblioteca Nacional de España|National Library of Spain]].))
Some((Date(13,February,1971),[[Vietnam War]]: Backed by American air and artillery support, [[South Vietnam]]ese troops invade [[Laos]].))
Some((Date(13,February,1978),[[Sydney Hilton Hotel bombing|Hilton bombing]]: a bomb explodes in a refuse truck outside the [[Hilton Hotel]] in Sydney, Australia, killing two refuse collectors and a policeman.))
Some((Date(13,February,1979),An intense [[February 13, 1979 windstorm|windstorm]] strikes western [[Washington (state)|Washington]] and sinks a 1/2-mile-long section of the [[Hood Canal Bridge]].))
Some((Date(13,February,1981),A series of [[Louisville sewer explosions|sewer explosions]] destroys more than two miles of streets in [[Louisville, Kentucky]].))
Some((Date(13,February,1982),The [[Río Negro Massacre]] takes place in [[Guatemala]].))
Some((Date(13,February,1983),A [[Cinema Statuto fire|cinema fire]] in [[Turin]], Italy, kills 64 people.))
Some((Date(13,February,1984),[[Konstantin Chernenko]] succeeds the late [[Yuri Andropov]] as general secretary of the [[Communist Party of the Soviet Union]].))
Some((Date(13,February,1990),[[German reunification]]: An agreement is reached on a two-stage plan to reunite Germany.))
Some((Date(13,February,1991),[[Gulf War]]: Two laser-guided "[[smart bomb]]s" destroy the [[Amiriyah shelter bombing|Amiriyah shelter]] in [[Baghdad]]. Allied forces said the bunker was being used as a military communications outpost, but over 400 Iraqi civilians inside were killed.))
Some((Date(13,February,2000),The last original "[[Peanuts]]" [[comic strip]] appears in newspapers one day after [[Charles M. Schulz]] dies.))
Some((Date(13,February,2001),An [[2001 El Salvador earthquakes|earthquake]] measuring 6.6 on the [[Richter magnitude scale]] hits [[El Salvador]], killing at least 400.))
Some((Date(13,February,2004),The [[Harvard&ndash;Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics]] announces the discovery of the universe's largest known [[diamond]], [[white dwarf]] [[star]] ''[[BPM 37093]]''. Astronomers named this star "Lucy" after [[The Beatles]]' song "[[Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds]]".))
Some((Date(13,February,2007),[[Taiwan]] opposition leader [[Ma Ying-jeou]] resigns as the chairman of the [[Kuomintang]] party after being indicted on charges of embezzlement during his tenure as the mayor of [[Taipei]]; Ma also announces his candidacy for the [[Republic of China presidential election, 2008|2008 presidential election]].))
Some((Date(13,February,2008),Australian Prime Minister [[Kevin Rudd]] makes a historic apology to the [[Indigenous Australians]] and the [[Stolen Generations]].))
Some((Date(13,February,2010),[[2010 Pune bombing|A bomb explodes]] in the city of [[Pune]], [[Maharashtra]], India, killing 17 and injuring 60 more.))
Some((Date(13,February,2011),For the first time in more than 100 years the [[Confederated Tribes of the Umatilla Indian Reservation|Umatilla]], an [[American Indian tribe]], are able to hunt and harvest a [[bison]] just outside [[Yellowstone National Park]], restoring a centuries-old tradition guaranteed by a [[treaty]] signed in 1855.))
Some((Date(13,February,2012),The [[European Space Agency]] (ESA) conducted the first launch of the European ''[[Vega (rocket)|Vega]]'' rocket from Europe's spaceport in [[Kourou]], [[French Guiana]].))
Some((Date(13,February,2013),A [[South Airlines Flight 8971|plane crash]] kills five people and injures nine others in [[Donetsk]], [[Ukraine]].

Some((Date(14,February,1983),United American Bank of [[Knoxville, Tennessee]] collapses. Its president, [[Jake Butcher]], is later convicted of [[fraud]].))

Some((Date(14,February,1998),An oil tanker train collides with a freight train in [[Yaoundé]], [[Cameroon]], spilling [[fuel oil]]. One person scavenging the oil created [[Yaoundé train explosion|a massive explosion]] which kills 120.))

Some((Date(14,February,2004),In a suburb of Moscow, Russia, the roof of the [[Transvaal Park|Transvaal water park]] collapses, killing more than 25 people, and wounding more than 100 others.))
Some((Date(14,February,2005),Lebanese self-made [[billionaire]] and business [[tycoon]] [[Rafic Hariri]] is [[Assassination of Rafic Hariri|killed]], along with 21 others, when explosives, equivalent of around 1,000 kg of [[Trinitrotoluene|TNT]], are detonated as his [[motorcade]] drove near the St. George Hotel in [[Beirut]].))
Some((Date(14,February,2008),[[Northern Illinois University shooting]]: A gunman opened fire in a lecture hall of the [[DeKalb County, Illinois]] university resulting in six fatalities (including gunman) and 21 injuries.))
Some((Date(14,February,2011),As a part of [[Arab Spring]], the [[Bahraini uprising (2011–present)|Bahraini uprising]], a series of demonstrations, amounting to a sustained campaign of civil resistance, in the Persian Gulf country of [[Bahrain]] begins with a [[Day of Rage (Bahrain)|'Day of Rage']].))

Some((Date(14,February,2015),Two people are killed in [[2015 Copenhagen shootings|shootings]] at a free-speech seminar and at a synagogue service in [[Copenhagen]].

Some((Date(15,February,1942),[[World War II]]: [[Fall of Singapore]]. Following an assault by [[Empire of Japan|Japan]]ese forces, the British General [[Arthur Percival]] surrenders. About 80,000 [[British Indian Army|Indian]], United Kingdom and Australian soldiers become [[prisoners of war]], the largest surrender of British-led military personnel in history.))

Some((Date(15,February,1979),[[Don Dunstan]] resigns as [[Premier of South Australia]], ending a decade of sweeping social liberalisation.))
Some((Date(15,February,1982),The [[drilling rig]] ''[[Ocean Ranger]]'' sinks during a storm off the coast of [[Newfoundland (island)|Newfoundland]], killing 84 workers.))
Some((Date(15,February,1989),[[Soviet war in Afghanistan]]: The [[Soviet Union]] officially announces that all of its troops have left [[Afghanistan]].))

Some((Date(15,February,2003),[[February 15, 2003 anti-war protest|Protests against the Iraq war]] take place in over 600 cities worldwide. It is estimated that between eight million to 30 million people participate, making this the largest peace demonstration in history.))
Some((Date(15,February,2013),[[Chelyabinsk meteor|A meteor explodes]] over Russia, injuring 1,500 people as a shock wave blows out windows and rocks buildings. This happens unexpectedly only hours before the ''expected'' closest ever approach of the larger and unrelated asteroid [[2012 DA14]].))

Some((Date(17,February,1964),In ''[[Wesberry v. Sanders]]'' the [[Supreme Court of the United States]] rules that [[United States Congress|congressional]] districts have to be approximately equal in population.))
Some((Date(17,February,1965),[[Ranger program|Project Ranger]]: The [[Ranger 8]] probe launches on its mission to photograph the ''[[Mare Tranquillitatis]]'' region of the Moon in preparation for the manned [[Apollo program|Apollo]] missions. ''Mare Tranquillitatis'' or the "Sea of Tranquility" would become the site chosen for the [[Apollo 11]] lunar landing.))

Some((Date(25,February,1986),[[People Power Revolution]]: President of the Philippines [[Ferdinand Marcos]] flees the nation after 20 years of rule; [[Corazon Aquino]] becomes the [[Philippines]]' first woman president.))
Some((Date(25,February,1987),[[Southern Methodist University]]'s football program is the first college football program to receive the [[death penalty (NCAA)|death penalty]] by the NCAA's Committee on Infractions. It was revealed that athletic officials and school administrators had knowledge of a "[[slush fund]]" used to make illegal payments to the school's football players as far back as 1981.))
Some((Date(25,February,1991),[[Gulf War]]: An [[Iraq]]i [[scud missile]] hits an American military barracks in [[Dhahran]], [[Saudi Arabia]] killing 28 [[United States Army Reserve|U.S. Army Reservists]] from [[Pennsylvania]].))

The Nazis used the fire to solidify their power and eliminate the communists as political rivals.))

Some((Date(28,February,1993),[[Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms]] agents [[Waco siege|raid]] the [[Branch Davidian]] church in [[Waco, Texas]] with a warrant to arrest the group's leader [[David Koresh]]. Four BATF agents and five Davidians die in the initial raid, starting a [[Waco siege|51-day standoff]].))
Some((Date(28,February,1995),Former Australian Liberal party leader [[John Hewson]] resigns from the Australian parliament almost two years after losing the [[Australian federal election, 1993]].))
Some((Date(28,February,1997),An [[1997 Ardabil earthquake|earthquake]] in northern [[Iran]] is responsible for about 3,000 deaths.))
Some((Date(28,February,1998),First flight of RQ-4 [[Global Hawk]], the first [[unmanned aerial vehicle]] certified to file its own flight plans and fly regularly in U.S. civilian airspace.))
Some((Date(28,February,2001),The [[2001 Nisqually earthquake|Nisqually earthquake]] (measuring 6.8 on the [[moment magnitude scale]]) hits the Nisqually Valley and the [[Seattle]], [[Tacoma, Washington|Tacoma]], and [[Olympia, Washington|Olympia]] area of the U.S. state of [[Washington (state)|Washington]].))
Some((Date(28,February,2002),During the [[2002 Gujarat riots|religious violence in Gujarat]], the 97 people killed in the [[Naroda Patiya massacre]] and 69 in [[Gulbarg Society massacre]].))
Some((Date(28,February,2004),Over one million [[Taiwan]]ese participating in the [[228 Hand-in-Hand Rally]] form a {{convert|500|km|mi|adj=on}} long human chain to commemorate the [[February 28 Incident]] in [[1947]]))
Some((Date(28,February,2005),A [[2005 Al Hillah bombing|suicide bombing]] at a police recruiting centre in [[Al Hillah]], [[Iraq]] kills 127.))
Some((Date(28,February,2013),[[Pope Benedict XVI]] [[Resignation of Pope Benedict XVI|resigns]] as the pope of the [[Catholic Church]] becoming the first pope to do so since 1415.

Some((Date(29,February,1704),[[Queen Anne's War]]: French forces and [[Native American (U.S.)|Native American]]s stage a [[1704 Raid on Deerfield|raid on Deerfield, Massachusetts]], killing 56 villagers and taking more than 100 captive.))
Some((Date(29,February,1712),February 29 is followed by [[February 30]] in Sweden, in a move to abolish the [[Swedish calendar]] for a return to the [[Julian calendar|Old style]].))

Some((Date(29,February,1768),Polish nobles formed [[Bar Confederation]].))
Some((Date(29,February,1796),The [[Jay Treaty]] between the United States and Great Britain comes into force, facilitating ten years of peaceful trade between the two nations.))
Some((Date(29,February,1892),[[St. Petersburg, Florida]] is incorporated.))
Some((Date(29,February,1912),The [[Piedra Movediza]] (Moving Stone) of [[Tandil]] falls and breaks.))
Some((Date(29,February,1916),[[Tokelau]] is annexed by the United Kingdom.))

Some((Date(29,February,1936),[[Baby Snooks]], played by [[Fanny Brice]], debuts on the [[radio]] program ''[[The Ziegfeld Follies of the Air]]''.))
Some((Date(29,February,1940),For her role as Mammy in ''[[Gone with the Wind (film)|Gone with the Wind]]'', [[Hattie McDaniel]] becomes the first [[African American]] to win an [[Academy Award]].))
Some((Date(29,February,1944),World War II: The [[Admiralty Islands]] are invaded in [[Operation Brewer]] led by American General [[Douglas MacArthur]].))
Some((Date(29,February,1952),The island of [[Heligoland]] is restored to German authority.))
Some((Date(29,February,1960),An [[1960 Agadir earthquake|earthquake]] in [[Morocco]] kills over 3,000 people and nearly destroys [[Agadir]] in the southern part of the country.))
Some((Date(29,February,1964),In Sydney, Australian swimmer [[Dawn Fraser]] sets a new world record in the 100-meter freestyle [[swimming (sport)|swimming]] competition (58.9 seconds).))
Some((Date(29,February,1980),[[Gordie Howe]] of the then [[Carolina Hurricanes|Hartford Whalers]] makes [[National Hockey League|NHL]] history as he scores his 800th goal.))
Some((Date(29,February,1988),South African archbishop [[Desmond Tutu]] is arrested along with 100 clergymen during a five-day anti-[[apartheid]] demonstration in [[Cape Town]].))
Some((Date(29,February,1992),First day of [[Bosnia and Herzegovina independence referendum, 1992|Bosnia and Herzegovina independence referendum]].))
Some((Date(29,February,1996),[[Faucett Flight 251]] crashes in the Andes, all 123 passengers and crew died.))
Some((Date(29,February,2004),[[Jean-Bertrand Aristide]] is removed as President of [[Haiti]] following a coup.))
Some((Date(29,February,2012),[[Tokyo Skytree]] construction completed. Now it is the [[List of tallest towers in the world|tallest tower in the world]], 634 meters high, and second tallest (man-made) structure on Earth, next to [[Burj Khalifa]].

Some((Date(1,March,-752),[[Romulus]], legendary first king of [[Ancient Rome|Rome]], celebrates the first [[Roman triumph]] after his victory over the [[Caenina (town)|Caeninenses]], following [[The Rape of the Sabine Women]].))

Some((Date(1,March,-86),[[Lucius Cornelius Sulla]], at the head of a [[Roman Republic]] army, enters [[Athens]], removing the [[tyrant]] [[Aristion]] who was supported by troops of [[Mithridates VI of Pontus]] ending the [[Siege of Athens and Piraeus (87–86 BC)|Siege of Athens and Piraeus]].))

Some((Date(1,March,1628),Writs issued in [[February]] by [[Charles I of England]] mandate that every county in England (not just seaport towns) pay [[ship tax]] by this date.))

Some((Date(1,March,1642),Georgeana, [[Massachusetts]] (now known as [[York, Maine]]), becomes the first incorporated city in the United States.))

Some((Date(1,March,1700),Sweden introduces its own [[Swedish calendar]], in an attempt to gradually merge into the [[Gregorian calendar]], reverts to the [[Julian calendar]] on this date in [[1712]], and introduces the Gregorian calendar on this date in [[1753]].))

Some((Date(2,March,1978),[[Czechoslovakia|Czech]] [[Vladimír Remek]] becomes the first non-Russian or non-American to go into [[outer space|space]], when he is launched aboard [[Soyuz 28]].))

Some((Date(3,March,1865),Opening of [[The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation]], the founding member of the [[HSBC|HSBC Group]].))
Some((Date(3,March,1873),[[Censorship in the United States]]: The U.S. Congress enacts the [[Comstock Law]], making it illegal to send any "obscene, lewd, or lascivious" books through the mail.))
Some((Date(3,March,1875),[[Georges Bizet]]'s opera ''[[Carmen]]'' receives its première at the [[Opéra-Comique]] in Paris.))
Some((Date(3,March,1878),The [[Russo-Turkish War (1877–78)|Russo-Turkish War]] ends as [[Bulgaria]] regains its independence from [[Ottoman Empire]] according to the [[Treaty of San Stefano]]; shortly after [[Congress of Berlin]] stripped its status to an autonomous state of the Ottoman Empire.))
Some((Date(3,March,1885),The [[American Telephone & Telegraph Company]] is incorporated in [[New York]].))
Some((Date(3,March,1904),Kaiser [[Wilhelm II of Germany]] becomes the first person to make a [[sound recording]] of a political document, using [[Thomas Edison]]'s [[phonograph cylinder]].))
Some((Date(3,March,1905),Tsar [[Nicholas II of Russia]] agrees to create an elected assembly, the [[Duma]].))
Some((Date(3,March,1910),[[Rockefeller Foundation]]: [[John D. Rockefeller Jr.]] announces his retirement from managing his businesses so that he can devote all his time to [[philanthropy]].))
Some((Date(3,March,1913),Thousands of women march in a [[Woman Suffrage Parade of 1913|suffrage parade]] in Washington, D.C.))
Some((Date(3,March,1915),[[National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics|NACA]], the predecessor of [[NASA]], is founded.))
Some((Date(3,March,1918),Germany, Austria and Russia sign the [[Treaty of Brest-Litovsk]] ending Russia's involvement in [[World War I]], and leading to the independence of Finland, [[Estonia]], [[Latvia]], [[Lithuania]] and Poland.))
Some((Date(3,March,1923),''[[Time (magazine)|TIME]]'' magazine is published for the first time.))
Some((Date(3,March,1924),The thirteen-century-old Islamic [[caliphate]] is abolished when Caliph [[Abdülmecid II]] of the Ottoman Empire is deposed. The last remnant of the old regime gives way to the reformed [[Turkey]] of [[Mustafa Kemal Atatürk|Kemal Atatürk]].))
Some((Date(3,March,1931),The United States adopts ''[[The Star-Spangled Banner]]'' as its [[national anthem]].))
Some((Date(3,March,1938),[[Petroleum|Oil]] is [[History of the oil industry in Saudi Arabia|discovered]] in [[Saudi Arabia]].))
Some((Date(3,March,1939),In [[Bombay]], [[Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi|Mohandas Gandhi]] begins a hunger strike in protest at the autocratic rule in [[British Raj|British India]].))
Some((Date(3,March,1940),Five people are killed in an arson attack on the offices of the [[Left Party (Sweden)|communist]] newspaper ''Norrskensflamman'' in [[Luleå]], Sweden.))
Some((Date(3,March,1942),[[World War II]]: Ten [[Empire of Japan|Japanese]] warplanes [[Attack on Broome|raid the town]] of [[Broome, Western Australia]], killing more than 100 people.))
Some((Date(3,March,1943),World War II: In London, England, 173 people are killed in a crush while trying to enter an air-raid shelter at [[Bethnal Green tube station]].))
Some((Date(3,March,1944),The [[Order of Nakhimov]] and [[Order of Ushakov]] are instituted in [[USSR]] as the highest naval awards.))
Some((Date(3,March,1945),World War II: American and Filipino troops [[Battle of Manila (1945)|recapture]] [[Manila]] in the [[Philippines]].))
Some((Date(3,March,1951),[[Jackie Brenston]], with [[Ike Turner]] and his band, records "[[Rocket 88]]", often cited as "the [[Origins of rock and roll#"The first rock and roll record"|first rock and roll record]]", at [[Sam Phillips]]' recording studios in [[Memphis, Tennessee]].))
Some((Date(3,March,1953),A [[Canadian Pacific Air Lines]] [[De Havilland Comet]] crashes in [[Karachi]], [[Pakistan]], killing 11.))
Some((Date(3,March,1958),[[Nuri al-Said]] becomes [[Prime Minister of Iraq]] for the eighth time.))
Some((Date(3,March,1969),[[Apollo program]]: NASA launches [[Apollo 9]] to test the [[Apollo Lunar Module|lunar module]].))
Some((Date(3,March,1972),[[Mohawk Airlines Flight 405]] crashes as a result of a control malfunction and insufficient training in emergency procedures.))
Some((Date(3,March,1974),[[Turkish Airlines Flight 981]] crashes at [[Ermenonville]] near Paris, France killing all 346 aboard.))
Some((Date(3,March,1980),The {{USS|Nautilus|SSN-571|6}} is [[Ship decommissioning|decommissioned]] and stricken from the [[Naval Vessel Register]].))
Some((Date(3,March,1985),[[Arthur Scargill]] declares that the [[National Union of Mineworkers (Great Britain)|National Union of Mineworkers]] national executive voted to end the longest-running industrial dispute in Great Britain without any peace deal over pit closures.))
Some((Date(3,March,1991),An [[amateur video]] captures the beating of [[Rodney King]] by [[Los Angeles Police Department|Los Angeles police officers]].))
Some((Date(3,March,1997),The [[List of tallest buildings and structures in the world|tallest free-standing structure]] in the Southern Hemisphere, [[Sky Tower (Auckland)|Sky Tower]] in downtown [[Auckland]], New Zealand, opens after two-and-a-half years of construction.))
Some((Date(3,March,2005),[[Mayerthorpe tragedy]]: [[James Roszko]] murders four [[Royal Canadian Mounted Police]] constables during a drug bust at his property in [[Rochfort Bridge, Alberta]], then commits suicide. It is the deadliest peace-time incident for the RCMP since 1885 and the [[North-West Rebellion]].))
Some((Date(3,March,2009),The [[Historical Archive of the City of Cologne]] collapses.))
Some((Date(3,March,2012),Two trains [[Szczekociny rail crash|crash]] in the small Polish town of [[Szczekociny]] near [[Zawiercie]], with 16 people killed and up to 58 people injured.))
Some((Date(3,March,2013),A [[March 2013 Karachi bombing|bomb blast]] in [[Karachi]], Pakistan, kills at least 45 people and injured 180 others in a predominately [[Shia Muslim]] area.))
Some((Date(3,March,2014),The [[Trial of Oscar Pistorius|trial]] of [[Oscar Pistorius]] begins in [[Pretoria]].))
Some((Date(3,March,2015),[[Slovenia]] [[Recognition of same-sex unions in Slovenia|legalizes]] same-sex marriage.

Some((Date(4,March,1152),[[Frederick I, Holy Roman Emperor|Frederick I Barbarossa]] is elected [[King of Germany]].))

Some((Date(4,March,1461),[[Wars of the Roses]] in England: [[House of Lancaster|Lancastrian]] [[Henry VI of England|King Henry VI]] is deposed by his [[House of York]] cousin, who then becomes [[Edward IV of England|King Edward IV]].))
Some((Date(4,March,1493),Explorer [[Christopher Columbus]] arrives back in [[Lisbon]], Portugal, aboard his ship ''[[Niña]]'' from [[Voyages of Christopher Columbus#First voyage|his voyage]] to what is now [[The Bahamas]] and other islands in the [[Caribbean]].))
Some((Date(4,March,1519),[[Hernán Cortés]] arrives in Mexico in search of the [[Aztec]] civilization and its wealth.))
Some((Date(4,March,1628),The [[Massachusetts Bay Colony]] is granted a [[Royal charter]].))
Some((Date(4,March,1665),English King [[Charles II of England|Charles II]] declares war on the Netherlands marking the start of the [[Second Anglo-Dutch War]].))
Some((Date(4,March,1675),[[John Flamsteed]] is appointed the first [[Astronomer Royal]] of England.))
Some((Date(4,March,1681),Charles II grants a land charter to [[William Penn]] for the area that will later become [[Pennsylvania]].))
Some((Date(4,March,1776),[[American Revolutionary War]]: The [[Continental Army]] [[Fortification of Dorchester Heights|fortifies]] [[Dorchester Heights]] with [[cannon]], leading the [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] troops to abandon the [[Siege of Boston]].))
Some((Date(4,March,1789),In New York City, the [[1st United States Congress|first]] [[Congress of the United States]] meets, putting the [[United States Constitution]] into effect. The [[United States Bill of Rights]] is written and proposed to Congress.))
Some((Date(4,March,1790),France is divided into 83 ''[[Departments of France|départements]]'', cutting across the [[provinces of France|former provinces]] in an attempt to dislodge regional loyalties based on ownership of land by the nobility.))
Some((Date(4,March,1791),The [[Constitutional Act of 1791]] is introduced by the [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom|British House of Commons]] in London which envisages the separation of Canada into [[Lower Canada]] ([[Quebec]]) and [[Upper Canada]] ([[Ontario]]).))
Some((Date(4,March,1794),The [[Eleventh Amendment to the United States Constitution|11th Amendment]] to the U.S. Constitution is passed by the [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]].))
Some((Date(4,March,1804),[[Castle Hill convict rebellion|Castle Hill Rebellion]]: Irish convicts rebel against British colonial authority in the Colony of [[New South Wales]].))
Some((Date(4,March,1814),Americans defeat British forces at the [[Battle of Longwoods]] between [[London, Ontario]] and Thamesville, near present-day [[Southwest Middlesex, Ontario|Wardsville]], [[Ontario]].))
Some((Date(4,March,1837),The city of [[Chicago]] is incorporated.))
Some((Date(4,March,1848),[[Charles Albert of Savoy|Carlo Alberto di Savoia]] signs the ''[[Statuto Albertino]]'' that will later represent the first [[Constitution of Italy|constitution]] of the ''[[Italy|Regno d'Italia]]''.))
Some((Date(4,March,1861),The [[Flags of the Confederate States of America|first national flag]] of the [[Confederate States of America]] (the "Stars and Bars") is adopted.))
Some((Date(4,March,1865),The [[Flags of the Confederate States of America|third and final national flag]] of the [[Confederate States of America]] is adopted by the Confederate Congress.))
Some((Date(4,March,1882),Britain's first electric trams run in east London.))
Some((Date(4,March,1890),The longest bridge in Great Britain, the [[Forth Bridge]] in Scotland, measuring {{Convert|1710|ft|m}} long, is opened by the [[Prince of Wales]], later King [[Edward VII]].))
Some((Date(4,March,1899),[[Cyclone Mahina]] sweeps in north of [[Cooktown]], Queensland, with a {{Convert|12|m|ft}} wave that reaches up to {{Convert|5|km|mi}} inland, killing over 300.))
Some((Date(4,March,1908),The [[Collinwood school fire]], [[Collinwood]] near [[Cleveland]], [[Ohio]], kills 174 people.))

Knox]] as [[United States Secretary of State|U.S. Secretary of State]]))

Some((Date(4,March,1957),The [[S&P 500]] [[stock market index]] is introduced, replacing the S&P 90.))

Some((Date(4,March,1970),French submarine ''[[French submarine Eurydice (S644)|Eurydice]]'' explodes underwater, resulting in the loss of the entire 57-man crew.))

Some((Date(4,March,1976),The [[Northern Ireland Constitutional Convention]] is formally dissolved in [[Northern Ireland]] resulting in [[direct rule]] of Northern Ireland from London by the [[Parliament of the United Kingdom|British parliament]].))

Some((Date(4,March,1983),[[Bertha Wilson]] is appointed the first woman to sit on the [[Supreme Court of Canada]].))
Some((Date(4,March,1985),The [[Food and Drug Administration]] approves a [[blood test]] for [[AIDS]] infection, used since then for screening all [[blood donation]]s in the United States.))
Some((Date(4,March,1986),The [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[Vega 1]] begins returning images of [[Halley's Comet]] and the first images of its nucleus.))
Some((Date(4,March,1991),[[Sheikh]] [[Saad Al-Salim Al-Sabah]], the [[Prime Minister of Kuwait]], returns to his country for the first time since [[Iraq]]'s invasion.))
Some((Date(4,March,1996),A [[Weyauwega, Wisconsin, derailment|derailed train]] in [[Weyauwega, Wisconsin]], US, causes the [[emergency evacuation]] of 2,300 people for 16 days.))
Some((Date(4,March,1998),[[LGBT rights in the United States|Gay rights]]: ''[[Oncale v. Sundowner Offshore Services, Inc.]]'': The [[Supreme Court of the United States]] rules that federal laws banning on-the-job [[sexual harassment]] also apply when both parties are the same sex.))
Some((Date(4,March,2001),[[2001 BBC bombing|BBC bombing]]: A massive car bomb explodes in front of the [[BBC Television Centre]] in London, seriously injuring one person. The attack was attributed to the [[Real IRA]].))
Some((Date(4,March,2002),[[War in Afghanistan (2001–14)|Afghanistan]]: Seven American [[Special Operations Forces]] soldiers and 200 Al-Qaeda Fighters are killed as American forces attempt to [[Battle of Takur Ghar|infiltrate]] the [[Shah-i-Kot Valley]] on a low-flying helicopter reconnaissance mission.))
Some((Date(4,March,2009),The [[International Criminal Court]] (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for [[President of Sudan|Sudanese President]] [[Omar Hassan al-Bashir]] for [[war crime]]s and [[crimes against humanity]] in [[Darfur]]. Al-Bashir is the first sitting [[head of state]] to be indicted by the ICC since its establishment in 2002.))

Some((Date(5,March,1906),[[Moro Rebellion]]: [[United States Army]] troops bring overwhelming force against the native [[Moro people|Moros]] in the [[First Battle of Bud Dajo]], leaving only six survivors.))

Some((Date(5,March,1931),The British [[Viceroy]] of [[British Raj|India]], [[Governor-General]] [[Edward Frederick Lindley Wood]] and [[Mohandas Gandhi]] (Mahatma Gandhi) [[Gandhi–Irwin Pact|sign an agreement]] envisaging the release of political prisoners and allowing salt to be freely used by the poorest members of the population.))

Some((Date(11,March,1931),''[[Ready for Labour and Defence of the USSR]]'', abbreviated as ''GTO'', is introduced in the [[Soviet Union]].))
Some((Date(11,March,1932),Booming Ben, the last [[heath hen]] was seen for the final time.))
Some((Date(11,March,1933),Ground breaking [[musical film]] ''[[42nd Street (film)|42nd Street]]'' is released.))
Some((Date(11,March,1941),[[World War II]]: United States President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] signs the [[Lend-Lease]] Act into law, allowing American-built war supplies to be shipped to the [[Allies of World War II|Allies]] on loan.))
Some((Date(11,March,1942),World War II: General [[Douglas MacArthur]] flees [[Corregidor]].))

Some((Date(11,March,1975),[[Vietnam War]]: [[North Vietnam]]ese and [[Viet Cong]] guerrilla forces [[Battle of Ban Me Thuot|establish control]] over [[Buôn Ma Thuột|Ban Me Thuot]] commune from the [[Army of the Republic of Vietnam|South Vietnamese army]].))
Some((Date(11,March,1977),The [[1977 Hanafi Siege]]: More than 130 hostages held in Washington, D.C., by [[Hanafi]] Muslims are set free after ambassadors from three [[Islam]]ic nations join negotiations.))

Some((Date(11,March,2004),[[2004 Madrid train bombings|Madrid train bombings]]: Simultaneous explosions on rush hour trains in [[Madrid]], Spain, kill 191 people.))
Some((Date(11,March,2006),[[Michelle Bachelet]] is inaugurated as first female president of Chile.))
Some((Date(11,March,2007),[[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] claims Russian helicopters [[2007 Georgia helicopter incident|attack]]ed the [[Kodori Valley]] in [[Abkhazia]], an accusation that Russia categorically denies later.))
Some((Date(11,March,2009),[[Winnenden school shooting]]: Sixteen are killed and 11 are injured before recent-graduate Tim Kretschmer shoots and kills himself, leading to tightened weapons restrictions in Germany.))
Some((Date(11,March,2010),Economist and businessman [[Sebastián Piñera]] is sworn in as [[President of Chile]], while [[2010 Pichilemu earthquake|three earthquakes]], the strongest measuring magnitude 6.9 and all centered next to [[Pichilemu]], capital of [[Cardenal Caro Province|Cardenal Caro]] province, hit central Chile during the ceremony.))
Some((Date(11,March,2011),An [[2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami|earthquake]] measuring 9.0 in magnitude strikes {{convert|130|km|mi|abbr=on}} east of [[Sendai]], Japan, triggering a [[2011 Japanese tsunami|tsunami]] killing thousands of people. This event also triggered the [[Fukushima Daiichi nuclear disaster|second largest nuclear accident]] in history, and one of only two events to be classified as a Level 7 on the [[International Nuclear Event Scale]].))
Some((Date(11,March,2012),A U.S. soldier [[Kandahar massacre|kills 16 civilians]] in the [[Panjwayi District]] of [[Afghanistan]] near [[Kandahar]].))

At least 498 were killed in this strike-slip event on the [[North Anatolian Fault]].))

Some((Date(15,March,1939),[[World War II]]: [[Nazi Germany|German]] troops occupy the remaining part of [[Bohemia]] and [[Moravia]]; [[Czechoslovakia]] ceases to exist.))

Some((Date(15,March,1945),World War II: Soviet forces begin an [[Upper Silesian Offensive|offensive]] to push Germans from [[Upper Silesia]].))
Some((Date(15,March,1952),In [[Cilaos]], [[Réunion]], 1870&nbsp;mm (73&nbsp;inches) of rain falls in a 24-hour period, setting a new world record (March 15 through March 16).))
Some((Date(15,March,1956),''[[My Fair Lady]]'' debuts on Broadway at the Mark Hellinger Theatre.))
Some((Date(15,March,1961),South Africa withdraws from the [[Commonwealth of Nations]].))

Some((Date(15,March,1978),[[Somalia]] and [[Ethiopia]] signed a truce to end the [[Ethio-Somali War]].))
Some((Date(15,March,1985),The first [[Internet]] [[domain name]] is registered ([[symbolics]].com).))
Some((Date(15,March,1986),[[Collapse of the Hotel New World]]: Thirty-three people die when the Hotel New World in Singapore collapses.))

Some((Date(16,March,1521),[[Ferdinand Magellan]], reached the island of [[Homonhon]], in the [[Philippines]], with 150 crew. Members of his expedition became the first Spaniards to reach the Philippine archipelago, but were not the first Europeans. He landed with three small ships, Concepcion, Trinidad and Victoria and called the place the Arcigelago de San Lazaro since it was the feast day of Saint [[Lazarus of Bethany]].))
Some((Date(16,March,1621),[[Samoset]], a [[Mohegan]], visited the settlers of [[Plymouth Colony]] and greets them, "Welcome, Englishmen! My name is Samoset."))

Lee Spence]], exactly 102 years after its destruction.))

Some((Date(22,March,1697),[[Charles II of Spain|Charles II]] of [[Spain]] issued a Royal Cedula extending to the indigenous nobles of the Spanish Crown colonies, as well as to their descendants, the preeminence and honors customarily attributed to the [[Hidalgo (nobility)|Hidalgos]] of [[Kingdom of Castile|Castile]].<ref>''Por cuanto teniendo presentes las leyes y cédulas que se mandaron despachar por los Señores Reyes mis progenitores y por mí, encargo el buen tratamiento, amparo, protección y defensa de los indios naturales de la América, y que sean atendidos, mantenidos, favorecidos y honrados  como todos los demás vasallos de mi Corona, y que por el trascurso del tiempo se detiene la práctica y uso de ellas, y siento tan conveniente su puntual cumplimiento al bien público  y utilidad de los Indios y al servicio de Dios y mío, y que en esta consecuencia por lo que toca a los indios mestizos está encargo a los Arzobispos y Obispos de las Indias, por la Ley Siete, Título Siete, del Libro Primero, de la  Recopilación, los ordenen de sacerdotes, concurriendo las calidades y circunstancias que en ella se disponen y que si algunas mestizas quisieren ser religiosas  dispongan el que se las admita en los monasterios y a las profesiones, y aunque en lo especial de que quedan ascender los indios a puestos eclesiásticos o seculares, gubernativos, políticos y de guerra, que todos piden limpieza de sangre y por estatuto  la calidad de nobles, hay distinción entre los Indios y mestizos, o como descendentes de los indios principales que se llaman caciques, o como procedidos de indios menos principales que son los tributarios, y que en su gentilidad reconocieron vasallaje, se considera que a los primeros y sus descendentes se les deben todas las preeminencias y honores, así en lo eclesiástico como en lo secular que se acostumbran conferir a los nobles Hijosdalgo de Castilla y pueden participar de cualesquier comunidades que por estatuto pidan nobleza, pues es constante que estos en su gentilismo eran nobles a quienes sus inferiores reconocían vasallaje y tributaban, cuya especie de nobleza todavía  se les conserva y considera, guardándoles en lo posible, o privilegios, como así se reconoce y declara por todo el Título de los caciques, que es el Siete, del Libro Seis, de la Recopilación, donde por distinción de los indios inferiores se les dejó el señorío con nombre de cacicazgo, transmisible de mayor en mayor, a sus  posterioridades...'' [https://books.google.it/books?id=MUZiJ2XG_-IC&lpg=PA232&ots=XtW6Qoc86n&dq=Vicente%20de%20Cadenas%20y%20Vicent%2C%20Las%20Pruebas%20de%20Nobleza%20y%20Genealogia%20en%20Filipinas%20y%20Los%20Archivios%20en%20Donde%20se%20Pueden%20Encontrar%20Antecedentes%20de%20Ellas%20in%20Heraldica%2C%20Genealogia%20y%20Nobleza%20en%20los%20Editoriales%20de%20%C2%ABHidalguia%C2%BB%2C&hl=it&pg=PA28#v=onepage&q&f=false| Cf. DE CADENAS Y VICENT, Vicente (1993). ''Las Pruebas de Nobleza y Genealogia en Filipinas y Los Archivios en Donde se Pueden Encontrar Antecedentes de Ellas'' in ''Heraldica, Genealogia y Nobleza en los Editoriales de «Hidalguia»'', 1953-1993: 40 años de un pensamiento (in Castellano). Madrid: HIDALGUIA, pp. 234-235.]</ref>))

Some((Date(23,March,1862),The [[First Battle of Kernstown]], Virginia, marks the start of Stonewall Jackson's Valley Campaign.  Though a Confederate defeat, the engagement distracts Federal efforts to capture Richmond.))

Some((Date(23,March,1889),The [[Ahmadiyya]] Muslim Community is established by [[Mirza Ghulam Ahmad]] in [[Qadian]],  India.))
Some((Date(23,March,1901),[[Emilio Aguinaldo]], only President of the [[First Philippine Republic]], was captured at [[Palanan, Isabela]] by forces of General [[Frederick Funston]].))
Some((Date(23,March,1905),[[Eleftherios Venizelos]] calls for [[Crete]]'s union with Greece, and begins what is to be known as the [[Theriso revolt]].))
Some((Date(23,March,1908),American diplomat [[Durham Stevens]] is attacked by Korean assassins [[Jeon Myeong-un]] and [[Jang In-hwan]], leading to his death in a hospital two days later.))
Some((Date(23,March,1909),[[Theodore Roosevelt]] leaves New York for a post-[[presidency]] [[safari]] in Africa. The trip is sponsored by the [[Smithsonian Institution]] and [[National Geographic Society]].))

Some((Date(23,March,1919),In [[Milan]], Italy, [[Benito Mussolini]] founds his [[Italian Fascism|Fascist]] political movement.))
Some((Date(23,March,1931),[[Bhagat Singh]], [[Shivaram Rajguru]] and [[Sukhdev Thapar]] are hanged for the killing of a deputy superintendent of police during the Indian struggle for independence.))

Some((Date(23,March,1978),The first [[UNIFIL]] troops arrived in [[Lebanon]] for [[Timeline of UN peacekeeping missions|peacekeeping mission]] along the [[Blue Line (Lebanon)|Blue Line]].))
Some((Date(23,March,1980),Archbishop [[Óscar Romero]] of [[El Salvador]] gives his famous speech appealing to men of the El Salvadoran armed forces to stop killing the Salvadorans.))
Some((Date(23,March,1982),[[Guatemala]]'s government, headed by [[Fernando Romeo Lucas García]] is overthrown in a military coup by right-wing General [[Efraín Ríos Montt]].))
Some((Date(23,March,1983),[[Strategic Defense Initiative]]: President [[Ronald Reagan]] makes his initial proposal to develop technology to intercept enemy missiles.))
Some((Date(23,March,1991),The [[Revolutionary United Front]], with support from the special forces of [[Charles Taylor (Liberian politician)|Charles Taylor]]'s [[National Patriotic Front of Liberia]], invades [[Sierra Leone]] in an attempt to overthrow [[Joseph Saidu Momoh]], sparking a gruesome 11-year [[Sierra Leone Civil War]].))

Some((Date(23,March,2005),[[Texas City Refinery explosion]]: During a test on a distillation tower liquid waste builds up and flows out of a blowout tower. Waste fumes ignite and explode killing 15 workers.))

She had been wanting to rule jointly with her husband in the same manner as [[William and Mary]] in the British Isles, but after the Riksdag of the Estates said no to this, she chose to abdicate the throne in his favour instead.))

Some((Date(25,March,1821),([[Julian calendar]]) Traditional date of the start of the [[Greek War of Independence]]. The war had actually begun on [[23 February]] 1821. The date was chosen in the early years of the Greek state so that it falls on the day of the [[Annunciation of the Blessed Virgin Mary]], strengthening the ties between the Greek Orthodox Church and the newly founded state.))

Some((Date(27,March,1884),A mob in [[Cincinnati]], [[Ohio]], attacks members of a [[jury]] who had returned a verdict of [[manslaughter]] in a clear case of [[murder]], and then over the next few days would [[Cincinnati riots of 1884|riot and destroy the courthouse]].))

Some((Date(27,March,1915),[[Typhoid Mary]], the first [[Asymptomatic carrier|healthy carrier]] of disease ever identified in the United States, is put in [[quarantine]], where she would remain for the rest of her life.))

Some((Date(27,March,1977),[[Tenerife airport disaster]]: Two [[Boeing 747]] [[airliner]]s collide on a foggy runway on [[Tenerife]] in the [[Canary Islands]], killing 583 (all 248 on [[KLM]] and 335 on [[Pan Am]]). Sixty-one survived on the Pan Am flight. This is the worst aviation accident in history.))
Some((Date(27,March,1980),The Norwegian oil platform [[Alexander L. Kielland (platform)|Alexander L. Kielland]] collapses in the [[North Sea]], killing 123 of its crew of 212.))

Some((Date(31,March,1921),The [[Royal Australian Air Force]] is formed.))
Some((Date(31,March,1930),The [[Motion Picture Production Code]] is instituted, imposing strict guidelines on the treatment of sex, crime, religion and violence in film, in the U.S., for the next thirty-eight years.))
Some((Date(31,March,1931),An [[1931 Nicaragua earthquake|earthquake]] destroys [[Managua]], Nicaragua, killing 2,000.))
Some((Date(31,March,1933),The [[Civilian Conservation Corps]] is established with the mission of relieving rampant unemployment in the United States.))
Some((Date(31,March,1942),[[World War II]]: [[Battle of Christmas Island|Japanese forces invade Christmas Island]], then a British possession.))
Some((Date(31,March,1945),World War II: A defecting German pilot delivers a [[Messerschmitt Me 262A-1]], the world's first operational [[Turbojet|jet-powered]] [[fighter aircraft]], to the Americans, the first to fall into Allied hands.))
Some((Date(31,March,1949),The [[Dominion of Newfoundland]] joins the [[Canadian Confederation]] and becomes the 10th [[Province of Canada]].))
Some((Date(31,March,1951),[[Remington Rand]] delivers the first [[UNIVAC I]] computer to the [[United States Census Bureau]].))
Some((Date(31,March,1957),[[Upper Voltan Territorial Assembly election, 1957|Elections to the Territorial Assembly]] of the French colony [[French Upper Volta|Upper Volta]] are held. After the elections [[Unified Democratic Party|PDU]] and [[Voltaic Democratic Movement|MDV]] form a government.))
Some((Date(31,March,1958),In the [[Canadian federal election, 1958|Canadian federal election]], the [[Progressive Conservative Party of Canada|Progressive Conservatives]], led by [[John Diefenbaker]], win the largest percentage of seats in Canadian history, with 208 seats of 265.))
Some((Date(31,March,1959),The [[14th Dalai Lama]], crosses the border into India and is granted [[political asylum]].))
Some((Date(31,March,1964),A [[1964 Brazilian coup d'état|coup d'état in Brazil]] establishes a [[Brazilian military government|military government]], under the aegis of general [[Humberto de Alencar Castelo Branco|Castelo Branco]].))
Some((Date(31,March,1966),The [[Soviet Union]] launches [[Luna 10]] which later becomes the first [[space probe]] to enter orbit around the Moon.))
Some((Date(31,March,1970),[[Explorer 1]] re-enters the Earth's atmosphere after 12 years in orbit.))
Some((Date(31,March,1979),The last British soldier leaves the [[Malta|Maltese Islands]]. Malta declares its Freedom Day (Jum il-Helsien).))
Some((Date(31,March,1980),The [[Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad]] operates its final train after being ordered to liquidate its assets because of bankruptcy and debts owed to creditors.))
Some((Date(31,March,1985),The first [[WrestleMania]], the biggest wrestling event from the WWE (then the WWF), takes place in [[Madison Square Garden]] in New York.))
Some((Date(31,March,1986),Six [[metropolitan county]] councils are abolished in England.))
Some((Date(31,March,1990),Approximately [[Poll Tax Riots|200,000 protestors take to the streets]] of London to protest against the newly introduced [[Community Charge|Poll Tax]].))
Some((Date(31,March,1991),[[Georgian independence referendum, 1991]]: Nearly 99 percent of the voters support the country's independence from the Soviet Union.))
Some((Date(31,March,1992),The {{USS|Missouri|BB-63|6}}, the last active United States Navy [[battleship]], is decommissioned in [[Long Beach, California]].))
Some((Date(31,March,1994),The journal ''[[Nature (journal)|Nature]]'' reports the finding in [[Ethiopia]] of the first complete ''[[Australopithecus afarensis]]'' skull.))
Some((Date(31,March,2004),[[Iraq War in Anbar Province]]: In [[Fallujah]], Iraq, four American [[private military contractor]]s working for [[Blackwater USA]], are killed after being [[2004 Fallujah ambush|ambushed]].

Some((Date(1,April,1918),The [[Royal Air Force]] is created by the merger of the [[Royal Flying Corps]] and the [[Royal Naval Air Service]].))
Some((Date(1,April,1919),The [[Bauhaus|Staatliches Bauhaus]] school is founded by [[Walter Gropius]] in [[Weimar]].))
Some((Date(1,April,1922),Six Irish Catholic civilians [[Arnon Street killings|are shot and beaten to death]] by a gang of policemen in [[Belfast]], [[Northern Ireland]].))

Some((Date(1,April,1933),The recently elected [[Nazism|Nazis]] under [[Julius Streicher]] organize a one-day boycott of all Jewish-owned businesses in Germany, ushering in a series of [[anti-Semitism|anti-Semitic]] acts.))

Some((Date(1,April,1986),[[Sector Kanda]]: [[Communist Party of Nepal (Mashal)]] cadres attacks a number of police stations in [[Kathmandu]], seeking to incite a popular rebellion.))

The Inquisition is suspended and a delegation is sent to [[Habsburg Spain|Spain]] to petition [[Philip II of Spain|Philip II]].))

Some((Date(7,April,1955),[[Winston Churchill]] resigns as [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom]] amid indications of failing health.))
Some((Date(7,April,1956),Spain relinquishes its [[Spanish Morocco|protectorate in Morocco]].))
Some((Date(7,April,1964),[[International Business Machines|IBM]] announces the [[IBM System/360|System/360]].))
Some((Date(7,April,1967),Film critic [[Roger Ebert]] published his very first film review in the ''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]''.))
Some((Date(7,April,1968),Motor racing world champion [[Jim Clark]] was killed in an accident during a [[Formula Two]] race at [[Hockenheimring|Hockenheim]].))
Some((Date(7,April,1969),The [[Internet]]'s symbolic birth date: Publication of [[Request for Comments|RFC]] 1.))
Some((Date(7,April,1971),President [[Richard Nixon]] announces his decision to increase the rate of American troop withdrawals from [[Vietnam]].))
Some((Date(7,April,1976),Former British Cabinet Minister [[John Stonehouse]] resigns from the [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour Party]].))
Some((Date(7,April,1977),German Federal prosecutor [[Siegfried Buback]] and his driver are shot by two [[Red Army Faction]] members while waiting at a red light.))
Some((Date(7,April,1978),Development of the [[neutron bomb]] is canceled by President [[Jimmy Carter]].))
Some((Date(7,April,1980),The United States severs relations with the [[Iran|Islamic Republic of Iran]].))
Some((Date(7,April,1983),During [[STS-6]], astronauts [[Story Musgrave]] and [[Donald H. Peterson|Don Peterson]] perform the first [[Space Shuttle]] spacewalk.))
Some((Date(7,April,1985),Soviet leader [[Mikhail Gorbachev]] declares a moratorium on the deployment of middle-range missiles in Europe.))
Some((Date(7,April,1989),[[Soviet submarine K-278 Komsomolets|Soviet submarine Komsomolets]] sinks in the [[Barents Sea]] off the coast of Norway killing 42 sailors.))
Some((Date(7,April,1990),[[Iran–Contra affair]]: [[John Poindexter]] is found guilty of five charges for his part in the scandal (the conviction is later reversed on appeal).))
Some((Date(7,April,1992),[[Republika Srpska]] announces its independence.))
Some((Date(7,April,1994),[[Rwandan Genocide]]: Massacres of [[Tutsi]]s begin in [[Kigali]], [[Rwanda]].))
Some((Date(7,April,1995),[[First Chechen War]]: Russian [[paramilitary]] troops begin a [[Samashki massacre|massacre]] of civilians in [[Samashki]], [[Chechnya]].))
Some((Date(7,April,1999),The [[World Trade Organization]] rules in favor of the United States in its long-running trade dispute with the [[European Union]] over bananas.))
Some((Date(7,April,2001),[[Mars Odyssey]] is launched.))
Some((Date(7,April,2003),U.S. troops capture [[Baghdad]]; [[Saddam Hussein]]'s regime falls two days later.))
Some((Date(7,April,2009),Former [[Peru]]vian President [[Alberto Fujimori]] is sentenced to 25 years in prison for ordering killings and kidnappings by security forces.))
Some((Date(8,April,1093),The new [[Winchester Cathedral]] is dedicated by [[Walkelin]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1139),[[Roger II of Sicily]] is excommunicated.))
Some((Date(8,April,1149),[[Pope Eugene III]] takes refuge in the castle of [[Ptolemy II of Tusculum]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1232),[[Mongol conquest of the Jin dynasty|Mongol–Jin War]]: The [[Mongol Empire|Mongols]] begin their [[Mongol siege of Kaifeng|siege on Kaifeng]], the capital of the [[Jin dynasty (1115–1234)|Jin dynasty]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1271),In [[Syria]], sultan [[Baibars]] conquers the [[Krak des Chevaliers]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1665),English colonial patents are granted for the establishment of the [[Monmouth Tract]], for what would eventually become [[Monmouth County, New Jersey|Monmouth County]] in northeastern New Jersey.))
Some((Date(8,April,1730),[[Shearith Israel]], the first [[synagogue]] in New York City, is dedicated.))
Some((Date(8,April,1740),[[War of Jenkins' Ear]]: Three British ships [[Action of 8 April 1740|capture]] the Spanish [[third-rate]] ''Princesa'', taken into service as  {{HMS|Princess|1740|6}}.))
Some((Date(8,April,1808),The [[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Baltimore|Roman Catholic Diocese of Baltimore]] is promoted to an archdiocese, with the founding of the dioceses of [[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York|New York]], [[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Philadelphia|Philadelphia]], [[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Boston|Boston]], and [[Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Louisville|Bardstown]] (now Louisville) by [[Pope Pius VII]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1820),The [[Venus de Milo]] is discovered on the [[Aegean Sea|Aegean]] island of [[Milos]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1832),[[Black Hawk War]]: Around three-hundred United States 6th Infantry troops leave [[St. Louis, Missouri]] to fight the [[Sauk people|Sauk]] [[Native Americans in the United States|Native Americans]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1864),[[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Mansfield]]: [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] forces are thwarted by the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] army at [[Mansfield, Louisiana]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1866),Italy and [[Prussia]] [[Austro-Prussian War|ally against]] the [[Austrian Empire]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1886),[[William Ewart Gladstone]] introduces the first [[Irish Government Bill 1886|Irish Home Rule Bill]] into the [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom|British House of Commons]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1895),In [[Pollock v. Farmers' Loan & Trust Co.]] the [[Supreme Court of the United States]] declares unapportioned [[income tax]] to be [[Constitutionality|unconstitutional]].))

Some((Date(8,April,1906),[[Auguste Deter]], the first person to be diagnosed with [[Alzheimer's disease]], dies.))
Some((Date(8,April,1908),[[Harvard University]] votes to establish the [[Harvard Business School]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1911),[[Dutch people|Dutch]] physicist [[Heike Kamerlingh Onnes]] discovers [[superconductivity]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1913),The [[17th Amendment to the United States Constitution]], requiring direct [[election]] of [[United States Senate|Senators]], becomes law.))
Some((Date(8,April,1916),In [[Corona, California]], race car driver [[Bob Burman]] crashes, killing three (including himself), and badly injuring five spectators.))
Some((Date(8,April,1918),[[World War I]]: Actors [[Douglas Fairbanks]] and [[Charlie Chaplin]] sell [[war bond]]s on the streets of New York City's financial district.))
Some((Date(8,April,1924),[[Sharia]] courts are abolished in [[Turkey]], as part of [[Atatürk's Reforms]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1929),[[Indian independence movement]]: At the Delhi Central Assembly, [[Bhagat Singh]] and [[Batukeshwar Dutt]] throw handouts and bombs to court arrest.))
Some((Date(8,April,1935),The [[Works Progress Administration]] is formed when the [[Emergency Relief Appropriation Act of 1935]] becomes law.))
Some((Date(8,April,1942),[[World War II]]: [[Siege of Leningrad]]: [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] forces open a much-needed railway link to [[Saint Petersburg|Leningrad]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1943),U.S. President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]], in an attempt to check [[inflation]], freezes wages and prices, prohibits workers from changing jobs unless the war effort would be aided thereby, and bars rate increases by [[common carrier]]s and [[public utilities]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1945),World War II: After an air raid accidentally destroys a train carrying about 4,000 [[Nazi concentration camp]] internees in [[Prussian Hanover]], the survivors are [[Celler Hasenjagd|massacred]] by Nazis.))
Some((Date(8,April,1946),[[Électricité de France]], the world's largest [[utility company]], is formed as a result of the [[nationalisation]] of a number of electricity producers, transporters and distributors.))
Some((Date(8,April,1950),India and Pakistan sign the [[Liaquat–Nehru Pact]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1952),U.S. President [[Harry Truman]] calls for the seizure of all domestic [[steel mill]]s to prevent a nationwide [[Strike action|strike]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1953),[[Mau Mau]] leader [[Jomo Kenyatta]] is convicted by [[Kenya]]'s British rulers.))
Some((Date(8,April,1954),A Royal Canadian Air Force Canadair [[T-6 Texan|Harvard]] collides with a Trans-Canada Airlines [[Canadair North Star]] over [[Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan]], killing 37 people.))
Some((Date(8,April,1959),A team of computer manufacturers, users, and university people led by [[Grace Hopper]] meets to discuss the creation of a new [[programming language]] that would be called [[COBOL]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1960),The Netherlands and West Germany sign an agreement to negotiate the return of [[Dutch annexation of German territory after World War II|German land annexed by the Dutch]] in return for 280 million [[German mark]]s as [[Wiedergutmachung]].))
Some((Date(8,April,1961),A large explosion on board the {{MV|Dara}} in the [[Persian Gulf]] kills 238.))
Some((Date(8,April,1964),[[Gemini 1]] (unmanned test flight) launched.))
Some((Date(8,April,1968),[[BOAC Flight 712]] catches fire shortly after take off. As a result of her actions in the accident, [[Barbara Jane Harrison]] is awarded a posthumous [[George Cross]], the only GC awarded to a woman in peacetime.))
Some((Date(8,April,1970),[[Bahr El-Baqar primary school bombing]]: Israeli bombers strike an Egyptian school. Forty-six children are killed.))
Some((Date(8,April,1974),At [[Atlanta–Fulton County Stadium]], [[Hank Aaron]] hits his 715th career [[home run]] to surpass [[Babe Ruth]]'s 39-year-old record.))
Some((Date(8,April,1975),[[Frank Robinson]] manages the [[Cleveland Indians]] in his first game as major league [[baseball]]'s first [[African American]] manager.))
Some((Date(8,April,1987),[[Los Angeles Dodgers]] executive [[Al Campanis]] resigns amid controversy over [[Racism|racially charged]] remarks he had made while on ''[[Nightline]]''.))
Some((Date(8,April,1992),Retired [[tennis]] great [[Arthur Ashe]] announces that he has [[AIDS]], acquired from [[blood transfusion]]s during one of his two heart surgeries.

Some((Date(19,April,1770),Captain [[James Cook]], still holding the rank of lieutenant, sights the eastern coast of what is now Australia.))

Some((Date(19,April,1809),An Austrian corps is defeated by the forces of the [[Duchy of Warsaw]] in the [[Battle of Raszyn (1809)|Battle of Raszyn]], part of the struggles of the [[Fifth Coalition]]. On the same day the Austrian main army is defeated by a [[First French Empire]] Corps led by [[Louis-Nicolas Davout]] at the [[Battle of Teugen-Hausen]] in Bavaria, part of a four-day campaign that ended in a French victory.))

Some((Date(19,April,1897),[[Léo Taxil]] exposes his own [[Taxil hoax|fabrications concerning Freemasonry]]))

Some((Date(19,April,1919),[[Leslie Irvin (parachutist)|Leslie Irvin]] of the United States makes the first successful voluntary [[free-fall]] [[parachute]] jump using a new kind of self-contained parachute.))
Some((Date(19,April,1927),[[Mae West]] is sentenced to ten days in jail for [[obscenity]] for her play ''[[Sex (play)|Sex]]''.))

Some((Date(19,April,1942),[[World War II]]: In Poland, the Majdan-Tatarski [[ghetto]] is established, situated between the [[Lublin Ghetto]] and a [[Majdanek]] subcamp.))

Some((Date(19,April,1987),''[[The Simpsons]]'' premieres as a short cartoon on ''[[The Tracey Ullman Show]]''.))
Some((Date(19,April,1989),A [[gun turret]] [[USS Iowa turret explosion|explodes]] on the {{USS|Iowa|BB-61|6}}, killing 47 sailors.))
Some((Date(19,April,1993),The 51-day FBI [[Waco siege|siege]] of the [[Branch Davidian]] building outside [[Waco, Texas]], USA, ends when a fire breaks out. Eighty-one people die.))
Some((Date(19,April,1995),[[Oklahoma City bombing]]: The [[Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building]] in [[Oklahoma City]], USA, is bombed, killing 168.))

Two hundred five tornadoes touched down on April 27 alone, killing more than 300 and injuring hundreds more.))

Some((Date(1,May,1576),[[Stephen Báthory]], the reigning [[Prince of Transylvania]], marries [[Anna Jagiellon]] and they become co-rulers of the [[Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth]].))

Some((Date(1,May,1866),The [[Memphis riots of 1866|Memphis Race Riots]] begin. In three days time, 46 blacks and two whites were killed. Reports of the atrocities influenced passage of the [[Fourteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution]].))

Some((Date(1,May,1875),[[Alexandra Palace]] reopens after being burned down in a fire in 1873.))

Some((Date(1,May,1893),The [[World's Columbian Exposition]] opens in Chicago.))

Some((Date(1,May,1915),The {{RMS|Lusitania}} departs from New York City on her two hundred and second, and final, crossing of the North Atlantic. Six days later, the ship is torpedoed off the coast of Ireland with the loss of 1,198 lives.))

However, his accomplishment is overshadowed later that evening by [[Nolan Ryan]] of the [[Texas Rangers (baseball)|Texas Rangers]], when he pitches his seventh career [[no-hitter]], breaking his own record.))

Images of the violent suppression are transmitted worldwide, bringing new-found attention to the [[African-American Civil Rights Movement (1954–68)|African-American Civil Rights Movement]].))

Some((Date(3,May,1999),The southwestern portion of [[Oklahoma City]] is devastated by an [[1999 Bridge Creek–Moore tornado|F5 tornado]], killing forty-five people, injuring 665, and causing $1 billion in damage.  The tornado is one of 66 from the [[1999 Oklahoma tornado outbreak]]. This tornado also produces the highest wind speed ever recorded, measured at 301 +/- 20&nbsp;mph (484 +/- 32&nbsp;km/h).))

The Japanese forces had [[Invasion of Tulagi (May 1942)|invaded Tulagi]] the day before.))

Some((Date(4,May,1949),The entire [[Torino F.C.|Torino]] football team (except for two players who did not take the trip: Sauro Tomà, due to an injury and Renato Gandolfi, because of coach request) is killed in [[Superga air disaster|a plane crash]] at the [[Superga]] hill at the edge of [[Turin]], Italy.))

Some((Date(4,May,1970),[[Vietnam War]]: [[Kent State shootings]]: The [[Ohio National Guard]], sent to [[Kent State University]] after disturbances in the city of Kent the weekend before, opens fire killing four unarmed students and wounding nine others. The students were protesting the United States' invasion of [[Cambodia]].))
Some((Date(4,May,1972),The ''[[Don't Make A Wave Committee]]'', a fledgling [[environmental organization]] founded in Canada in 1971, officially changes its name to "[[Greenpeace|Greenpeace Foundation]]".))

Some((Date(4,May,1990),[[Latvia]] [[On the Restoration of Independence of the Republic of Latvia|proclaims the renewal of its independence]] after the [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] occupation.))

Some((Date(4,May,1998),A federal judge in [[Sacramento, California]], gives "[[Unabomber]]" [[Theodore Kaczynski]] four life sentences plus 30 years after Kaczynski accepts a plea agreement sparing him from the [[Capital punishment|death penalty]].))

Some((Date(4,May,2002),[[EAS Airlines Flight 4226]] crashes in a suburb of [[Kano]], [[Nigeria]] shortly after takeoff, killing 149 people.))
Some((Date(4,May,2007),[[Greensburg, Kansas]] is almost completely destroyed by a 1.7&nbsp;mi wide [[Enhanced Fujita scale|EF5]] [[tornado]]. It was the first-ever tornado to be rated as such with the new [[Enhanced Fujita scale]].))
Some((Date(4,May,2014),Three people are killed and 62 injured in a [[2014 Nairobi bus bombings|pair of bombings]] on buses in [[Nairobi, Kenya]].))

Some((Date(5,May,1809),[[Mary Kies]] becomes the first woman awarded a U.S. [[patent]], for a technique of [[weaving]] [[straw]] with [[silk]] and [[yarn|thread]].))
Some((Date(5,May,1811),In the second day of fighting at the [[Peninsular War]] [[Battle of Fuentes de Oñoro]] the French army, under Marshall [[André Masséna]], drive in the [[Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington|Duke of Wellington]]'s overextended right flank, but French frontal assaults fail to take the town of Fuentes de Oñoro and the Anglo-Portuguese army holds the field at the end of the day.))

Some((Date(7,May,1864),[[American Civil War]]: The [[Army of the Potomac]], under General [[Ulysses S. Grant]], breaks off from the [[Battle of the Wilderness]] and moves southwards.))

In some parts of the former [[Soviet Union]] the anniversary of this day is celebrated as [[Radio Day]].))
Some((Date(7,May,1915),[[World War I]]: German [[submarine]] {{SMU|U-20|Germany|2}} sinks [[Sinking of the RMS Lusitania|RMS ''Lusitania'']], killing 1,198 people including 128 Americans. Public reaction to the sinking turns many formerly pro-Germans in the United States against the [[German Empire]]))
Some((Date(7,May,1920),[[Kiev Offensive (1920)|Kiev Offensive]]: [[Second Polish Republic|Polish]] troops led by [[Józef Piłsudski]] and [[Edward Rydz-Śmigły]] and assisted by a symbolic [[Ukrainian People's Republic|Ukrainian]] force capture [[Kiev]] only to be driven out by the [[Red Army]] counter-offensive a month later.))

The battle marks the first time in the naval history that two enemy fleets fight without visual contact between warring ships.))

Some((Date(7,May,1986),Canadian [[Patrick Morrow]] becomes the first person to climb each of the [[Seven Summits]].))
Some((Date(7,May,1992),[[Michigan]] ratifies a 203-year-old proposed amendment to the [[United States Constitution]] making the [[Twenty-seventh Amendment to the United States Constitution|27th Amendment]] law. This amendment bars the [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] from giving itself a mid-term pay raise.))
Some((Date(7,May,1994),[[Edvard Munch]]'s iconic painting ''[[The Scream]]'' is recovered undamaged after being stolen from the [[National Gallery of Norway]] in February.))

Some((Date(7,May,2004),American businessman [[Nick Berg]], is [[decapitation|beheaded]] by [[Islamic militants]]. The act is recorded on videotape and released on the Internet.))

Some((Date(8,May,1902),In [[Martinique]], [[Mount Pelée]] erupts, destroying the town of [[Saint-Pierre, Martinique|Saint-Pierre]] and killing over 30,000 people. Only a handful of residents survive the blast.))

Some((Date(8,May,1919),[[Edward George Honey]] proposes the idea of a moment of silence to commemorate the [[Armistice]] of [[World War I]].))
Some((Date(8,May,1924),The [[Klaipėda Convention]] is signed formally incorporating [[Klaipėda Region]] (Memel Territory) into [[Lithuania]].))
Some((Date(8,May,1927),Attempting to make the first non-stop [[transatlantic flight]] from Paris to New York, French war heroes [[Charles Nungesser]] and [[François Coli]] disappear after taking off aboard ''[[The White Bird]]'' biplane.))
Some((Date(8,May,1933),[[Mohandas Gandhi]] begins a 21-day fast of self-purification and launched a one-year campaign to help the Harijan movement.))
Some((Date(8,May,1941),The German [[Luftwaffe]] launches a [[Nottingham Blitz|bombing raid on Nottingham and Derby]]))
Some((Date(8,May,1942),[[World War II]]: The [[Battle of the Kerch Peninsula]]: The German [[11th Army (Wehrmacht)|11th Army]] begins Operation ''Trappenjagd'' (Bustard Hunt) and destroys the [[bridgehead]] of the three Soviet Armies (44th, 47th, and 51st) defending the [[Kerch Peninsula]], in the eastern part of the [[Crimea]].))
Some((Date(8,May,1945),Hundreds of [[Algeria]]n civilians are killed by French Army soldiers in the [[Sétif massacre]].))
Some((Date(8,May,1946),[[Estonia]]n school girls [[Aili Jõgi]] and [[Ageeda Paavel]] blow up the [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] memorial which stood in front of the [[Bronze Soldier of Tallinn]].))
Some((Date(8,May,1962),The [[Rabindra Bharati University]], a prominent University in India, was founded.))
Some((Date(8,May,1963),[[Army of the Republic of South Vietnam|South Vietnamese soldiers]] of Catholic President [[Ngo Dinh Diem]] [[Huế Phật Đản shootings|open fire on Buddhists]] defying a ban on the flying of the [[Buddhist flag]] on [[Vesākha|Vesak]], killing nine and sparking the [[Buddhist crisis]].))
Some((Date(8,May,1966),A plane crash at [[Connellsville, Pennsylvania]] kills [[Pennsylvania Attorney General]], Walter E. Alessandroni, his wife, and other state officials.))
Some((Date(8,May,1967),The [[Philippines|Philippine]] province of [[Davao province|Davao]] is split into three: [[Davao del Norte]], [[Davao del Sur]], and [[Davao Oriental]].))
Some((Date(8,May,1970),The [[Hard Hat Riot]] occurs in the [[Wall Street]] area of New York City as [[Blue-collar worker|blue-collar]] construction workers clash with [[Opposition to United States involvement in the Vietnam War|demonstrators protesting the Vietnam War]].))
Some((Date(8,May,1972),[[Vietnam War]]: U.S. President [[Richard Nixon]] announces his order to place [[Naval mine|mine]]s in major [[North Vietnam]]ese ports in order to stem the flow of weapons and other goods to that nation.))
Some((Date(8,May,1973),A [[Wounded Knee incident|71-day standoff]] between federal authorities and the [[American Indian Movement]] members occupying the [[Pine Ridge Reservation]] at [[Wounded Knee, South Dakota]] ends with the surrender of the militants.))
Some((Date(8,May,1976),The rollercoaster [[Revolution (Six Flags Magic Mountain)|Revolution]], the first steel coaster with a vertical loop, opens at [[Six Flags Magic Mountain]].))
Some((Date(8,May,1978),The first ascent of [[Mount Everest]] without supplemental oxygen, by [[Reinhold Messner]] and [[Peter Habeler]].))
Some((Date(8,May,1980),The [[World Health Organization]] confirms the eradication of [[smallpox]].))
Some((Date(8,May,1984),The [[Soviet Union]] announces that it will [[1984 Summer Olympics boycott|boycott]] the [[1984 Summer Olympics]] in [[Los Angeles]].))
Some((Date(8,May,1987),The [[Loughgall ambush]]: The [[Special Air Service|SAS]] kills eight [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] volunteers and a civilian during an ambush in [[Loughgall]], [[Northern Ireland]].))
Some((Date(8,May,1988),A fire at [[Illinois Bell]]'s Hinsdale Central Office triggers an extended [[1AESS]] [[network outage]] once considered the "worst telecommunications disaster in US telephone industry history".))
Some((Date(8,May,1997),A [[China Southern Airlines]] [[China Southern Airlines Flight 3456|Flight 3456]] crashes on approach into [[Shenzhen Bao'an International Airport|Bao'an International Airport]], killing 35 people.))

Some((Date(9,May,1662),The figure who later became [[Punch and Judy|Mr. Punch]]  made his first recorded appearance in England.))

Some((Date(9,May,1874),The first horse-drawn [[bus]] makes its début in the city of [[Mumbai]], traveling two routes.))
Some((Date(9,May,1877),[[Mihail Kogălniceanu]] reads, in the [[Chamber of Deputies (Romania)|Chamber of Deputies]], the Declaration of Independence of [[Romania]]. This day became the Independence Day of Romania.))
