Some((Date(9,May,1911),The works of [[Gabriele D'Annunzio]] are placed in the [[Index of Forbidden Books]] by the [[Holy See|Vatican]].))
Some((Date(9,May,1915),[[World War I]]: [[Second Battle of Artois]] between German and French forces.))
Some((Date(9,May,1918),World War I: Germany repels Britain's [[Second Ostend Raid|second attempt]] to blockade the port of [[Ostend]], Belgium.))
Some((Date(9,May,1920),[[Polish–Soviet War]]: The Polish army under General [[Edward Rydz-Śmigły]] celebrates its [[Kiev Offensive (1920)|capture of Kiev]] with a [[victory parade]] on [[Khreshchatyk]].))
Some((Date(9,May,1926),Admiral [[Richard E. Byrd]] and [[Floyd Bennett]] claim to have flown over the [[North Pole]] (later discovery of Byrd's diary appears to cast some doubt on the claim.)))
Some((Date(9,May,1927),The [[Parliament of Australia|Australian Parliament]] first convenes in [[Canberra]].))
Some((Date(9,May,1936),Italy formally annexes [[Ethiopia]] after taking the capital [[Addis Ababa]] on [[May 5]].))
Some((Date(9,May,1940),[[World War II]]: The [[Nazi Germany|German]] submarine [[German submarine U-9 (1935)|''U-9'']] sinks the French coastal submarine ''[[French submarine Doris (Q 135) |Doris]]'' near [[Den Helder]].))
Some((Date(9,May,1941),World War II: The German submarine [[German submarine U-110 (1940)|''U-110'']] is captured by the [[Royal Navy]]. On board is the latest [[Enigma machine]] which [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] [[cryptographer]]s later use to break coded German messages.))
Some((Date(9,May,1942),[[The Holocaust|Holocaust]]: The [[SS]] murders 588 Jewish residents of the [[Podolia]]n town of [[Zinkiv]] ([[Khmelnytska oblast]], [[Ukraine]]). The [[Ghettos in Nazi-occupied Europe|Zoludek Ghetto]] (in [[Belarus]]) is destroyed and all its inhabitants murdered or deported.))
Some((Date(9,May,1945),World War II: Ratification in [[Karlshorst|Berlin-Karlshorst]] of the German unconditional surrender of May 8 in Rheims, France, with the signatures of [[Marshal of the Soviet Union|Marshal]] [[Georgy Zhukov]] for the Soviet Union, and for the Western Headquarters Sir [[Arthur Tedder]], British Air Marshal and Eisenhower's deputy, and for the German side of [[Colonel-General]] [[Hans-Jürgen Stumpff]] as the representative of the [[Luftwaffe]], [[Field Marshal]] [[Wilhelm Keitel]] as the [[German General Staff|Chief of Staff]] of [[OKW]], and [[Admiral]] [[Hans-Georg von Friedeburg]] as [[Commander-in-Chief]] of the [[Kriegsmarine]].))
Some((Date(9,May,1946),King [[Victor Emmanuel III of Italy]] abdicates and is succeeded by [[Umberto II of Italy|Umberto II]].))
Some((Date(9,May,1948),[[Czechoslovakia]]'s [[Ninth-of-May Constitution]] comes into effect.))
Some((Date(9,May,1949),[[Rainier III, Prince of Monaco|Rainier III of Monaco]] becomes [[Prince of Monaco]].))
Some((Date(9,May,1950),[[Robert Schuman]] presents his proposal on the creation of an organized Europe, which according to him was indispensable to the maintenance of peaceful relations. This proposal, known as the "[[Schuman Declaration]]", is considered by some people to be the beginning of the creation of what is now the [[European Union]].))
Some((Date(9,May,1955),[[Cold War]]: West Germany joins [[NATO]].))
Some((Date(9,May,1958),Film: ''[[Vertigo (film)|Vertigo]]'' has world premiere in [[San Francisco]].))
Some((Date(9,May,1960),The [[Food and Drug Administration]] announces it will approve [[birth control]] as an additional [[indication (medicine)|indication]] for [[G. D. Searle & Company|Searle]]'s Enovid, making Enovid the world's first approved [[combined oral contraceptive pill|oral contraceptive pill]].))
Some((Date(9,May,1961),FCC Chairman [[Newton N. Minow]] gives his [[Wasteland Speech]].))
Some((Date(9,May,1964),[[Ngô Đình Cẩn]], ''de facto'' ruler of central [[Vietnam]] under his brother President [[Ngo Dinh Diem]] before the family's toppling, is executed.))
Some((Date(9,May,1969),[[Carlos Lamarca]] leads the first urban guerrilla action against the [[Brazilian military government|military dictatorship]] of [[Brazil]] in [[São Paulo]], by robbing two banks.))
Some((Date(9,May,1970),[[Vietnam War]]: In Washington, D.C., 75,000 to 100,000 war protesters demonstrate in front of the [[White House]].))
Some((Date(9,May,1974),[[Watergate scandal]]: The  [[United States House Committee on the Judiciary]] opens formal and public [[Impeachment in the United States|impeachment]] hearings against President [[Richard Nixon]].))
Some((Date(9,May,1977),[[Hotel Polen fire]]: A disastrous fire burns down the Hotel Polen in [[Amsterdam]] causing 33 deaths and 21 severe injuries.))
Some((Date(9,May,1979),[[Persian Jews|Iranian Jewish]] businessman [[Habib Elghanian]] is executed by firing squad in Tehran, prompting the mass exodus of the once 100,000-strong Jewish community of Iran.))
Some((Date(9,May,1980),In [[Florida]], [[Liberia]]n freighter {{ship|MV|Summit Venture}} collides with the [[Sunshine Skyway Bridge]] over [[Tampa Bay]], making a 1,400-ft. section of the southbound span collapse.  Thirty-five people in six cars and a [[Greyhound bus]] fall 150&nbsp;ft. into the water and die.))
Some((Date(9,May,1987),[[LOT Flight 5055|LOT Flight 5055 ''Tadeusz Kościuszko'' crashes after takeoff]] in [[Warsaw]], Poland, killing all 183 people on board.))
Some((Date(9,May,1992),[[Armenia]]n forces capture [[Shusha]], marking a major turning point in the [[Nagorno-Karabakh War]].))
Some((Date(9,May,1992),[[Westray Mine disaster]] kills 26 workers in [[Nova Scotia]], Canada.))
Some((Date(9,May,2001),In [[Ghana]], 129 football fans die in what  became known as the [[Accra Sports Stadium disaster]]. The deaths are caused by a stampede (caused by the firing of teargas by police personnel at the stadium) that followed a controversial decision by the referee.))
Some((Date(9,May,2002),The [[Siege of the Church of the Nativity in Bethlehem|38-day stand-off]] in the [[Church of the Nativity]] in [[Bethlehem]] comes to an end when the [[Palestinians]] inside agree to have 13 suspected terrorists among them deported to several different countries.))

Some((Date(10,May,1291),Scottish [[nobles]] recognize the authority of [[Edward I of England]] pending the selection of a king.))
Some((Date(10,May,1497),[[Amerigo Vespucci]] allegedly leaves [[Cádiz]] for his first voyage to the [[New World]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1503),[[Christopher Columbus]] visits the [[Cayman Islands]] and names them ''Las Tortugas'' after the numerous [[turtle]]s there.))
Some((Date(10,May,1534),[[Jacques Cartier]] visits [[Newfoundland (island)|Newfoundland]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1655),England, with troops under the command of Admiral [[William Penn (Royal Navy officer)|William Penn]] and [[Robert Venables|General Robert Venables]], annexes [[Jamaica]] from Spain.))
Some((Date(10,May,1768),[[John Wilkes]] is imprisoned for writing an article for ''[[The North Briton]]'' severely criticizing [[George III of the United Kingdom|King George III]]. This action provokes rioting in London.))
Some((Date(10,May,1773),The [[Parliament of Great Britain]] passes the [[Tea Act]], designed to save the [[British East India Company]] by granting it a [[monopoly]] on the North American [[tea]] trade.))
Some((Date(10,May,1774),[[Louis XVI of France|Louis XVI]] and [[Marie Antoinette]] become King and Queen of France.))
Some((Date(10,May,1775),[[American Revolutionary War]]: A small Colonial militia led by [[Ethan Allen]] and Colonel [[Benedict Arnold]] [[Capture of Fort Ticonderoga|captures Fort Ticonderoga]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1796),[[War of the First Coalition]]: [[Napoleon I of France]] wins a [[Battle of Lodi|decisive victory]] against [[Habsburg Empire|Austria]]n forces at [[Lodi, Lombardy|Lodi]] bridge over the [[Adda River]] in Italy. The Austrians lose some 2,000 men.))
Some((Date(10,May,1801),[[First Barbary War]]: The [[Barbary pirates]] of [[Tripoli]] declare war on the United States of America.))
Some((Date(10,May,1824),The [[National Gallery]] in London opens to the public.))
Some((Date(10,May,1833),The desecration of the grave of the viceroy of [[Northern and southern Vietnam|southern Vietnam]] [[Lê Văn Duyệt]] by Emperor [[Minh Mạng]] provokes his [[Lê Văn Khôi|adopted son]] to [[Lê Văn Khôi revolt|start a revolt]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1837),[[Panic of 1837]]: New York City banks fail, and [[unemployment]] reaches record levels.))
Some((Date(10,May,1849),[[Astor Place Riot]]: A riot breaks out at the [[Astor Opera House]] in [[Manhattan]], New York City over a dispute between actors [[Edwin Forrest]] and [[William Charles Macready]], killing at least 25 and injuring over 120.))
Some((Date(10,May,1857),[[Indian Rebellion of 1857]]: In India, the first war of Independence begins. [[Sepoy]]s mutiny against their commanding officers at [[Meerut]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1863),[[American Civil War]]: [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] General [[Stonewall Jackson|Thomas "Stonewall" Jackson]] dies eight days after he is accidentally [[Friendly fire|shot by his own troops]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1864),American Civil War: Colonel [[Emory Upton]] leads a 10-[[regiment]] "Attack-in-depth" assault against the Confederate works at The [[Battle of Spotsylvania]], which, though ultimately unsuccessful, would provide the idea for the massive [[Benjamin T. Brockman#Battle of the Bloody Angle|assault against the Bloody Angle]] on [[May 12]]. Upton is slightly wounded but is immediately promoted to Brigadier general.))
Some((Date(10,May,1865),American Civil War: [[Jefferson Davis]] is captured by [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] troops near [[Irwinville, Georgia]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1866),[[Romania]] National Holiday 1866-1947, The Modern Monarchy Instauration of the [[Kingdom of Romania]], [[Carol I of Romania]]))
Some((Date(10,May,1869),The [[First Transcontinental Railroad]], linking the eastern and western United States, is completed at [[Promontory Summit]], [[Utah]] with the [[golden spike]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1872),[[Victoria Woodhull]] becomes the first woman nominated for [[President of the United States]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1876),The [[Centennial Exposition]] is opened in [[Philadelphia]] by U.S. President [[Ulysses S. Grant]] and Brazilian Emperor [[Dom Pedro II]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1877),[[Romania]] declares itself independent from the [[Ottoman Empire]] following the [[Senate of Romania|Senate]] adoption of [[Mihail Kogălniceanu]]'s Declaration of Independence. Recognized on March 26, 1881 after the end of the [[Romanian War of Independence]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1893),The [[Supreme Court of the United States]] rules in ''[[Nix v. Hedden]]'' that a [[tomato]] is a [[vegetable]], not a [[fruit]], under the [[Tariff of 1883|Tariff Act of 1883]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1904),The [[Horch|Horch & Cir. Motorwagenwerke AG]] is founded.))
Some((Date(10,May,1908),[[Mother's Day]] is observed for the first time in the United States, in [[Grafton, West Virginia]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1916),Sailing in the lifeboat [[Voyage of the James Caird|''James Caird'']], [[Ernest Shackleton]] arrives at [[South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands|South Georgia]] after a journey of 800 nautical miles from [[Elephant Island]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1922),The United States annexes the [[Kingman Reef]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1924),[[J. Edgar Hoover]] is appointed first Director of the United States' [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]] (FBI), and remains so until his death in [[1972]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1933),[[Censorship]]: In Germany, the [[Nazism|Nazis]] stage [[Nazi book burnings|massive public book burnings]].))

Some((Date(10,May,1954),[[Bill Haley & His Comets]] release "[[Rock Around the Clock]]", the first [[rock and roll]] record to reach number one on the [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard'']] charts.))
Some((Date(10,May,1960),The nuclear submarine {{USS|Triton|SSRN-586|6}} completes [[Operation Sandblast]], the first underwater circumnavigation of the [[earth]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1962),[[Marvel Comics]] publishes the first issue of [[Hulk (comics)|The Incredible Hulk]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1969),[[Vietnam War]]: The Battle of [[Dong Ap Bia]] begins with an assault on Hill 937. It will ultimately become known as [[Battle of Hamburger Hill|Hamburger Hill]].))

Some((Date(10,May,1972),First flight of the [[Fairchild Republic A-10 Thunderbolt II]] (a.k.a. "Warthog").))
Some((Date(10,May,1975),[[Sony]] introduces the [[Betamax]] [[videocassette recorder]] in Japan.))
Some((Date(10,May,1979),The [[Federated States of Micronesia]] become self-governing.))
Some((Date(10,May,1981),[[François Mitterrand]] wins the presidential election and becomes the first [[Socialist Party (France)|Socialist]] [[President of France]] in the [[France|French Fifth Republic]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1993),In [[Thailand]], a [[Kader Toy Factory fire|fire at the Kader Toy Factory]] kills 156 workers.))
Some((Date(10,May,1994),[[Nelson Mandela]] is inaugurated as South Africa's first black [[President of South Africa|president]].))
Some((Date(10,May,1997),A 7.3 [[Moment magnitude scale|M<sub>w</sub>]] earthquake [[1997 Qayen earthquake|strikes]] [[Iran]]'s [[Khorasan Province]], killing 1,567, injuring over 2,300, leaving 50,000&nbsp;homeless, and damaging or destroying over 15,000&nbsp;homes.))
Some((Date(10,May,2002),F.B.I. agent [[Robert Hanssen]] is sentenced to [[Life without parole|life imprisonment without the possibility of parole]] for selling United States secrets to Moscow for $1.4 million in cash and [[diamond]]s.))
Some((Date(10,May,2005),A [[hand grenade]] thrown by [[Vladimir Arutyunian]] lands about 65 feet (20 meters) from U.S. President [[George W. Bush]] while he is giving a speech to a crowd in [[Tbilisi]], [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]], but it malfunctions and does not detonate.))
Some((Date(10,May,2008),An [[Enhanced Fujita scale|EF4]] tornado strikes the [[Oklahoma]]–[[Kansas]] state line, killing 21 people and injuring over 100.))
Some((Date(10,May,2012),The [[10 May 2012 Damascus bombings|Damascus bombings]] are carried out using a pair of [[car bomb]]s detonated by [[suicide bombers]] outside of a military intelligence complex in [[Damascus]], [[Syria]], killing 55 people and injuring 400 others))
Some((Date(10,May,2013),[[One World Trade Center]] becomes the tallest building in the [[Western Hemisphere]].

Some((Date(11,May,1812),[[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|Prime Minister]] [[Spencer Perceval]] is assassinated by [[John Bellingham]] in the lobby of the [[British House of Commons|House of Commons]], London.))
Some((Date(11,May,1813),In Australia, [[William Lawson (explorer)|William Lawson]], [[Gregory Blaxland]] and [[William Wentworth]] lead an [[1813 crossing of the Blue Mountains|expedition to cross the Blue Mountains]] west of Sydney. Their route opens up inland Australia for continued expansion throughout the 19th century.))
Some((Date(11,May,1820),{{HMS|Beagle}}, the ship that will take [[Charles Darwin]] on his scientific voyage, is launched.))
Some((Date(11,May,1833),The Aberdeen-built brig [[Lady of the Lake (brig)|Lady of the Lake]] struck an iceberg and sank off the coast of Newfoundland with the loss of up to 265 passengers and crew.))

Some((Date(11,May,1857),[[Indian Rebellion of 1857]]: Indian rebels seize [[Delhi]] from the British.))

Some((Date(11,May,1862),[[American Civil War]]: The [[ironclad]] {{Ship|CSS|Virginia}} is scuttled in the [[James River (Virginia)|James River]] northwest of [[Norfolk, Virginia]].))

Some((Date(11,May,1880),Seven people are killed in the [[Mussel Slough Tragedy]], a gun battle in [[California]].))
Some((Date(11,May,1889),An [[Wham Paymaster Robbery|attack upon a U.S. Army paymaster and escort]] results in the theft of over $28,000 and the award of two [[Medal of Honor|Medals of Honor]].))
Some((Date(11,May,1891),The [[Ōtsu incident]]: [[Tsarevich]] Nicholas Alexandrovich of [[Imperial Russia]] (later [[Nicholas II]]) suffers a critical head injury during a sword attack by Japanese policeman Tsuda Sanzō. He is rescued by [[Prince George of Greece and Denmark]].))
Some((Date(11,May,1894),[[Pullman Strike]]: Four thousand [[Pullman Palace Car Company]] workers go on a [[Wildcat strike action|wildcat strike]] in [[Illinois]].))
Some((Date(11,May,1907),Thirty-two [[Shriners]] are killed when their chartered train derails at a switch near Surf Depot in [[Lompoc, California]].))
Some((Date(11,May,1910),An act of the [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]] establishes [[Glacier National Park (U.S.)|Glacier National Park]] in [[Montana]].))
Some((Date(11,May,1918),The [[Mountainous Republic of the Northern Caucasus]] is officially established.))
Some((Date(11,May,1927),The [[Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences]] is founded.))
Some((Date(11,May,1942),[[William Faulkner]]'s collections of [[Short story|short stories]], ''[[Go Down, Moses (short story collection)|Go Down, Moses]]'', is published.))
Some((Date(11,May,1943),[[World War II]]: American troops [[Battle of Attu|invade]] [[Attu Island]] in the [[Aleutian Islands]] in an attempt to expel occupying Japanese forces.))
Some((Date(11,May,1944),World War II: The [[Allies of World War II|Allies]] begin a major offensive against the [[Axis Powers]] on the [[Gustav Line]].))
Some((Date(11,May,1945),World War II: Off the coast of [[Okinawa]], the [[aircraft carrier]] {{USS|Bunker Hill|CV-17|6}} is hit by two [[kamikaze]]s, killing 346 of its crew. Although badly damaged, the ship is able to return to the U.S. under its own power.))
Some((Date(11,May,1946),[[UMNO]] is created.))
Some((Date(11,May,1949),Siam officially changes its name to [[Thailand]] for the second time. The name had been in use since [[1939]] but was reverted in [[1945]].))

Some((Date(11,May,1995),More than 170 countries extend the [[Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty]] indefinitely and without conditions.))
Some((Date(11,May,1996),After the aircraft's departure from [[Miami]], a fire started by improperly handled [[chemical oxygen generator]]s in the cargo hold of [[Atlanta, Georgia|Atlanta]]-bound [[ValuJet Flight 592]] causes the [[Douglas DC-9]] to crash in the [[Florida Everglades]] killing all 110 on board.))
Some((Date(11,May,1997),[[Deep Blue (chess computer)|Deep Blue]], a [[chess]]-playing [[supercomputer]], defeats [[Garry Kasparov]] in the [[Deep Blue – Kasparov, 1997, Game 6|last game]] of the rematch, becoming the first [[chess computer|computer]] to beat a world-champion chess player in a classic match format.))

Some((Date(11,May,2000),[[Second Chechen War]]: [[Chechens|Chechen]] separatists [[Galashki ambush|ambush]] Russian paramilitary forces in the Republic of [[Ingushetia]].))

Pemberton]]'s defensive line on Fourteen Mile Creek, opening up the interior of [[Mississippi]] to the [[Union (American Civil War)|Union Army]] during the [[Vicksburg Campaign]].))

Some((Date(15,May,-495),A newly constructed temple in honour of the god [[Mercury (mythology)|Mercury]] was dedicated in [[ancient Rome]] on the [[Circus Maximus]], between the [[Aventine Hill|Aventine]] and [[Palatine]] hills.  To spite the senate and the consuls, the people awarded the dedication to a [[Primus pilus|senior military officer]], [[Laetoria (gens)|Marcus Laetorius]].))
Some((Date(15,May,1252),[[Pope Innocent IV]] issues the [[papal bull]] ''[[ad extirpanda]]'', which authorizes, but also limits, the torture of [[Heresy in Christianity|heretics]] in the [[Medieval Inquisition]].))
Some((Date(15,May,1525),[[Insurgency|Insurgent]] peasants led by [[Anabaptist]] pastor [[Thomas Müntzer]] were defeated at the [[Battle of Frankenhausen]], ending the [[German Peasants' War]] in the [[Holy Roman Empire]].))
Some((Date(15,May,1536),[[Anne Boleyn]], Queen of England, stands trial in London on  charges of treason, adultery and incest. She is condemned to death by a specially-selected [[jury]].))
Some((Date(15,May,1567),[[Mary, Queen of Scots]] marries [[James Hepburn, 4th Earl of Bothwell]], her third husband.))
Some((Date(15,May,1602),[[Bartholomew Gosnold]] becomes the first recorded European to see [[Cape Cod]].))
Some((Date(15,May,1618),[[Johannes Kepler]] confirms his previously rejected discovery of the [[Kepler's laws of planetary motion|third law of planetary motion]] (he first discovered it on [[March 8]] but soon rejected the idea after some initial calculations were made).))

Some((Date(15,May,1755),[[Laredo, Texas]] is established by the Spaniards.))

Some((Date(15,May,1793),[[Diego Marín Aguilera]] flies a glider for "about 360 meters", at a height of 5–6 meters, during one of the first attempted manned flights.))

Some((Date(15,May,1851),The first [[Australian gold rushes|Australian gold rush]] is proclaimed, although the discovery had been made three months earlier.))

Some((Date(15,May,1905),[[Las Vegas]], is founded when {{convert|110|acre|km2}}, in what later would become downtown, are auctioned off.))

Some((Date(15,May,1919),The [[Winnipeg General Strike]] begins. By 11:00, almost the whole working population of [[Winnipeg]] had walked off the job.))
Some((Date(15,May,1925),''[[Al-Insaniyyah]]'', the first Arabic communist newspaper, is founded.))

Some((Date(18,May,1593),Playwright [[Thomas Kyd]]'s accusations of [[Christian heresy|heresy]] lead to an arrest warrant for [[Christopher Marlowe]].))

Some((Date(18,May,1763),Fire destroys a large part of [[Montreal]]))
Some((Date(18,May,1783),First [[United Empire Loyalists]] reach Parrtown (later called [[Saint John, New Brunswick]], Canada after leaving the United States. ))

Some((Date(18,May,1804),[[Napoleon|Napoleon Bonaparte]] is proclaimed [[Emperor of the French]] by the [[French Senate]].))
Some((Date(18,May,1811),[[Battle of Las Piedras (1811)|Battle of Las Piedras]]: The first great military triumph of the revolution of the [[Río de la Plata]] in [[Uruguay]] led by [[José Artigas]].))

Some((Date(18,May,1863),[[American Civil War]]: The [[Siege of Vicksburg]] begins.))
Some((Date(18,May,1896),The [[United States Supreme Court]] rules in ''[[Plessy v. Ferguson]]'' that the "[[separate but equal]]" doctrine is constitutional.))
Some((Date(18,May,1900),The United Kingdom proclaims a [[protectorate]] over [[Tonga]].))
Some((Date(18,May,1910),The Earth passes through the tail of [[Comet Halley]].))
Some((Date(18,May,1912),The first [[Cinema of India|Indian film]], ''Shree Pundalik'' by [[Dadasaheb Torne]] is released in [[Mumbai]].))
Some((Date(18,May,1917),[[World War I]]: The [[Selective Service Act of 1917]] is passed, giving the [[President of the United States]] the power of [[conscription]].))
Some((Date(18,May,1926),[[Evangelism|Evangelist]] [[Aimee Semple McPherson]] disappears while visiting a [[Venice, California]] beach.))
Some((Date(18,May,1927),The [[Bath School disaster]]: Forty-five people are killed by bombs planted by a disgruntled school-board member in [[Michigan]].))
Some((Date(18,May,1933),[[New Deal]]: President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] signs an act creating the [[Tennessee Valley Authority]].))
Some((Date(18,May,1944),[[World War II]]: [[Battle of Monte Cassino]]: Conclusion after seven days of the fourth battle as [[Fallschirmjäger (World War II)|German paratroopers]] evacuate [[Monte Cassino]].))
Some((Date(18,May,1948),The First [[Legislative Yuan]] of the [[Republic of China (1912–49)|Republic of China]] officially convenes in [[Nanking]].))
Some((Date(18,May,1953),[[Jacqueline Cochran|Jackie Cochran]] becomes the first woman to break the [[sound barrier]].))
Some((Date(18,May,1955),[[Operation Passage to Freedom]], the evacuation of 310,000 [[Vietnamese people|Vietnamese]] civilians, soldiers and non-Vietnamese members of the [[French Union|French]] Army from communist [[North Vietnam]] to [[South Vietnam]] following the end of the [[First Indochina War]], ends.))
Some((Date(18,May,1956),First ascent of [[Lhotse]] 8,516 meters, by a [[Switzerland|Swiss]] team.))
Some((Date(18,May,1958),An [[F-104 Starfighter]] sets a [[Flight airspeed record|world speed record]] of 1,404.19&nbsp;mph (2,259.82&nbsp;km/h).))
Some((Date(18,May,1959),Launch of the [[National Liberation Committee of Côte d'Ivoire]] in [[Conakry]], [[Guinea]].))
Some((Date(18,May,1965),Israeli spy [[Eli Cohen]] was hanged in [[Damascus]], [[Syria]].))
Some((Date(18,May,1969),[[Apollo program]]: ''[[Apollo 10]]'' is launched.))
Some((Date(18,May,1974),[[Nuclear test]]: under project [[Smiling Buddha]], India successfully detonates its first [[nuclear weapon]] becoming the sixth nation to do so.))
Some((Date(18,May,1980),[[Mount St. Helens]] [[1980 eruption of Mount St. Helens|erupts]] in [[Washington (state)|Washington]], United States, killing 57 people and causing $3&nbsp;billion in damage.))
Some((Date(18,May,1983),In [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]], the government launches a crackdown, with the leading Dublin pirate [[Radio Nova (Ireland)|Radio Nova]] being put off the air.))
Some((Date(18,May,1990),In France, a modified [[TGV]] train achieves a new [[Land speed record for rail vehicles|rail world speed record]] of [[TGV world speed record|515.3&nbsp;km/h]] (320.2&nbsp;mph).))
Some((Date(18,May,1991),Northern [[Somalia]] declares independence from the rest of Somalia as the [[Republic of Somaliland]] but is not recognized by the international community.))
Some((Date(18,May,1993),Riots in [[Nørrebro]], [[Copenhagen]] caused by the approval of the four Danish exceptions in the [[Danish Maastricht Treaty referendum, 1993#Riots|Maastricht Treaty referendum]]. Police opened fire against civilians for the first time since [[World War II]] and injured 11 demonstrators. In total 113 bullets are fired.))
Some((Date(18,May,2005),A second photo from the [[Hubble Space Telescope]] confirms that [[Pluto]] has two additional moons, [[Nix (moon)|Nix]] and [[Hydra (moon)|Hydra]].))
Some((Date(18,May,2006),The post [[2006 democracy movement in Nepal|Loktantra Andolan]] government passes a landmark bill curtailing the power of the [[Kingdom of Nepal|monarchy]] and making [[Nepal]] a secular country.))
Some((Date(18,May,2009),[[Sri Lankan Civil War]]: The [[Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam|LTTE]] are defeated by the [[Government of Sri Lanka|Sri Lankan government]], ending almost 26 years of fighting between the two sides.))
Some((Date(18,May,2011),Twenty-two people are killed when [[Sol Líneas Aéreas Flight 5428]] crashes in southern [[Argentina]].))
Some((Date(18,May,2015),At least 78 people die in a [[2015 Colombian landslide|landslides]] caused by heavy rains in the Colombian town of [[Salgar]].

Some((Date(19,May,1535),French explorer [[Jacques Cartier]] sets sail on his second voyage to North America with three ships, 110 men, and [[Chief Donnacona]]'s two sons (whom Cartier had kidnapped during his first voyage).))

Some((Date(19,May,1643),[[Thirty Years' War]]: French forces under the [[Louis, Grand Condé|duc d'Enghien]] decisively defeat Spanish forces at the [[Battle of Rocroi]], marking the symbolic end of Spain as a dominant land power.))
Some((Date(19,May,1649),An [[Act of Parliament]] declaring England a [[Commonwealth of England|Commonwealth]] is passed by the [[Long Parliament]]. England would be a [[republic]] for the next eleven years.))
Some((Date(19,May,1655),The [[Invasion of Jamaica]] begins during the [[Anglo-Spanish War (1654–60)|Anglo-Spanish War]].))

Some((Date(19,May,1776),[[American Revolutionary War]]: A [[Continental Army]] garrison surrenders in the [[Battle of The Cedars]].))
Some((Date(19,May,1780),[[New England's Dark Day]]: A combination of thick smoke and heavy cloud cover causes complete darkness to fall on [[Eastern Canada]] and the [[New England]] area of the United States at 10:30 A.M.))
Some((Date(19,May,1802),[[Napoleon|Napoleon Bonaparte]] founds the [[Legion of Honour]].))
Some((Date(19,May,1828),U.S. President [[John Quincy Adams]] signs the [[Tariff of 1828]] into law, protecting [[wool]] manufacturers in the United States.))
Some((Date(19,May,1845),Captain Sir [[John Franklin]] and his [[Franklin's lost expedition|ill-fated Arctic expedition]] depart from [[Greenhithe]], England.))
Some((Date(19,May,1848),[[Mexican–American War]]: Mexico ratifies the [[Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo]] thus ending the war and ceding [[California]], [[Nevada]], [[Utah]] and parts of four other modern-day U.S. states to the United States for US$15 million.))
Some((Date(19,May,1897),[[Oscar Wilde]] is released from [[Reading Gaol]].))
Some((Date(19,May,1911),[[Parks Canada]], the world's first [[national park]] service, is established as the Dominion Parks Branch under the Department of the Interior.))
Some((Date(19,May,1917),the Norwegian football club [[Rosenborg BK]] is founded.))
Some((Date(19,May,1919),[[Mustafa Kemal Atatürk]] lands at [[Samsun]] on the [[Anatolia]]n [[Black Sea]] coast, initiating what is later termed the [[Turkish War of Independence]].))
Some((Date(19,May,1921),The [[United States Congress]] passes the [[Emergency Quota Act]] establishing national quotas on immigration.))
Some((Date(19,May,1922),The [[Young Pioneer Organization of the Soviet Union]] is established.))
Some((Date(19,May,1934),[[Zveno]] and the [[Bulgarian Army]] engineer a [[Bulgarian coup d'état of 1934|coup d'état]] and install [[Kimon Georgiev]] as the new [[List of Prime Ministers of Bulgaria|Prime Minister of Bulgaria]].))
Some((Date(19,May,1941),The [[Viet Minh]], a communist coalition, formed at [[Cao Bằng Province]], [[Vietnam]].))
Some((Date(19,May,1942),[[World War II]]: In the aftermath of the [[Battle of the Coral Sea]], [[Task Force 16]] heads to [[Pearl Harbor]].))
Some((Date(19,May,1943),[[World War II]]: British Prime Minister [[Winston Churchill]] and U.S. President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] set Monday, [[May 1]], [[1944]] as the date for the [[Normandy landings]] ("D-Day"). It  would later be delayed over a month due to bad weather.))
Some((Date(19,May,1950),A barge containing munitions destined for [[Pakistan]] explodes in the harbor at [[South Amboy, New Jersey]], devastating the city.))
Some((Date(19,May,1959),The [[People's Army of Vietnam|North Vietnamese Army]] establishes [[Group 559]], whose responsibility is to determine how to maintain [[supply line]]s to [[South Vietnam]]; the resulting route is the [[Ho Chi Minh trail]].))
Some((Date(19,May,1961),[[Venera program]]: ''[[Venera 1]]'' becomes the first man-made object to fly-by another planet by passing [[Venus]] (the probe had lost contact with Earth a month earlier and did not send back any data).))
Some((Date(19,May,1962),A birthday salute to U.S. President [[John F. Kennedy]] takes place at [[Madison Square Garden (1925)|Madison Square Garden]], New York City. The highlight is [[Marilyn Monroe]]'s [[Happy Birthday, Mr. President|rendition]] of "[[Happy Birthday to You|Happy Birthday]]".))
Some((Date(19,May,1963),The ''New York Post Sunday Magazine'' publishes Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.'s [[Letter from Birmingham Jail]].))
Some((Date(19,May,1971),[[Mars probe program]]: ''[[Mars 2]]'' is launched by the [[Soviet Union]].))

Some((Date(19,May,1991),[[Croatia]]ns vote for independence in a [[Croatian independence referendum, 1991|referendum]].))
Some((Date(19,May,1997),The [[Sierra Gorda biosphere]], the most [[Ecosystem diversity|ecologically diverse]] region in Mexico, is established as a result of [[grassroots]] efforts.))

Some((Date(20,May,1520),The [[Massacre in the Great Temple|massacre at the festival of Tóxcatl]] takes place during the [[Fall of Tenochtitlan]], resulting in turning the Aztecs against the Spanish.))
Some((Date(20,May,1521),[[Ignatius Loyola]] is seriously wounded in the [[Battle of Pampeluna]].))

Some((Date(20,May,1609),[[Shakespeare's sonnets]] are first published in London, perhaps illicitly, by the publisher [[Thomas Thorpe]].))
Some((Date(20,May,1631),The city of [[Magdeburg]] in Germany is seized by forces of the [[Holy Roman Empire]] and most of its inhabitants [[Sack of Magdeburg|massacred]], in one of the bloodiest incidents of the [[Thirty Years' War]].))
Some((Date(20,May,1645),[[Yangzhou massacre]]: the 10-day massacre of 800,000 residents of the city of [[Yangzhou]], part of the [[Transition from Ming to Qing]].))
Some((Date(20,May,1775),[[Mecklenburg Declaration of Independence]] is signed in [[Charlotte, North Carolina]]))
Some((Date(20,May,1802),By the [[Law of 20 May 1802]], [[Napoleon I of France|Napoleon Bonaparte]] reinstates [[slavery]] in the [[French colonial empire|French colonies]], revoking its abolition in the [[French Revolution]].))
Some((Date(20,May,1813),Napoleon Bonaparte leads his French troops into the [[Battle of Bautzen]] in [[Saxony]], Germany, against the combined armies of Russia and [[Prussia]]. The battle ends the next day with a French victory.))
Some((Date(20,May,1840),[[York Minster]] is badly damaged by fire.))
Some((Date(20,May,1861),[[American Civil War]]: The state of [[Kentucky]] proclaims its [[Country neutrality (international relations)|neutrality]], which will last until [[September 3]] when [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] forces enter the state. Meanwhile, the State of North Carolina secedes from the Union.))
Some((Date(20,May,1862),[[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Abraham Lincoln]] signs the [[Homestead Act]] into law.))

Some((Date(20,May,1883),[[Krakatoa]] [[1883 eruption of Krakatoa|begins to erupt]]; the volcano explodes three months later, killing more than 36,000 people.))

Some((Date(20,May,1896),The six ton [[chandelier]] of the [[Palais Garnier]] falls on the crowd below resulting in the death of one and the injury of many others.))
Some((Date(20,May,1899),The first [[traffic ticket]] in the US: New York City taxi driver Jacob German was arrested for speeding while driving 12 miles per hour on Lexington Street.))
Some((Date(20,May,1902),[[Cuba]] gains independence from the United States. [[Tomás Estrada Palma]] becomes the country's first President.))
Some((Date(20,May,1908),[[Budi Utomo]] organization is founded in [[Dutch East Indies]], beginning the [[Indonesian National Awakening]].))
Some((Date(20,May,1916),The ''[[Saturday Evening Post]]'' publishes its first cover with a [[Norman Rockwell]] painting (''Boy with Baby Carriage'').))
Some((Date(20,May,1920),[[Montreal]] radio station [[XWA]] broadcasts the first regularly scheduled [[radio]] programming in North America.))
Some((Date(20,May,1927),[[Treaty of Jeddah (1927)|Treaty of Jeddah]]: The United Kingdom recognizes the [[sovereignty]] of King [[Ibn Saud]] in the Kingdoms of [[Hejaz]] and [[Najd|Nejd]], which later merge to become the Kingdom of [[Saudi Arabia]].))
Some((Date(20,May,1932),[[Amelia Earhart]] takes off from [[Newfoundland (island)|Newfoundland]] to begin the world's first solo nonstop flight across the Atlantic Ocean by a female pilot, landing in Ireland the next day.))
Some((Date(20,May,1940),[[The Holocaust]]: The first prisoners arrive at a new [[concentration camp]] at [[Auschwitz]].))
Some((Date(20,May,1941),[[World War II]]: [[Battle of Crete]]: [[Nazi Germany|German]] [[Fallschirmjäger (World War II)|paratroops]] invade [[Crete]].))
Some((Date(20,May,1948),[[Chiang Kai-shek]] is elected as the first [[President of the Republic of China]].))
Some((Date(20,May,1949),In the United States, the Armed Forces Security Agency, the predecessor to the [[National Security Agency]], is established.))
Some((Date(20,May,1956),In [[Operation Redwing]], the first United States airborne [[hydrogen bomb]] is dropped over [[Bikini Atoll]] in the Pacific Ocean.))
Some((Date(20,May,1964),Discovery of the [[cosmic microwave background radiation]] by [[Robert Woodrow Wilson]] and [[Arno Penzias]].))
Some((Date(20,May,1965),[[PIA Flight 705]], a [[Pakistan International Airlines]] [[Boeing 720|Boeing 720-040B]], crashes while descending to land at [[Cairo International Airport]], killing 121 of the 127 passengers and crew.))
Some((Date(20,May,1967),The [[Popular Movement of the Revolution]] [[political party]] is established in the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]].))
Some((Date(20,May,1969),The [[Battle of Hamburger Hill]] in [[Vietnam]] ends.))
Some((Date(20,May,1980),In a [[1980 Quebec referendum|referendum]] in Quebec, the population rejects by a 60% vote the proposal from its government to move towards independence from Canada.))
Some((Date(20,May,1983),First publications of the discovery of the [[HIV]] [[virus]] that causes [[AIDS]] in the journal ''[[Science (journal)|Science]]'' by [[Luc Montagnier]].))
Some((Date(20,May,1985),[[Radio Martí]], part of the [[Voice of America]] service, begins broadcasting to [[Cuba]].))
Some((Date(20,May,1989),The Chinese authorities declare martial law in the face of pro-[[democracy]] demonstrations, setting the scene for the [[Tiananmen Square massacre]].))
Some((Date(20,May,1990),The first post-[[communism|Communist]] presidential and parliamentary elections are held in [[Romania]].))
Some((Date(20,May,1996),[[LGBT rights in the United States|Civil rights]]: The [[Supreme Court of the United States]] rules in ''[[Romer v. Evans]]'' against a law that would have prevented any city, town or county in the state of [[Colorado]] from taking any legislative, executive, or judicial action to protect the rights of [[Homosexuality|gays and lesbians]].))
Some((Date(20,May,2002),The independence of [[East Timor]] is recognized by Portugal, formally ending 23 years of [[Indonesia]]n rule and three years of provisional UN administration (Portugal itself is the former [[Portuguese Empire|colonizer]] of East Timor until 1976).))
Some((Date(20,May,2006),[[2006 Dhaka strikes|Dhaka wildcat strikes]]: A series of massive strikes begin, involving nearly 1.8 million garment workers in [[Bangladesh]].))
Some((Date(20,May,2010),[[Everybody Draw Mohammed Day]]: A social media event is celebrated in response to the Muslim extremists' reaction to images of Mohammed.))
Some((Date(20,May,2012),At least 27 people are killed and 50 others injured when a [[2012 Northern Italy earthquakes|6.0-magnitude earthquake]] strikes northern Italy.))
Some((Date(20,May,2013),An [[Enhanced Fujita scale|EF5]] [[2013 Moore tornado|tornado]] strikes the [[Oklahoma City]] suburb of [[Moore, Oklahoma|Moore]], killing 24 people and injuring 377 others.))
Some((Date(20,May,2014),More than 118 people are killed in [[2014 Jos bombings|two bombings]] in [[Jos]], [[Nigeria]].

Some((Date(21,May,1085),The Swedish town of [[Helsingborg]] is founded.))

Some((Date(21,May,1502),The island of [[Saint Helena]] is discovered by the Portuguese explorer [[João da Nova]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1554),[[Mary I of England|Queen Mary I]] grants a [[royal charter]] to [[Derby School]], as a grammar school for boys in [[Derby]], England.))
Some((Date(21,May,1674),The [[szlachta|nobility]] elect [[John III Sobieski|John Sobieski]] King of Poland and Grand Duke of [[Lithuania]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1725),The [[Order of St. Alexander Nevsky]] is instituted in Russia by Empress [[Catherine I]]. It would later be discontinued and then reinstated by the Soviet government in [[1942]] as the [[Order of Alexander Nevsky]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1758),Ten-year-old [[Mary Campbell (colonial settler)|Mary Campbell]] is abducted in [[Pennsylvania]] by [[Lenape]] during the [[French and Indian War]]. She is returned six and a half years later.))
Some((Date(21,May,1809),The first day of the [[Battle of Aspern-Essling]] between the Austrian army led by [[Archduke Charles, Duke of Teschen|Archduke Charles]] and the French army led by [[Napoleon|Napoleon I of France]] sees the French attack across the [[Danube]] held.))
Some((Date(21,May,1851),[[Slavery]] is abolished in [[Colombia]], South America.))
Some((Date(21,May,1856),[[Lawrence, Kansas]] is [[Sacking of Lawrence|captured and burned]] by pro-[[slavery]] forces.))
Some((Date(21,May,1863),[[American Civil War]]: The [[Union Army]] [[Battle of Plains Store|succeeds]] in closing off the last escape route from [[Port Hudson, Louisiana]], in preparation for the coming [[Siege of Port Hudson|siege]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1864),Russia declares an end to the [[Russo-Circassian War]] and many [[Circassians]] are forced into exile. The day is designated the [[Circassian Day of Mourning]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1871), French troops invade the [[Paris Commune]] and engage its residents in street fighting. By the close of "[[Bloody Week]]", some 20,000 [[communard]]s have been killed and 38,000 arrested.))
Some((Date(21,May,1879),[[War of the Pacific]]: Two [[Chile]]an ships blocking the harbor of [[Iquique]] (then belonging to [[Peru]]) battle two Peruvian vessels in the [[Battle of Iquique]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1881),The [[American Red Cross]] is established by [[Clara Barton]] in Washington, D.C.))
Some((Date(21,May,1894),The [[Manchester Ship Canal]] in the United Kingdom is officially opened by [[Queen Victoria]], who later [[knight]]s its designer [[Edward Leader Williams|Sir Edward Leader Williams]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1904),The [[FIFA|Fédération Internationale de Football Association]] (FIFA) is founded in Paris.))
Some((Date(21,May,1911),[[President of Mexico]] [[Porfirio Díaz]] and the revolutionary [[Francisco Madero]] sign the [[Treaty of Ciudad Juárez]] to put an end to the fighting between the forces of both men, concluding the initial phase of the [[Mexican Revolution]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1917),The [[Commonwealth War Graves Commission]] is established through [[royal charter]] to mark, record and maintain the graves and places of commemoration of [[Commonwealth of Nations]] military forces.))
Some((Date(21,May,1924),[[University of Chicago]] students [[Leopold and Loeb|Richard Loeb and Nathan Leopold, Jr.]] murder 14-year-old [[Bobby Franks]] in a "[[thrill killing]]".))
Some((Date(21,May,1927),[[Charles Lindbergh]] touches down at [[Le Bourget Field]] in Paris, completing the world's first solo nonstop flight across the Atlantic Ocean.))
Some((Date(21,May,1932),Bad weather forces [[Amelia Earhart]] to land in a pasture in [[Derry]], [[Northern Ireland]], and she thereby becomes the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean.))
Some((Date(21,May,1934),[[Oskaloosa, Iowa]], becomes the first municipality in the United States to fingerprint all of its citizens.))
Some((Date(21,May,1936),[[Sada Abe]] is arrested after wandering the streets of Tokyo for days with her dead lover's severed genitals in her handbag. Her story soon becomes one of Japan's most notorious scandals.))
Some((Date(21,May,1937),A [[Soviet and Russian manned drifting ice stations|Soviet station]], [[North Pole-1]], becomes the first scientific research settlement to operate on the [[drift ice]] of the Arctic Ocean.))
Some((Date(21,May,1939),The Canadian [[National War Memorial (Canada)|National War Memorial]] is unveiled by [[George VI|King George VI]] and [[Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother|Queen Elizabeth]] in [[Ottawa]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1946),Physicist [[Louis Slotin]] is fatally irradiated in a [[criticality incident]] during an experiment with the [[demon core]] at [[Los Alamos National Laboratory]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1951),The opening of the [[Ninth Street Show]], otherwise known as the [[9th Street Art Exhibition]]: A gathering of a number of notable artists, and the stepping-out of the post war New York [[avant-garde]], collectively known as the [[New York School (art)|New York School]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1961),[[African-American Civil Rights Movement (1954–68)|American civil rights movement]]: [[Alabama]] Governor [[John Malcolm Patterson]] declares [[martial law]] in an attempt to restore order after [[race riot]]s break out.))
Some((Date(21,May,1965),Adoption of the [[Flag of Ontario]] by the Canadian province.))
Some((Date(21,May,1966),The [[Ulster Volunteer Force]] declares war on the [[Irish Republican Army (1922–69)|Irish Republican Army]] in [[Northern Ireland]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1969),Civil unrest in [[Rosario, Argentina]], known as ''[[Rosariazo]]'', following the death of a 15-year-old student.))
Some((Date(21,May,1972),[[Michelangelo]]'s ''[[Pietà (Michelangelo)|Pietà]]'' in [[St. Peter's Basilica]] in Rome is damaged by a [[vandalism|vandal]], the mentally disturbed Hungarian geologist [[Laszlo Toth]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1976),The [[Yuba City bus disaster]] occurs in [[Martinez, California]]. Twenty-nine are killed making it the deadliest road accident in U.S. history.))
Some((Date(21,May,1979),[[White Night riots]] in [[San Francisco]] following the [[manslaughter]] conviction of [[Dan White]] for the assassinations of [[George Moscone]] and [[Harvey Milk]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1981),[[Irish republicanism|Irish Republican]] hunger strikers [[Raymond McCreesh]] and [[Patsy O'Hara]] die on hunger strike in [[Maze prison]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1982),[[Falklands War]]: A British amphibious assault during [[Operation Sutton]] leads to the [[Battle of San Carlos (1982)|Battle of San Carlos]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1991),Former Indian [[Prime Minister of India|Prime Minister]] [[Rajiv Gandhi]] is assassinated by a female suicide bomber near [[Chennai|Madras]].))
Some((Date(21,May,1992),After 30 seasons [[Johnny Carson]] hosted his penultimate episode and last featuring guests ([[Robin Williams]] and [[Bette Midler]]) of ''[[The Tonight Show]]''.))
Some((Date(21,May,1994),The [[Democratic Republic of Yemen]] unsuccessfully attempts to secede from the [[Republic of Yemen]]; a war breaks out.))
Some((Date(21,May,1996),The ferry {{MV|Bukoba}} sinks in [[Tanzania]]n waters on [[Lake Victoria]], killing nearly 1,000.))
Some((Date(21,May,1998),In [[Miami]], five [[abortion clinic]]s are hit by a [[butyric acid]] attacker.))
Some((Date(21,May,2001),French [[Christiane Taubira|Taubira law]] is enacted, officially recognizing the [[Atlantic slave trade]] and [[slavery]] as [[crimes against humanity]].))
Some((Date(21,May,2003),An earthquake hits northern [[Algeria]], killing more than 2,000 people.))
Some((Date(21,May,2005),The tallest [[roller coaster]] in the world, [[Kingda Ka]] opens at [[Six Flags Great Adventure]] in [[Jackson Township, New Jersey]].))
Some((Date(21,May,2006),The [[Republic of Montenegro]] holds a [[Montenegrin independence referendum, 2006|referendum]] proposing independence from the [[State Union of Serbia and Montenegro]]; 55% of Montenegrins vote for independence.))
Some((Date(21,May,2010),JAXA, the [[Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency]], launches the [[solar-sail]] spacecraft [[IKAROS]] aboard an [[H-IIA]] rocket. The vessel would make a Venus flyby late in the year.))
Some((Date(21,May,2011),Radio broadcaster [[Harold Camping]] predicted that the [[2011 end times prediction|world would end]] on this date. ))
Some((Date(21,May,2012),A [[Qafa e Vishës bus accident|bus accident]] near [[Himara]], [[Albania]] kills 13 people and injures 21 others.))
Some((Date(21,May,2014),A [[2014 Taipei Metro attack|knife attack]] on a [[Taipei Metro]] train leaves four people dead and almost two dozen others injured.))
Some((Date(22,May,-334),The [[Macedonia (ancient kingdom)|Macedonian]] army of [[Alexander the Great]] defeats [[Darius III]] of Persia in the [[Battle of the Granicus]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1176),The Hashshashin ([[Assassins]]) attempt to murder [[Saladin]] near [[Aleppo]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1200),King [[John, King of England|John of England]] and King [[Philip II of France]] sign the [[Treaty of Le Goulet]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1246),[[Henry Raspe, Landgrave of Thuringia|Henry Raspe]] is elected [[anti-king]] of the [[Kingdom of Germany]], in opposition to [[Conrad IV of Germany|Conrad IV]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1254),[[Kingdom of Serbia (medieval)|Serbian King]] [[Stefan Uroš I of Serbia|Stefan Uroš I]] and the [[Republic of Venice]] sign a peace treaty.))
Some((Date(22,May,1377),[[Pope Gregory XI]] issues five [[papal bull]]s to denounce the [[doctrine]]s of English [[theology|theologian]] [[John Wycliffe]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1455),Start of the [[Wars of the Roses]]: At the [[First Battle of St Albans]], [[Richard of York, 3rd Duke of York|Richard, Duke of York]], defeats and captures King [[Henry VI of England]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1629),[[Holy Roman Emperor]] [[Ferdinand II, Holy Roman Emperor|Ferdinand II]] and [[List of Danish monarchs|Danish King]] [[Christian IV of Denmark|Christian IV]] sign the [[Treaty of Lübeck]] to end the Danish intervention in the [[Thirty Years' War]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1762),Sweden and [[Prussia]] sign the [[Treaty of Hamburg (1762)|Treaty of Hamburg]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1807),A [[grand jury]] indicts former [[Vice President of the United States]] [[Aaron Burr]] on a charge of [[treason]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1809),On the second and last day of the [[Battle of Aspern-Essling]] (near [[Vienna]], Austria), [[Napoleon]] I is repelled by an enemy army for the first time.))
Some((Date(22,May,1812),[[Action of 22 May 1812]]: A small French two-frigate squadron comprising [[French frigate Ariane (1811)|''Ariane'']] and [[French frigate Andromaque (1811)|''Andromaque'']], returning from a [[commerce raiding]] campaign in the Atlantic, meets the 74-gun [[HMS Northumberland (1798)|HMS ''Northumberland'']] while trying the slip to Lorient through the British blockade. ))
Some((Date(22,May,1816),A mob in [[Littleport, Cambridgeshire]], England, [[Ely and Littleport riots of 1816|riots]] over high unemployment and rising grain costs; the rioting spreads to [[Ely, Cambridgeshire|Ely]] the next day.))
Some((Date(22,May,1819),The {{SS|Savannah}} leaves port at [[Savannah, Georgia]], United States, on a voyage to become the first [[steamship]] to cross the Atlantic Ocean. The ship arrived at [[Liverpool]], England, on [[June 20]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1826),{{HMS|Beagle}} departs on its first voyage.))
Some((Date(22,May,1840),The [[penal transportation|transportation]] of British [[convict]]s to the [[New South Wales]] [[colony]] is abolished.))
Some((Date(22,May,1848),[[History of Martinique#1815-1899|Slavery is abolished]] in [[Martinique]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1849),Future [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Abraham Lincoln]] is issued a [[patent]] for an [[Abraham Lincoln's patent|invention to lift boats]] over obstacles in a river, making him the only U.S. President to ever hold a patent.))
Some((Date(22,May,1856),[[United States House of Representatives|Congressman]] [[Preston Brooks]] of [[South Carolina]] beats [[United States Senate|Senator]] [[Charles Sumner]] with a cane in the hall of the [[United States Senate]] for a speech Sumner had made attacking [[Southern United States|Southerners]] who sympathized with the pro-[[slavery]] violence in [[Kansas]] ("[[Bleeding Kansas]]").))
Some((Date(22,May,1863),[[American Civil War]]: [[Siege of Port Hudson]]: [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] forces begin to lay [[siege]] to the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]]-controlled [[Port Hudson, Louisiana]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1864),American Civil War: After ten weeks, the [[Union Army]]'s [[Red River Campaign]] ends with the Union unable to achieve any of its objectives.))
Some((Date(22,May,1871),The [[United States Army|U.S. Army]] issues an order for abandonment of [[Fort Kearny]] in [[Nebraska]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1872),[[Reconstruction Era|Reconstruction]]: [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Ulysses S. Grant]] signs the [[Amnesty Act]] into law restoring full [[civil and political rights]] to all but about 500 Confederate sympathizers.))
Some((Date(22,May,1885),Prior to burial in the [[Panthéon]], the body of [[Victor Hugo]] was exposed under the [[Arc de Triomphe]] during the night.))
Some((Date(22,May,1897),The [[Blackwall Tunnel]] under the [[River Thames]] is officially opened))
Some((Date(22,May,1903),Launch of the [[White Star Line]]r, {{SS|Ionic}}.))
Some((Date(22,May,1906),The [[Wright brothers]] are granted U.S. patent number 821,393 for their "[[Airplane|Flying-Machine]]".))
Some((Date(22,May,1915),[[Lassen Peak]] erupts with a powerful force, and is the only mountain other than [[Mount St. Helens]] to erupt in the contiguous US during the 20th century.))
Some((Date(22,May,1926),[[Chiang Kai-shek]] replaces communists in [[Kuomintang]], China.))
Some((Date(22,May,1939),[[World War II]]: Germany and Italy sign the [[Pact of Steel]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1942),Mexico enters World War II on the side of the [[Allies of World War II|Allies]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1943),[[Joseph Stalin]] disbands [[Comintern]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1945),[[Operation Paperclip]]: United States Army Major Robert B. Staver recommends that the U.S. evacuate German scientists and engineers to help in the development of [[rocket]] technology.))
Some((Date(22,May,1947),[[Cold War]]: In an effort to fight the spread of [[Communism]], the U.S. President [[Harry S. Truman]] signs an act into law that will later be called the [[Truman Doctrine]]. The act grants [[United States dollar|$]]400&nbsp;million in military and economic aid to [[Turkey]] and Greece, each battling an internal Communist movement.))
Some((Date(22,May,1958),[[1958 riots in Ceylon|Sri Lankan riots of 1958]]: This riot is a watershed event in the race relationship of the various ethnic communities of Sri Lanka. The total number of deaths is estimated to be 300, mostly Sri Lankan [[Tamil people|Tamils]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1960),An [[earthquake]] measuring 9.5 on the [[moment magnitude scale]], now known as the [[1960 Valdivia earthquake|Great Chilean earthquake]], hits southern [[Chile]]. It is the most powerful earthquake ever recorded.))
Some((Date(22,May,1961),An [[1961 New South Wales earthquake|earthquake]] rocks New South Wales.))
Some((Date(22,May,1962),[[Continental Airlines Flight 11]] crashes after bombs explode on board.))
Some((Date(22,May,1963),Greek left-wing politician [[Grigoris Lambrakis]], is shot and dies five days later.))
Some((Date(22,May,1964),The U.S. President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] announces the goals of his [[Great Society]] social reforms to bring an "end to poverty and racial injustice" in America.))
Some((Date(22,May,1967),The [[L'Innovation Department Store fire|L'Innovation]] department store in the center of [[Brussels]], Belgium, burns down. It is the most devastating fire in Belgian history, resulting in 323 dead and missing and 150 injured.))
Some((Date(22,May,1968),The nuclear-powered [[submarine]] the {{USS|Scorpion|SSN-589|6}} sinks with 99 men aboard 400 miles southwest of the [[Azores]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1969),''[[Apollo 10]]'' 's lunar module flies within 8.4 [[nautical mile]]s (16&nbsp;km) of the [[moon]]'s surface.))
Some((Date(22,May,1972),Ceylon adopts a new [[constitution]], thus becoming a [[Republic]], changes its name to [[Sri Lanka]], and joins the [[Commonwealth of Nations]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1980),[[Namco]] releases the highly influential [[arcade game]] ''[[Pac-Man]]''.))
Some((Date(22,May,1987),[[Hashimpura massacre]] in [[Meerut]], India.))
Some((Date(22,May,1990),[[Yemen Arab Republic|North]] and [[South Yemen]] are unified to create the Republic of [[Yemen]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1992),After 30 years, 66-year-old [[Johnny Carson]] hosts ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson|The Tonight Show]]'' for the last time.))
Some((Date(22,May,1997),[[Kelly Flinn incident|Kelly Flinn]], the [[United States Air Force|US Air Force]]'s first female bomber pilot certified for combat, accepts a [[general discharge]] in order to avoid a [[court-martial]].))
Some((Date(22,May,1998),[[Lewinsky scandal]]: A federal judge rules that [[United States Secret Service]] agents can be compelled to testify before a [[grand jury]] concerning the scandal, involving [[President]] [[Bill Clinton]].))
Some((Date(22,May,2002),In [[Washington, D.C.]], the remains of [[Chandra Levy]] are found in [[Rock Creek Park]].))
Some((Date(22,May,2003),In [[Fort Worth, Texas]], [[Annika Sörenstam]] becomes the first woman to play the [[PGA Tour]] in 58 years.))
Some((Date(22,May,2004),The U.S. town of [[Hallam, Nebraska]] is wiped out by a powerful [[Fujita scale#F4|F4]] [[tornado]] (part of the [[May 2004 tornado outbreak sequence]]) which kills one resident, and becomes the widest tornado on record at {{convert|2.5|mi}} wide; a record that wouldn't be broken until the [[May 26–31, 2013 tornado outbreak|El Reno tornado]] on May 31, 2013.))
Some((Date(22,May,2005),[[Mongolian presidential election, 2005|A Presidential election]] is held in Mongolia; the result is a victory for [[Nambaryn Enkhbayar]] of the Mongolian People's Revolutionary Party (MPRP). ))
Some((Date(22,May,2008),The [[Late-May 2008 tornado outbreak sequence]] unleashes 235 [[tornado]]es, including an [[Enhanced Fujita scale|EF4]] and an [[Enhanced Fujita scale|EF5]] tornado, between May 22 and May 31, 2008. The tornadoes strike 19 [[U.S. state|state]]s and one [[Canadian province]].))
Some((Date(22,May,2009),The [[Credit CARD Act of 2009]] was [[Signature|signed]] into [[Law of the United States|U.S. law]] by the [[President of the United States|President]], [[Barack Obama]].))
Some((Date(22,May,2010),An [[Air India Express]] [[Boeing 737]] [[Air India Express Flight 812|goes over a cliff and crashes]] upon landing at [[Mangalore]], India, killing 158 of the 166 people on board.  It is the worst crash involving a Boeing 737.))
Some((Date(22,May,2011),[[2011 Joplin tornado|An EF5 tornado]] strikes [[Joplin, Missouri]], killing 162 people and wreaking $2.8 billion worth in damage&mdash;the costliest and seventh-deadliest single tornado in U.S. history.))
Some((Date(22,May,2012),[[Tokyo Skytree]] is opened to public. It is the [[List of tallest towers in the world|tallest tower in world]] (634 m), and the second tallest man-made structure on Earth, after [[Burj Khalifa]] (829.8 m).))
Some((Date(22,May,2014),General [[Prayut Chan-o-cha]] of the [[Royal Thai Armed Forces]] announces a military [[2014 Thai coup d'état|coup d'état]], following six months of political turmoil.))
Some((Date(23,May,1430),[[Siege of Compiègne]]: [[Joan of Arc]] is captured by the [[Duchy of Burgundy|Burgundians]] while leading an army to relieve [[Compiègne]].))

Some((Date(23,May,1701),After being convicted of [[piracy]] and of murdering William Moore, Captain [[William Kidd]] is hanged in London, England.))

Some((Date(23,May,1788),[[South Carolina]] ratifies the [[United States Constitution]] as the eighth American state.))
Some((Date(23,May,1793),[[Battle of Famars]] during the [[Flanders Campaign]] of the [[War of the First Coalition]].))
Some((Date(23,May,1829),[[Accordion]] patent granted to [[Cyrill Demian]] in [[Vienna]], [[Austrian Empire]].))
Some((Date(23,May,1844),Declaration of the [[Báb]] the evening before the 23rd: A merchant of Shiraz announces that he is a Prophet and founds a religious movement that would later be brutally crushed by the Persian government. He is considered to be a forerunner of the [[Bahá'í Faith]], and Bahá'ís celebrate the day as a holy day.))
Some((Date(23,May,1846),[[Mexican–American War]]: President [[Mariano Paredes]] of Mexico unofficially declares war on the United States.))
Some((Date(23,May,1873),The Canadian Parliament establishes the [[North-West Mounted Police]], the forerunner of the [[Royal Canadian Mounted Police]].))
Some((Date(23,May,1900),[[American Civil War]]: Sergeant [[William Harvey Carney]] is awarded the [[Medal of Honor]] for his heroism in the [[Assault on the Battery Wagner]] in 1863.))
Some((Date(23,May,1907),The [[Unicameralism|unicameral]] [[Parliament of Finland]] gathers for its first plenary session.))
Some((Date(23,May,1911),The [[New York Public Library]] is dedicated.))
Some((Date(23,May,1915),[[World War I]]: Italy joins the [[Allies of World War I|Allies]] after they declare war on [[Austria-Hungary]].))
Some((Date(23,May,1932),In [[Brazil]], four students are shot and killed during a manifestation against the Brazilian dictator [[Getúlio Vargas]], which occurred in the city of [[São Paulo]]. Their names and surnames were used to form the [[MMDC]], a revolutionary group that would act against the dictatorial government, especially in the [[Constitutionalist Revolution]] ("Revolução Constitucionalista", in Portuguese), the major uprising in Brazil during the [[20th century]].))
Some((Date(23,May,1934),The American [[Bank robbery|bank robbers]] [[Bonnie and Clyde]] are ambushed by police and killed in [[Bienville Parish, Louisiana]].))
Some((Date(23,May,1939),The [[United States Navy|U.S. Navy]] [[submarine]] [[USS Sailfish (SS-192)|USS ''Squalus'']] sinks off the coast of [[New Hampshire]] during a test dive, causing the death of 24 sailors and two civilian technicians. The remaining 32 sailors and one civilian naval architect are rescued the following day.))
Some((Date(23,May,1945),[[World War II]]: [[Heinrich Himmler]], the head of the [[Schutzstaffel]], commits suicide while in [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] custody.))
Some((Date(23,May,1948),[[Thomas C. Wasson]], the US Consul-General, is assassinated in [[Jerusalem]], [[Israel]].))
Some((Date(23,May,1949),The [[West Germany|Federal Republic of Germany]] is established and the [[Basic Law for the Federal Republic of Germany]] is proclaimed.))
Some((Date(23,May,1951),[[Tibet]]ans sign the [[Seventeen Point Agreement for the Peaceful Liberation of Tibet]] with China.))
Some((Date(23,May,1958),The satellite ''[[Explorer 1]]'' ceases transmission.))
Some((Date(23,May,1967),[[Egypt]] closes the [[Straits of Tiran]] and blockades the port of [[Eilat]] at the northern end of the [[Gulf of Aqaba]] to Israeli shipping.))
Some((Date(23,May,1970),[[Robert Stephenson]]'s pioneering [[Britannia Tubular Bridge]] over the [[Menai Strait]] is catastrophically damaged by fire after standing for 120 years.))
Some((Date(23,May,1992),Italy's most prominent anti-mafia judge [[Giovanni Falcone]], his wife and three body guards are killed by the [[Corleonesi]] clan with a half-ton bomb near [[Capaci]], [[Sicily]]. His friend and colleague [[Paolo Borsellino]] will be assassinated less than two months later, making 1992 a turning point in the history of [[Sicilian Mafia|Italian Mafia]] prosecutions.))
Some((Date(23,May,1995),The first version of the [[Java (programming language)|Java programming language]] is released.))
Some((Date(23,May,1998),The [[Good Friday Agreement]] is accepted in a [[referendum]] in [[Northern Ireland]] with 75% voting yes.))
Some((Date(23,May,2002),The "55 parties" clause of the [[Kyoto Protocol]] is reached after its ratification by [[Iceland]].))
Some((Date(23,May,2004),Part of Paris [[Charles de Gaulle Airport]]'s Terminal 2E collapses, killing four people and injuring three others.))
Some((Date(23,May,2006),Alaskan [[stratovolcano]] [[Mount Cleveland (Alaska)|Mount Cleveland]] erupts.))
Some((Date(23,May,2008),The [[International Court of Justice]] (ICJ) awards [[Middle Rocks]] to [[Malaysia]] and [[Pedra Branca, Singapore|Pedra Branca]] (Pulau Batu Puteh) to [[Singapore]], ending a 29-year [[Pedra Branca dispute|territorial dispute]] between the two countries.))
Some((Date(23,May,2009),Former [[President of South Korea|South Korean president]] [[Roh Moo-hyun]] commits suicide, jumping from a 45-meter cliff in [[Bongha]], [[Gimhae]], South Korea.))
Some((Date(23,May,2010),[[Jamaica]]n police begin a manhunt for drug lord [[Christopher Coke]], after the United States requested his extradition, leading to [[2010 Kingston unrest|three days of violence]] during which at least 73 bystanders are killed.))
Some((Date(23,May,2012),[[Adam Lambert]] became the first [[openly gay]] artist to debut at #1 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] Album Charts, with his album ''[[Trespassing (album)|Trespassing]]''.))

Some((Date(23,May,2014),Seven people, including the perpetrator, are killed and another 14 injured in [[2014 Isla Vista killings|a killing spree]] near the campus of [[University of California, Santa Barbara]].))
Some((Date(23,May,2015),At least 46 people are killed as a result of [[2015 Texas–Oklahoma flood and tornado outbreak|floods]] caused by a tornado in Texas and Oklahoma.))

Some((Date(24,May,1595),''[[Nomenclator (nomenclature)|Nomenclator]]'' of [[Leiden University Library]] appears, the first printed catalog of an institutional library.))
Some((Date(24,May,1607),One hundred English settlers disembark in [[Jamestown, Virginia|Jamestown]], the first English colony in America.))
Some((Date(24,May,1621),The [[Protestant Union]] is formally dissolved.))
Some((Date(24,May,1626),[[Peter Minuit]] buys [[Manhattan]].))
Some((Date(24,May,1689),The [[Parliament of England|English Parliament]] passes the [[Act of Toleration 1689|Act of Toleration]] protecting [[Protestantism|Protestants]]. [[Roman Catholics]] are intentionally excluded.))
Some((Date(24,May,1738),[[John Wesley]] is [[Born again (Christianity)|converted]], essentially launching the [[Methodism|Methodist movement]]; the day is celebrated annually by [[Methodists]] as [[Aldersgate Day]] and a church service is generally held on the preceding Sunday.))
Some((Date(24,May,1798),The [[Irish Rebellion of 1798]] led by the [[Society of United Irishmen|United Irishmen]] against British rule begins.))
Some((Date(24,May,1813),South American independence leader [[Simón Bolívar]] enters [[Mérida, Mérida|Mérida]], leading the invasion of [[Venezuela]], and is proclaimed ''El Libertador'' ("The Liberator").))

Some((Date(24,May,1830),"[[Mary Had a Little Lamb]]" by [[Sarah Josepha Hale]] is published.))
Some((Date(24,May,1832),The [[First Kingdom of Greece]] is declared in the [[London Conference of 1832|London Conference]].))
Some((Date(24,May,1844),[[Samuel Morse]] sends the message "What hath God wrought" (a [[Bible|biblical]] quotation, [[Book of Numbers|Numbers]] 23:23) from the [[Old Supreme Court Chamber]] in the [[United States Capitol]] to his assistant, [[Alfred Vail]], in [[Baltimore]], [[Maryland]], to inaugurate the first [[Telegraphy|telegraph]] line.))
Some((Date(24,May,1856),[[John Brown (abolitionist)|John Brown]] and his men [[Pottawatomie massacre|kill five slavery supporters at Pottawatomie Creek, Kansas]].))
Some((Date(24,May,1861),[[American Civil War]]: [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] troops occupy [[Alexandria, Virginia]].))
Some((Date(24,May,1883),The [[Brooklyn Bridge]] in New York City is opened to traffic after 14 years of construction.))
Some((Date(24,May,1895),[[Henry Irving]] becomes the first person from the [[theatre]] to be [[knight]]ed.))
Some((Date(24,May,1900),[[Second Boer War]]: The United Kingdom annexes the [[Orange Free State]].))
Some((Date(24,May,1915),[[World War I]]: [[Kingdom of Italy|Italy]] declares war on [[Austria-Hungary]], joining the conflict on the side of [[Allies of World War I|the Allies]].))
Some((Date(24,May,1921),The trial of [[Sacco and Vanzetti]] opens.))
Some((Date(24,May,1930),[[Amy Johnson]] lands in [[Darwin, Northern Territory]], becoming the first woman to fly solo from England to Australia (she left on [[May 5]] for the 11,000 mile flight).))
Some((Date(24,May,1935),The first [[night game]] in [[Major League Baseball]] history is played in [[Cincinnati, Ohio]], with the [[Cincinnati Reds]] beating the [[Philadelphia Phillies]] 2–1 at [[Crosley Field]].))
Some((Date(24,May,1939),First issue of ''[[Fashizmi]]'' is published in [[Tirana]].))
Some((Date(24,May,1940),[[Igor Sikorsky]] performs the first successful single-rotor [[helicopter]] flight.))
Some((Date(24,May,1941),[[World War II]]: In the [[Battle of the Atlantic]], the [[German battleship Bismarck|German Battleship ''Bismarck'']] sinks then-pride of the [[Royal Navy]], {{HMS|Hood|51|6}}, killing all but three crewmen.))
Some((Date(24,May,1943),[[The Holocaust]]: [[Josef Mengele]] becomes chief medical officer of the [[Auschwitz concentration camp]].))
Some((Date(24,May,1948),[[1948 Arab–Israeli War|Arab–Israeli War]]: Egypt [[Battle of Yad Mordechai|captures]] the Israeli [[kibbutz]] of [[Yad Mordechai]], but the five-day effort gives Israeli forces time to prepare enough to stop the Egyptian advance a week later.))
Some((Date(24,May,1956),Conclusion of the [[Sixth Buddhist Council]] on [[Vesak]] Day, marking the 2,500 year anniversary after the Lord [[Gautama Buddha|Buddha]]'s [[Parinibbāna]].))
Some((Date(24,May,1958),[[United Press International]] is formed through a merger of the [[United Press]] and the [[International News Service]].))
Some((Date(24,May,1960),Following the [[1960 Valdivia earthquake]], the largest ever recorded earthquake, [[Puyehue-Cordón Caulle#1960 eruption|Cordón Caulle begins to erupt]].))
Some((Date(24,May,1961),[[American civil rights movement]]: [[Freedom Riders]] are arrested in [[Jackson, Mississippi]], for "disturbing the peace" after disembarking from their bus.))
Some((Date(24,May,1962),[[Project Mercury]]: American [[astronaut]] [[Scott Carpenter]] orbits the Earth three times in the ''[[Aurora 7]]'' [[space capsule]].))

Some((Date(24,May,1967),[[Egypt]] imposes a blockade and siege of the [[Red Sea]] coast of [[Israel]].))

Some((Date(24,May,1976),The London to Washington, D.C., [[Concorde]] service begins.))
Some((Date(24,May,1981),Ecuadorian president [[Jaime Roldós Aguilera]], his wife, and his presidential committee die in an aircraft accident while travelling from Quito to Zapotillo minutes after the president gave a famous speech regarding the 24 de mayo anniversary of the [[Battle of Pichincha]].))
Some((Date(24,May,1982),[[Liberation of Khorramshahr]]: [[Iran]]ians recapture of the port city of [[Khorramshahr]] from the [[Iraqis]] during the [[Iran–Iraq War]].))
Some((Date(24,May,1988),[[Section 28]] of the United Kingdom's [[Local Government Act 1988]], a controversial amendment stating that a [[Local government in England|local authority]] cannot intentionally promote [[homosexuality]], is enacted.))
Some((Date(24,May,1991),[[Israel]] conducts [[Operation Solomon]], evacuating [[Ethiopia]]n Jews to Israel.))
Some((Date(24,May,1992),The last [[Thailand|Thai]] dictator, General [[Suchinda Kraprayoon]], resigns following pro-democracy protests.))
Some((Date(24,May,1993),[[Eritrea]] gains its independence from [[Ethiopia]].))
Some((Date(24,May,1994),Four men convicted of [[1993 World Trade Center bombing|bombing the World Trade Center in New York]] in 1993 are each sentenced to 240 years in prison.))
Some((Date(24,May,1999),The [[International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia]] in [[The Hague]], Netherlands indicts [[Slobodan Milošević]] and four others for [[war crime]]s and [[crimes against humanity]] committed in [[Kosovo]].))
Some((Date(24,May,2000),Israeli troops withdraw from [[southern Lebanon]] after 22 years of occupation.))
Some((Date(24,May,2001),[[Mountaineering]]: [[Temba Tsheri]], a 16-year-old [[Sherpa people|Sherpa]], becomes the youngest person to climb to the top of [[Mount Everest]].))
Some((Date(24,May,2002),Russia and the United States sign the [[Strategic Offensive Reductions Treaty|Moscow Treaty]].))
Some((Date(24,May,2014),A 6.4 magnitude [[2014 Aegean Sea earthquake|earthquake]] occurs in the [[Aegean Sea]] between [[Greece]] and [[Turkey]], injuring 324 people.))
Some((Date(25,May,-567),[[Servius Tullius]], the king of [[Ancient Rome|Rome]], celebrates a [[Roman triumph|triumph]] for his [[victory]] over the [[Etruscans]].))
Some((Date(25,May,-240),First recorded [[perihelion]] passage of [[Halley's Comet]].))

Some((Date(25,May,1420),[[Henry the Navigator]] is appointed governor of the [[Order of Christ (Portugal)|Order of Christ]].))
Some((Date(25,May,1521),The [[Diet of Worms]] ends when [[Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor]], issues the [[Edict of Worms]], declaring [[Martin Luther]] an [[outlaw]].))
Some((Date(25,May,1644),[[Ming dynasty|Ming]] general [[Wu Sangui]] forms an alliance with the invading [[Manchus]] and opens the gates of the [[Great Wall of China]] at [[Shanhai Pass|Shanhaiguan]] pass, letting the Manchus through towards the capital Beijing.))
Some((Date(25,May,1659),[[Richard Cromwell]] resigns as [[Lord Protector]] of England following the [[wikt:restoration|restoration]] of the [[Long Parliament]], beginning a second brief period of the [[republicanism|republican]] government called the [[Commonwealth of England]].))
Some((Date(25,May,1738),A treaty between [[Pennsylvania]] and [[Maryland]] ends the [[Cresap's War|Conojocular War]] with settlement of a [[territorial dispute|boundary dispute]] and exchange of [[prisoner of war|prisoners]].))
Some((Date(25,May,1798),[[Irish Rebellion of 1798|United Irishmen Rebellion]]: [[Battle of Carlow]] begins; [[Carnew executions|executions of suspected rebels at Carnew]] and [[Dunlavin Green executions|at Dunlavin Green]] take place.))
Some((Date(25,May,1809),[[Chuquisaca Revolution]]: [[Patriot (Spanish American Independence)|Patriot revolt]] in Chuquisaca (modern day [[Sucre]]) against the [[Spanish Empire]], sparking the [[Latin American wars of independence]].))

Some((Date(25,May,1895),The playwright, poet, and novelist [[Oscar Wilde]] is convicted of "committing acts of [[Labouchere Amendment|gross indecency]] with [[Homosexuality|other male persons]]" and sentenced to serve two years in prison.))
Some((Date(25,May,1914),The [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom]] passes [[Home Rule Act 1914|the Home Rule Act]] for [[devolution]] in Ireland.))
Some((Date(25,May,1925),[[Scopes Trial]]: [[John T. Scopes]] is indicted for teaching [[Charles Darwin]]'s theory of [[evolution]] in Tennessee.))
Some((Date(25,May,1926),[[Sholom Schwartzbard]] assassinates [[Symon Petliura]], the head of the government of the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]], which is in [[exile|government-in-exile]] in Paris.))
Some((Date(25,May,1935),[[Jesse Owens]] of [[Ohio State University]] breaks three world records and ties a fourth at the [[Big Ten Conference]] [[Track and field|Track and Field]] Championships in [[Ann Arbor, Michigan]].))

Some((Date(25,May,1938),[[Spanish Civil War]]: The bombing of [[Alicante]] takes place, with 313 deaths.))
Some((Date(25,May,1940),[[World War II]]: The German [[2nd Panzer Division (Wehrmacht)|2nd Panzer Division]] captures the port of [[Boulogne-sur-Mer]]; the surrender of the last French and British troops marks the end of the [[Battle of Boulogne (1940)|Battle of Boulogne]].))
Some((Date(25,May,1946),The parliament of [[Jordan|Transjordan]] makes [[Abdullah I of Jordan]] their Emir.))
Some((Date(25,May,1950),[[Public transport]]: Green Hornet disaster. A [[Chicago Surface Lines]] streetcar crashes into a fuel truck, killing 33.))
Some((Date(25,May,1953),[[Nuclear testing]]: At the [[Nevada Test Site]], the United States conduct their first and only [[nuclear artillery]] test.))
Some((Date(25,May,1955),In the United States, a night-time [[Fujita scale|F5]] [[tornado]] strikes the small city of [[Udall, Kansas]], killing 80 and injuring 273. It is the deadliest tornado to ever occur in the state and the 23rd deadliest in the U.S.))
Some((Date(25,May,1961),[[Apollo program]]: U.S. President [[John F. Kennedy]] announces before a special joint session of the [[United States Congress|Congress]] his goal to initiate a project to put a "man on the [[Moon]]" before the end of the decade.))
Some((Date(25,May,1962),The [[Old Bay Line]], the last overnight [[steamboat]] service in the United States, goes out of business.))
Some((Date(25,May,1963),In [[Addis Ababa]], [[Ethiopia]], the [[Organisation of African Unity]] is established.))
Some((Date(25,May,1966),[[Explorer program]]: ''[[Explorer 32]]'' launches.))
Some((Date(25,May,1967),[[Celtic F.C.]] from Glasgow, Scotland, becomes the first ever Northern European team to win the [[1967 European Cup Final|European Cup]]; with previous winners being from Spain, Italy and Portugal.))
Some((Date(25,May,1968),[[Gateway Arch]] Saint Louis Gateway Arch is dedicated.))
Some((Date(25,May,1973),{{ship|HNS|Velos|D-16|6}}, while participating in a [[NATO]] exercise and in order to protest against the [[Greek military junta of 1967–74|dictatorship in Greece]], anchored at [[Fiumicino]], Italy, refusing to return to Greece.))
Some((Date(25,May,1977),''[[Star Wars]]'' is released in theaters, inspiring the [[Jediism]] religion and [[Geek Pride Day]] holiday.))
Some((Date(25,May,1979),[[American Airlines Flight 191]]: In Chicago, a [[McDonnell Douglas DC-10]] crashes during takeoff at [[O'Hare International Airport]] killing all 271 on board and two people on the ground.))
Some((Date(25,May,1981),In [[Riyadh]], the [[Gulf Cooperation Council]] is created between [[Bahrain]], [[Kuwait]], [[Oman]], [[Qatar]], [[Saudi Arabia]] and the [[United Arab Emirates]].))
Some((Date(25,May,1982),[[HMS Coventry (D118)|HMS ''Coventry'']] is sunk during the [[Falklands War]].))
Some((Date(25,May,1985),[[Bangladesh]] is hit by a [[tropical cyclone]] and [[storm surge]], which kills approximately 10,000 people.))
Some((Date(25,May,1986),[[Hands Across America]] takes place.))
Some((Date(25,May,1997),A [[military coup]] in [[Sierra Leone]] replaces President [[Ahmad Tejan Kabbah]] with Major [[Johnny Paul Koromah]].))
Some((Date(25,May,1999),The [[United States House of Representatives]] releases the ''[[Cox Report]]'' which details the People's Republic of China's nuclear espionage against the U.S. over the prior two decades.))
Some((Date(25,May,2000),[[Liberation Day (Lebanon)|Liberation Day of Lebanon]]. [[Israel]] withdraws its army from most of the [[Lebanon|Lebanese]] territory after 22 years of its first [[Operation Litani|invasion in 1978]].))
Some((Date(25,May,2001),[[Erik Weihenmayer]], 32 years old, of [[Boulder, Colorado]], becomes the first blind person to reach the summit of [[Mount Everest]].))
Some((Date(25,May,2002),[[China Airlines Flight 611]] disintegrates in mid-air and crashes into the [[Taiwan Strait]]. All 225 people on board are killed.))
Some((Date(25,May,2008),[[NASA]]'s ''[[Phoenix (spacecraft)|Phoenix]]'' [[lander (spacecraft)|lander]] lands in [[Green Valley (Mars)|Green Valley]] region of [[Mars]] to search for environments suitable for water and [[Life on Mars|microbial life]].))
Some((Date(25,May,2009),[[North Korea]] allegedly tests [[2009 North Korean nuclear test|its second nuclear device]]. Following the nuclear test, Pyongyang also conducted several missile tests building tensions in the international community.))

Some((Date(26,May,-47),[[Julius Caesar]] visits [[Tarsus, Mersin|Tarsus]] on his way to [[Pontus]], where he meets enthusiastic support, but where, according to [[Cicero]], [[Gaius Cassius Longinus|Cassius]] is planning to kill him at this point.))
Some((Date(26,May,1135),[[Alfonso VII of León and Castile]] is crowned in [[León Cathedral]] as ''[[Imperator totius Hispaniae]]'', "Emperor of all of Spain".))

Some((Date(26,May,1966),[[British Guiana]] gains independence, becoming [[Guyana]].))

Some((Date(26,May,1981),[[Prime Minister of Italy|Italian Prime Minister]] [[Arnaldo Forlani]] and his coalition cabinet resign following a scandal over membership of the [[Freemasonry|pseudo-masonic]] lodge [[Propaganda Due|P2 ''(Propaganda Due)'']].))

Some((Date(26,May,1998),The [[Supreme Court of the United States]] rules that [[Ellis Island]], the historic gateway for millions of immigrants, is mainly in the state of [[New Jersey]], not New York.))

Some((Date(26,May,2008),[[2008 South China floods|Severe flooding]] begins in eastern and southern China that will ultimately cause 148 deaths and force the evacuation of 1.3 million.))
Some((Date(26,May,2012),A [[Miami cannibal attack|cannibal attack]] takes place on the [[MacArthur Causeway]] in [[Miami]], Florida.
