Some((Date(27,May,1967),Australians vote in favor of a [[Australian referendum, 1967 (Aboriginals)|constitutional referendum]] granting the Australian government the power to make laws to benefit [[Indigenous Australians]] and to count them in the national census.))

Some((Date(27,May,1971),The [[Dahlerau train disaster]], the worst railway accident in West Germany, kills 46 people and injures 25 near [[Wuppertal]].))
Some((Date(27,May,1975),[[Dibbles Bridge coach crash]] near [[Grassington]], in [[North Yorkshire]], England, kills 33 – the highest ever death toll in a road accident in the United Kingdom.))
Some((Date(27,May,1980),The [[Gwangju Massacre]]: Airborne and army troops of South Korea retake the city of [[Gwangju]] from civil militias, killing at least 207 and possibly many more.))
Some((Date(27,May,1986),''[[Dragon Quest]]'', the game credited as setting the template for [[role-playing video games]], is released in Japan. ))
Some((Date(27,May,1995),In [[Culpeper, Virginia]], the actor [[Christopher Reeve]] is paralyzed from the neck down after falling from his horse in a riding competition.))
Some((Date(27,May,1996),[[First Chechen War]]: the Russian President [[Boris Yeltsin]] meets with [[Chechnya]]n rebels for the first time and negotiates a cease-fire.))
Some((Date(27,May,1997),The unusual [[1997 Central Texas tornado outbreak|tornado outbreak]] in [[Jarrell, Texas]].))
Some((Date(27,May,1998),[[Oklahoma City bombing]]: [[Michael Fortier (American)|Michael Fortier]] is sentenced to 12 years in prison and fined $200,000 for failing to warn authorities about the [[terrorism|terrorist]] plot.))
Some((Date(27,May,2001),Members of the [[Islamism|Islamist]] separatist group [[Abu Sayyaf]] [[Dos Palmas kidnappings|seize twenty hostages]] from an affluent island resort on [[Palawan]] in the [[Philippines]]; the hostage crisis would not be resolved until June 2002.))
Some((Date(27,May,2006),The [[2006 Yogyakarta earthquake]] strikes devastating [[Bantul]] and the city of [[Yogyakarta]] killing over 6,600 people.

))
Some((Date(28,May,-585),A [[solar eclipse]] occurs, as predicted by the Greek philosopher and scientist [[Thales]], while [[Alyattes of Lydia|Alyattes]] is battling [[Cyaxares]] in the [[Eclipse of Thales|Battle of Halys]], leading to a truce. This is one of the cardinal dates from which other dates can be calculated.))
Some((Date(28,May,1503),[[James IV of Scotland]] and [[Margaret Tudor]] are married according to a papal bull by [[Pope Alexander VI]]. A Treaty of Everlasting Peace between Scotland and England signed on that occasion results in a peace that lasts ten years.))
Some((Date(28,May,1533),The [[Archbishop of Canterbury]], [[Thomas Cranmer]], declares the marriage of King [[Henry VIII of England]] to [[Anne Boleyn]] valid.))
Some((Date(28,May,1588),The [[Spanish Armada]], with 130 ships and 30,000 men, sets sail from [[Lisbon]], Portugal, heading for the [[English Channel]]. (It will take until May 30 for all ships to leave port.)))
Some((Date(28,May,1644),[[Bolton Massacre]] by [[Cavalier|Royalist]] troops under the command of [[James Stanley, 7th Earl of Derby]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1754),[[French and Indian War]]: In the first engagement of the war, [[Virginia]] [[militia]] under the 22-year-old [[Lieutenant colonel]] [[George Washington]] defeat a French reconnaissance party in the [[Battle of Jumonville Glen]] in what is now [[Fayette County, Pennsylvania|Fayette County]] in southwestern [[Pennsylvania]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1830),[[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Andrew Jackson]] signs the [[Indian Removal Act]] which relocates [[Native Americans in the United States|Native Americans]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1871),Fall of the [[Paris Commune]]. ))
Some((Date(28,May,1892),In [[San Francisco]], [[John Muir]] organizes the [[Sierra Club]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1900),[[Gare d'Orsay]] railway station is inaugurated in Paris.))
Some((Date(28,May,1905),[[Russo-Japanese War]]: The [[Battle of Tsushima]] ends with the destruction of the Russian [[Baltic Fleet]] by [[Admiral]] [[Tōgō Heihachirō]] and the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1907),The first [[Isle of Man TT]] race was held.))
Some((Date(28,May,1918),The [[Azerbaijan Democratic Republic]] and the [[First Republic of Armenia]] declare their independence.))
Some((Date(28,May,1926),The [[28 May 1926 coup d'état]]: [[Ditadura Nacional]] is established in Portugal to suppress the unrest of the [[History of Portugal#The First Republic|First Republic]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1932),In the Netherlands, construction of the [[Afsluitdijk]] is completed and the [[Zuiderzee]] bay is [[Zuiderzee Works|converted]] to the freshwater [[IJsselmeer]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1934),Near [[Callander, Ontario]], Canada, the [[Dionne quintuplets]] are born to Oliva and Elzire Dionne; they will be the first [[Multiple birth|quintuplet]]s to survive [[Infant|infancy]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1936),[[Alan Turing]] submits ''On Computable Numbers'' for publication.))
Some((Date(28,May,1937),The [[Golden Gate Bridge]] in San Francisco, California, is officially opened by President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] in Washington, D.C., who pushes a button signaling the start of vehicle traffic over the span.))
Some((Date(28,May,1940),[[World War II]]: Belgium surrenders to [[Nazi Germany]] to end the [[Battle of Belgium]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1942),World War II: In retaliation for the assassination attempt on [[Reinhard Heydrich]], [[Nazism|Nazis]] in [[Czechoslovakia]] kill over 1,800 people.))
Some((Date(28,May,1948),[[Daniel François Malan]] is elected as [[Prime Minister of South Africa]]. He later goes on to implement [[Apartheid]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1951),The British radio comedy program ''[[The Goon Show]]'' is broadcast on the [[BBC]] for the first time.))
Some((Date(28,May,1952),The women of Greece are granted [[suffrage|the right to vote]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1958),[[Cuban Revolution]]: [[Fidel Castro]]'s [[26th of July Movement]], heavily reinforced by Frank Pais Militia, overwhelm an army post in El Uvero.))
Some((Date(28,May,1961),[[Peter Benenson]]'s article ''The Forgotten Prisoners'' is published in several internationally read [[newspaper]]s. This will later be thought of as the founding of the [[human rights]] organization [[Amnesty International]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1964),The [[Palestine Liberation Organization]] is formed.))
Some((Date(28,May,1974),[[Northern Ireland]]'s power-sharing [[Sunningdale Agreement]] collapses following a [[Ulster Workers' Council strike|general strike]] by [[Ulster loyalism|loyalists]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1975),Fifteen [[West Africa]]n countries sign the [[Treaty of Lagos]], creating the [[Economic Community of West African States]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1977),In [[Southgate, Kentucky]], the [[Beverly Hills Supper Club fire|Beverly Hills Supper Club]] is engulfed in fire, killing 165 people inside.))
Some((Date(28,May,1979),[[Konstantinos Karamanlis]] signs the full treaty of the accession of Greece with the [[European Economic Community]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1987),West German pilot [[Mathias Rust]], who was 18 years old, evades [[Soviet Union]] air defenses and lands a private plane in the [[Red Square]] in Moscow, Russia. He is immediately detained and would not be released until August 3, 1988.))
Some((Date(28,May,1991),The capital city of [[Addis Ababa]] falls to the [[Ethiopian People's Revolutionary Democratic Front]], ending both the [[Derg]] regime in [[Ethiopia]] and the [[Ethiopian Civil War]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1993),[[Eritrea]] and [[Monaco]] join the [[United Nations]].))
Some((Date(28,May,1995),The Russian town of [[Neftegorsk, Sakhalin Oblast|Neftegorsk]] is hit by a 7.6 magnitude earthquake that kills at least 2,000 people, half of the total population.))
Some((Date(28,May,1996),U.S. President [[Bill Clinton]]'s former business partners in the [[Whitewater controversy|Whitewater land deal]], [[Jim McDougal]] and [[Susan McDougal]], and the [[Governor of Arkansas]] [[Jim Guy Tucker]], are convicted of fraud.))
Some((Date(28,May,1998),[[Nuclear weapons testing|Nuclear testing]]: Pakistan responds to a series of nuclear tests by India with five of its own codenamed '''''[[Chagai-I]]''''', prompting the United States, Japan, and other nations to impose [[economic sanctions]]. Pakistan celebrates [[Youm-e-Takbir]] annually.))
Some((Date(28,May,1999),In [[Milan]], Italy, after 22 years of restoration work, [[Leonardo da Vinci]]'s masterpiece ''[[The Last Supper (Leonardo da Vinci)|The Last Supper]]'' is put back on display.))
Some((Date(28,May,2002),The last steel girder is removed from the original [[World Trade Center site]]. Cleanup duties officially end with closing ceremonies at [[Ground Zero]] in [[Manhattan]], New York City.  ))
Some((Date(28,May,2003),[[Peter Hollingworth]] becomes the first [[Governor-General of Australia]] to resign his office as a result of criticism of his conduct.))
Some((Date(28,May,2004),The [[Iraqi Governing Council]] chooses [[Ayad Allawi]], a longtime anti-[[Saddam Hussein]] exile, as prime minister of [[Iraq]]'s interim government.))
Some((Date(28,May,2008),The first meeting of the Constituent Assembly of [[Nepal]] formally declares Nepal a republic, ending the 240-year reign of the [[Shah dynasty]].))
Some((Date(28,May,2010),In [[West Bengal]], India, a [[Jnaneswari Express train derailment|train derailment]] and subsequent collision kills 141 passengers.))
Some((Date(28,May,2011),[[Malta]] [[Maltese divorce referendum, 2011|votes]] on the introduction of divorce.

Some((Date(29,May,1108),[[Battle of Uclés (1108)|Battle of Uclés]]: [[Almoravid dynasty|Almoravid]] troops under the command of Tamim ibn Yusuf defeat a [[Kingdom of Castile|Castile]] and [[Kingdom of León|León]] alliance under the command of Prince [[Sancho Alfónsez]].))
Some((Date(29,May,1176),[[Battle of Legnano]]: The [[Lombard League]] defeats [[Frederick I, Holy Roman Emperor|Emperor Frederick I]].))
Some((Date(29,May,1328),[[Philip VI of France|Philip VI]] is crowned [[List of French monarchs|King of France]].))
Some((Date(29,May,1414),[[Council of Constance]].))

Some((Date(29,May,1660),[[Restoration (England)|English Restoration]]: [[Charles II of England|Charles II]] is restored to the throne of England, Scotland and Ireland.))
Some((Date(29,May,1677),[[Treaty of 1677|Treaty of Middle Plantation]] establishes peace between the [[Virginia]] [[Settler|colonist]]s and the local [[Native Americans in the United States|Natives]].))
Some((Date(29,May,1727),[[Peter II of Russia|Peter II]] becomes [[Tsar|Czar]] of Russia.))
Some((Date(29,May,1733),The right of Canadians to keep [[First Nations|Indian]] [[slavery|slaves]] is upheld at [[Quebec City]].))
Some((Date(29,May,1780),[[American Revolutionary War]]: At the [[Battle of Waxhaws]], the British continue attacking after the Continentals lay down their arms, killing 113 and critically wounding all but 53 that remained.))
Some((Date(29,May,1790),[[Rhode Island]] becomes the last of the original United States' [[Thirteen Colonies|colonies]] to ratify the [[United States Constitution|Constitution]] and is admitted as the 13th [[U.S. state]].))
Some((Date(29,May,1798),[[Irish Rebellion of 1798|United Irishmen Rebellion]]: Between 300 and 500 [[Society of United Irishmen|United Irishmen]] [[Gibbet Rath massacre|are massacred]] by the British Army in [[County Kildare]], Ireland.))
Some((Date(29,May,1807),[[Mustafa IV]] became [[Sultan of the Ottoman Empire]] and [[Caliph of Islam]].))
Some((Date(29,May,1848),[[Wisconsin]] is admitted as the 30th U.S. state.))
Some((Date(29,May,1852),[[Jenny Lind]] leaves New York after her [[Jenny Lind tour of America, 1850–52|two-year American tour]].))
Some((Date(29,May,1861),The [[Hong Kong General Chamber of Commerce]] is founded, in Hong Kong.))
Some((Date(29,May,1864),[[Emperor of Mexico|Emperor]] [[Maximilian I of Mexico]] arrives in Mexico for the first time.))
Some((Date(29,May,1867),The [[Austro-Hungarian Compromise of 1867]] ("the Compromise") is born through Act 12, which establishes the [[Austria-Hungary|Austro-Hungarian Empire]].))
Some((Date(29,May,1868),The assassination of [[Mihailo Obrenović III, Prince of Serbia|Michael Obrenovich III]], Prince of Serbia, in [[Belgrade]].))
Some((Date(29,May,1886),The [[pharmacist]] [[John Pemberton]] places his first [[advertising|advertisement]] for [[Coca-Cola]], which appeared in ''[[The Atlanta Journal]]''.))
Some((Date(29,May,1900),[[N'Djamena]] is founded as Fort-Lamy by the French commander [[Émile Gentil]].))
Some((Date(29,May,1903),In the [[May Coup (Serbia)|May Coup]], [[Alexander I of Serbia|Alexander I]], King of Serbia, and Queen Draga, are [[Assassination|assassinated]] in Belgrade by the [[Black Hand (Serbia)|Black Hand]] (''Crna Ruka'') organization.))
Some((Date(29,May,1913),[[Igor Stravinsky]]'s [[ballet]] score ''[[The Rite of Spring]]'' receives its premiere performance in Paris, France, provoking a riot.))
Some((Date(29,May,1914),The [[Ocean liner]] {{RMS|Empress of Ireland}} sinks in the [[Gulf of Saint Lawrence]] with the loss of 1,024 lives.))
Some((Date(29,May,1918),[[Armenia]] defeats the [[Military of the Ottoman Empire|Ottoman Army]] in the [[Battle of Sardarabad]].))
Some((Date(29,May,1919),[[Albert Einstein]]'s theory of [[general relativity]] is tested (later confirmed) by [[Arthur Eddington]] and [[Andrew Claude de la Cherois Crommelin]].))

Some((Date(29,May,1950),The ''[[St. Roch (ship)|St. Roch]]'', the first ship to [[Circumnavigation|circumnavigate]] North America, arrives in [[Halifax (former city)|Halifax, Nova Scotia]], Canada.))

Some((Date(29,May,1954),First of the annual [[Bilderberg Group|Bilderberg conferences]].))

Some((Date(29,May,1982),[[Pope John Paul II]] becomes the first pontiff to visit [[Canterbury Cathedral]].))
Some((Date(29,May,1985),[[Heysel Stadium disaster]]: Thirty-nine [[association football]] fans die and hundreds are injured when a dilapidated retaining wall collapses.))
Some((Date(29,May,1988),The [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Ronald Reagan]] begins his first visit to the [[Soviet Union]] when he arrives in Moscow for a superpower summit with the Soviet leader [[Mikhail Gorbachev]].))
Some((Date(29,May,1989),Signing of an agreement between [[Egypt]] and the United States, allowing the manufacture of parts of the [[General Dynamics F-16 Fighting Falcon|F-16]] jet fighter plane in Egypt.))

Some((Date(29,May,1993),The [[Miss Sarajevo]] beauty pageant is held in war torn [[Sarajevo]] drawing global attention to the plight of its citizens.))
Some((Date(29,May,1999),[[Olusegun Obasanjo]] takes office as [[President of Nigeria]], the first elected and civilian [[head of state]] in [[Nigeria]] after 16 years of military rule.))
Some((Date(29,May,2001),The [[Supreme Court of the United States|U.S. Supreme Court]] rules that the disabled golfer [[Casey Martin]] can use a cart to ride in tournaments.))
Some((Date(29,May,2004),The [[National World War II Memorial]] is dedicated in [[Washington, D.C.]]))
Some((Date(29,May,2008),A [[2008 Iceland earthquake|doublet earthquake]], of combined [[Moment_magnitude_scale|magnitude]] 6.1, strikes [[Iceland]] near the town of [[Selfoss (town)|Selfoss]], injuring 30 people.))
Some((Date(29,May,2012),A 5.8-magnitude [[2012 Northern Italy earthquakes#29 May earthquake|earthquake]] hits northern Italy near [[Bologna]], killing at least 24 people.

Some((Date(30,May,1434),[[Hussite Wars]]: [[Battle of Lipany]]: Effectively ending the war, [[Utraquist]] forces led by Diviš Bořek of Miletínek defeat and almost annihilate [[Taborite]] forces led by [[Prokop the Great]].))

Some((Date(30,May,1539),In [[Florida]], [[Hernando de Soto]] lands at [[Tampa Bay]] with 600 soldiers with the goal of finding [[gold]].))
Some((Date(30,May,1574),[[Henry III of France|Henry III]] becomes King of France.))
Some((Date(30,May,1588),The last ship of the [[Spanish Armada]] sets sail from [[Lisbon]] heading for the [[English Channel]].))

Some((Date(30,May,1635),[[Thirty Years' War]]: The [[Peace of Prague (1635)|Peace of Prague]] is signed.))
Some((Date(30,May,1642),From this date all honors granted by [[Charles I of England|Charles I]] are retrospectively [[List of Ordinances and Acts of the Parliament of England, 1642–60|annulled by Parliament]].))
Some((Date(30,May,1806),Future U.S. President [[Andrew Jackson]] kills [[Charles Dickinson (historical figure)|Charles Dickinson]] in a duel after Dickinson had accused Jackson's wife of [[bigamy]].))
Some((Date(30,May,1814),[[Napoleonic Wars]]: [[War of the Sixth Coalition]]: The [[Treaty of Paris (1814)]] is signed returning French borders to their 1792 extent. [[Napoleon]] is exiled to [[Elba]].))
Some((Date(30,May,1815),The [[East Indiaman]] ''[[Arniston (East Indiaman)|Arniston]]'' is wrecked during a storm at [[Waenhuiskrans]], near [[Cape Agulhas]], in present-day South Africa, with the loss of 372 lives.))
Some((Date(30,May,1832),End of the [[Hambach Festival]] in [[Rhineland-Palatinate]], [[German Confederation|Germany]].))
Some((Date(30,May,1834),[[Joaquim António de Aguiar]] issues a law extinguishing "all convents, monasteries, colleges, hospices and any other houses of the regular religious orders" in Portugal, earning him the nickname of "The Friar-Killer".))
Some((Date(30,May,1842),John Francis attempts to murder [[Queen Victoria]] as she drives down [[Constitution Hill, London|Constitution Hill]] in London with [[Albert, Prince Consort|Prince Albert]].))
Some((Date(30,May,1845),The ''[[Fatel Razack]]'' lands in the [[Gulf of Paria]] in [[Trinidad and Tobago]] carrying the first [[East India]]ns to the country.))
Some((Date(30,May,1854),The [[Kansas–Nebraska Act]] becomes law establishing the [[Political divisions of the United States|US territories]] of [[Kansas]] and [[Nebraska]].))
Some((Date(30,May,1868),Decoration Day (the predecessor of the modern "[[Memorial Day]]") is observed in the United States for the first time (by "Commander-in-chief of the [[Grand Army of the Republic]]" [[John A. Logan]]'s proclamation on May 5).))
Some((Date(30,May,1876),Ottoman sultan [[Abdülaziz]] is deposed and succeeded by his nephew [[Murad V]].))
Some((Date(30,May,1883),In New York City, a rumor that the [[Brooklyn Bridge]] is going to collapse causes a stampede that crushes twelve people.))
Some((Date(30,May,1899),[[Pearl Hart]], a female outlaw of the [[American frontier|Old West]], robs a stage coach 30 miles southeast of [[Globe, Arizona]].))
Some((Date(30,May,1911),At the [[Indianapolis Motor Speedway]], the first [[Indianapolis 500]] ends with [[Ray Harroun]] in his [[Marmon Wasp|Marmon ''Wasp'']] becoming the first winner of the 500-mile auto race.))
Some((Date(30,May,1913),[[First Balkan War]]: The [[Treaty of London (1913)|Treaty of London]], is signed ending the war. [[Albania]] becomes an independent nation.))

Some((Date(30,May,1966),The former [[Democratic Republic of the Congo|Congolese]] Prime Minister, [[Évariste Kimba]], and several other politicians are publicly executed in [[Kinshasa]] on the orders of President [[Mobutu Sese Seko|Joseph Mobutu]].))
Some((Date(30,May,1967),The [[Nigeria]]n Eastern Region declares independence as the [[Biafra|Republic of Biafra]], sparking a [[Nigerian Civil War|civil war]].))
Some((Date(30,May,1968),[[Charles de Gaulle]] reappears publicly after his flight to [[Baden-Baden]], Germany, and dissolves the French National Assembly by a radio appeal. Immediately after, less than one million of his supporters march on the [[Champs-Élysées]] in Paris. This is the turning point of [[May 1968 events in France]].))
Some((Date(30,May,1971),[[Mariner program]]: ''[[Mariner 9]]'' is launched to map 70% of the surface, and to study temporal changes in the atmosphere and surface, of [[Mars]].))
Some((Date(30,May,1972),[[The Angry Brigade]] goes on trial over a series of 25 bombings throughout the United Kingdom.))
Some((Date(30,May,1974),The [[Airbus A300]] passenger aircraft first enters service.))
Some((Date(30,May,1989),[[Tiananmen Square protests of 1989]]: The 33-foot high "[[Goddess of Democracy]]" [[statue]] is unveiled in [[Tiananmen Square]] by student demonstrators.))
Some((Date(30,May,1998),A magnitude 6.6 [[earthquake]] hits northern [[Afghanistan]], killing up to 5,000.))
Some((Date(30,May,2003),[[Depayin massacre]]: At least 70 people associated with the [[National League for Democracy]] are killed by government-sponsored mob in [[Burma]]. [[Aung San Suu Kyi]] fled the scene, but is arrested soon afterwards.))
Some((Date(30,May,2005),American student [[Disappearance of Natalee Holloway|Natalee Holloway]] disappears while on a high school graduation trip to [[Aruba]], and caused a media sensation in the United States.))
Some((Date(30,May,2012),Former [[Liberia]]n president, [[Charles Taylor (Liberian politician)|Charles Taylor]], is sentenced to 50 years in prison for his role in atrocities committed during the [[Sierra Leone Civil War]].))

Some((Date(31,May,1854),The [[civil death]] procedure is abolished in France.))
Some((Date(31,May,1859),The clock tower at the [[Palace of Westminster|Houses of Parliament]], which houses [[Big Ben]], starts keeping time.))
Some((Date(31,May,1862),[[American Civil War]] [[Peninsula Campaign]]: [[Battle of Seven Pines]] or (Battle of Fair Oaks): Confederate forces under [[Joseph E. Johnston]] & [[Gustavus Woodson Smith|G.W. Smith]] engage Union forces under [[George B. McClellan]] outside Richmond, Virginia.))
Some((Date(31,May,1864),[[American Civil War]] [[Overland Campaign]]: [[Battle of Cold Harbor]]: The [[Army of Northern Virginia]] under [[Robert E. Lee]] engages the [[Army of the Potomac]] under [[Ulysses S. Grant]] and [[George Meade]].))
Some((Date(31,May,1866),In the [[Fenian raids|Fenian Invasion of Canada]], John O'Neill leads 850 [[Fenian]] raiders across the [[Niagara River]] at [[Buffalo, New York]]/[[Fort Erie, Ontario]], as part of an effort to free Ireland from the United Kingdom. Canadian [[militia]] and [[British Armed Forces|British regulars]] repulse the invaders in over the next three days, at a cost of nine dead and 38 wounded to the [[Fenian]]'s 19 dead and about 17 wounded.))
Some((Date(31,May,1879),Gilmores Garden in New York City, is renamed [[Madison Square Garden (1879)|Madison Square Garden]] by [[William Henry Vanderbilt]] and is opened to the public at 26th Street and [[Madison Avenue]].))
Some((Date(31,May,1884),The arrival at [[Plymouth]] of [[Tāwhiao]], King of [[Māori people|Maoris]], to claim the protection of [[Queen Victoria]]))
Some((Date(31,May,1889),[[Johnstown Flood]]: Over 2,200 people die after a dam fails and sends a 60-foot (18-meter) wall of water over the town of [[Johnstown, Pennsylvania]].))
Some((Date(31,May,1902),[[Second Boer War]]: The [[Treaty of Vereeniging]] ends the war and ensures British control of South Africa.))
Some((Date(31,May,1909),The [[National Negro Committee]], forerunner to the [[National Association for the Advancement of Colored People]], convenes for the first time.))
Some((Date(31,May,1910),The creation of the [[Union of South Africa]].))
Some((Date(31,May,1911),The hull of the ocean liner {{RMS|Titanic}} is launched.))
Some((Date(31,May,1916),[[World War I]]: [[Battle of Jutland]]: The British [[Grand Fleet]] under the command of [[John Jellicoe, 1st Earl Jellicoe]] and [[David Beatty, 1st Earl Beatty]] engage the [[Imperial German Navy]] under the command of [[Reinhard Scheer]] and [[Franz von Hipper]] in the largest naval battle of the war, which proves indecisive.))
Some((Date(31,May,1921),[[Tulsa race riot]]: [[Civil disorder|civil unrest]] in [[Tulsa, Oklahoma]]. The official death toll is 39, but recent investigations suggest the actual toll may be much higher.))
Some((Date(31,May,1924),The [[Soviet Union]] signs an agreement with the Beijing government, referring to [[Outer Mongolia]] as an "integral part of the Republic of China", whose "sovereignty" therein the [[Soviet Union]] promises to respect.))
Some((Date(31,May,1927),The last [[Ford Model T]] rolls off the [[assembly line]] after a production run of 15,007,003 vehicles.))
Some((Date(31,May,1929),The first talking [[Mickey Mouse]] cartoon, "[[The Karnival Kid]]", is released.))
Some((Date(31,May,1935),A 7.7 [[moment magnitude scale|Mw]] [[1935 Quetta earthquake|earthquake]] destroys [[Quetta]] in modern-day [[Pakistan]] killing 40,000.))
Some((Date(31,May,1941),A [[Bombing of Dublin in World War II|Luftwaffe]] air raid on [[Dublin]], Ireland, claims 38 lives.))
Some((Date(31,May,1942),[[World War II]]: [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] [[midget submarine]]s begin a series of [[attack on Sydney Harbour|attacks on Sydney]], Australia.))
Some((Date(31,May,1961),The [[Union of South Africa]] becomes the [[Republic of South Africa]].))
Some((Date(31,May,1962),The [[West Indies Federation]] dissolves.))
Some((Date(31,May,1970),The [[1970 Ancash earthquake|Ancash earthquake]] causes a [[landslide]] that buries the town of [[Yungay, Peru]]; more than 47,000 people are killed.))
Some((Date(31,May,1971),In accordance with the [[Uniform Monday Holiday Act]] passed by the [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] in [[1968]], observation of [[Memorial Day]] occurs on the last Monday in May for the first time, rather than on the traditional [[Memorial Day]] of [[May 30]].))
Some((Date(31,May,1973),The [[United States Senate]] votes to cut off funding for the bombing of [[Khmer Rouge]] targets within [[Cambodia]], hastening the end of the [[Cambodian Civil War]].))
Some((Date(31,May,1977),The [[Trans-Alaska Pipeline System]] is completed.))
Some((Date(31,May,1981),The [[burning of Jaffna library]] in [[Sri Lanka]]. It is one of the violent examples of ethnic [[Book burning|biblioclasm]] of the twentieth century.))
Some((Date(31,May,1985),[[1985 United States–Canada tornado outbreak|United States–Canada tornado outbreak]]: Forty-one tornadoes hit [[Ohio]], [[Pennsylvania]], New York, and [[Ontario]], leaving 76 dead.))
Some((Date(31,May,1989),A group of six members of the guerrilla group [[Túpac Amaru Revolutionary Movement]] (MRTA) of Peru, shoot dead eight [[transsexual]]s, in the city of [[Tarapoto]].))
Some((Date(31,May,1991),[[Bicesse Accords]] in [[Angola]] lay out a transition to multi-party [[democracy]] under the supervision of the [[United Nations]]' [[United Nations Angola Verification Mission II|UNAVEM II]] mission.))
Some((Date(31,May,2005),''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'' reveals that [[Mark Felt]] was [[Deep Throat (Watergate)|Deep Throat]].))
Some((Date(31,May,2010),In international waters, armed [[Shayetet 13]] commandos, intending to force the flotilla to anchor at the [[Ashdod]] port, [[gaza flotilla raid|boarded]] ships trying to break the [[Blockade of the Gaza Strip|ongoing blockade]] of the [[Gaza Strip]], resulting in nine civilian deaths.))
Some((Date(31,May,2013),The [[asteroid]] [[(285263) 1998 QE2|1998 QE2]] and its [[Natural satellite|moon]] make their [[List of asteroid close approaches to Earth|closest approach to Earth]] for the next two centuries.

Some((Date(2,June,1774),[[Intolerable Acts]]: The [[Quartering Act]] is enacted, allowing a governor in [[Thirteen Colonies|colonial America]] to house British soldiers in uninhabited houses, outhouses, barns, or other buildings if suitable quarters are not provided.))

Some((Date(2,June,1990),The [[June 1990 Lower Ohio Valley tornado outbreak|Lower Ohio Valley tornado outbreak]] spawns 66 confirmed tornadoes in [[Illinois]], [[Indiana]], [[Kentucky]], and [[Ohio]], killing 12. [[Petersburg, Indiana]], is the hardest-hit town in the outbreak, with six deaths.))
Some((Date(2,June,1995),[[United States Air Force]] [[Captain (U.S. Air Force)|Captain]] [[Scott O'Grady]]'s [[F-16 Fighting Falcon|F-16]] is shot down over [[Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnia]] while patrolling the [[NATO]] no-fly zone.))
Some((Date(2,June,1997),In [[Denver]], [[Timothy McVeigh]] is convicted on 15 counts of murder and [[conspiracy (criminal)|conspiracy]] for his role in the [[1995]] [[Oklahoma City bombing|bombing]] of the [[Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building]] in [[Oklahoma City]]. He was executed four years later.))

Some((Date(3,June,1980),The [[1980 Grand Island tornado outbreak]]. Seven tornadoes hit [[Grand Island, Nebraska]], which take five lives, 357 single-family homes, 33 mobile homes, 85 apartments, 49 businesses and cause $300 million in damages all told, according to statistics compiled on the deadly storm by the National Weather Service and the American Red Cross.))
Some((Date(3,June,1982),The Israeli ambassador to the United Kingdom, [[Shlomo Argov]], is shot on a London street. He survives but is permanently paralysed.))

The operation continues until [[June 6]], with casualties, most of them civilians, in excess of 5,000.))

Some((Date(3,June,1991),[[Mount Unzen]] erupts in [[Kyūshū]], Japan, killing 43 people, all of them either researchers or journalists.))
Some((Date(3,June,1992),Aboriginal Land Rights are granted in Australia in [[Mabo v Queensland (No 2)]], a case brought by [[Eddie Mabo]].))
Some((Date(3,June,2006),The union of [[Serbia and Montenegro]] comes to an end with [[Montenegro]]'s formal declaration of independence.))
Some((Date(3,June,2012),A plane carrying 153 people on board [[Dana Air Flight 992|crashes]] in a residential neighborhood in [[Lagos, Nigeria]], killing everyone on board and 10 people on the ground.))
Some((Date(3,June,2013),The [[United States v. Manning|trial]] of United States Army private [[Chelsea Manning]] for leaking classified material to [[WikiLeaks]] begins in [[Fort Meade, Maryland]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1039),[[Henry III, Holy Roman Emperor|Henry III]] becomes [[Holy Roman Emperor]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1411),King [[Charles VI of France|Charles VI]] granted a monopoly for the ripening of [[Roquefort|Roquefort cheese]] to the people of [[Roquefort-sur-Soulzon]] as they had been doing for centuries.))
Some((Date(4,June,1615),[[Siege of Osaka]]: Forces under [[Tokugawa Ieyasu]] take [[Osaka Castle]] in Japan.))
Some((Date(4,June,1647),[[Canonicus]] Grand Chief Sachem of the Narragansett Indian Tribe dies.  He was Chief Sachem of the Narragansett Tribe (rivals to the Wampanoag) at the time of the Pilgrims landing in Plymouth.))
Some((Date(4,June,1745),[[Battle of Hohenfriedberg]]: [[Frederick the Great|Frederick the Great's]] [[Prussia]]n army decisively defeated an Austrian army under [[Prince Charles Alexander of Lorraine]] during the [[War of the Austrian Succession]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1760),[[Great Upheaval]]: [[New England]] planters arrive to claim land in [[Nova Scotia]], Canada, taken from the [[Acadians]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1783),The [[Montgolfier brothers]] publicly demonstrate their ''montgolfière'' ([[hot air balloon]]).))
Some((Date(4,June,1784),[[Élisabeth Thible]] becomes the first woman to fly in an untethered hot air balloon. Her flight covers 4 kilometres in 45 minutes, and reached 1,500 metres altitude (estimated).))
Some((Date(4,June,1792),[[Captain (Royal Navy)|Captain]] [[George Vancouver]] claims [[Puget Sound]] for the [[Kingdom of Great Britain]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1794),British troops capture [[Port-au-Prince]] in [[Haiti]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1802),Grieving over the death of his wife, [[Marie Clotilde of France]], King [[Charles Emmanuel IV of Sardinia]] abdicates his throne in favor of his brother, [[Victor Emmanuel I of Sardinia|Victor Emmanuel]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1812),Following [[Louisiana]]'s admittance as a [[U.S. state]], the [[Louisiana Territory]] is renamed the [[Missouri Territory]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1825),[[Gilbert du Motier, Marquis de Lafayette|General Lafayette]], a French officer in the [[American Revolutionary War]], speaks at what would become [[Lafayette Square, Buffalo]], during [[Visit of the Marquis de Lafayette to the United States|his visit to the United States]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1855),Major [[Henry C. Wayne]] departs New York aboard the {{USS|Supply|1846|6}} to procure [[camel]]s to establish the [[U.S. Camel Corps]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1859),[[Second Italian War of Independence|Italian Independence wars]]: In the [[Battle of Magenta]], the French army, under [[Louis-Napoleon]], defeat the Austrian army.))
Some((Date(4,June,1862),[[American Civil War]]: [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] troops evacuate [[Fort Pillow]] on the [[Mississippi River]], leaving the way clear for [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] troops to take [[Memphis, Tennessee]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1876),An express [[train]] called the ''[[Transcontinental Express]]'' arrives in [[San Francisco]], via the [[First Transcontinental Railroad]] only 83 hours and 39 minutes after leaving New York City.))
Some((Date(4,June,1878),[[Cyprus Convention]]: The [[Ottoman Empire]] cedes [[Cyprus]] to the United Kingdom but retains nominal title.))
Some((Date(4,June,1896),[[Henry Ford]] completes the [[Ford Quadricycle]], his first gasoline-powered automobile, and gives it a successful test run.))
Some((Date(4,June,1912),[[Massachusetts]] becomes the first state of the United States to set a [[minimum wage]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1913),[[Emily Davison]], a [[suffragette]], runs out in front of King [[George V]]'s horse, [[Anmer (horse)|Anmer]], at the [[Epsom Derby]]. She is trampled, never regains consciousness and dies four days later.))
Some((Date(4,June,1916),[[World War I]]: [[Russian Empire|Russia]] opens the [[Brusilov Offensive]] with an [[artillery]] barrage of [[Austria-Hungary|Austro-Hungarian]] lines in [[Galicia (Eastern Europe)|Galicia]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1917),The first [[Pulitzer Prize]]s are awarded: [[Laura E. Richards]], [[Maude H. Elliott]], and Florence Hall receive the first Pulitzer for biography (for ''[[Julia Ward Howe]]''). [[Jean Jules Jusserand]] receives the first Pulitzer for history for his work ''[[With Americans of Past and Present Days]]''. [[Herbert B. Swope]] receives the first Pulitzer for [[journalism]] for his work for the ''[[New York World]]''.))
Some((Date(4,June,1919),[[Women's rights]]: The [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] approves the [[19th Amendment to the United States Constitution]], which guarantees [[suffrage]] to women, and sends it to the U.S. states for ratification.))
Some((Date(4,June,1920),Hungary loses 71% of its territory and 63% of its population when the [[Treaty of Trianon]] is signed in Paris.))
Some((Date(4,June,1928),The [[President of the Republic of China]], [[Zhang Zuolin]], is assassinated by Japanese agents.))
Some((Date(4,June,1932),[[Marmaduke Grove]] and other Chilean military officers lead a [[coup d'état]] establishing the short-lived [[Socialist Republic of Chile]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1939),[[The Holocaust]]: The {{MS|St. Louis}}, a ship carrying 963 Jewish refugees, is denied permission to land in [[Florida]], in the United States, after already being turned away from [[Cuba]]. Forced to return to Europe, more than 200 of its passengers later die in [[Nazism|Nazi]] [[concentration camp]]s.))
Some((Date(4,June,1940),[[World War II]]: The [[Dunkirk evacuation]] ends: British forces complete evacuation of 338,000 troops from [[Dunkirk]] in France. To rally the morale of the country, [[Winston Churchill]] delivers, only to the [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom|House of Commons]], his famous "[[We shall fight on the beaches]]" speech.))
Some((Date(4,June,1942),World War II: The [[Battle of Midway]] begins. The Japanese [[Admiral]] [[Chūichi Nagumo]] orders a strike on [[Midway Island]] by much of the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1943),A [[1943 Argentine coup d'état|military coup]] in [[Argentina]] ousts [[Ramón Castillo]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1944),World War II: A hunter-killer group of the United States Navy captures the German submarine [[German submarine U-505|''U-505'']]: The first time a U.S. Navy vessel had captured an enemy vessel at sea since the 19th century.))
Some((Date(4,June,1961),In the [[Vienna summit]], the [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] premier [[Nikita Khrushchev]] sparks the [[Berlin Crisis of 1961|Berlin Crisis]] by threatening to sign a separate peace treaty with [[East Germany]] and ending American, British and French access to [[East Berlin]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1965),[[Duane Earl Pope]] robs the Farmers' State Bank of [[Big Springs, Nebraska]], killing three people execution-style and severely wounding a fourth. The crime later puts Pope on the FBI Ten Most Wanted list.))
Some((Date(4,June,1970),[[Tonga]] gains independence from the United Kingdom.))
Some((Date(4,June,1974),During [[Ten Cent Beer Night]], inebriated [[Cleveland Indians]] fans start a riot, causing the game to be forfeited to the [[Texas Rangers (baseball)|Texas Rangers]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1975),The [[Governor of California]] [[Jerry Brown]] signs the [[California Agricultural Labor Relations Act]] into law, the first law in the U.S. giving farmworkers [[collective bargaining]] rights.))
Some((Date(4,June,1979),[[Flight Lieutenant]] [[Jerry Rawlings]] takes power in [[Ghana]] after a military [[coup d'état|coup]] in which General [[Fred Akuffo]] is overthrown.))
Some((Date(4,June,1986),[[Jonathan Pollard]] pleads guilty to [[espionage]] for selling top secret United States [[military intelligence]] to [[Israel]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1988),Three cars on a train carrying [[hexogen]] to [[Kazakhstan]] [[Arzamas train disaster|explode]] in [[Arzamas]], [[Gorky Oblast]], [[Soviet Union|USSR]], killing 91 and injuring about 1,500.))
Some((Date(4,June,1989),[[Ali Khamenei]] is elected as the new [[Supreme Leader of Iran|Supreme Leader]] of the Islamic Republic of [[Iran]] by the [[Assembly of Experts]] after the death and funeral of [[Ayatollah]] [[Ruhollah Khomeini]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1996),The first flight of [[Ariane 5]] explodes after roughly 37 seconds. It was a [[Cluster mission]].))
Some((Date(4,June,1998),[[Terry Nichols]] is sentenced to life in prison for his role in the [[Oklahoma City bombing]].))
Some((Date(4,June,2001),[[Gyanendra]], the last [[King of Nepal]], ascends to the throne after the massacre in the Royal Palace.))
Some((Date(4,June,2010),[[Falcon 9 Flight 1]] is the [[maiden flight]] of the [[SpaceX]] [[Falcon 9]] rocket, which launches from [[Cape Canaveral Air Force Station Space Launch Complex 40]].))
Some((Date(4,June,2012),The [[Diamond Jubilee Concert|concert]] for [[Elizabeth II]]'s [[Diamond Jubilee of Elizabeth II|Diamond Jubilee]] takes place outside [[Buckingham Palace]] in [[London]].))
Some((Date(4,June,2015),An [[2015 Accra explosion|explosion]] at a gasoline station in [[Accra]], [[Ghana]], killing over 200 people.

Some((Date(5,June,1933),The [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] abrogates the United States' use of the [[gold standard]] by enacting a joint resolution (48 Stat. 112) nullifying the right of creditors to demand payment in [[gold]].))

Some((Date(5,June,1975),The [[Suez Canal]] opens for the first time since the Six-Day War.))
Some((Date(5,June,1976),The [[Teton Dam]] in [[Idaho]], United States, collapses.))
Some((Date(5,June,1981),The "[[Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report]]" of the [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]] reports that five people in Los Angeles, California, have a rare form of [[pneumonia]] seen only in patients with weakened [[immune system]]s, in what turns out to be the first recognized cases of [[AIDS]].))
Some((Date(5,June,1984),The [[Prime Minister of India]], [[Indira Gandhi]], orders an attack on the [[Harmandir Sahib|Golden Temple]], the holiest site of the [[Sikh]] religion.))
Some((Date(5,June,1989),The [[Tank Man]] halts the progress of a column of advancing tanks for over half an hour after the [[Tiananmen Square protests of 1989]].))
Some((Date(5,June,1993),Portions of the [[Holbeck Hall Hotel]] in [[Scarborough, North Yorkshire|Scarborough]], in [[North Yorkshire]], England, fall into the sea following a landslide.))
Some((Date(5,June,1995),The [[Bose–Einstein condensate]] is first created.))
Some((Date(5,June,1998),A [[Strike action|strike]] begins at the [[General Motors]] parts factory in [[Flint, Michigan]], that quickly spreads to five other assembly plants. The strike lasts seven weeks.))
Some((Date(5,June,2000),The [[Six-Day War (2000)|Six-Day War in Kisangani]] begins in [[Kisangani]], in the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]], between [[Uganda]]n and [[Rwanda]]n forces. A large part of the city is destroyed.))
Some((Date(5,June,2001),[[Tropical Storm Allison]] makes landfall on the upper-[[Texas]] coastline as a strong tropical storm and dumps large amounts of rain over Houston. The storm causes $5.5 billion in damages, making Allison the costliest tropical storm in U.S. history.))
Some((Date(5,June,2003),A severe [[heat wave]] across [[Pakistan]] and India reaches its peak, as temperatures exceed 50°C (122°F) in the region.))
Some((Date(5,June,2004),[[Ronald Reagan]], the 40th president of the [[United States]], dies at 93.))

Some((Date(5,June,2009),After 65 straight days of civil disobedience, at least 31 people [[2009 Peruvian political crisis|are killed]] in clashes between security forces and indigenous people near [[Bagua, Peru]].))

Some((Date(5,June,2013), A [[2013 Philadelphia building collapse|building collapse]] in [[Philadelphia]] kills 6, wounds 14 other people.

At the same time, [[Charles XIII of Sweden|Charles XIII]] is elected to succeed [[Gustav IV Adolf of Sweden|Gustav IV Adolf]] as [[Monarchy of Sweden|King of Sweden]].))

Some((Date(6,June,1822),[[Alexis St. Martin]] is accidentally shot in the stomach, leading to [[William Beaumont]]'s studies on digestion.))

Some((Date(6,June,1833),[[Andrew Jackson]] becomes the first [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] to ride on a train.))

Some((Date(6,June,1882),More than 100,000 inhabitants of [[Bombay]] are killed when a [[cyclone]] in the [[Arabian Sea]] pushes huge waves into the harbour.))

Some((Date(6,June,1892),The [[Chicago "L"#History|Chicago "L"]] commuter rail system begins operation))

Some((Date(6,June,1944), World War II: The [[Normandy landings|Battle of Normandy]] begins. [[D-Day]], code named ''[[Operation Overlord]]'', commences with the landing of 155,000 [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] troops on the beaches of [[Normandy]] in France. The allied soldiers quickly break through the [[Atlantic Wall]] and push inland in the largest amphibious military operation in history.))

The government places the official death toll at 268 plus another 300 missing; however, it is generally believed that the death toll is closer to 1,000.))

Some((Date(6,June,1984),''[[Tetris]]'', one of the [[List of best-selling video games|best-selling video games]] of all time, is first released in the [[USSR]].))
Some((Date(6,June,1985),The grave of "Wolfgang Gerhard" is opened in [[Embu das Artes|Embu]], Brazil; the exhumed remains are later proven to be those of [[Josef Mengele]], [[Auschwitz concentration camp|Auschwitz]]'s "Angel of Death". Mengele is thought to have drowned while swimming in February 1979.))
Some((Date(6,June,1992),The [[Fantoft Stave Church]] in Norway is destroyed by [[Varg Vikernes]]. This was the first in a string of church arsons in the [[Early Norwegian black metal scene]]))
Some((Date(6,June,1993),[[Mongolia]] holds its first direct presidential elections.))
Some((Date(6,June,1997),Prom Mom incident: While attending her senior prom in [[Lacey Township, New Jersey]], [[Melissa Drexler]] gives birth in a bathroom stall, leaves the baby to die in a trash can and then returns to the prom.))
Some((Date(6,June,2002),[[2002 Eastern Mediterranean event|Eastern Mediterranean event]]. A [[near-Earth asteroid]] estimated at ten meters in diameter explodes over the Mediterranean Sea between Greece and [[Libya]]. The resulting explosion is estimated to have a force of 26 [[kiloton]]s, slightly more powerful than the [[Nagasaki atomic bomb]].))
Some((Date(6,June,2004),[[Tamil language|Tamil]] is established as a "[[Languages of India#Official classical languages|classical language]]" by the President of India, Dr. [[A. P. J. Abdul Kalam]], in a joint sitting of the two houses of the Indian Parliament.))
Some((Date(6,June,2005),In ''[[Gonzales v. Raich]]'', the [[United States Supreme Court]] upholds a federal law banning [[Cannabis (drug)|cannabis]], including [[medical marijuana]].

Some((Date(7,June,1654),[[Louis XIV of France|Louis XIV]] is crowned King of [[Kingdom of France|France]].))
Some((Date(7,June,1692),[[Port Royal]], [[Jamaica]], is hit by a [[1692 Jamaica earthquake|catastrophic earthquake]]; in just three minutes, 1,600 people are killed and 3,000 are seriously injured.))
Some((Date(7,June,1776),[[Richard Henry Lee]] presents the "[[Lee Resolution]]" to the [[Continental Congress]]. The motion is seconded by [[John Adams]] and will lead to the [[United States Declaration of Independence]].))
Some((Date(7,June,1788),[[French Revolution]]: [[Day of the Tiles]] — civilians in [[Grenoble]] toss roof tiles and various objects down upon royal troops.))
Some((Date(7,June,1800),[[David Thompson (explorer)|David Thompson]] reaches the mouth of the [[Saskatchewan River]] in [[Manitoba]].))
Some((Date(7,June,1810),The newspaper ''[[Gazeta de Buenos Ayres]]'' is first published in Argentina.))
Some((Date(7,June,1832),[[Second cholera pandemic (1829–51)|Asian cholera]] reaches [[Quebec]], brought by [[Irish Canadian|Irish immigrants]], and kills about 6,000 people in [[Lower Canada]].))
Some((Date(7,June,1862),The United States and the [[United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland|United Kingdom]] agree to suppress the [[slave trade]].))
Some((Date(7,June,1863),During the [[French intervention in Mexico]], Mexico City is captured by [[Second French Empire|French]] troops.))
Some((Date(7,June,1866),1,800 [[Fenian]] raiders are repelled back to the United States after they looted and plundered around [[Saint-Armand, Quebec|Saint-Armand]] and [[Frelighsburg, Quebec]].))
Some((Date(7,June,1880),[[War of the Pacific]]: The [[Battle of Arica]], the assault and capture of [[Morro de Arica]] (Arica Cape), ends the ''Campaña del Desierto'' (Desert Campaign).))
Some((Date(7,June,1892),[[Benjamin Harrison]] becomes the first President of the United States to attend a [[baseball]] game.))
Some((Date(7,June,1893),[[Mohandas Gandhi]] commits his first act of [[civil disobedience]].))
Some((Date(7,June,1899),American [[Temperance movement in the United States|Temperance]] crusader [[Carrie Nation]] begins her campaign of [[vandalism|vandalizing]] alcohol-serving establishments by destroying the inventory in a saloon in [[Kiowa, Kansas]].))
Some((Date(7,June,1905),Norway's parliament [[Dissolution of the union between Norway and Sweden|dissolves]] its [[Union between Sweden and Norway|union with Sweden]]. The vote was confirmed by a national [[plebiscite]] on [[August 13]] of that year.))
Some((Date(7,June,1906),[[Cunard Line]]'s {{RMS|Lusitania}} is launched from the [[John Brown Shipyard]], [[Glasgow]] ([[Clydebank]]), Scotland.))
Some((Date(7,June,1909),[[Mary Pickford]] makes her screen debut at the age of 16.))
Some((Date(7,June,1919),[[Sette Giugno]]: Four people are killed in a riot in [[Malta]].))
Some((Date(7,June,1929),The [[Lateran Treaty]] is ratified, bringing [[Vatican City]] into existence.))
Some((Date(7,June,1936),The [[Steel Workers Organizing Committee]], a [[trade union]], is founded in [[Pittsburgh]], [[Pennsylvania]]. [[Philip Murray]] was elected its first president.))
Some((Date(7,June,1938),The [[Douglas DC-4E]] makes its first test flight.))
Some((Date(7,June,1940),[[Haakon VII of Norway|King Haakon VII]], [[Olav V of Norway|Crown Prince Olav]] and the [[Norwegian government]] leaves [[Tromsø]] and goes into exile in London. They return exactly five years later))
Some((Date(7,June,1942),[[World War II]]: The [[Battle of Midway]] ends in American victory.))
Some((Date(7,June,1944),World War II: The steamer ''Danae'', carrying 350 [[Crete|Cretan]] Jews and 250 Cretan partisans, is sunk without survivors off the shore of [[Santorini]].))
Some((Date(7,June,1948),[[Edvard Beneš]] resigns as [[List of Presidents of Czechoslovakia|President]] of [[Czechoslovakia]] rather than signing the [[Ninth-of-May Constitution]], making his nation a [[Communist state]].))
Some((Date(7,June,1955),[[Lux Radio Theatre]] signs [[off-the-air|off the air]] permanently. The show launched in New York in 1934, and featured radio adaptations of [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] shows and popular films.))
Some((Date(7,June,1965),The [[Supreme Court of the United States]] hands down its decision in ''[[Griswold v. Connecticut]]'', effectively legalizing the use of [[contraception]] by married couples.))
Some((Date(7,June,1967),[[Six-Day War]]: [[Israel]]i soldiers enter [[Jerusalem]].))
Some((Date(7,June,1971),The United States Supreme Court overturns the conviction of [[Cohen v. California|Paul Cohen]] for disturbing the peace, setting the precedent that vulgar writing is protected under the [[First Amendment to the United States Constitution]].))
Some((Date(7,June,1975),[[1975 Cricket World Cup|The inaugural]] [[Cricket World Cup]] begins in England.))
Some((Date(7,June,1977),500 million people watch the high day of the [[Silver Jubilee of Elizabeth II|Silver Jubilee]] of Queen [[Elizabeth II]] begin on television.))
Some((Date(7,June,1981),The [[Israeli Air Force]] destroys [[Iraq]]'s Osiraq [[nuclear reactor]] during [[Operation Opera]].))
Some((Date(7,June,1982),[[Priscilla Presley]] opens [[Graceland]] to the public; the bathroom where [[Elvis Presley]] died five years earlier is kept off-limits.))
Some((Date(7,June,1989),[[Surinam Airways Flight 764]] crashes on approach to [[Paramaribo-Zanderij International Airport]] in [[Suriname]] because of pilot error, killing 176 of 187 aboard))
Some((Date(7,June,1990),[[Universal Studios Florida]] opens in [[Orlando, Florida]].))
Some((Date(7,June,1991),[[Mount Pinatubo]] erupts, generating an ash column {{convert|7|km|mi}} high.))
Some((Date(7,June,1995),The long-range [[Boeing 777]] enters service with [[United Airlines]].))
Some((Date(7,June,2000),The [[United Nations]] defines the [[Blue Line (Lebanon)|Blue Line]] as the border between [[Israel]] and [[Lebanon]].))
Some((Date(7,June,2013),A bus [[Xiamen bus fire|catches fire]] in the Chinese city of [[Xiamen]], killing at least 47 people and injuring more than 34 others. ))
Some((Date(7,June,2014),At least 37 people are killed in an [[2014 South Kivu attack|attack]] in the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]]'s [[South Kivu]] province.

Some((Date(8,June,1191),[[Richard I]] arrives in [[Acre, Israel|Acre]] ([[Palestine (region)|Palestine]]) {{dn|date=September 2015}} thus beginning his crusade.))
Some((Date(8,June,1405),[[Richard le Scrope]], the [[Archbishop of York]], and [[Thomas de Mowbray, 4th Earl of Norfolk|Thomas Mowbray]], [[Earl of Norfolk]], are executed in [[York]] on [[Henry IV of England|Henry IV]]'s orders.))
Some((Date(8,June,1690),Yadi Sakat, a Siddi general, razes the [[Mazagon Fort]] in Mumbai.))
Some((Date(8,June,1776),[[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Battle of Trois-Rivières]]: American attackers are driven back at [[Trois-Rivières, Quebec]].))
Some((Date(8,June,1783),[[Laki]], a [[volcano]] in [[Iceland]], begins an eight-month eruption which kills over 9,000 people and starts a seven-year [[famine]].))
Some((Date(8,June,1789),[[James Madison]] introduces twelve proposed [[List of amendments to the United States Constitution|amendments to the United States Constitution]] in the [[United States House of Representatives|House of Representatives]]; by 1791, ten of them are [[Ratification|ratified]] by the [[State legislature (United States)|state legislatures]] and become the [[United States Bill of Rights|Bill of Rights]]; another is eventually ratified in 1992 to become the [[Twenty-seventh Amendment to the United States Constitution|27th Amendment]].))
Some((Date(8,June,1794),[[Maximilien Robespierre|Robespierre]] inaugurates the [[French Revolution]]'s new state religion, the [[Cult of the Supreme Being]], with large organized festivals all across France.))
Some((Date(8,June,1856),A group of 194 [[Pitcairn Islands|Pitcairn Islanders]], descendants of the mutineers of {{HMS|Bounty}}, arrives at [[Norfolk Island]], commencing the Third Settlement of the Island.))
Some((Date(8,June,1861),[[American Civil War]]: [[Tennessee]] secedes from the [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]].))
Some((Date(8,June,1862),American Civil War: [[Battle of Cross Keys]]: [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] forces under General [[Stonewall Jackson]] save the [[Army of Northern Virginia]] from a Union assault on the James Peninsula led by General [[George B. McClellan]].))
Some((Date(8,June,1867),Coronation of [[Franz Joseph I of Austria|Franz Joseph]] as [[King of Hungary]] following the Austro-Hungarian compromise (''[[Ausgleich]]'').))
Some((Date(8,June,1887),[[Herman Hollerith]] applies for US [[patent]] #395,781 for the 'Art of Compiling Statistics', which was his [[punched card]] [[calculator]].))
Some((Date(8,June,1906),[[Theodore Roosevelt]] signs the [[Antiquities Act]] into law, authorizing the President to restrict the use of certain parcels of [[public land]] with historical or conservation value.))
Some((Date(8,June,1912),[[Carl Laemmle]] incorporates [[Universal Studios|Universal Pictures]].))
Some((Date(8,June,1928),[[Second Northern Expedition]]: The [[National Revolutionary Army]] captures [[Peking]], whose name is changed to Beijing ("Northern Capital").))
Some((Date(8,June,1929),[[Margaret Bondfield]] is appointed [[Secretary of State for Employment|Minister of Labour]].  She is the first woman appointed to the [[Cabinet of the United Kingdom]].))
Some((Date(8,June,1940),[[World War II]]: The completion of [[Operation Alphabet]], the evacuation of Allied forces from [[Narvik]] at the end of the [[Norwegian Campaign]].))
Some((Date(8,June,1941),World War II: [[Allies of World War II|Allies]] [[Syria–Lebanon Campaign|invade]] [[Syria]] and [[Lebanon]].))
Some((Date(8,June,1942),World War II: The Japanese imperial submarines [[Japanese submarine I-21|I-21]] and I-24 shell the Australian cities of Sydney and [[Newcastle, New South Wales|Newcastle]].))
Some((Date(8,June,1948),[[Milton Berle]] hosts the debut of ''[[Texaco Star Theater]].''))
Some((Date(8,June,1949),The celebrities [[Helen Keller]], [[Dorothy Parker]], [[Danny Kaye]], [[Fredric March]], [[John Garfield]], [[Paul Muni]] and [[Edward G. Robinson]] are named in an [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] report as [[Communist Party]] members.))
Some((Date(8,June,1950),Sir [[Thomas Blamey]] becomes the only Australian-born [[Field Marshal]] in Australian history.))
Some((Date(8,June,1953),[[1953 Flint–Beecher tornado|An F5 tornado]] hits [[Beecher, Michigan]], killing 116, injuring 844, and destroying 340 homes. ))
Some((Date(8,June,1959),The {{USS|Barbero|SS-317|6}} and [[United States Postal Service]] attempt the delivery of mail via [[Missile Mail]].))
Some((Date(8,June,1966),An [[F-104 Starfighter]] collides with [[XB-70 Valkyrie]] prototype no. 2, destroying both planes during a photo shoot near [[Edwards Air Force Base]]. [[Joseph A. Walker]], a [[NASA]] pilot, and Carl Cross, a United States Air Force test pilot, are both killed.))
Some((Date(8,June,1967),[[Six-Day War]]: The [[USS Liberty incident|USS ''Liberty'' incident]] occurs, killing 34 and wounding 171.))
Some((Date(8,June,1968),[[Robert F. Kennedy]]'s funeral takes place at the [[St. Patrick's Cathedral (Manhattan)|St. Patrick's Cathedral]] in New York City.))
Some((Date(8,June,1972),[[Vietnam War]]: Nine-year-old [[Phan Thị Kim Phúc]] is burned by [[napalm]], an event captured by [[Associated Press]] photographer [[Nick Ut]] moments later while the young girl is seen running down a road, in what would become an iconic, [[Pulitzer Prize]]-winning photo.))
Some((Date(8,June,1982),[[Bluff Cove Air Attacks]] during the [[Falklands War]]: Fifty-six British servicemen are killed by an [[Argentine]] air attack on two landing ships, [[RFA Sir Galahad|RFA ''Sir Galahad'']] and {{ship|RFA|Sir Tristram|L3505|6}}.))
Some((Date(8,June,1984),[[Homosexuality]] is declared legal in the [[States and territories of Australia|Australian state]] of [[New South Wales]].))
Some((Date(8,June,1987),New Zealand's [[New Zealand Labour Party|Labour]] government establishes a [[New Zealand nuclear-free zone|national nuclear-free zone]] under the [[New Zealand Nuclear Free Zone, Disarmament, and Arms Control Act 1987]].))
Some((Date(8,June,1992),The first [[World Ocean Day]] is celebrated, coinciding with the [[Earth Summit]] held in [[Rio de Janeiro]], Brazil.))
Some((Date(8,June,1995),The downed U.S. Air Force pilot [[Captain (United States O-3)|Captain]] [[Scott O'Grady]] is rescued by [[U.S. Marines]] in [[Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnia]].))
Some((Date(8,June,2001),[[Mamoru Takuma]] kills eight and injures 15 in [[Osaka school massacre|a mass stabbing]] at an elementary school in the [[Osaka Prefecture]] of [[Japan]].))
Some((Date(8,June,2004),The first [[Transit of Venus, 2004|Venus Transit]] in well over a century takes place, the previous one being in [[1882]].))
Some((Date(8,June,2007),[[Newcastle, New South Wales]], Australia, is hit by the State's worst storms and flooding in 30 years resulting in the death of nine people and the grounding of a trade ship, the {{MV|Pasha Bulker}}.))
Some((Date(8,June,2008),At least 37 miners go missing after an explosion in an [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] coal mine causes [[2008 Ukraine coal mine collapse|it to collapse]].))
Some((Date(8,June,2009),Two American [[journalist]]s are [[2009 imprisonment of American journalists by North Korea|found guilty]] of illegally entering [[North Korea]] and sentenced to 12 years of [[penal labour]].))

Some((Date(9,June,1534),[[Jacques Cartier]] is the first European to discover the [[Saint Lawrence River]].))
Some((Date(9,June,1650),The [[President and Fellows of Harvard College|Harvard Corporation]], the more powerful of the two administrative boards of [[Harvard]], is established. It is the first legal [[corporation]] in the Americas.))
Some((Date(9,June,1667),[[Second Anglo-Dutch War]]: The [[Raid on the Medway]] by the Dutch fleet begins. It lasts for five days and results in the worst ever defeat of the [[Royal Navy]]. ))

Some((Date(9,June,1815),End of the [[Congress of Vienna]]: The new European political situation is set. Also, [[Luxembourg]] declares independence from the [[First French Empire|French Empire]].))
Some((Date(9,June,1856),Five hundred [[Mormon handcart pioneers|Mormon]]s leave [[Iowa City, Iowa]], and head west for [[Salt Lake City]] carrying all their possessions in two-wheeled [[handcart]]s.))

Some((Date(9,June,1863),American Civil War: [[Battle of Brandy Station]], [[Virginia]].))
Some((Date(9,June,1873),[[Alexandra Palace]] in London burns down after being open for only 16 days.))

Some((Date(9,June,1900),[[Birsa Munda]], an important figure in the [[Indian independence movement]], dies in a British prison under mysterious circumstances.))
Some((Date(9,June,1915),[[William Jennings Bryan]] resigns as [[Woodrow Wilson]]'s [[United States Secretary of State|Secretary of State]] over a disagreement regarding the United States' handling of the sinking of the {{RMS|Lusitania}}.))

Some((Date(9,June,1934),[[Donald Duck]] makes his debut in ''[[The Wise Little Hen]]''.))
Some((Date(9,June,1944),[[World War II]]: Ninety-nine civilians are [[Tulle massacre|hanged from lampposts and balconies]] by German troops in [[Tulle]], France, in reprisal for [[Maquis du Limousin|maquisards]] attacks.))
Some((Date(9,June,1946),King [[Ananda Mahidol]] is found shot dead in his bedroom, [[Bhumibol Adulyadej]] ascends to the throne of [[Thailand]]. He is currently the world's longest reigning monarch.))

Some((Date(9,June,1954),[[McCarthyism]]: [[Joseph Welch]], special counsel for the United States Army, lashes out at [[United States Senate|Senator]] [[Joseph McCarthy]] during hearings on whether [[Communism]] has infiltrated the Army giving McCarthy the famous rebuke, "You've done enough. Have you no sense of decency, sir, at long last? Have you left no sense of decency?"))

Some((Date(9,June,1968),U.S. President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] declares a national day of mourning following the [[assassination of Senator Robert F. Kennedy]].))

Some((Date(9,June,1978),[[The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints]] opens its [[Priesthood (Latter Day Saints)|priesthood]] to "all worthy men", ending a 148-year-old policy of excluding black men.))

Some((Date(10,June,1861),[[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Big Bethel]]: [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] troops under [[John B. Magruder]] defeat a much larger [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] force led by General [[Ebenezer W. Pierce]] in [[Virginia]].))
Some((Date(10,June,1864),American Civil War: [[Battle of Brice's Crossroads]]: Confederate troops under [[Nathan Bedford Forrest]] defeat a much larger Union force led by General [[Samuel D. Sturgis]] in [[Mississippi]].))

Some((Date(10,June,1886),[[Mount Tarawera]] in New Zealand erupts, killing 153 people and destroying the famous [[Pink and White Terraces]]. Eruptions continue for 3 months creating a large, 17&nbsp;km long fissure across the mountain peak.))

Some((Date(10,June,1912),The [[Villisca axe murders]] were discovered in [[Villisca, Iowa]].))

Some((Date(10,June,1957),[[John Diefenbaker]] leads the [[Progressive Conservative Party of Canada]] to a stunning upset in the [[Canadian federal election, 1957]], ending 22 years of [[Liberal Party of Canada|Liberal Party]] government.))

Some((Date(10,June,1990),[[British Airways Flight 5390]] lands safely at [[Southampton Airport]] after a blowout in the cockpit causes the captain to be partially sucked from the cockpit. There are no fatalities))
Some((Date(10,June,1991), Eleven-year-old [[Jaycee Lee Dugard]] is kidnapped in [[South Lake Tahoe, California]]; she would remain a captive until 2009.))
Some((Date(10,June,1996),Peace talks begin in [[Northern Ireland]] without the participation of [[Sinn Féin]].))
Some((Date(10,June,1997),Before fleeing his northern stronghold, [[Khmer Rouge]] leader [[Pol Pot]] orders the killing of his defense chief [[Son Sen]] and 11 of Sen's family members.))

Some((Date(11,June,1594),[[Philip II of Spain|Philip II]] recognizes the rights and privileges of the local nobles and chieftains in the [[Philippines]], which paved way to the stabilization of the rule of the [[Principalía]] (an elite ruling class of native nobility in Spanish Philippines).))

Some((Date(11,June,1775),The [[American Revolutionary War]]'s first naval engagement, the [[Battle of Machias]], results in the capture of a small British naval vessel.))

Some((Date(11,June,1788),Russian explorer [[Gerasim Izmailov]] reaches Alaska.))
Some((Date(11,June,1805),A [[History of Detroit#1805 fire|fire]] consumes large portions of [[Detroit]] in the [[Michigan Territory]].))

Some((Date(11,June,1837),The [[Broad Street Riot]] occurs in [[Boston]], fueled by ethnic tensions between [[Yankee]]s and Irish.))
Some((Date(11,June,1865),The Naval [[Battle of Riachuelo]] is fought on the rivulet Riachuelo ([[Argentina]]), between the [[Paraguayan Navy]] on one side and the [[Brazilian Navy]] on the other. The [[Brazil]]ian victory was crucial for the later success of the [[Treaty of the Triple Alliance|Triple Alliance]] ([[Brazil]], [[Uruguay]] and [[Argentina]]) in the [[Paraguayan War]]. ))
Some((Date(11,June,1892),The [[Limelight Department]], one of the world's first [[Movie studio|film studios]], is officially established in [[Melbourne]], Australia.))
Some((Date(11,June,1895),[[Paris–Bordeaux–Paris]] is sometimes called the first automobile race in history or the "first motor race".))
Some((Date(11,June,1898),[[Spanish–American War]]: U.S. war ships set sail for [[Cuba]].))
Some((Date(11,June,1901),The boundaries of the [[Colony of New Zealand]] are extended by the UK to include the [[Cook Islands]].))
Some((Date(11,June,1903),A group of Serbian officers [[May Coup (Serbia)|stormed royal palace and assassinated]] King [[Alexander I of Serbia|Alexander Obrenović]] and his wife queen [[Draga Obrenović|Draga]].))
Some((Date(11,June,1907),[[George Dennett]], aided by [[Gilbert Jessop]], dismisses [[Northamptonshire]] for 12 runs, the lowest total in [[first-class cricket]].))
Some((Date(11,June,1917),King [[Alexander of Greece|Alexander]] assumes the throne of Greece after his father [[Constantine I of Greece|Constantine I]] abdicates under pressure by [[Triple Entente|allied]] armies occupying [[Athens]].))
Some((Date(11,June,1919),[[Sir Barton]] wins the [[Belmont Stakes]], becoming the first horse to win the [[Triple Crown of Thoroughbred Racing|U.S. Triple Crown]].))
Some((Date(11,June,1920),During the [[1920 Republican National Convention|U.S. Republican National Convention]] in Chicago, [[Republican Party (United States)|U.S. Republican Party]] leaders gathered in a room at the [[Blackstone Hotel]] to come to a consensus on their candidate for the [[United States presidential election, 1920|U.S. presidential election]], leading the [[Associated Press]] to first coin the political phrase "[[smoke-filled room]]".))

Some((Date(11,June,1944),{{USS|Missouri|BB-63|6}}, the last [[battleship]] built by the United States Navy and future site of the signing of the [[Japanese Instrument of Surrender]], is [[ship commissioning|commissioned]].))
Some((Date(11,June,1955),Eighty-three spectators are killed and at least 100 are injured after an [[Austin-Healey]] and a [[Mercedes-Benz]] [[1955 Le Mans disaster|collide at the 24 Hours of Le Mans]], the deadliest ever accident in [[motorsports]].))
Some((Date(11,June,1956),Start of [[Gal Oya riots]], the first reported ethnic riots that target minority [[Sri Lankan Tamil people|Sri Lankan Tamils]] in the Eastern Province. The total number of deaths is reportedly 150.))
Some((Date(11,June,1962),[[Frank Morris (prisoner)|Frank Morris]], [[John Anglin]] and [[Clarence Anglin]] allegedly become the only prisoners to [[June 1962 Alcatraz escape|escape]] from the prison on [[Alcatraz Island]].))
Some((Date(11,June,1963),[[African-American Civil Rights Movement (1954–68)|American Civil Rights Movement]]: [[List of Governors of Alabama|Governor]] of [[Alabama]] [[George Wallace]] defiantly [[Stand in the Schoolhouse Door|stands at the door]] of [[Foster Auditorium]] at the [[University of Alabama]] in an attempt to block two black students, [[Vivian Malone]] and [[James Hood]], from attending that school. Later in the day, accompanied by federalized [[National Guard of the United States|National Guard]] troops, they are able to register.))
Some((Date(11,June,1964),World War II veteran [[Walter Seifert]] runs amok in an elementary school in [[Cologne]], Germany, killing at least eight children and two teachers and seriously injuring several more with a home-made [[flamethrower]] and a [[lance]].))
Some((Date(11,June,1968),[[Lloyd J. Old]] identified the first cell surface antigens distinguishing cells of different lineages, introducing the concept of cell surface antigens that could differentiate different cell types. ))

Some((Date(11,June,1971),The U.S. Government forcibly removes the last holdouts to the [[Indigenous peoples of the Americas|Native American]] [[Occupation of Alcatraz]], ending 19 months of control.))
Some((Date(11,June,1972),The [[Eltham Well Hall rail crash]], caused by an intoxicated train driver, kills six people and injures 126.))
Some((Date(11,June,1978),[[Altaf Hussain]] founds the students' political movement [[All Pakistan Muhajir Students Organisation]] (APMSO) in [[Karachi University]].))
Some((Date(11,June,1981),A magnitude 6.9 earthquake at Golbaf, [[Iran]], kills at least 2,000.))
Some((Date(11,June,1982),The [[Sentosa Musical Fountain]] was officially opened as part of the second phase of construction on the island of [[Sentosa]], [[Singapore]].))
Some((Date(11,June,1987),[[Diane Abbott]], [[Paul Boateng]] and [[Bernie Grant]] are elected as the first black Parliamentarians in Great Britain.))
Some((Date(11,June,1998),[[Compaq]] Computer pays US$9 billion for [[Digital Equipment Corporation]] in the largest high-tech acquisition.))

The British offer a pardon to all colonists who lay down their arms. There would be only two exceptions to the amnesty: [[Samuel Adams]] and [[John Hancock]], if captured, were to be hanged.))

Some((Date(14,June,1789),[[Mutiny on the Bounty]]: {{HMS|Bounty}} mutiny survivors including Captain [[William Bligh]] and 18 others reach [[Timor]] after a nearly {{convert|7,400|km|mi|abbr=on}} journey in an open boat.))
Some((Date(14,June,1800),The French Army of [[Napoleon|First Consul Napoleon Bonaparte]] defeats the Austrians at the [[Battle of Marengo]] in Northern Italy and re-conquers Italy.))
Some((Date(14,June,1807),Emperor [[Napoleon]]'s French [[Grande Armée]] defeats the [[Russian Empire|Russian]] Army at the [[Battle of Friedland]] in Poland (modern Russian  [[Kaliningrad Oblast]]) ending the [[War of the Fourth Coalition]].))
Some((Date(14,June,1821),[[Badi VII]], king of [[Sennar (sultanate)|Sennar]], surrenders his throne and realm to [[Isma'il Pasha]], general of the [[Ottoman Empire]], ending the existence of that Sudanese kingdom.))
Some((Date(14,June,1822),[[Charles Babbage]] proposes a [[difference engine]] in a paper to the [[Royal Astronomical Society]] entitled "Note on the application of machinery to the computation of astronomical and mathematical tables".))
Some((Date(14,June,1830),Beginning of the [[French Algeria|French colonization of Algeria]]: 34,000 French soldiers begin their [[Invasion of Algiers in 1830|invasion of Algiers]], landing 27 kilometers west at [[Sidi Fredj]].))
Some((Date(14,June,1839),[[Henley Royal Regatta]]: the village of [[Henley-on-Thames]], on the [[River Thames]] in [[Oxfordshire]], stages its first [[regatta]].))
Some((Date(14,June,1872),[[Trade union]]s are legalised in Canada.))
Some((Date(14,June,1900),[[Territory of Hawaii|Hawaii]] becomes a [[United States territory]].))
Some((Date(14,June,1907),Norway grants women the [[women's suffrage|right to vote]].))
Some((Date(14,June,1919),[[Transatlantic flight of Alcock and Brown|John Alcock and Arthur Whitten Brown depart]] from [[St. John's, Newfoundland]] on the first nonstop [[transatlantic flight]].))
Some((Date(14,June,1926),[[Brazil]] leaves the [[League of Nations]]))
Some((Date(14,June,1937),[[Pennsylvania]] becomes the first (and only) state of the United States to celebrate [[Flag Day (United States)|Flag Day]] officially as a [[state holiday]].

Some((Date(14,June,1949),Albert II, a [[rhesus monkey]], rides a [[V-2 rocket]] to an altitude of 134&nbsp;km (83&nbsp;mi), thereby becoming the first [[monkeys and apes in space|monkey in space]].))
Some((Date(14,June,1951),[[UNIVAC I]] is dedicated by the [[United States Bureau of the Census|U.S. Census Bureau]].))
Some((Date(14,June,1952),The [[keel]] is laid for the nuclear submarine {{USS|Nautilus|SSN-571|6}}.))

Some((Date(14,June,1959),[[Disneyland Monorail System]], the first daily operating monorail system in the Western Hemisphere, opens to the public in [[Anaheim, California]].))
Some((Date(14,June,1962),The [[European Space Research Organisation]] is established in Paris – later becoming the [[European Space Agency]].))
Some((Date(14,June,1966),The [[Roman Curia|Vatican]] announces the abolition of the ''[[Index Librorum Prohibitorum]]'' ("index of prohibited books"), which was originally instituted in [[1557]].))
Some((Date(14,June,1967),[[Mariner program]]: ''[[Mariner 5]]'' is launched towards [[Venus]].))
Some((Date(14,June,1982),[[Falklands War]]: [[Argentina|Argentine]] forces in the capital [[Stanley, Falkland Islands|Stanley]] [[Conditional surrender|conditionally surrender]] to British forces.))
Some((Date(14,June,1985),[[TWA Flight 847]] is hijacked by [[Lebanon|Lebanese]] Islamist organization [[Hezbollah]] shortly after take-off from [[Athens]], Greece.))
Some((Date(14,June,1994),The [[1994 Vancouver Stanley Cup riot ]] occurs after the New York Rangers win the [[Stanley Cup]] from Vancouver, causing an estimated {{$|CAD}}1.1 million, leading to 200 arrests and injuries. ))
Some((Date(14,June,2002),[[Near-Earth asteroid]] [[2002 MN]] misses the Earth by {{convert|75000|mi|km}}, about one-third of the distance between the Earth and the Moon.))
Some((Date(14,June,2014),A Ukraine military [[Ilyushin Il-76]] airlifter is [[Ukrainian Air Force Ilyushin Il-76 shoot-down|shot down]], killing all 49 people on board.))
Some((Date(14,June,2015),A [[2015 Alaska Sockeye wildfire|wildfire]] near [[Willow, Alaska]] in the [[Matanuska-Susitna Borough]] burns over 6,500 acres.

Some((Date(15,June,-763),[[Assyria]]ns record a [[Assyrian eclipse|solar eclipse]] that is later used to fix the [[chronology]] of [[Mesopotamia]]n history.))

Some((Date(15,June,1215),King [[John of England]] puts his [[seal (emblem)|seal]] to the [[Magna Carta]].))
Some((Date(15,June,1219),[[Northern Crusades]]: Danish victory at the [[Battle of Lyndanisse]] (modern-day [[Tallinn]]) establishes the Danish [[Danish Estonia|Duchy of Estonia]].  According to legend, this battle also marks the first use of the [[Flag of Denmark|Dannebrog]], the world's first national flag still in use, as the national flag of Denmark.))
Some((Date(15,June,1246),With the death of [[Frederick II, Duke of Austria]], the [[Babenberg dynasty]] ends in Austria.))

Some((Date(15,June,1752),[[Benjamin Franklin]] proves that [[lightning]] is [[electricity]] (traditional date, the exact date is unknown).))

Some((Date(15,June,1776),Delaware Separation Day: [[Delaware]] votes to suspend government under the British Crown and separate officially from [[Pennsylvania]].))
Some((Date(15,June,1785),[[Jean-François Pilâtre de Rozier]], co-pilot of the first-ever manned flight (1783), and his companion, [[Pierre Romain]], become the first-ever [[Casualty (person)|casualties]] of an air crash when their [[hot air balloon]] explodes during their attempt to cross the [[English Channel]].))
Some((Date(15,June,1804),[[New Hampshire]] approves the [[Twelfth Amendment to the United States Constitution]], ratifying the document.))
Some((Date(15,June,1808),[[Joseph Bonaparte]] becomes [[King of Spain]].))
Some((Date(15,June,1815),The [[Duchess of Richmond's ball]] is held in [[Brussels]], "the most famous ball in history".))

Some((Date(15,June,1844),[[Charles Goodyear]] receives a [[patent]] for [[vulcanization]], a process to strengthen [[rubber]].))
Some((Date(15,June,1846),The [[Oregon Treaty]] establishes the [[49th parallel north|49th parallel]] as the border between the United States and Canada, from the [[Rocky Mountains]] to the [[Strait of Juan de Fuca]].))
Some((Date(15,June,1859),[[Pig War]]: Ambiguity in the Oregon Treaty leads to the "Northwestern Boundary Dispute" between United States and British/Canadian settlers.))

Some((Date(15,June,1867),[[Atlantic Cable Quartz Lode]] [[Gold mining|gold mine]] located in [[Montana]].))
Some((Date(15,June,1877),[[Henry Ossian Flipper]] becomes the first [[African American]] cadet to graduate from the [[United States Military Academy]].))
Some((Date(15,June,1878),[[Eadweard Muybridge]] takes [[Sallie Gardner at a Gallop|a series of photographs]] to prove that all four feet of a horse leave the ground when it runs; the study becomes the basis of [[film|motion pictures]].))
Some((Date(15,June,1888),Crown Prince [[Wilhelm II, German Emperor|Wilhelm]] becomes Kaiser Wilhelm II; he will be the last Emperor of the [[German Empire]]. Due to the death of his predecessors [[William I, German Emperor|Wilhelm I]] and [[Frederick III, German Emperor|Frederick III]], 1888 is the [[Year of the Three Emperors]].))

Some((Date(15,June,1978),[[Hussein of Jordan|King Hussein]] of [[Jordan]] marries American Lisa Halaby, who takes the name [[Queen Noor of Jordan|Queen Noor]].))
Some((Date(15,June,1985),[[Rembrandt]]'s painting ''[[Danaë (Rembrandt painting)|Danaë]]'' is attacked by a man (later judged insane) who throws [[sulfuric acid]] on the canvas and cuts it twice with a knife.))
Some((Date(15,June,1991),In the Philippines, [[Mount Pinatubo]] erupts in the second largest volcanic eruption of the 20th Century. In the end, over 800 people die.))

Álvarez-Machaín]]'' that it is permissible for the United States to forcibly extradite suspects in foreign countries and bring them to the USA for trial, without approval from those other countries.))

At the same time on the ground, some forces soldiers attempt to stage a coup but are suppressed by loyal forces.))
