Some((Date(17,June,1944),[[Iceland]] declares [[Icelandic National Day|independence]] from Denmark and becomes a [[republic]].))
Some((Date(17,June,1948),A [[Douglas DC-6]] carrying [[United Airlines Flight 624]] crashes near [[Mount Carmel, Pennsylvania]], killing all 43 people on board.))
Some((Date(17,June,1953),[[Uprising of 1953 in East Germany|East Germany Workers Uprising]]: In [[East Germany]], the Soviet Union orders a division of troops into [[East Berlin]] to quell a rebellion.))
Some((Date(17,June,1958),The [[Ironworkers Memorial Second Narrows Crossing]], in the process of being built to connect Vancouver and [[North Vancouver (district municipality)|North Vancouver]] (Canada), collapses into the [[Burrard Inlet]] killing many of the ironworkers and injuring others.))
Some((Date(17,June,1960),The [[Nez Perce people|Nez Perce]] tribe is awarded $4&nbsp;million for {{convert|7|e6acre|km2}} of land undervalued at four cents/acre in the 1863 treaty.))
Some((Date(17,June,1963),The [[United States Supreme Court]] rules 8–1 in ''[[Abington School District v. Schempp]]'' against requiring the reciting of [[Bible]] verses and the [[Lord's Prayer]] in [[public school (government funded)|public schools]].))
Some((Date(17,June,1967),The People's Republic of China announces a successful test of its first [[thermonuclear weapon]].))
Some((Date(17,June,1972),[[Watergate scandal]]: Five [[White House]] operatives are arrested for burgling the offices of the [[Democratic National Committee]], in an attempt by some members of the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican party]] to illegally [[Telephone tapping|wiretap]] the opposition.))
Some((Date(17,June,1985),[[STS-51-G]] [[Space Shuttle Discovery]] launches carrying [[Sultan bin Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud]], the first Arab and first Muslim in space, as a [[Payload Specialist]].))
Some((Date(17,June,1987),With the death of the last individual of the species, the [[dusky seaside sparrow]] becomes extinct.))
Some((Date(17,June,1991),[[Apartheid]]: The [[Parliament of South Africa|South African Parliament]] repeals the [[Population Registration Act]] which required racial classification of all South Africans at birth.))
Some((Date(17,June,1992),A "joint understanding" agreement on arms reduction is signed by U.S. President [[George H. W. Bush|George Bush]] and [[President of Russia|Russian President]] [[Boris Yeltsin]] (this would be later codified in [[START II]]).))
Some((Date(17,June,1994),Following a televised low-speed highway chase, [[O. J. Simpson]] is arrested for the [[O. J. Simpson murder case|murders]] of his wife, [[Nicole Brown Simpson]], and her friend [[Ronald Goldman]].))
Some((Date(17,June,2015),Nine people are killed in [[Charleston church shooting|a mass shooting]] at [[Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church]] in [[Charleston, South Carolina]].

))
Some((Date(18,June,1053),[[Battle of Civitate]]: Three thousand horsemen of [[Normans|Norman]] [[Humphrey of Hauteville|Count Humphrey]] rout the troops of [[Pope Leo IX]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1178),Five [[Canterbury]] monks see what is possibly the [[Giordano Bruno (crater)|Giordano Bruno crater]] being formed. It is believed that the current oscillations of the [[Moon]]'s distance from the [[Earth]] (on the order of meters) are a result of this collision.))
Some((Date(18,June,1264),The [[Parliament of Ireland]] meets at [[Castledermot]] in [[County Kildare]], the first definitively known meeting of this Irish [[legislature]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1429),[[France in the Middle Ages|French]] forces under the leadership of [[Joan of Arc]] defeat the main English army under [[John Fastolf|Sir John Fastolf]] at the [[Battle of Patay]]. This turns the tide of the [[Hundred Years' War]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1633),[[Charles I of England|Charles I]] is crowned King of Scots at [[St Giles' Cathedral]], [[Edinburgh]]))
Some((Date(18,June,1684),The charter of the [[Massachusetts Bay Colony]] is revoked via a ''[[scire facias]]'' writ issued by an English court.))
Some((Date(18,June,1757),[[Battle of Kolín]] between [[Prussia]]n forces under [[Frederick the Great]] and an Austrian army under the command of Field Marshal [[Count Leopold Joseph von Daun]] in the [[Seven Years' War]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1767),[[Samuel Wallis]], an English sea captain, sights [[Tahiti]] and is considered the first European to reach the island.))
Some((Date(18,June,1778),[[American Revolutionary War]]: British troops abandon [[Philadelphia]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1799),[[Action of 18 June 1799]]: A frigate squadron under Rear-admiral [[Jean-Baptiste Perrée|Perrée]] is captured by the British fleet under [[George Elphinstone, 1st Viscount Keith|Lord Keith]]))
Some((Date(18,June,1812),[[War of 1812]]: The [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] declares war on Great Britain, Canada, and Ireland.))
Some((Date(18,June,1815),[[Napoleonic Wars]]: The [[Battle of Waterloo]] results in the defeat of [[Napoleon|Napoleon Bonaparte]] by the [[Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington|Duke of Wellington]] and [[Gebhard Leberecht von Blücher]] forcing him to abdicate the throne of [[First French Empire|France]] for the second and last time.))
Some((Date(18,June,1830),French invasion of [[Algeria]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1858),[[Charles Darwin]] receives a paper from [[Alfred Russel Wallace]] that includes nearly identical conclusions about [[evolution]] as Darwin's own, prompting Darwin to publish his theory.))
Some((Date(18,June,1859),First ascent of [[Aletschhorn]], second summit of the [[Bernese Alps]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1873),[[Susan B. Anthony]] is fined $100 for attempting to vote in the [[United States presidential election, 1872|1872 presidential election]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1887),The [[Reinsurance Treaty]] between Germany and Russia is signed.))
Some((Date(18,June,1900),[[Empress Dowager Longyu]] of China orders all foreigners killed, including foreign [[diplomat]]s and their families.))
Some((Date(18,June,1908),[[Japanese Brazilian|Japanese immigration to Brazil]] begins when 781 people arrive in [[Santos, São Paulo|Santos]] aboard the ship Kasato-Maru.))
Some((Date(18,June,1923),[[Checker Taxi]] puts its first [[taxicab|taxi]] on the streets.))
Some((Date(18,June,1928),[[Aviator]] [[Amelia Earhart]] becomes the first woman to fly in an aircraft across the Atlantic Ocean (she is a passenger; [[Wilmer Stultz]] is the pilot and Lou Gordon the mechanic).))
Some((Date(18,June,1930),Groundbreaking ceremonies for the [[Franklin Institute]] are held.))
Some((Date(18,June,1935),Police in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada [[Battle of Ballantyne Pier|clash with striking longshoremen]], resulting in a total 60 injuries and 24 arrests.))
Some((Date(18,June,1940),[[Appeal of 18 June]] by [[Charles de Gaulle]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1945),[[William Joyce]] ("[[Lord Haw-Haw]]") is charged with [[treason]] for his pro-German propaganda broadcasting during [[World War II]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1946),Dr. [[Ram Manohar Lohia]], a [[Socialist]], calls for a [[Direct Action Day]] against the Portuguese in [[Goa]]. A road is named after this date in [[Panjim]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1948),[[Columbia Records]] introduces the [[LP album|long-playing record album]] in a public demonstration at the [[Waldorf-Astoria Hotel]] in [[New York City|New York, New York]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1953),The [[Egyptian Revolution of 1952]] ends with the overthrow of the [[Muhammad Ali dynasty]] and the declaration of the [[Egypt#Modern history|Republic of Egypt]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1954),[[Pierre Mendès France]] becomes [[Prime Minister of France]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1965),[[Vietnam War]]: The United States uses [[B-52 Stratofortress|B-52]] bombers to attack [[National Front for the Liberation of Vietnam|National Liberation Front]] [[guerrilla warfare|guerrilla]] fighters in [[South Vietnam]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1971),President [[Richard Nixon]] declares that illegal drugs are "public enemy number one", which becomes popularized as the "[[War on Drugs]]".))
Some((Date(18,June,1972),[[British European Airways Flight 548|Staines air disaster]]: One hundred eighteen are killed when a [[British European Airways|BEA]] [[Hawker Siddeley Trident|H.S. Trident]] crashes two minutes after take off from [[London Heathrow Airport]].<!-- significant policy impact: lead to use of cockpit voice recorders -->))
Some((Date(18,June,1979),[[SALT II]] is signed by the United States and the [[Soviet Union]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1981),The [[Lockheed F-117 Nighthawk]], the first operational aircraft initially designed around [[stealth technology]], makes its first flight.))
Some((Date(18,June,1982),Italian banker [[Roberto Calvi]]'s body is discovered hanging beneath [[Blackfriars Bridge]] in London, England.))
Some((Date(18,June,1983),[[Space Shuttle program]]: [[STS-7]], [[Astronaut]] [[Sally Ride]] becomes the first American woman in space.))
Some((Date(18,June,1984),[[Battle of Orgreave|A major clash]] between about 5,000 police and a similar number of miners takes place at Orgreave, [[South Yorkshire]], during the 1984–85 [[UK miners' strike (1984–85)|UK miners' strike]].))
Some((Date(18,June,1994),[[The Troubles]]: Members of the [[Ulster Volunteer Force]] (UVF) [[Loughinisland massacre|attack a crowded pub]] with assault rifles in [[Loughinisland]], [[Northern Ireland]]. Six Catholic civilians are killed and five wounded. It was crowded with people watching the [[1994 FIFA World Cup]].))
Some((Date(18,June,2006),The first [[Kazakhstan|Kazakh]] space [[satellite]], [[KazSat]] is launched.))
Some((Date(18,June,2007),The [[Charleston Sofa Super Store fire]] happened in [[Charleston, South Carolina]] killing nine [[firefighters]].))
Some((Date(18,June,2009),The [[Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter]] (LRO), a NASA robotic spacecraft is launched.

Some((Date(19,June,1179),The Norwegian Battle of Kalvskinnet outside [[Nidaros]]. [[Earl]] [[Erling Skakke]] is killed, and the battle changes the tide of the [[Civil war era in Norway|civil wars]].))

Some((Date(19,June,1306),The [[Earl of Pembroke]]'s army defeats [[Robert the Bruce|Bruce's]] Scottish army at the [[Battle of Methven]].))
Some((Date(19,June,1586),English colonists leave [[Roanoke Island]], after failing to establish [[Roanoke Colony|England's first permanent settlement]] in North America.))

Some((Date(19,June,1821),Decisive defeat of the [[Filiki Eteria]] by the Ottomans at [[Drăgășani]] (in [[Wallachia]]).))

Cartwright umpired.))
Some((Date(19,June,1850),Princess [[Louise of the Netherlands]] marries [[Charles XV of Sweden|Crown Prince Karl]] of [[Sweden–Norway]].))

Some((Date(19,June,1862),The [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] prohibits [[slavery]] in United States territories, nullifying [[Dred Scott v. Sandford]].))
Some((Date(19,June,1865),Over two years after the [[Emancipation Proclamation]], slaves in [[Galveston, Texas]], United States, are finally informed of their freedom. The anniversary is still officially celebrated in [[Texas]] and 41 other contiguous states as [[Juneteenth]].))
Some((Date(19,June,1867),[[Maximilian I of Mexico|Maximilian I]] of the [[Second Mexican Empire]] is executed by a [[Execution by firing squad|firing squad]] in [[Querétaro, Querétaro]].))

Some((Date(19,June,1985),Members of the [[Revolutionary Party of Central American Workers]], dressed as [[El Salvador|Salvadoran]] soldiers, [[1985 Zona Rosa attacks|attack the Zona Rosa]] area of [[San Salvador]].))

Some((Date(19,June,2007),The [[2007 al-Khilani Mosque bombing|al-Khilani Mosque bombing]] in Baghdad leaves 78 people dead and another 218 injured.))
Some((Date(19,June,2009),[[Shishou incident|Mass riots]] involving over 10,000 people and 10,000 police officers break out in [[Shishou]], China, over the dubious circumstances surrounding the death of a local chef.))

Some((Date(19,June,2014),[[Felipe VI of Spain|Felipe VI]], Prince of Asturias, rises to the [[Monarchy of Spain|Spanish throne]] following the abdication of his father, [[Juan Carlos I of Spain|Juan Carlos I]].

Some((Date(20,June,1819),The U.S. vessel {{SS|Savannah}} arrives at [[Liverpool]], United Kingdom. It is the first steam-propelled vessel to cross the [[Atlantic Ocean|Atlantic]], although most of the journey is made under sail.))

Some((Date(20,June,1895),The [[Kiel Canal]], crossing the base of the [[Jutland]] peninsula and the busiest artificial waterway in the world, is officially opened.))

Some((Date(20,June,1942),[[The Holocaust]]: [[Kazimierz Piechowski]] and three others, dressed as members of the [[SS-Totenkopfverbände]], steal an SS staff car and escape from the [[Auschwitz concentration camp]].))
Some((Date(20,June,1943),The [[Detroit race riot of 1943|Detroit race riot]] breaks out and continues for three more days.))
Some((Date(20,June,1944),World War II: The [[Battle of the Philippine Sea]] concludes with a decisive U.S. naval victory. The lopsided naval air battle is also known as the "Great Marianas Turkey Shoot".))
Some((Date(20,June,1945),The [[United States Secretary of State]] approves the transfer of [[Wernher von Braun]] and his team of Nazi rocket scientists to America.))
Some((Date(20,June,1948),''[[Toast of the Town]]'', later ''[[The Ed Sullivan Show]]'', makes its television debut.))
Some((Date(20,June,1956),A [[Venezuela]]n [[Lockheed Constellation|Super-Constellation]] [[Linea Aeropostal Venezolana Flight 253 (June 1956)|crashes]] in the Atlantic Ocean off [[Asbury Park, New Jersey]], killing 74 people.<!--Resulted in plane design regulations-->))
Some((Date(20,June,1959),[[1959 Escuminac disaster|A rare June hurricane]] strikes Canada's Gulf of St. Lawrence killing 35.))
Some((Date(20,June,1960),The [[Mali Federation]] gains independence from France (it later splits into [[Mali]] and [[Senegal]]).))
Some((Date(20,June,1963),The so-called "[[Moscow–Washington hotline|red telephone]]" link is established between the Soviet Union and the United States following the [[Cuban Missile Crisis]].))
Some((Date(20,June,1972),[[Watergate scandal]]: An 18½-minute gap appears in the [[Nixon White House tapes|tape recording of the conversations]] between U.S. President [[Richard Nixon]] and his advisers regarding the recent arrests of his operatives while breaking into the [[Watergate complex]].))
Some((Date(20,June,1973),[[Ezeiza massacre]] in [[Buenos Aires]], [[Argentina]]. [[Sniper]]s fire upon left-wing [[Peronism|Peronists]]. At least 13 are killed and more than 300 are injured.))
Some((Date(20,June,1979),ABC News correspondent [[Bill Stewart (journalist)|Bill Stewart]] is shot dead by a [[Nicaragua]]n soldier under the regime of [[Anastasio Somoza Debayle]]. The murder is caught on tape and sparks an international outcry against the regime.))
Some((Date(20,June,1982),The Argentine [[Corbeta Uruguay base]] on [[Southern Thule]] surrenders to Royal Marine commandos in the final action of the [[Falklands War]].))
Some((Date(20,June,1990),[[Asteroid]] [[5261 Eureka|Eureka]] is discovered.))
Some((Date(20,June,1991),The German [[Bundestag]] votes to move the capital from [[Bonn]] back to Berlin.))
Some((Date(20,June,2001),[[Andrea Yates]], in an attempt to save her young children from [[Satan]], drowns all five of them in a bathtub in [[Houston]], [[Texas]].))
Some((Date(20,June,2003),The [[Wikimedia Foundation]] is founded in [[St. Petersburg, Florida]].

Some((Date(21,June,-217),The Romans, led by [[Gaius Flaminius Nepos|Gaius Flaminius]], are ambushed and defeated by [[Hannibal]] at the [[Battle of Lake Trasimene]].))

Some((Date(21,June,1582),[[Sengoku period]]: [[Oda Nobunaga]], the most powerful of the Japanese [[daimyo]], was [[Honnō-ji Incident|forced to commit suicide]] by his own general [[Akechi Mitsuhide]].))
Some((Date(21,June,1621), Execution of 27 [[Czech people|Czech]] noblemen on the Old Town Square in [[Prague]] as a consequence of the [[Battle of White Mountain]].))
Some((Date(21,June,1734),In [[Montreal]] in [[New France]], a  slave known by the French name of [[Marie-Joseph Angélique]] is put to death, having been convicted of [[arson|setting the fire]] that destroyed much of the city.))
Some((Date(21,June,1749),[[Halifax, Nova Scotia]], is founded.))
Some((Date(21,June,1768),[[James Otis, Jr.]] offends the [[George III of the United Kingdom|King]] and [[Parliament of Great Britain|Parliament]] in a speech to the [[Massachusetts General Court]].))

Some((Date(21,June,1826),[[Maniots]] defeat Egyptians under [[Ibrahim Pasha of Egypt|Ibrahim Pasha]] in the [[Battle of Vergas]].))

Some((Date(21,June,1877),The [[Molly Maguires]], ten Irish immigrants convicted of murder, are hanged at the [[Schuylkill County]] and [[Carbon County, Pennsylvania]] prisons.))

Some((Date(21,June,1900),[[Boxer Rebellion]]. China formally declares war on the United States, Britain, Germany, France and Japan, as an edict issued from the [[Empress Dowager Cixi]].))
Some((Date(21,June,1915),The [[Supreme Court of the United States|U.S. Supreme Court]] hands down its decision in ''[[Guinn v. United States]]'' 238 US 347 1915, striking down an [[Oklahoma]] law denying the right to vote to some citizens.))
Some((Date(21,June,1919),The [[Royal Canadian Mounted Police]] fire a volley into a crowd of unemployed war veterans, killing two, during the [[Winnipeg General Strike]].))
Some((Date(21,June,1929),An agreement brokered by U.S. Ambassador [[Dwight Whitney Morrow]] ends the [[Cristero War]] in Mexico. ))

Some((Date(21,June,1940),The first successful west-to-east navigation of [[Northwest Passage]] begins at Vancouver, [[British Columbia]], Canada.))
Some((Date(21,June,1942),[[World War II]]: [[Tobruk]] falls to Italian and German forces.))
Some((Date(21,June,1945),World War II: The [[Battle of Okinawa]] ends when the organized resistance of [[Imperial Japanese Army]] forces collapses in the Mabuni area on the southern tip of the main island.))
Some((Date(21,June,1952),The Philippine School of Commerce, through a republic act, is converted to Philippine College of Commerce, later to be the [[Polytechnic University of the Philippines]].))
Some((Date(21,June,1957),[[Ellen Fairclough]] is sworn in as Canada's first female [[Cabinet of Canada|Cabinet Minister]].))
Some((Date(21,June,1963),Cardinal Giovanni Battista Montini is [[Papal conclave, 1963|elected]] as [[Pope Paul VI]].))
Some((Date(21,June,1964),Three [[African-American Civil Rights Movement (1954–68)|civil rights]] workers, [[Andrew Goodman]], [[James Chaney]] and [[Mickey Schwerner]], [[Mississippi civil rights workers' murders|are murdered]] in [[Neshoba County, Mississippi]], United States, by members of the [[Ku Klux Klan]].))
Some((Date(21,June,1970),[[Penn Central]] declares Section 77 [[bankruptcy]], largest ever US corporate bankruptcy up to this date.))
Some((Date(21,June,1973),In handing down the decision in ''[[Miller v. California]]'' 413 US 15, the Supreme Court of the United States establishes the [[Miller test]] for obscenity in U.S. law.))
Some((Date(21,June,1977),[[Bülent Ecevit]], of the [[Republican People's Party (Turkey)|CHP]] forms the new government of [[Turkey]].))
Some((Date(21,June,1982),[[John Hinckley]] is found [[Insanity defense|not guilty by reason of insanity]] for the attempted assassination of U.S. President [[Ronald Reagan]].))
Some((Date(21,June,2000),[[Section 28]] (of the [[Local Government Act 1988]]), outlawing the 'promotion' of [[homosexuality]] in the United Kingdom, is repealed in Scotland with a 99 to 17 vote.))
Some((Date(21,June,2001),A federal grand jury in [[Alexandria, Virginia]], indicts 13 Saudis and a Lebanese in the 1996 bombing of the [[Khobar Towers]] in [[Saudi Arabia]] that killed 19 American servicemen.))
Some((Date(21,June,2004),''[[SpaceShipOne]]'' becomes the first privately funded [[spaceplane]] to achieve [[Human spaceflight|spaceflight]].))
Some((Date(21,June,2005),[[Edgar Ray Killen]], who had previously been acquitted for the murders of James Chaney, Andrew Goodman, and Mickey Schwerner, is convicted of manslaughter 41 years afterwards (the case had been reopened in 2004). ))

After this battle, the future king calls himself "Prince of Portugal", the first step towards "official independence" that will be reached in [[1139]] after the [[Battle of Ourique]].))

Some((Date(29,June,1864),Ninety-nine people are killed in Canada's worst [[St-Hilaire train disaster|railway disaster]] near [[Mont-Saint-Hilaire, Quebec|St-Hilaire]], [[Quebec]].))

Some((Date(29,June,1880),France annexes [[Tahiti]].))
Some((Date(29,June,1881),In Sudan, [[Muhammad Ahmad]] declares himself to be the [[Mahdi]], the messianic redeemer of Islam.))
Some((Date(29,June,1888),[[George Edward Gouraud]] records [[George Frideric Handel|Handel]]'s ''[[Israel in Egypt]]'' onto a [[phonograph cylinder]], thought for many years to be the oldest known recording of music.))
Some((Date(29,June,1889),[[Hyde Park Township, Cook County, Illinois|Hyde Park]] and several other [[Illinois]] townships vote to be annexed by Chicago, forming the largest United States city in area and second largest in population.))
Some((Date(29,June,1895),[[Doukhobor]]s burn their weapons as a protest against conscription by the [[Russian Empire|Tsarist Russian government]].))
Some((Date(29,June,1914),[[Jina Guseva]] attempts to assassinate [[Grigori Rasputin]] at his home town in [[Siberia]].))
Some((Date(29,June,1915),The [[North Saskatchewan River flood of 1915]] is the worst flood in [[Edmonton]] history.))
Some((Date(29,June,1916),The [[Irish nationalism|Irish Nationalist]] and British [[diplomat]] [[Roger Casement]] is sentenced to death for his part in the [[Easter Rising]].))
Some((Date(29,June,1922),France grants 1&nbsp;km² at [[Vimy Ridge]] "freely, and for all time, to the Government of Canada, the free use of the land exempt from all taxes".))
Some((Date(29,June,1926),[[Arthur Meighen]] returns to office as [[Prime Minister of Canada]].))
Some((Date(29,June,1927),The ''[[Bird of Paradise (aircraft)|Bird of Paradise]]'', a [[U.S. Army Air Corps]] Fokker tri-motor, completes the first transpacific flight, from the mainland United States to Hawaii.))
Some((Date(29,June,1928),The [[Outerbridge Crossing]] and [[Goethals Bridge]] in [[Staten Island, New York]] are both opened.))
Some((Date(29,June,1945),[[Carpathian Ruthenia]] is annexed by the [[Soviet Union]].))
Some((Date(29,June,1956),The [[Federal Aid Highway Act of 1956]] is signed, officially creating the United States [[Interstate Highway System]].))
Some((Date(29,June,1972),The [[United States Supreme Court]] rules in the case ''[[Furman v. Georgia]]'' that arbitrary and inconsistent imposition of the death penalty violates the [[Eighth Amendment to the United States Constitution|Eighth]] and [[Fourteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution|Fourteenth]] Amendments, and constitutes cruel and unusual punishment.))
Some((Date(29,June,1974),[[Isabel Perón]] is sworn in as the first female [[President of Argentina]]. Her husband, President [[Juan Perón]], had delegated responsibility due to weak health and died two days later.))
Some((Date(29,June,1975),[[Steve Wozniak]] tested his first prototype of [[Apple I]] computer.))
Some((Date(29,June,1976),The [[Seychelles]] become independent from the United Kingdom.))
Some((Date(29,June,1995),[[Space Shuttle program]]: [[STS-71]] Mission (''[[Space Shuttle Atlantis|Atlantis]]'') docks with the [[Mir|Russian space station ''Mir'']] for the first time.))
Some((Date(29,June,2002),[[Second Battle of Yeonpyeong|Naval clashes]] between South Korea and [[North Korea]] lead to the death of six South Korean sailors and sinking of a North Korean vessel.))
Some((Date(29,June,2006),''[[Hamdan v. Rumsfeld]]'': The [[U.S. Supreme Court]] rules that President [[George W. Bush]]'s plan to try [[Guantanamo Bay detention camp|Guantanamo Bay detainees]] in military tribunals violates U.S. and [[international law]].))
Some((Date(29,June,2007),[[Apple Inc.]] releases its first mobile phone, the [[iPhone]].))
Some((Date(29,June,2012),A [[derecho]] [[June 2012 North American derecho|strikes]] the eastern [[United States]], leaving at least 22 people dead and millions without power.))

Some((Date(6,July,1999),U.S. Army private [[Barry Winchell]] dies from baseball-bat injuries inflicted on him in his sleep the previous day by a fellow soldier, Calvin Glover, for his relationship with [[transgender]] showgirl and former [[Navy]] [[Corpsman]] [[Calpernia Addams]].))
Some((Date(6,July,2003),The 70-metre [[Yevpatoria]] Planetary Radar sends a [[Message to Extra-Terrestrial Intelligence|METI]] message ([[Cosmic Call 2]]) to five stars: [[Cassiopeia (constellation)|Hip 4872]], [[Orion (constellation)|HD 245409]], [[55 Cancri]] (HD 75732), [[HD 10307]] and [[47 Ursae Majoris]] (HD 95128). The messages will arrive to these stars in 2036, 2040, 2044, and 2049, respectively.))

Some((Date(13,July,1973),[[Alexander Butterfield]] reveals the existence of the "[[Nixon White House tapes|Nixon tapes]]" to the special [[United States Senate|Senate]] committee investigating the [[Watergate scandal|Watergate break-in]].))
Some((Date(13,July,1977),[[Somalia]] declares war on [[Ethiopia]], starting the [[Ogaden War]].))
Some((Date(13,July,1985),The [[Live Aid]] [[benefit concert]] takes place in London and [[Philadelphia]], as well as other venues such as [[Sydney]] and [[Moscow]].))

Some((Date(13,July,2008),[[Battle of Wanat]] begins when [[Taliban]] and [[al-Qaeda]] guerrillas attack US Army and [[Afghan National Army]] troops in [[War in Afghanistan (2001–present)|Afghanistan]]. The U.S. deaths were, at that time, the most in a single battle since the beginning of [[Operation Enduring Freedom|operations in 2001]].))

Some((Date(14,July,1865),[[First ascent of the Matterhorn]] by [[Edward Whymper]] and party, four of whom die on the descent.))
Some((Date(14,July,1874),The [[Chicago Fire of 1874]] burns down 47 acres of the city, destroying 812 buildings, killing 20, and resulting in the fire insurance industry demanding municipal reforms from Chicago's city council.))
Some((Date(14,July,1877),The [[Great Railroad Strike of 1877]] begins in [[Martinsburg, West Virginia]], US, when [[Baltimore and Ohio Railroad]] workers have their wages cut for the second time in a year.))
Some((Date(14,July,1881),[[Billy the Kid]] is shot and killed by [[Pat Garrett]] outside [[Fort Sumner]].))
Some((Date(14,July,1900),Armies of the [[Eight-Nation Alliance]] [[Siege of the International Legations|capture]] [[Tianjin|Tientsin]] during the [[Boxer Rebellion]].))
Some((Date(14,July,1902),[[St Mark's Campanile|The Campanile]] in [[Piazza San Marco|St. Mark's Square]], [[Venice]] collapses, also demolishing the loggetta.))
Some((Date(14,July,1911),[[Harry Atwood]], an exhibition pilot for the [[Wright brothers]] lands his airplane at the [[South Lawn (White House)|South Lawn]] of the White House. He is later awarded a [[Gold medal]] from U.S. President [[William Howard Taft]] for this feat.))
Some((Date(14,July,1916),Start of the [[Battle of Delville Wood]] as an action within the [[Battle of the Somme]], which was to last until 3 September 1916.))

Some((Date(16,July,1054),Three Roman [[Legatus|legates]] break relations between [[Western Christianity|Western]] and [[Eastern Christianity|Eastern Christian Churches]] through the act of placing an invalidly-issued [[Papal bull]] of [[Excommunication]] on the altar of [[Hagia Sophia]] during Saturday afternoon divine liturgy. Historians frequently describe the event as the start of the [[East–West Schism]].))
Some((Date(16,July,1212),[[Battle of Las Navas de Tolosa]]: After [[Pope Innocent III]] calls European knights to a [[Crusades|crusade]], forces of Kings [[Alfonso VIII of Castile]], [[Sancho VII of Navarre]], [[Peter II of Aragon]] and [[Afonso II of Portugal]] defeat those of the [[Berbers|Berber]] [[Muslim]] leader [[Almohad Caliphate|Almohad]], thus marking a significant turning point in the ''[[Reconquista]]'' and in the [[Spain in the Middle Ages|medieval history of Spain]].))

Some((Date(17,July,1944),[[Port Chicago disaster]]: Near the [[San Francisco Bay]], two ships laden with [[ammunition]] for the war explode in [[Port Chicago, California]], killing 320.))

Some((Date(17,July,1953),The largest number of United States [[midshipman]] casualties in a single event results from an [[USMC R4Q NROTC crash|aircraft crash]] in Florida killing 44.))

Some((Date(17,July,1962),[[Nuclear weapons testing]]: The "Small Boy" test shot [[Little Feller (nuclear tests)|Little Feller I]] becomes the last atmospheric test detonation at the [[Nevada National Security Site]].))

Some((Date(17,July,1976),[[East Timor]] is [[annexation|annexed]], and becomes the 27th [[Provinces of Indonesia|province]] of [[Indonesia]].))
Some((Date(17,July,1979),[[Nicaragua]]n dictator General [[Anastasio Somoza Debayle]] resigns and flees to [[Miami]], [[Florida]].))
Some((Date(17,July,1981),The opening of the [[Humber Bridge]] by Queen [[Elizabeth II]] in England.))
Some((Date(17,July,1984),The national drinking age in the United States was [[National Minimum Drinking Age Act|changed]] from 18 to 21.))
Some((Date(17,July,1985),Founding of the [[Eureka (organization)|EUREKA Network]] by former head of states [[François Mitterrand]] (France) and [[Helmut Kohl]] (Germany).))

Some((Date(17,July,1998),[[1998 Papua New Guinea earthquake|Papua New Guinea earthquake]]: A [[tsunami]] triggered by an undersea earthquake destroys ten villages in [[Papua New Guinea]] killing an estimated 3,183, leaving 2,000 more unaccounted for and thousands more homeless.))

Some((Date(21,July,1904),[[Louis Rigolly]], a Frenchman, becomes the first man to break the {{convert|100|mph|0|abbr=on}} barrier on land. He drove a 15-liter [[Gobron-Brillié]] in [[Ostend]], Belgium.))
Some((Date(21,July,1907),The passenger steamer [[SS Columbia (1880)|SS ''Columbia'']] collides with the steam schooner ''San Pedro'' off [[Shelter Cove, California]], causing the ''Columbia'' to sink killing 88 people.))

Some((Date(21,July,1919),The [[Airship|dirigible]] ''[[Wingfoot Air Express crash|Wingfoot Air Express]]'' crashes into the Illinois Trust and Savings Building in [[Chicago]], killing 12 people.))
Some((Date(21,July,1925),[[Scopes Trial]]: In [[Dayton, Tennessee]], high school biology teacher [[John T. Scopes]] is found guilty of teaching [[evolution]] in class and fined $100.))
Some((Date(21,July,1944),[[World War II]]: [[Battle of Guam (1944)|Battle of Guam]]: American troops land on [[Guam]] starting the battle. It would end on [[August 10]].))

Some((Date(21,July,1959),{{Ship|NS|Savannah}}, the first [[nuclear marine propulsion|nuclear-powered]] cargo-passenger ship, is [[ship naming and launching|launched]] as a showcase for [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]]'s "[[Atoms for Peace]]" initiative.))

Some((Date(21,July,1970),After 11 years of construction, the [[Aswan Dam|Aswan High Dam]] in [[Egypt]] is completed.))
Some((Date(21,July,1972),[[The Troubles]]: [[Bloody Friday (1972)|Bloody Friday]]: The [[Provisional Irish Republican Army|Provisional IRA]] detonate 22 bombs in central [[Belfast|Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom]] in the space of 80 minutes, killing nine and injuring 130.))
Some((Date(21,July,1973),In the [[Lillehammer affair]] in Norway, [[Israel]]i [[Mossad]] agents kill a waiter whom they mistakenly thought was involved in the 1972 [[Munich massacre|Munich Olympics Massacre]].))

Some((Date(21,July,1995),[[Third Taiwan Strait Crisis]]: The [[People's Liberation Army]] begins firing missiles into the waters north of [[Taiwan]].))
Some((Date(21,July,2001),At the conclusion of a fireworks display on Okura Beach in [[Akashi, Hyōgo]], Japan, [[Akashi pedestrian bridge accident|11 people are killed and more than 120 are injured]] when a pedestrian footbridge connecting the beach to JR [[Asagiri Station (Hyōgo)|Asagiri Station]] becomes overcrowded and people leaving the event fall down in a domino effect.))

Some((Date(22,July,1706),The [[Acts of Union 1707]] are agreed upon by commissioners from the [[Kingdom of England]] and the [[Kingdom of Scotland]], which, when passed by each countries' Parliaments, led to the creation of the [[Kingdom of Great Britain]].))
Some((Date(22,July,1793),[[Alexander Mackenzie (explorer)|Alexander Mackenzie]] reaches the Pacific Ocean becoming the first recorded human to complete a transcontinental crossing of Canada.))
Some((Date(22,July,1796),Surveyors of the [[Connecticut Land Company]] name an area in [[Ohio]] "[[Cleveland]]" after Gen. [[Moses Cleaveland]], the superintendent of the surveying party.))
Some((Date(22,July,1797),[[Battle of Santa Cruz de Tenerife (1797)|Battle of Santa Cruz de Tenerife]]: Battle between Spanish and British naval forces during the [[French Revolutionary Wars]]. During the Battle, Rear-Admiral [[Horatio Nelson, 1st Viscount Nelson|Nelson]] is wounded in the arm and the arm had to be partially amputated.))
Some((Date(22,July,1802),Emperor [[Gia Long]] conquers [[Hanoi]] and unified [[Viet Nam]], which had experienced centuries of feudal warfare.))

Some((Date(22,July,1894),The first ever motor race is held in France between the cities of [[Paris–Rouen (motor race)|Paris and Rouen]]. The fastest finisher was the Comte [[Jules-Albert de Dion]], but the 'official' victory was awarded to [[Albert Lemaître]] driving his 3&nbsp;hp petrol engined [[Peugeot]].))

Serbia accepts all but one of those demands and Austria declares war on [[July 28]].))

Some((Date(23,July,1968),[[Glenville shootout]]: In [[Cleveland|Cleveland, Ohio]], a violent shootout between a Black Militant organization and the [[Cleveland Division of Police|Cleveland Police Department]] occurs. During the shootout, a riot begins and lasts for five days.))

Celebrations of this event include the [[Pioneer Day (Utah)|Pioneer Day]] [[Utah]] state holiday and the [[Days of '47 Parade]].))

Some((Date(24,July,1901),[[O. Henry]] is released from prison in [[Columbus, Ohio]] after serving three years for [[embezzlement]] from a bank.))
Some((Date(24,July,1910),The [[Ottoman Empire]] captures the city of [[Shkodër]], putting down the [[Albanian Revolt of 1910]].))

Some((Date(24,July,1931),A fire at a home for the elderly in [[Pittsburgh]] kills 48 people.))
Some((Date(24,July,1935),The [[Dust Bowl]] heat wave reaches its peak, sending temperatures to 109°F (43°C) in [[Chicago]] and 104°F (40°C) in [[Milwaukee]].))

Some((Date(24,July,1938),First ascent of the [[Eiger]] north face.))
Some((Date(24,July,1943),[[World War II]]: [[Bombing of Hamburg in World War II|Operation Gomorrah]] begins: British and Canadian aeroplanes bomb [[Hamburg]] by night, and American planes by day. By the end of the operation in [[November]], 9,000 tons of explosives will have killed more than 30,000 people and destroyed 280,000 buildings.))

Some((Date(24,July,1963),The ship ''[[Bluenose II]]'' was launched in [[Lunenburg, Nova Scotia]]. The schooner is a major Canadian symbol.))
Some((Date(24,July,1966),[[Michael Pelkey]] makes the first [[BASE jumping|BASE jump]] from [[El Capitan]] along with Brian Schubert. Both came out with broken bones. BASE jumping has now been banned from El Cap.))
Some((Date(24,July,1967),During an official state visit to Canada, French President [[Charles de Gaulle]] declares to a crowd of over 100,000 in [[Montreal]]: ''[[Vive le Québec libre]]!'' ("Long live free Quebec!"). The statement, interpreted as support for [[Quebec sovereignty movement|Quebec independence]], delighted many [[French-speaking Quebecer|Quebecers]] but angered the Canadian government and many [[English Canada|English Canadians]].))

Some((Date(24,July,1972),[[Bugojno group]] is caught by Yugoslav security forces.))

Some((Date(24,July,1977),End of a four day long [[Libyan–Egyptian War]].))
Some((Date(24,July,1980),The [[Quietly Confident Quartet]] of [[Australia at the 1980 Summer Olympics|Australia]] wins the [[Swimming at the 1980 Summer Olympics – Men's 4 × 100 metre medley relay|Men's 4 x 100 metre medley relay]] at the [[1980 Summer Olympics|Moscow Olympics]], the only time the United States has not won the event at Olympic level.))
Some((Date(24,July,1982),Heavy rain causes a mudslide that destroys a bridge at [[Nagasaki]], Japan, killing 299.))
Some((Date(24,July,1983),The [[Black July]] anti-Tamil riots begin in [[Sri Lanka]], killing between 400 and 3,000. Black July is generally regarded as the beginning of the [[Sri Lankan Civil War]].))

Some((Date(24,July,1998),[[United States Capitol shooting incident (1998)|Russell Eugene Weston, Jr.]] bursts into the [[United States Capitol]] and opens fire killing two police officers. He is later ruled to be incompetent to stand trial.))
Some((Date(24,July,2001),[[Simeon Saxe-Coburg-Gotha]], the last [[List of Bulgarian monarchs|Tsar]] of [[Bulgaria]] when he was a child, is sworn in as [[Prime Minister of Bulgaria]], becoming the first monarch in history to regain political power through democratic [[election]] to a different office.))
Some((Date(24,July,2002),[[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrat]] [[James Traficant]] is expelled from the [[United States House of Representatives]] on a vote of 420–1.))
Some((Date(24,July,2011),[[ISDB|Digital switchover]] [[Analog shutdown|is completed]] in 44 of the 47 [[Japanese prefectures|prefectures]] of [[Japan]], with [[Iwate Prefecture|Iwate]], [[Miyagi Prefecture|Miyagi]], and [[Fukushima Prefecture|Fukushima]] television stations terminating [[NTSC-J|analog broadcasting operations]] later as a result of the [[2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami|Tōhoku earthquake]].))
Some((Date(24,July,2014),[[Air Algérie Flight 5017]] loses contact with air traffic controllers 50 minutes after takeoff. It was travelling between [[Ouagadougou]], [[Burkina Faso]] and [[Algiers]] with 116 people on board. The wreckage is later found in [[Mali]].

Some((Date(25,July,1609),The English ship ''[[Sea Venture]]'', en route to [[Colony of Virginia|Virginia]], is deliberately driven ashore during a storm at [[Bermuda]] to prevent its sinking; the survivors go on to found a new colony there.))

Some((Date(25,July,1722),[[Father Rale's War|Dummer's War]] begins along the [[Maine]]-[[Massachusetts]] border.))
Some((Date(25,July,1755),[[British Empire|British]] governor [[Charles Lawrence (British Army officer)|Charles Lawrence]] and the [[Nova Scotia]] Council order the [[Expulsion of the Acadians|deportation]] of the [[Acadians]]. Thousands of Acadians are sent to the British Colonies in America, France and England. Some later move to [[Louisiana]], while others resettle in [[New Brunswick]].))

Some((Date(25,July,1797),[[Horatio Nelson, 1st Viscount Nelson|Horatio Nelson]] loses more than 300 men and his right arm during the failed conquest attempt of [[Tenerife]] (Spain).))

Some((Date(27,July,1983),[[Black July]]: Eighteen [[Sri Lankan Tamil people|Tamil]] political prisoners at the [[Welikada]] [[Welikada Prison|high security prison]] in [[Colombo]] are [[Welikada prison massacre|massacred]] by [[Sinhalese people|Sinhalese]] prisoners, the second such massacre in two days.))

Some((Date(27,July,1990),The [[Supreme Soviet]] of the [[Byelorussian Soviet Socialist Republic|Belarusian Soviet Republic]] declares independence of [[Belarus]] from the [[Soviet Union]]. Until [[1996]] the day is celebrated as the Independence Day of Belarus; after a [[Belarusian referendum, 1996|referendum]] held that year the celebration of [[independence]] is moved to [[June 3]].))
Some((Date(27,July,1995),The [[Korean War Veterans Memorial]] is dedicated in [[Washington, D.C.]].))
Some((Date(27,July,1996),[[Centennial Olympic Park bombing]]: In [[Atlanta|Atlanta, United States]], a [[pipe bomb]] explodes at [[Centennial Olympic Park]] during the [[1996 Summer Olympics]]. One woman (Alice Hawthorne) is killed, and a cameraman suffers a heart attack fleeing the scene. One hundred eleven are injured.))
Some((Date(27,July,1997),About 50 people are killed in the [[Si Zerrouk massacre]] in [[Algeria]].))
Some((Date(27,July,2002),[[Sknyliv air show disaster|Ukraine airshow disaster]]: A [[Sukhoi Su-27]] fighter crashes during an air show at [[Lviv]], [[Ukraine]] killing 85 and injuring more than 100 others, the largest air show disaster in history.))
Some((Date(27,July,2005),[[STS-114]]: [[NASA]] grounds the [[Space Shuttle]], pending an investigation of the continuing problem with the shedding of foam insulation from the [[Space Shuttle external tank|external fuel tank]]. During ascent, the external tank of the [[Space Shuttle Discovery]] sheds a piece of foam slightly smaller than the piece that caused the [[Space Shuttle Columbia disaster]]; this foam does not strike the [[spacecraft]].))
Some((Date(27,July,2007),[[2007 Phoenix news helicopter collision|Phoenix News Helicopter Collision]]: News helicopters from [[Phoenix, Arizona]] television stations [[KNXV-TV|KNXV]] and [[KTVK]] collide over [[Steele Indian School Park]] in central Phoenix while covering a police chase.))
Some((Date(27,July,2012),The [[2012 Summer Olympics opening ceremony|opening ceremony]] for the [[2012 Summer Olympics|Summer Olympics]] takes place in London.))
Some((Date(27,July,2015),At least 7 people are killed and many injured after gunmen [[2015 Gurdaspur attack|attack]] an Indian police station in [[Punjab, India|Punjab]].

Some((Date(28,July,1866),At the age of 18, [[Vinnie Ream]] becomes the first and youngest female artist to receive a commission from the United States government for a statue (of [[Abraham Lincoln]]).))

Some((Date(28,July,1932),U.S. President [[Herbert Hoover]] orders the United States Army to forcibly evict the "[[Bonus Army]]" of World War I veterans gathered in Washington, D.C.))
Some((Date(28,July,1933),[[Diplomacy#Diplomatic relations|Diplomatic relations]] between the [[Soviet Union]] and Spain are established.))
Some((Date(28,July,1935),First flight of the [[Boeing B-17 Flying Fortress]].))
Some((Date(28,July,1938),''[[Hawaii Clipper]]'' disappears between [[Guam]] and [[Manila]] as the first loss of an airliner in trans-Pacific ''[[China Clipper]]'' service.))
Some((Date(28,July,1942),[[World War II]]: Soviet leader [[Joseph Stalin]] issues [[Order No. 227]]. In response to alarming [[Nazi Germany|German]] advances, all those who retreat or otherwise leave their positions without orders to do so are to be tried in a military court, with punishment ranging from duty in a [[shtrafbat]] battalion, imprisonment in a [[Gulag]], or execution.))
Some((Date(28,July,1943),World War II: [[Bombing of Hamburg in World War II|Operation Gomorrah]]: The Royal Air Force bombs [[Hamburg|Hamburg, Germany]] causing a [[firestorm]] that kills 42,000 German civilians.))

Some((Date(28,July,1955),The [[Union Mundial pro Interlingua]] is founded at the first [[Interlingua]] congress in [[Tours|Tours, France]].))
Some((Date(28,July,1957),Heavy rain and a mudslide in [[Isahaya, Nagasaki|Isahaya]], western [[Kyushu|Kyushu, Japan]], kills 992.))
Some((Date(28,July,1965),[[Vietnam War]]: U.S. President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] announces his order to increase the number of United States troops in [[South Vietnam]] from 75,000 to 125,000.))

Some((Date(28,July,1974),[[Spetsgruppa A]], Russia's elite special force, was formed.))
Some((Date(28,July,1976),The [[1976 Tangshan earthquake|Tangshan earthquake]] measuring between 7.8 and 8.2 [[moment magnitude scale|moment magnitude]] flattens [[Tangshan]] in the People's Republic of China, killing 242,769 and injuring 164,851.))

Some((Date(28,July,1993),[[Andorra]] joins the [[United Nations]].))

Some((Date(29,July,1907),Sir [[Robert Baden-Powell, 1st Baron Baden-Powell|Robert Baden-Powell]] sets up the [[Brownsea Island Scout camp]] in [[Poole Harbour]] on the south coast of England. The camp runs from August 1 to August 9, 1907, and is regarded as the foundation of the [[Scouting]] movement.))

Some((Date(31,July,1972),[[The Troubles]]: In [[Operation Motorman]], the British Army re-takes the urban [[no-go area]]s of [[Northern Ireland]]. It is the biggest British military operation since the [[Suez Crisis]] of 1956, and the biggest in Ireland since the [[Irish War of Independence]]. Later that day, nine civilians are [[Claudy bombing|killed by car bombs]] in the village of [[Claudy]].))

Some((Date(4,August,1873),[[American Indian Wars]]: While protecting a railroad survey party in [[Montana]], the [[7th Cavalry Regiment|United States 7th Cavalry]], under [[Lieutenant colonel (United States)|Lieutenant Colonel]] [[George Armstrong Custer]] clashes for the first time with the [[Cheyenne]] and [[Lakota people]] near the [[Tongue River (Montana)|Tongue River]]; only one man on each side is killed.))
Some((Date(4,August,1889), [[The Great Fire (Spokane)|The Great Fire]] of [[Spokane, Washington]] destroys some 32 blocks of the city, prompting a mass rebuilding project.))
Some((Date(4,August,1892),The father and stepmother of [[Lizzie Borden]] are found murdered in their [[Fall River, Massachusetts]] home.))
Some((Date(4,August,1902),The [[Greenwich foot tunnel]] under the [[River Thames]] opens.))
Some((Date(4,August,1906),[[Central railway station, Sydney]] opens.))
Some((Date(4,August,1914),[[World War I]]: Germany invades Belgium. In response, Belgium and the United Kingdom declare war on Germany. The United States declares its [[Neutrality (international relations)|neutrality]].))
Some((Date(4,August,1915),World War I: The [[12th Army (German Empire)|German 12th Army]] occupies [[Warsaw]] during the [[Gorlice–Tarnów Offensive]] and the [[Great Retreat (Russian)|Great Retreat of 1915]].))
Some((Date(4,August,1924),[[Diplomacy#Diplomatic relations|Diplomatic relations]] between Mexico and the [[Soviet Union]] are established.))
Some((Date(4,August,1936),[[List of Prime Ministers of Greece|Prime Minister of Greece]] [[Ioannis Metaxas]] suspends [[Hellenic Parliament|parliament]] and the [[Constitution of Greece|Constitution]] and establishes the [[4th of August Regime]].))
Some((Date(4,August,1944),[[The Holocaust]]: A tip from a Dutch informer leads the [[Gestapo]] to a sealed-off area in an [[Amsterdam]] warehouse, where they find and arrest Jewish diarist [[Anne Frank]], her family, and four others.))
Some((Date(4,August,1946),An [[1946 Dominican Republic earthquake|earthquake of magnitude 8.0]] hits northern [[Dominican Republic]]. One hundred are killed and 20,000 are left homeless.))
Some((Date(4,August,1947),The [[Supreme Court of Japan]] is established.))
Some((Date(4,August,1958),The [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] is published for the first time.))
Some((Date(4,August,1964),[[African-American Civil Rights Movement (1954–68)|American civil rights movement]]: [[Civil and political rights|Civil rights]] workers [[Michael Schwerner]], [[Andrew Goodman]] and [[James Chaney]] are found dead in [[Mississippi]] after disappearing on [[June 21]].))
Some((Date(4,August,1965),The [[Constitution of the Cook Islands]] comes into force, giving the [[Cook Islands]] self-governing status within New Zealand.))
Some((Date(4,August,1969),[[Vietnam War]]: At the apartment of French intermediary [[Jean Sainteny]] in Paris, American representative [[Henry Kissinger]] and [[North Vietnam]]ese representative [[Xuân Thuỷ]] begin secret peace negotiations. The negotiations will eventually fail.))
Some((Date(4,August,1974),A [[Italicus Express bombing 1974|bomb]] explodes in the ''Italicus Express'' train at [[San Benedetto Val di Sambro]], Italy, killing 12 people and wounding 22.))
Some((Date(4,August,1975),The [[Japanese Red Army]] takes [[1975 AIA building hostage crisis|more than 50 hostages]] at the AIA Building housing several embassies in [[Kuala Lumpur]], [[Malaysia]]. The hostages include the U.S. [[consul]] and the Swedish [[Chargé d'affaires]]. The gunmen win the release of five imprisoned comrades and fly with them to [[History of Libya under Muammar Gaddafi#Libyan Arab Republic (1969–1977)|Libya]].))
Some((Date(4,August,1977),[[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Jimmy Carter]] signs legislation creating the [[United States Department of Energy]].))
Some((Date(4,August,1984),The [[Republic of Upper Volta]] changes its name to [[Burkina Faso]].))
Some((Date(4,August,1987),The [[Federal Communications Commission]] rescinds the [[Fairness Doctrine]] which had required radio and television stations to present controversial issues "fairly".))
Some((Date(4,August,1991),The Greek cruise ship {{Ship|MTS|Oceanos}} sinks off the [[Eastern Cape|Wild Coast]] of South Africa.))
Some((Date(4,August,1993),A [[federal judge]] sentences [[Los Angeles Police Department]] officers [[Stacey Koon]] and [[Laurence Powell]] to 30 months in prison for violating motorist [[Rodney King]]'s [[Civil and political rights|civil rights]].))
Some((Date(4,August,1995),[[Operation Storm]] begins in [[Croatia]].))
Some((Date(4,August,2002),[[Soham murders]]: Ten-year-old school girls Jessica Chapman and Holly Wells go missing from the town of [[Soham]], [[Cambridgeshire]], United Kingdom.))
Some((Date(4,August,2006),A [[2006 Trincomalee massacre of NGO workers|massacre]] is carried out by [[Sri Lanka]]n government forces, killing 17 employees of the French [[International nongovernmental organization|INGO]] [[Action Against Hunger]] (known internationally as Action Contre la Faim, or ACF).))
Some((Date(4,August,2007),[[NASA]]'s ''[[Phoenix (spacecraft)|Phoenix]]'' spacecraft is launched.

Some((Date(5,August,1068),[[Byzantine–Norman wars]]: [[Italo-Norman]]s begin a [[Siege of Bari|nearly-three-year siege]] of [[Bari]].))
Some((Date(5,August,1100),[[Henry I of England|Henry I]] is crowned [[List of English monarchs|King of England]] in [[Westminster Abbey]].))
Some((Date(5,August,1278),The [[Siege of Algeciras (1278)|Siege of Algeciras]] ends in the context of the [[Spanish Reconquista]] pitting the forces of the [[Kingdom of Castile]] against the [[Emirate of Granada]]. The battle resulted in a Granadan victory.))
Some((Date(5,August,1305),[[William Wallace]], who led the Scottish resistance against England, is captured by the English near [[Glasgow]] and transported to London where he is put on trial and executed.))
Some((Date(5,August,1388),The [[Battle of Otterburn]], a border skirmish between the Scottish and the English in Northern England, is fought near [[Otterburn, Northumberland|Otterburn]].))
Some((Date(5,August,1583),Sir [[Humphrey Gilbert]] establishes the first English [[colony]] in North America, at what is now [[St. John's, Newfoundland and Labrador]].))
Some((Date(5,August,1600),The [[John Ruthven, 3rd Earl of Gowrie#Gowrie conspiracy|Gowrie Conspiracy]] against [[James VI and I|King James VI of Scotland]] (later to become King James I of England) takes place.))
Some((Date(5,August,1620),The ''[[Mayflower]]'' departs from [[Southampton|Southampton, England]] on its first attempt to reach North America.))
Some((Date(5,August,1689),One thousand five hundred [[Iroquois]] attack the village of [[Lachine, Quebec|Lachine]] in [[New France]].))
Some((Date(5,August,1716),The [[Battle of Petrovaradin]] takes place.))
Some((Date(5,August,1735),[[Freedom of the press]]: New York Weekly Journal writer [[John Peter Zenger]] is acquitted of [[seditious libel]] against the royal governor of New York, on the basis that what he had published was true.))
Some((Date(5,August,1763),[[Pontiac's War]]: [[Battle of Bushy Run]]: British forces led by [[Henry Bouquet]] defeat [[Chief Pontiac]]'s [[Native Americans in the United States|Indians]] at [[Battle of Bushy Run|Bushy Run]].))
Some((Date(5,August,1772),The [[First Partition of Poland]] begins.))
Some((Date(5,August,1781),The [[Battle of Dogger Bank (1781)|Battle of Dogger Bank]] takes place.))
Some((Date(5,August,1824),[[Greek War of Independence]]: [[Constantine Kanaris]] leads a Greek fleet to victory against Ottoman and Egyptian ships in the [[Battle of Samos (1824)|Battle of Samos]].))
Some((Date(5,August,1858),[[Cyrus West Field]] and others complete the first [[transatlantic telegraph cable]] after several unsuccessful attempts. It will operate for less than a month.))
Some((Date(5,August,1860),[[Charles XV of Sweden]] of Sweden-Norway is crowned king of Norway in [[Trondheim]].))
Some((Date(5,August,1861),[[American Civil War]]: In order to help pay for the war effort, the [[Federal government of the United States|United States government]] levies the first [[income tax]] as part of the [[Revenue Act of 1861]] (3% of all incomes over US $800; rescinded in [[1872]]).))
Some((Date(5,August,1862),American Civil War: [[Battle of Baton Rouge (1862)|Battle of Baton Rouge]]: Along the [[Mississippi River]] near [[Baton Rouge, Louisiana]], [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] troops attempt to take the city, but are driven back by fire from Union gunboats.))
Some((Date(5,August,1864),American Civil War: The [[Battle of Mobile Bay]] begins at [[Mobile Bay]] near [[Mobile, Alabama]], [[Admiral]] [[David Farragut]] leads a Union flotilla through Confederate defenses and seals one of the last major Southern ports.))
Some((Date(5,August,1874),Japan launches its [[postal savings system]], modeled after a similar system in the United Kingdom.))
Some((Date(5,August,1882),The [[Esso|Standard Oil of New Jersey]] is established.))
Some((Date(5,August,1884),The cornerstone for the [[Statue of Liberty]] is laid on [[Liberty Island|Bedloe's Island]] (now Liberty Island) in [[New York Harbor]].))
Some((Date(5,August,1888),[[Bertha Benz]] drives from [[Mannheim]] to [[Pforzheim]] and back in the first long distance automobile trip, commemorated as the [[Bertha Benz Memorial Route]] since 2008.))
Some((Date(5,August,1901),[[Peter O'Connor (athlete)|Peter O'Connor]] sets the first [[International Association of Athletics Federations|IAAF]] recognised [[long jump]] [[List of world records in athletics|world record]] of {{convert|24|ft|11.75|in|m|abbr=on}}.  The record will stand for 20 years.))
Some((Date(5,August,1906),[[Persian Constitutional Revolution]]: [[Mozaffar ad-Din Shah Qajar]], King of Iran, agrees to convert the government to a [[constitutional monarchy]].))
Some((Date(5,August,1914),[[World War I]]: The German [[minelayer]] {{SS|Königin Luise|1913|6}} lays a minefield about {{convert|40|mi|km}} off the [[Thames Estuary]] ([[Lowestoft]]). She is intercepted and sunk by the British light-cruiser {{HMS|Amphion|1911|6}}.))
Some((Date(5,August,1916),World War I: [[Battle of Romani]]: Allied forces, under the command of [[Archibald Murray]], defeat an attacking [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman army]] under the command of [[Friedrich Freiherr Kress von Kressenstein]], securing the [[Suez Canal]] and beginning the Ottoman retreat from the [[Sinai Peninsula]].))
Some((Date(5,August,1925),[[Plaid Cymru]] is formed with the aim of disseminating knowledge of the [[Welsh language]] that is at the time in danger of dying out.))
Some((Date(5,August,1926),[[Harry Houdini]] performs his greatest feat, spending 91 minutes underwater in a sealed tank before escaping.))
Some((Date(5,August,1940),[[World War II]]: The [[Soviet Union]] formally [[Soviet occupation of Latvia in 1940#1940-1941: The first Soviet occupation|annexes]] [[Latvia]].))
Some((Date(5,August,1941),World War II: The [[Battle of Smolensk (1941)|Battle of Smolensk]] concludes with Germany capturing about 300,000 Soviet [[Red Army]] prisoners.))
Some((Date(5,August,1943),World War II: [[Anti-Nazi]] [[Widerstand|resistance]] fighter [[Eva-Maria Buch]] guillotined at [[Plötzensee Prison]], Berlin.   ))
Some((Date(5,August,1944),World War II: Possibly the biggest prison breakout in history occurs as 545 [[Japanese people|Japanese]] [[Prisoner of war|POW]]s [[Cowra breakout|attempt to escape]] outside the town of [[Cowra]], [[New South Wales]], Australia.))
Some((Date(5,August,1949),In [[Ecuador]], [[1949 Ambato earthquake|an earthquake]] destroys 50 towns and kills more than 6,000.))
Some((Date(5,August,1957),''[[American Bandstand]]'', a show dedicated to the teenage "baby-boomers" by playing the songs and showing popular dances of the time, debuts on the [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] television network.))
Some((Date(5,August,1958),[[Herbert Hoover]] eclipses [[John Adams]] as having the longest retirement of any former U.S President until that time.  Hoover would live another six years, his record 31 years 7 months 16 days retirement has since been eclipsed by Jimmy Carter.))
Some((Date(5,August,1960),[[Burkina Faso]], then known as [[Republic of Upper Volta|Upper Volta]], becomes independent from France.))
Some((Date(5,August,1962),[[Apartheid]] in South Africa: [[Nelson Mandela]] is jailed. He would not be released until [[1990]].))
Some((Date(5,August,1963),The United States, the United Kingdom, and the Soviet Union sign a [[Partial Nuclear Test Ban Treaty|nuclear test ban treaty]].))
Some((Date(5,August,1964),[[Vietnam War]]: [[Operation Pierce Arrow]]: American aircraft from carriers {{USS|Ticonderoga|CV-14|6}} and {{USS|Constellation|CV-64|6}} bomb [[North Vietnam]] in retaliation for strikes against U.S. destroyers in the [[Gulf of Tonkin]].))
Some((Date(5,August,1965),The [[Indo-Pakistani War of 1965]] begins as Pakistani soldiers cross the [[Line of Control]] dressed as locals.))
Some((Date(5,August,1969),[[Mariner program]]: ''[[Mariner 6 and 7|Mariner 7]]'' makes its closest fly-by of [[Mars]] (3,524 kilometers).))
Some((Date(5,August,1971),The first [[Pacific Islands Forum]] (then known as the "South Pacific Forum") is held in [[Wellington]], New Zealand, with the aim of enhancing cooperation between the independent countries of the Pacific Ocean.))
Some((Date(5,August,1974),[[Vietnam War]]: The [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] places a $1 billion limit on military aid to [[South Vietnam]].))
Some((Date(5,August,1979),In [[Afghanistan]], [[Afghanistan Liberation Organization|Maoists]] undertake an attempted military uprising.))
Some((Date(5,August,1981),President [[Ronald Reagan]] [[Professional Air Traffic Controllers Organization (1968)|fires]] 11,359 [[Strike action|striking]] air-traffic controllers who ignored his order for them to return to work.))
Some((Date(5,August,1989),General elections are held in [[Nicaragua]] with the [[Sandinista National Liberation Front]] winning a majority.))
Some((Date(5,August,1995),[[Yugoslav Wars]]: The city of [[Knin]], Croatia, a significant [[Serbs|Serb]] stronghold, is captured by [[Croatia]]n forces during [[Operation Storm]]. The date is celebrated in Croatia as [[Victory Day (Croatia)|Victory Day]].))
Some((Date(5,August,2003),A [[2003 Marriott Hotel bombing|car bomb]] explodes in the [[Indonesia]]n capital of [[Jakarta]] outside the [[Marriott International|Marriott Hotel]] killing 12 and injuring 150.))
Some((Date(5,August,2010),The [[2010 Copiapó mining accident|Copiapó mining accident]] occurs, trapping 33 Chilean miners approximately {{convert|2,300|ft|m|abbr=on}} below the ground.))

Some((Date(5,August,2015),The [[2015 Gold King Mine waste water spill|Gold King Mine waste water spill]] releases 3 million gallons of [[Toxic heavy metal|heavy metal toxin]] tailings and waste water into the [[Animas River]] in Colorado.

Some((Date(6,August,1870),[[Franco-Prussian War]]: The [[Battle of Spicheren]] is fought, resulting in a [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussian]] victory.))

Some((Date(6,August,1914),[[World War I]]: [[First Battle of the Atlantic]]: Two days after the United Kingdom had declared war on Germany over the German invasion of Belgium, ten German [[U-boat]]s leave their base in [[Heligoland]] to attack [[Royal Navy]] warships in the [[North Sea]].))
Some((Date(6,August,1915),World War I: [[Battle of Sari Bair]]: The [[Allies of World War I|Allies]] mount a diversionary attack timed to coincide with a major Allied landing of reinforcements at [[Suvla|Suvla Bay]].))
Some((Date(6,August,1917),World War I: [[Battle of Mărășești]] between the [[Romania]]n and German armies begins.))
Some((Date(6,August,1926),[[Gertrude Ederle]] becomes the first woman to swim across the [[English Channel]].))
Some((Date(6,August,1930),Judge [[Joseph Force Crater]] steps into a taxi in New York and disappears never to be seen again.))
Some((Date(6,August,1940),[[Estonia]] was illegally annexed by the [[Soviet Union]].))
Some((Date(6,August,1942),Queen [[Wilhelmina of the Netherlands]] becomes the first reigning queen to address a joint session of the [[United States Congress]].))
Some((Date(6,August,1944),The [[Warsaw Uprising]] occurs on [[August 1]]. It is brutally suppressed and all able-bodied men in Kraków are detained afterwards to prevent a similar uprising, the [[Kraków Uprising (1944)|Kraków Uprising]], that was planned but never carried out.))
Some((Date(6,August,1945),[[World War II]]: [[Hiroshima]], Japan is [[Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki|devastated]] when the [[nuclear weapon|atomic bomb]] "[[Little Boy]]" is dropped by the United States [[Boeing B-29 Superfortress|B-29]] ''[[Enola Gay]]''. Around 70,000 people are killed instantly, and some tens of thousands die in subsequent years from burns and [[Acute radiation syndrome|radiation poisoning]].))
Some((Date(6,August,1956),After going bankrupt in [[1955]], the American broadcaster [[DuMont Television Network]] makes its final broadcast, a boxing match from [[St. Nicholas Rink|St. Nicholas Arena]] in New York in the ''[[Boxing from St. Nicholas Arena]]'' series.))

Some((Date(6,August,1976),[[Zulfikar Ali Bhutto]] lays the foundation stone of [[Port Qasim]], [[Karachi]].))
Some((Date(6,August,1986),A low-pressure system that redeveloped off the [[New South Wales]] coast dumps a record 328 millimeters (13&nbsp;inches) of rain in a day on [[Sydney|Sydney, New South Wales]], Australia.))
Some((Date(6,August,1988),The [[Tompkins Square Park Riot (1988)|Tompkins Square Park Riot]] in New York City spurs a reform of the [[New York City Police Department|NYPD]], held responsible for the event.))
Some((Date(6,August,1990),[[Gulf War]]: The [[United Nations Security Council]] orders a global [[Embargo|trade embargo]] against [[Iraq]] in response to Iraq's invasion of [[Kuwait]].))
Some((Date(6,August,1991),[[Tim Berners-Lee]] releases files describing his idea for the [[World Wide Web]]. WWW debuts as a publicly available service on the [[Internet]].))
Some((Date(6,August,1996),[[NASA]] announces that the [[Allan Hills 84001|ALH 84001]] meteorite, thought to originate from [[Mars]], contains evidence of primitive life-forms.))
Some((Date(6,August,1997),[[Korean Air Flight 801]] crashed at [[Nimitz Hill]], [[Guam]] killing 228 of 254 people on board.<!--Resulted in notable deaths-->))
Some((Date(6,August,2001),[[Erwadi fire incident]], 28 mentally ill persons tied to chain were burnt to death at a faith based institution at [[Erwadi]], [[Tamil Nadu]].))
Some((Date(6,August,2008),A military junta led by [[Mohamed Ould Abdel Aziz]] stages a [[2008 Mauritanian coup d'état|coup d'état]] in [[Mauritania]], overthrowing president [[Sidi Ould Cheikh Abdallahi]].))
Some((Date(6,August,2010),[[2010 Ladakh floods|Flash floods]] across a large part of [[Jammu and Kashmir]], India, damages 71 towns and kills at least 255 people.))
Some((Date(6,August,2011),A march in protest of the [[death of Mark Duggan]] in [[Tottenham]], London, ends in a riot, sparking off a [[2011 England riots|wave of rioting]] throughout the country over the following four nights.))
Some((Date(6,August,2012),[[NASA]]'s [[Curiosity rover]] [[Mars Science Laboratory|lands]] on the surface of [[Mars]].))
Some((Date(6,August,2015),A [[2015 Abha mosque bombing|suicide bomb attack]] kills at least 15 people at a mosque in the south-western Saudi city of [[Abha]].

Some((Date(7,August,1714),The [[Battle of Gangut]]: The first important victory of the [[Russian Navy]].))
Some((Date(7,August,1782),[[George Washington]] orders the creation of the [[Badge of Military Merit]] to honor soldiers wounded in battle. It is later renamed to the more poetic [[Purple Heart]].))
Some((Date(7,August,1789),The [[United States Department of War]] is established.))

Some((Date(7,August,1794),[[President of the United States|U.S. President]] George Washington invokes the [[Militia Acts of 1792]] to suppress the [[Whiskey Rebellion]] in [[western Pennsylvania]].))
Some((Date(7,August,1819),[[Simón Bolívar]] triumphs over Spain in the [[Battle of Boyacá]].))
Some((Date(7,August,1858),The first [[Australian rules football]] match is played between [[Melbourne Grammar]] and Scotch College. ))
Some((Date(7,August,1879),The opening of the [[Openshaw Citadel|Poor Man's Palace]] in [[Manchester|Manchester, England]].))
Some((Date(7,August,1890),[[Anna Månsdotter]] becomes the last woman in Sweden to be executed, for the 1889 [[Yngsjö murder]].))
Some((Date(7,August,1909),[[Alice Huyler Ramsey]] and three friends become the first women to complete a transcontinental auto trip, taking 59 days to travel from [[New York City|New York, New York]] to [[San Francisco|San Francisco, California]].))
Some((Date(7,August,1927),The [[Peace Bridge]] opens between [[Fort Erie, Ontario]] and [[Buffalo, New York]].))
Some((Date(7,August,1930),The last confirmed [[lynching]] of blacks in the Northern United States occurs in [[Marion, Indiana]]. Two men, [[Thomas Shipp and Abram Smith]], are killed.))
Some((Date(7,August,1933),The [[Simele massacre]]: The [[Politics of Iraq|Iraqi government]] [[Simele massacre|slaughters]] over 3,000 [[Assyrian people|Assyrians]] in the village of [[Simele]]. The day becomes known as Assyrian Martyrs Day.))
Some((Date(7,August,1938),[[The Holocaust]]: The building of [[Mauthausen-Gusen concentration camp|Mauthausen concentration camp]] begins.))
Some((Date(7,August,1940),[[World War II]]: [[Alsace-Lorraine]] is annexed by the Third Reich.))
Some((Date(7,August,1942),World War II: The [[Guadalcanal Campaign|Battle of Guadalcanal]] begins as the [[United States Marine Corps|United States Marines]] initiate the first American offensive of the war with landings on [[Guadalcanal]] and [[Battle of Tulagi and Gavutu–Tanambogo|Tulagi]] in the [[Solomon Islands]].))
Some((Date(7,August,1944),[[IBM]] dedicates the first program-controlled [[calculator]], the Automatic Sequence Controlled Calculator (known best as the [[Harvard Mark I]]).))
Some((Date(7,August,1946),The government of the [[Soviet Union]] presented a note to its [[Turkey|Turkish counterparts]] which refuted the latter's sovereignty over the [[Turkish Straits]], thus beginning the [[Turkish Straits crisis]].))
Some((Date(7,August,1947),[[Thor Heyerdahl]]'s [[Ochroma pyramidale|balsa wood]] raft the [[Kon-Tiki]], smashes into the [[reef]] at [[Raroia]] in the [[Tuamotus|Tuamotu Islands]] after a 101-day, {{Convert|7000|km|mi}} journey across the Pacific Ocean in an attempt to prove that pre-historic peoples could have traveled from South America.))
Some((Date(7,August,1955),[[Sony|Tokyo Telecommunications Engineering]], the precursor to [[Sony]], sells its first [[transistor radio]]s in Japan.))
Some((Date(7,August,1959),The [[Lincoln Memorial]] design on the U.S. [[Penny (United States coin)|penny]] goes into circulation. It replaces the "sheaves of wheat" design, and was minted until 2008.))
Some((Date(7,August,1960),[[Ivory Coast]] becomes independent from France.))
Some((Date(7,August,1962),Canadian-born American pharmacologist [[Frances Oldham Kelsey]] awarded the U.S. President's Award for Distinguished Federal Civilian Service for her refusal to authorize [[thalidomide]].))

Some((Date(7,August,1966),[[List of ethnic riots|Race riot]]s occur in [[Lansing, Michigan]].))

Some((Date(11,August,2012),At least 306 people are killed and 3,000 others injured in [[2012 East Azerbaijan earthquakes|a pair of earthquakes]] near [[Tabriz]], [[Iran]].))
Some((Date(11,August,2015),For the first time in [[Major League Baseball]] history, all 15 home teams won their game. Prior to this happening, the record was 12 which was reached over a century ago in 1914.

Some((Date(15,August,1534),[[Ignatius of Loyola]] and six classmates take initial vows, leading to the creation of the [[Society of Jesus]] in September 1540.))
Some((Date(15,August,1537),[[Asunción]], [[Paraguay]], is founded.))
Some((Date(15,August,1540),[[Arequipa]], [[Peru]], is founded.))

Some((Date(15,August,1599),[[Nine Years' War (Ireland)|Nine Years' War]]: [[Battle of Curlew Pass]] – Irish forces led by [[Hugh Roe O'Donnell]] successfully ambush English forces, led by Sir [[Conyers Clifford]], sent to relieve Collooney Castle.))
Some((Date(15,August,1695),French forces end the [[bombardment of Brussels]], leaving a third of the buildings in the city in ruins.))
Some((Date(15,August,1760),[[Seven Years' War]]: [[Battle of Liegnitz (1760)|Battle of Liegnitz]] – [[Frederick the Great]]'s victory over the [[Austrians]] under [[Ernst Gideon von Laudon]].))
Some((Date(15,August,1812),[[War of 1812]]: The [[Battle of Fort Dearborn]] is fought between United States troops and [[Potawatomi]] at what is now [[Chicago]].))

Some((Date(15,August,1843),The [[Cathedral of Our Lady of Peace]] in [[Honolulu|Honolulu, Hawaii]] is dedicated. Now the cathedral of the [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Honolulu]], it is the oldest [[Catholic Church|Roman Catholic]] [[cathedral]] in continuous use in the United States.))
Some((Date(15,August,1863),The [[Bombardment of Kagoshima|Anglo-Satsuma War]] begins between the [[Satsuma Domain]] of Japan and the United Kingdom (Traditional [[Japanese calendar|Japanese date]]: July 2, 1863).))
Some((Date(15,August,1869),The [[Government of Meiji Japan|Meiji government]] in Japan establishes six new ministries, including one for [[Shinto]].))
Some((Date(15,August,1893),[[Ibadan]] area becomes a British [[Protectorate]] after a treaty signed by Fijabi, the [[Olubadan|Baale of Ibadan]] with the British acting Governor of [[Lagos Colony|Lagos]], George C. Denton.))
Some((Date(15,August,1907),Ordination in Constantinople of Fr. [[Raphael Morgan]], the first African-American [[Eastern Orthodox Church|Orthodox]] priest, "Priest-Apostolic" to America and the West Indies.))
Some((Date(15,August,1914),A male servant of American [[architect]] [[Frank Lloyd Wright]] sets fire to the living quarters of the latter's [[Wisconsin]] home, [[Taliesin (studio)|Taliesin]], murders seven people and burns the living quarters to the ground.))
Some((Date(15,August,1915),A story in ''[[New York World]]'' newspaper reveals that the [[German Empire|Imperial German government]] had purchased excess [[phenol]] from [[Thomas Edison]] that could be used to make explosives for the war effort and [[Great Phenol Plot|diverted it]] to [[Bayer]] for [[aspirin]] production.))
Some((Date(15,August,1920),[[Polish–Soviet War]]: [[Battle of Warsaw (1920)|Battle of Warsaw]], so-called Miracle at the Vistula.))
Some((Date(15,August,1935),[[Will Rogers]] and [[Wiley Post]] are killed after their aircraft develops engine problems during takeoff in [[Barrow, Alaska]].))
Some((Date(15,August,1939),Thirteen [[Junkers Ju 87|Stukas]] dive into the ground during a disastrous air-practice at Neuhammer. There are no survivors.))
Some((Date(15,August,1940),An [[Kingdom of Italy|Italian]] submarine torpedoes and sinks the [[Greek cruiser Elli (1912)|Greek cruiser ''Elli'']] at [[Tinos]] harbor during peacetime, marking the most serious Italian provocation prior to the outbreak of the [[Greco-Italian War]] in October.))
Some((Date(15,August,1941),Corporal [[Josef Jakobs]] is executed by firing squad at the [[Tower of London]] at 07:12, making him the last person to be executed at the Tower for [[espionage]].))
Some((Date(15,August,1942),[[World War II]]: [[Operation Pedestal]]: The {{SS|Ohio}} reaches the island of [[Malta]] barely afloat carrying vital fuel supplies for the island's defenses.))
Some((Date(15,August,1944),World War II: [[Operation Dragoon]]: Allied forces land in [[southern France]].))
Some((Date(15,August,1945),[[Gyokuon-hoso|Effective surrender of Japan]] in World War II.))
Some((Date(15,August,1947),India gains [[Indian independence movement|Independence]] from [[British Raj|British rule]] after near 190 years of Crown rule and joins the [[Commonwealth of Nations]].))
Some((Date(15,August,1948),The [[South Korea|Republic of Korea]] is established south of the [[38th parallel north]].))
Some((Date(15,August,1952),[[Lynmouth Flood|A flash flood]] drenches the town of [[Lynmouth]], England, killing 34 people.))
Some((Date(15,August,1954),[[Alfredo Stroessner]] begins his dictatorship in [[Paraguay]].))
Some((Date(15,August,1960),[[Republic of the Congo]] ([[Brazzaville]]) becomes independent from [[French Fourth Republic|France]].))
Some((Date(15,August,1961),Border guard [[Conrad Schumann]] flees from [[East Germany]] while on duty guarding the construction of the [[Berlin Wall]].))
Some((Date(15,August,1962),[[James Joseph Dresnok]] defects to [[North Korea]] after running across the [[Korean Demilitarized Zone]]. Dresnok still resides in the capital, [[Pyongyang]].))
Some((Date(15,August,1963),Execution of [[Henry John Burnett]], the last man to be hanged in Scotland.))
Some((Date(15,August,1965),[[The Beatles]] play to nearly [[The Beatles' 1965 US tour|60,000 fans at Shea Stadium]] in New York City, an event later regarded as the birth of [[arena rock|stadium rock]].))
Some((Date(15,August,1969),the [[Woodstock|Woodstock Music & Art Fair]] opens in upstate New York, featuring some of the top rock musicians of the era.))
Some((Date(15,August,1970),[[Patricia Palinkas]] becomes the first woman to play professionally in an [[American football]] game.))
Some((Date(15,August,1971),President [[Richard Nixon]] completes the break from the [[gold standard]] by [[Nixon Shock|ending]] convertibility of the [[United States dollar]] into gold by foreign investors.))
Some((Date(15,August,1973),[[Vietnam War]]: The United States bombing of [[Cambodia]] ends.))
Some((Date(15,August,1974),[[Yuk Young-soo]], [[First Lady]] of South Korea, is killed during an apparent assassination attempt upon [[President of South Korea|President]], [[Park Chung-hee]].))
Some((Date(15,August,1975),[[Bangladeshi]] leader [[Sheikh Mujibur Rahman]] is killed along with most members of his family during a military coup.))
Some((Date(15,August,1977),[[Ohio State University Radio Observatory|The Big Ear]], a [[radio telescope]] operated by [[Ohio State University]] as part of the [[Search for extraterrestrial intelligence|SETI]] project, receives a radio signal from deep space; the event is named the "[[Wow! signal]]" from the notation made by a volunteer on the project.))
Some((Date(15,August,1984),The [[Kurdistan Workers' Party]] in [[Turkey]] starts a campaign of armed attacks upon the Turkish military with an [[1984 PKK attacks|attack on police and gendarmerie bases in Şemdinli and Eruh]]))
Some((Date(15,August,1995),In [[South Carolina]], [[Shannon Faulkner]] becomes the first female [[cadet]] matriculated at [[The Citadel, The Military College of South Carolina|The Citadel]] (she drops out less than a week later).))
Some((Date(15,August,1998),[[Omagh bombing]] in [[Northern Ireland]], the worst [[terrorism|terrorist]] incident of [[The Troubles]].))
Some((Date(15,August,1999),[[Béni Ounif|Beni Ounif massacre]] in [[Algeria]]: Some 29 people are killed at a false roadblock near the Moroccan border, leading to temporary tensions with [[Morocco]].))
Some((Date(15,August,2005),[[Israel's unilateral disengagement plan]] to evict all [[Israelis]] from the [[Gaza Strip]] and from four [[Israeli settlement|settlements]] in the northern [[West Bank]] begins.))
Some((Date(15,August,2007),An [[2007 Peru earthquake|8.0-magnitude earthquake]] off the Pacific coast devastates [[Ica Region|Ica]] and various regions of [[Peru]] killing 514 and injuring 1,090.))
Some((Date(15,August,2013),At least 27 people are killed and 226 injured in an [[August 2013 Beirut bombing|explosion]] in southern [[Beirut]] near a complex used by Lebanon's militant group [[Hezbollah]] in Lebanon. A previously unknown [[Syria]]n [[Sunni]] group claims responsibility in an online video.))
Some((Date(15,August,2015),North Korea moves its clock back half an hour to introduce [[Time in North Korea|Pyongyang Time]], 8.5 hours ahead of [[UTC]].

Enraged [[Whig Party (United States)|Whig Party]] members riot outside the [[White House]] in the most violent demonstration on White House grounds in U.S. history.))
Some((Date(16,August,1858),U.S. President [[James Buchanan]] inaugurates the new [[transatlantic telegraph cable]] by exchanging greetings with [[Queen Victoria]] of the United Kingdom. However, a weak signal forces a shutdown of the service in a few weeks.))

Some((Date(16,August,1870),[[Franco-Prussian War]]: The [[Battle of Mars-la-Tour]] is fought, resulting in a [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussian]] victory.))
Some((Date(16,August,1891),The [[Basilica of San Sebastian, Manila|Basilica of San Sebastian]] in [[Manila]], the first all-steel church in Asia, is officially inaugurated and blessed.))

Some((Date(16,August,1900),The [[Battle of Elands River (1900)|Battle of Elands River]] during the Second Boer War ends after a 13-day siege is lifted by the British. The battle had begun when a force of between 2,000 and 3,000 Boers had surrounded a force of 500 Australians, Rhodesians, Canadians and British soldiers at a supply dump at Brakfontein Drift.))
Some((Date(16,August,1906),An estimated [[1906 Valparaíso earthquake|8.2 M<sub>W</sub> earthquake]] hits [[Valparaíso]], Chile, killing 3,886 people.))

Some((Date(16,August,1918),The [[Battle of Lake Baikal]] was fought between the [[Czechoslovak Legion]] and the [[Red Army]].))
Some((Date(16,August,1920),[[Ray Chapman]] of the [[Cleveland Indians]] is hit on the head by a [[fastball]] thrown by [[Carl Mays]] of the [[New York Yankees]], and dies early the next day. Chapman was the second player to die from injuries sustained in a [[Major League Baseball]] game, the first being [[Doc Powers]] in 1909.))
Some((Date(16,August,1923),The United Kingdom gives the name "[[Ross Dependency]]" to part of its claimed Antarctic territory and makes the [[Governor-General of New Zealand|Governor-General]] of the [[Dominion of New Zealand]] its administrator.))

The committee intends to introduce legislation making these activities illegal. Anti-war demonstrators disrupt the meeting and 50 people are arrested.))

Some((Date(16,August,1987),[[Northwest Airlines Flight 255]] a [[McDonnell Douglas MD-80#MD-82|McDonnell Douglas MD-82]] crashes after take off in [[Detroit|Detroit, Michigan]], killing 154 of the 155 on board, plus two people on the ground.))
Some((Date(16,August,1989),A [[solar flare]] from the Sun creates a [[geomagnetic storm]] that affects micro chips, leading to a halt of all trading on Toronto's stock market.))
Some((Date(16,August,2008),The [[Trump International Hotel and Tower (Chicago)|Trump International Hotel and Tower]] in Chicago is topped off at {{convert|1389|ft|m}}, at the time becoming the world's highest [[Dwelling|residence]] above ground-level.))
Some((Date(16,August,2012),[[South African Police Service|South African police]] fatally shoot 34 miners and wound 78 more during an [[Marikana miners' strike|industrial dispute]] near [[Rustenburg]].))
