Some((Date(17,August,1186),[[Georgenberg Pact]]: [[Ottokar IV, Duke of Styria]] and [[Leopold V, Duke of Austria]] sign a heritage agreement in which Ottokar gives his duchy to Leopold and to his son [[Frederick I, Duke of Austria (Babenberg)|Frederick]] under the stipulation that Austria and Styria would henceforth remain undivided.))
Some((Date(17,August,1386),[[Karl Topia]], the ruler of [[Princedom of Albania]] forges an alliance with the [[Republic of Venice]], committing to participate in all wars of the Republic and receiving coastal protection against the [[Ottomans]] in return.))
Some((Date(17,August,1424),[[Hundred Years' War]]: [[Battle of Verneuil]]: An English force under [[John, Duke of Bedford]] defeats a larger French army under [[Jean II, Duke of Alençon]], [[John Stewart, 2nd Earl of Buchan|John Stewart]], and [[Archibald Douglas, 4th Earl of Douglas|Earl Archibald of Douglas]].))
Some((Date(17,August,1498),[[Cesare Borgia]], son of [[Pope Alexander VI]], becomes the first person in history to resign the [[Cardinal (Catholicism)|cardinalate]]. On the same day, King [[Louis XII of France]] names him [[Duke of Valentinois]].))

Some((Date(17,August,1784),Classical composer [[Luigi Boccherini]] receives a pay rise of 12000 [[Spanish real|reals]] from his employer, the [[Infante Luis, Count of Chinchón]].))

Some((Date(17,August,1962),[[East Germany|East German]] border guards [[Killing of Peter Fechter|kill Peter Fechter]], 18, as he attempts to cross the [[Berlin Wall]] into [[West Berlin]] becoming one of the first victims of the wall.))

Some((Date(17,August,1970),[[Venera]] program: ''[[Venera 7]]'' launched. It will later become the first spacecraft to successfully transmit data from the surface of another [[planet]] ([[Venus]]).))
Some((Date(17,August,1977),The Soviet icebreaker ''[[Arktika (icebreaker)|Arktika]]'' becomes the first surface ship to reach the [[North Pole]].))

Some((Date(17,August,1998),[[Lewinsky scandal]]: US President [[Bill Clinton]] admits in taped testimony that he had an "improper physical relationship" with [[White House]] intern [[Monica Lewinsky]]. On the same day he admits before the nation that he "misled people" about the relationship.))
Some((Date(17,August,1999),A 7.4-magnitude [[1999 İzmit earthquake|earthquake]] strikes [[İzmit]], Turkey, killing more than 17,000 and injuring 44,000.))

Some((Date(17,August,2005),The first forced [[Israel's unilateral disengagement plan|evacuation]] of [[Israeli settlement|settler]]s, as part of [[Israel's unilateral disengagement plan]], starts.))
Some((Date(17,August,2008),American swimmer [[Michael Phelps]] becomes the first person to win eight gold medals in one Olympic Games.))
Some((Date(17,August,2009),[[2009 Sayano–Shushenskaya power station accident|An accident]] at the [[Sayano–Shushenskaya Dam]] in [[Khakassia]], Russia, kills 75 and shuts down the hydroelectric power station, leading to widespread power failure in the local area.))

Some((Date(24,August,1963),[[Buddhist crisis]]: As a result of the [[Xá Lợi Pagoda raids]], the [[US State Department]] [[Cable 243|cables]] the [[United States Embassy, Saigon]] to encourage [[Army of the Republic of Vietnam]] generals to [[1963 South Vietnamese coup|launch a coup]] against President [[Ngô Đình Diệm]] if he did not remove his brother [[Ngô Đình Nhu]].))
Some((Date(24,August,1967),Led by [[Abbie Hoffman]], the [[Youth International Party]] temporarily disrupts trading at the [[New York Stock Exchange]] by throwing dollar bills from the viewing gallery, causing trading to cease as brokers scramble to grab them.))

The explosions are caused by suicide bombers (reportedly female) from the Russian [[Republic of Chechnya]].))
Some((Date(24,August,2006),The [[International Astronomical Union]] (IAU) [[2006 definition of planet|redefines the term "planet"]] such that [[Pluto]] is now considered a [[dwarf planet]].))
Some((Date(24,August,2010),In [[San Fernando, Tamaulipas]], Mexico, 72 illegal immigrants are [[2010 San Fernando massacre|killed]] by [[Los Zetas]] and eventually found dead by Mexican authorities.))
Some((Date(24,August,2014),A 6.0 magnitude [[2014 South Napa earthquake|earthquake strikes]] [[Napa, California]], in the northern San Francisco Bay area, killing one person and injuring over 200 others. Estimated damage in the southern Napa Valley and Vallejo areas was between $362 million to 1 billion. It was the largest earthquake to strike northern California since [[1989 Loma Prieta earthquake|1989]].

Some((Date(28,August,1955),[[African American|Black]] teenager [[Emmett Till]] is brutally murdered in [[Mississippi]], galvanizing the nascent [[American Civil Rights Movement]].))
Some((Date(28,August,1957),[[United States Senate|U.S. Senator]] [[Strom Thurmond]] begins a [[filibuster]] to prevent the Senate from voting on [[Civil Rights Act of 1957]]; he stopped speaking 24 hours and 18 minutes later, the longest filibuster ever conducted by a single Senator.))

Some((Date(28,August,1979),An [[Provisional Irish Republican Army|IRA]] bomb explodes at the [[Grote Markt (Brussels)|Grote Markt]] in [[Brussels]].))
Some((Date(28,August,1988),[[Ramstein air show disaster]]: Three aircraft of the [[Frecce Tricolori]] demonstration team collide and the wreckage falls into the crowd. Seventy-five are killed and 346 seriously injured.))

Some((Date(28,August,1996),[[Charles, Prince of Wales]] and [[Diana, Princess of Wales]] divorce.))

Some((Date(1,September,1715),King [[Louis XIV of France]] dies after a reign of 72 years—the longest of any major European monarch.))

Some((Date(1,September,1772),The [[Mission San Luis Obispo de Tolosa]] is founded in [[San Luis Obispo, California]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1774),[[Province of Massachusetts Bay|Massachusetts Bay]] colonists rise up in the bloodless [[Powder Alarm]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1804),[[3 Juno|Juno]], one of the largest [[asteroid]]s in the [[Main Belt]], is discovered by the German astronomer [[Karl Ludwig Harding]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1831),The high honor of ''[[Order of St. Gregory the Great]]'' is established by [[Pope Gregory XVI]] of the [[Vatican State]] to recognize high support for the Vatican or for the Pope, by a man or a woman, and not necessarily a [[Roman Catholic]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1836),[[Narcissa Whitman]], one of the first English-speaking white women to settle west of the [[Rocky Mountains]], arrives at [[Walla Walla, Washington]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1862),[[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Chantilly]]: [[Confederate States of America|Confederate Army troop]]s defeat a group of retreating [[United States Army|Union Army troop]]s in [[Chantilly, Virginia]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1864),American Civil War: The [[Confederate Army]] General [[John Bell Hood]] orders the evacuation of [[Atlanta]], ending a four-month [[siege]] by General [[William Tecumseh Sherman]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1870),[[Franco-Prussian War]]: The [[Battle of Sedan (1870)|Battle of Sedan]] is fought, resulting in a decisive [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussian]] victory.))
Some((Date(1,September,1873),[[Cetshwayo]] ascends to the throne as king of the [[Zulu Kingdom|Zulu]] nation following the death of his father [[Mpande]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1878),[[Emma Nutt]] becomes the world's first female telephone operator when she is recruited by [[Alexander Graham Bell]] to the Boston Telephone Dispatch Company.))
Some((Date(1,September,1880),The army of [[Mohammad Ayub Khan (Emir of Afghanistan)|Mohammad Ayub Khan]] is routed by the British at the [[Battle of Kandahar]], ending the [[Second Anglo-Afghan War]]))
Some((Date(1,September,1894),Over 400 people die in the [[Great Hinckley Fire]], a [[forest fire]] in [[Hinckley, Minnesota]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1897),The [[Tremont Street Subway]] in Boston opens, becoming the first underground [[rapid transit]] system in North America.))
Some((Date(1,September,1902),''[[A Trip to the Moon]]'', considered one of the first [[science fiction film]]s, is released in France.))
Some((Date(1,September,1905),[[Alberta]] and [[Saskatchewan]] join the Canadian confederation.))
Some((Date(1,September,1906),The [[International Federation of Intellectual Property Attorneys]] is established.))
Some((Date(1,September,1910),In [[Brazil]], [[Sport Club Corinthians Paulista]], the first Fifa World Club Championship, is founded.))
Some((Date(1,September,1911),The [[armored cruiser]] [[Greek cruiser Georgios Averof|''Georgios Averof'']] is commissioned into the [[Hellenic Navy|Greek Navy]]. It now serves as a [[museum ship]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1914),[[St. Petersburg]], [[Russian Empire|Russia]], changes its name to [[Petrograd]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1920),The ''[[Fountain of Time]]'' opens as a tribute to the 100 years of peace between the United States and Great Britain following the [[Treaty of Ghent]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1923),The [[1923 Great Kantō earthquake|Great Kantō earthquake]] devastates Tokyo and [[Yokohama]], killing about 105,000 people.))
Some((Date(1,September,1928),[[Ahmet Zogu]] declares [[Albania]] to be a [[monarchy]] and proclaims himself king.))
Some((Date(1,September,1934),[[SMJK Sam Tet]] is founded by Father Fourgs from the St. Michael Church, [[Ipoh]], [[Perak]], [[Malaysia]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1939),[[World War II]]: [[Nazi Germany]] and [[Slovak Republic (1939–45)|Slovakia]] [[Invasion of Poland|invade]] [[Second Polish Republic|Poland]], beginning the European phase of World War II.))
Some((Date(1,September,1951),The United States, Australia and New Zealand sign a mutual defense pact, called the [[ANZUS Treaty]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1952),''[[The Old Man and the Sea]]'', the [[Pulitzer Prize for Fiction|Pulitzer Prize]]-winning novel by [[Ernest Hemingway]], is first published.))
Some((Date(1,September,1958),[[Iceland]] expands its fishing zone, putting it into conflict with the United Kingdom, beginning the [[Cod Wars]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1961),The [[Eritrean War of Independence]] officially begins with the shooting of the [[Ethiopia]]n police by [[Hamid Idris Awate]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1967),The [[Khmer–Chinese Friendship Association]] is banned in [[Cambodia]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1969),A [[coup d'état|coup]] in [[Libya]] brings [[Muammar Gaddafi]] to power.))
Some((Date(1,September,1970),Attempted assassination of King [[Hussein of Jordan]] by Palestinian guerrillas, who attack his motorcade.))
Some((Date(1,September,1972),In [[Reykjavík]], [[Iceland]], American [[Bobby Fischer]] beats Russian [[Boris Spassky]] to become the [[World Chess Championship|world chess champion]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1974),The ''[[SR-71 Blackbird]]'' sets (and holds) the record for flying from New York to London in the time of 1 hour, 54 minutes and 56.4 seconds at a speed of {{convert|1435.587|mph|km/h}}.))
Some((Date(1,September,1979),The American space probe ''[[Pioneer 11]]'' becomes the first spacecraft to visit [[Saturn]] when it passes the [[planet]] at a distance of {{convert|21000|km|mi}}.))
Some((Date(1,September,1980),[[Terry Fox]]'s [[Marathon of Hope]] ends near Thunder Bay, Ontario.))
Some((Date(1,September,1981),A ''[[coup d'état]]'' in the [[Central African Republic]] overthrows [[List of heads of state of the Central African Republic and Central African Empire|President]] [[David Dacko]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1982),The United States [[Air Force Space Command]] is founded.))
Some((Date(1,September,1983),[[Cold War]]: [[Korean Air Lines Flight 007]] is shot down by a [[Soviet Union]] jet fighter when the commercial aircraft enters [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] airspace. All 269 on board die, including [[United States Congress|Congressman]] [[Larry McDonald|Lawrence McDonald]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1985),A joint American–French expedition locates the wreckage of the {{RMS|Titanic}}.))
Some((Date(1,September,1991),[[Uzbekistan]] declares independence from the [[Soviet Union]].))
Some((Date(1,September,1997),The death of [[Diana, Princess of Wales]], is announced by [[Buckingham Palace]].))
Some((Date(1,September,2004),The [[Beslan school hostage crisis]] commences when armed terrorists take children and adults hostage in [[Beslan]] in [[North Ossetia]], Russia.

Some((Date(2,September,-47),[[Pharaoh]] [[Cleopatra VII]] of [[Egypt]] declares her son co-ruler as Ptolemy XV [[Caesarion]].))
Some((Date(2,September,-44),[[Cicero]] launches the first of his ''[[Philippic]]s'' (oratorical attacks) on [[Mark Antony]]. He will make 14 of them over the following months.))
Some((Date(2,September,-31),[[Final War of the Roman Republic]]: [[Battle of Actium]]: Off the western coast of Greece, forces of [[Augustus|Octavian]] defeat troops under [[Mark Antony]] and [[Cleopatra]].))
Some((Date(2,September,1192),The [[Treaty of Jaffa]] is signed between [[Richard I of England]] and [[Saladin]], leading to the end of the [[Third Crusade]].))
Some((Date(2,September,1649),The Italian city of [[Castro, Lazio|Castro]] is completely destroyed by the forces of [[Pope Innocent X]], ending the [[Wars of Castro]].))
Some((Date(2,September,1666),The [[Great Fire of London]] breaks out and burns for three days, destroying 10,000 buildings including [[St Paul's Cathedral]].))
Some((Date(2,September,1752),Great Britain adopts the [[Gregorian calendar]], nearly two centuries later than most of [[Western Europe]].))
Some((Date(2,September,1789),The [[United States Department of the Treasury]] is founded.))
Some((Date(2,September,1792),During what became known as the [[September Massacres]] of the [[French Revolution]], rampaging mobs slaughter three [[Roman Catholic Church]] [[bishop]]s, more than two hundred [[priest]]s, and prisoners believed to be royalist sympathizers.))
Some((Date(2,September,1806),A massive [[landslide]] destroys the town of [[Goldau]], Switzerland, killing 457.))
Some((Date(2,September,1807),The [[Royal Navy]] [[Battle of Copenhagen (1807)|bombards Copenhagen]] with fire bombs and phosphorus rockets to prevent Denmark from surrendering its fleet to [[Napoleon]].))
Some((Date(2,September,1811),The [[University of Oslo]] is founded as The Royal Fredericks University, after [[Frederick VI of Denmark]] and Norway.))
Some((Date(2,September,1833),[[Oberlin College]] is founded by [[John Jay Shipherd]] and Philo P. Stewart in [[Oberlin, Ohio]].))
Some((Date(2,September,1856),The [[Tianjing incident]] takes place in [[Nanjing]], China.))
Some((Date(2,September,1859),A [[Aurora#Auroral events of historical significance|solar super storm]] affects [[electrical telegraph]] service.))
Some((Date(2,September,1862),[[American Civil War]]: United States President [[Abraham Lincoln]] reluctantly restores [[United States|Union]] [[General officer|General]] [[George B. McClellan]] to full command after General [[John Pope (military officer)|John Pope]]'s disastrous defeat at the [[Second Battle of Bull Run]].))
Some((Date(2,September,1864),American Civil War: Union forces enter [[Atlanta]], a day after the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] defenders flee the city, ending the [[Atlanta Campaign]].))
Some((Date(2,September,1867),Mutsuhito, [[Emperor Meiji]] of Japan, marries Masako Ichijō. The [[Queen consort|Empress consort]] is thereafter known as ''Lady Haruko''. Since her death in 1914, she is called by the posthumous name [[Empress Shōken]].))
Some((Date(2,September,1870),[[Franco-Prussian War]]: [[Battle of Sedan (1870)|Battle of Sedan]]: [[Prussia]]n forces take [[Napoleon III of France]] and 100,000 of his soldiers prisoner.))
Some((Date(2,September,1885),[[Rock Springs massacre]]: In [[Rock Springs, Wyoming]], 150 white miners, who are struggling to unionize so they could strike for better wages and work conditions, attack their [[Overseas Chinese|Chinese]] fellow workers killing 28, wounding 15 and forcing several hundred more out of town.))
Some((Date(2,September,1898),[[Battle of Omdurman]]: British and Egyptian troops defeat [[Sudan]]ese tribesmen and establish British dominance in Sudan.))
Some((Date(2,September,1901),Vice President of the United States [[Theodore Roosevelt]] utters the famous phrase, "Speak softly and carry a [[Big Stick ideology|big stick]]" at the [[Minnesota State Fair]].))
Some((Date(2,September,1912),[[Arthur Rose Eldred]] is awarded the first [[Eagle Scout (Boy Scouts of America)|Eagle Scout]] award of the [[Boy Scouts of America]].))
Some((Date(2,September,1935),The [[1935 Labor Day hurricane]] hits the [[Florida Keys]], killing 423.))
Some((Date(2,September,1939),World War II: Following the start of the [[invasion of Poland]] the previous day, the [[Free City of Danzig]] (now [[Gdańsk]], Poland) is annexed by [[Nazi Germany]].))

Some((Date(2,September,1946),The [[Interim Government of India]] is formed, headed by [[Jawaharlal Nehru]] as Vice President with the powers of a Prime Minister.))
Some((Date(2,September,1957),President [[Ngô Đình Diệm]] of [[South Vietnam]] becomes [[Ngo Dinh Diem presidential visit to Australia|the first foreign head of state to make a state visit to Australia]].))
Some((Date(2,September,1958),[[United States Air Force]] [[C-130A-II]] [[1958 C-130 shootdown incident|is shot down]] by fighters over [[Yerevan]] in Armenia when it strays into [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] airspace while conducting a [[Signals intelligence|sigint]] mission. All crew members are killed.))
Some((Date(2,September,1960),The first election of the [[Parliament of the Central Tibetan Administration]], in [[history of Tibet]]. The Tibetan community observes this date as [[Democracy Day (Tibet)|Democracy Day]].))
Some((Date(2,September,1963),''[[CBS Evening News]]'' becomes U.S. network television's first half-hour weeknight news broadcast, when the show is lengthened from 15 to 30 minutes.))
Some((Date(2,September,1968),[[Operation OAU]] begins during the [[Nigerian Civil War]]))
Some((Date(2,September,1970),[[NASA]] announces the [[Canceled Apollo missions|cancellation]] of two [[Apollo program|Apollo]] missions to the Moon, [[Apollo 15]] (the designation is re-used by a later mission), and [[Canceled Apollo missions#Apollos 18–20|Apollo 19]].))
Some((Date(2,September,1984),Seven people are shot and killed and 12 wounded in the [[Milperra massacre]], a shootout between the rival motorcycle [[gang]]s [[Bandidos]] and [[Comanchero Motorcycle Club|Comanchero]]s in Sydney, Australia.))
Some((Date(2,September,1985),[[Sri Lankan Civil War]]: Sri Lankan Tamil politicians and former MPs [[M. Alalasundaram]] and [[V. Dharmalingam]] are shot dead.))
Some((Date(2,September,1987),In Moscow, the trial begins for 19-year-old pilot [[Mathias Rust]], who flew his [[Cessna]] airplane into [[Red Square]] in May.))
Some((Date(2,September,1990),[[Transnistria]] is unilaterally proclaimed a [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] republic; the [[Presidium of the Supreme Soviet|Soviet president]] [[Mikhail Gorbachev]] declares the decision null and void.))
Some((Date(2,September,1992),An [[1992 Nicaragua earthquake|earthquake in Nicaragua]] kills at least 116 people.))
Some((Date(2,September,1998),[[Swissair Flight 111]] crashes near [[Peggys Cove, Nova Scotia]]. All 229 people on board are killed.))
Some((Date(2,September,2013),The [[Eastern span replacement of the San Francisco–Oakland Bay Bridge]] opened to traffic as the widest bridge in the world.

Some((Date(3,September,301),[[San Marino]], one of the [[List of countries by area|smallest nations in the world]] and the world's oldest [[republic]] still in existence, is founded by [[Saint Marinus]].))

Some((Date(3,September,1189),[[Richard I of England]] (a.k.a. Richard "the Lionheart") is crowned at [[Westminster Abbey|Westminster]].))

Some((Date(3,September,1651),Third English Civil War: [[Battle of Worcester]]: [[Charles II of England]] is defeated in the last main battle of the war.))
Some((Date(3,September,1658),[[Richard Cromwell]] becomes [[Lord Protector]] of England.))
Some((Date(3,September,1666),The [[Royal Exchange, London|Royal Exchange]] burns down in the [[Great Fire of London]].))

Some((Date(3,September,1812),Twenty-four settlers are killed in the [[Pigeon Roost State Historic Site#Pigeon Roost Massacre|Pigeon Roost Massacre]] in [[Indiana]].))

Some((Date(3,September,1843),[[Otto of Greece|King Otto of Greece]] is forced to grant a [[Greek Constitution of 1844|constitution]] following an [[3 September 1843 Revolution|uprising]] in Athens.))
Some((Date(3,September,1855),[[American Indian Wars]]: In [[Nebraska]], 700 soldiers under United States General [[William S. Harney]] avenge the [[Grattan massacre]] by attacking a [[Sioux]] village and killing 100 men, women and children.))

Some((Date(3,September,1870),[[Franco-Prussian War]]: The [[Siege of Metz (1870)|Siege of Metz]] begins, resulting in a decisive [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussian]] victory on October 23.))
Some((Date(3,September,1874),The congress of the [[State of Mexico]] elevates [[Naucalpan]] to the category of [[villa]], with the title of "Villa de [[Benito Juárez|Juárez]]".))
Some((Date(3,September,1875),The first official game of [[polo]] is played in [[Argentina]] after being introduced by British ranchers.))
Some((Date(3,September,1878),Over 640 die when the crowded pleasure boat {{SS|Princess Alice|1865|2}} collides with the ''[[Bywell Castle]]'' in the [[River Thames]].))
Some((Date(3,September,1879),[[Siege of the British Residency in Kabul]]: British envoy Sir [[Pierre Louis Napoleon Cavagnari|Louis Cavagnari]] and 72 men of the [[Corps of Guides (India)|The Guides]] are massacred by Afghan troops while defending the British Residency in [[Kabul]]. Their heroism and loyalty became famous and revered throughout the [[British Empire]].))
Some((Date(3,September,1895),[[John Brallier]] becomes the first openly professional [[American football]] player, when he was paid US$10 by [[Dave Berry (American football)|David Berry]], to play for the [[Latrobe Athletic Association]] in a 12&ndash;0 win over the [[Jeanette Athletic Association]].))
Some((Date(3,September,1914),[[William, Prince of Albania]] leaves the country after just six months due to opposition to his rule.))
Some((Date(3,September,1916),World War I: [[Leefe Robinson]] destroys the German [[airship]] [[Schütte-Lanz SL 11]] over [[Cuffley]], north of London; the first German airship to be shot down on British soil.))
Some((Date(3,September,1925),{{USS|Shenandoah|ZR-1|6}}, the United States' first American-built rigid airship, was destroyed in a [[squall line]] over [[Noble County, Ohio|Noble County]], [[Ohio]]. Fourteen of her 42-man crew perished, including her commander, [[Zachary Lansdowne]].))
Some((Date(3,September,1933),[[Yevgeniy Abalakov]] is the first man to reach the highest point in the [[Soviet Union]], Communism Peak (now called [[Ismoil Somoni Peak]] and situated in [[Tajikistan]]) (7495 m).))
Some((Date(3,September,1935),Sir [[Malcolm Campbell]] reaches a speed of 304.331 miles per hour on the [[Bonneville Salt Flats]] in [[Utah]], becoming the first person to drive an [[automobile]] over 300&nbsp;mph.))
Some((Date(3,September,1939),[[World War II]]: France, the United Kingdom, New Zealand and Australia declare war on Germany after the [[invasion of Poland]], forming the [[Allies of World War II|Allies]].))
Some((Date(3,September,1941),[[The Holocaust]]: [[Karl Fritzsch]], deputy camp commandant of the [[Auschwitz concentration camp]], experiments with the use of [[Zyklon B]] in the gassing of Soviet POWs.))

Some((Date(3,September,1967),[[Dagen H]] in Sweden: Traffic changes from driving on the left to driving on the right overnight.))
Some((Date(3,September,1971),[[Qatar]] becomes an independent state.))
Some((Date(3,September,1976),[[Viking program]]: The American ''[[Viking 2]]'' spacecraft lands at [[Utopia Planitia]] on [[Mars]].))
Some((Date(3,September,1981),[[Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women]] enters into force.))
Some((Date(3,September,1987),In a [[1987 Burundian coup d'état|coup d'état in Burundi]], President [[Jean-Baptiste Bagaza]] is deposed by Major [[Pierre Buyoya]].))
Some((Date(3,September,1994),[[Sino-Soviet split]]: Russia and the People's Republic of China agree to de-target their [[nuclear weapon]]s against each other.))
Some((Date(3,September,1997),[[Vietnam Airlines]] [[Vietnam Airlines Flight 815|Flight 815]] ([[Tupolev Tu-134]]) crashes on approach into [[Phnom Penh]] airport, killing 64.))
Some((Date(3,September,2001),In [[Belfast]], Protestant [[Ulster loyalism|loyalists]] begin a [[Holy Cross dispute|picket of Holy Cross]], a Catholic [[primary school]] for girls. For the next 11 weeks, riot police escort the schoolchildren and their parents through hundreds of protesters, some of whom hurl missiles and abuse. The protest sparks fierce rioting and grabs world headlines.))
Some((Date(3,September,2004),The [[Beslan school hostage crisis]] ends on its third day with the deaths of over 300 people, more than half of whom are children.))
Some((Date(3,September,2014),Heavy monsoon rains and [[2014 India – Pakistan floods|flash floods]] leave over 200 people dead across India and [[Pakistan]].))
Some((Date(3,September,2015),China's [[2015 China Victory Day Parade|Victory Day Parade]] is held in [[Beijing]] to celebrate the 70th [[Victory over Japan Day]] of the [[Second World War]].

Some((Date(4,September,1882),[[Thomas Edison]] flips the switch to the first commercial electrical power plant in history, lighting one square mile of [[lower Manhattan]]. This is considered by many as the day that began the electrical age.))
Some((Date(4,September,1886),[[American Indian Wars]]: After almost 30 years of fighting, [[Apache]] leader [[Geronimo]], with his remaining warriors,  surrenders to General [[Nelson Miles]] in [[Arizona]].))

The collisions occurred around 10am, after the Japanese Coast Guard ordered the trawler to leave the area. After the collisions, Japanese sailors boarded the Chinese vessel and arrested the captain, Zhan Qixiong.))

Some((Date(11,September,1709),[[Battle of Malplaquet]]: Great Britain, Netherlands and Austria fight against France.))
Some((Date(11,September,1714),[[Siege of Barcelona (1713–14)|Siege of Barcelona]]: [[Barcelona]], capital city of [[Catalonia]], surrenders to Spanish and French [[Philip V of Spain|Bourbon]] armies in the [[War of the Spanish Succession]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1758),[[Battle of Saint Cast]]: France repels British invasion during the [[Seven Years' War]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1775),[[Benedict Arnold's expedition to Quebec]] leaves [[Cambridge, Massachusetts]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1776),British–American [[Staten Island Peace Conference|peace conference]] on [[Staten Island]] fails to stop nascent [[American Revolutionary War]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1777),American Revolutionary War: [[Battle of Brandywine]]: The British celebrate a major victory in [[Chester County, Pennsylvania]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1786),The beginning of the [[Annapolis Convention (1786)|Annapolis Convention]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1789),[[Alexander Hamilton]] is appointed the first [[United States Secretary of the Treasury]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1792),The [[Hope Diamond]] is stolen along with other French crown jewels when six men break into the house where they are stored.))
Some((Date(11,September,1802),France annexes the [[Kingdom of Sardinia|Kingdom of Piedmont]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1803),[[Battle of Delhi (1803)|Battle of Delhi]], during the [[Second Anglo-Maratha War]], between British troops under [[Gerard Lake, 1st Viscount Lake|General Lake]], and [[Maratha]]s of [[Scindia]]'s army under General Louis Bourquin.))
Some((Date(11,September,1813),[[War of 1812]]: British troops arrive in [[Mount Vernon]] and prepare to march to and invade [[Washington, D.C.]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1814),War of 1812: The climax of the [[Battle of Plattsburgh]], a major United States victory in the war.))
Some((Date(11,September,1826),[[William Morgan (anti-Mason)|Captain William Morgan]], an ex-[[freemason]] is arrested in [[Batavia, New York]] for debt after declaring that he would publish [http://www.gutenberg.org/files/18136/18136-h/18136-h.htm The Mysteries of Free Masonry], a book against [[Freemasonry]]. This sets into motion the events that lead to his [[Disappeared|mysterious disappearance]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1829),Surrender of the expedition led by [[Isidro Barradas]] at [[Tampico]], sent by the Spanish crown in order to retake Mexico. This was the consummation of Mexico's campaign for independence.))
Some((Date(11,September,1830),[[Anti-Masonic Party]] convention; one of the first American political party conventions.))
Some((Date(11,September,1847),[[Stephen Foster]]'s song "[[Oh! Susanna]]" is first performed at a saloon in [[Pittsburgh]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1851),[[Christiana Resistance]]: Escaped slaves stand against their former owner in armed resistance in Christiana, Pennsylvania, creating a rallying cry for the abolitionist movement.))
Some((Date(11,September,1852),The [[State of Buenos Aires]] secedes from the [[Federales (Argentina)|Argentine Federal government]], rejoining on September 17, 1861. Several places are named ''Once de Septiembre'' after this event.))
Some((Date(11,September,1857),The [[Mountain Meadows massacre]]: [[Mormon]] settlers and [[Paiute]]s massacre 120 pioneers at [[Mountain Meadows, Utah]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1893),[[Parliament of the World's Religions]] opens in Chicago, where [[Swami Vivekananda]] delivers his speech on fanaticism, tolerance and the truth inherent in all religions.))
Some((Date(11,September,1897),After months of pursuit, generals of [[Menelik II of Ethiopia]] capture [[Gaki Sherocho]], the last king of [[Kingdom of Kaffa|Kaffa]], bringing an end to that ancient kingdom.))
Some((Date(11,September,1903),The first race at the [[Milwaukee Mile]] in [[West Allis, Wisconsin]] is held. It is the oldest major speedway in the world.))
Some((Date(11,September,1914),Australia invades [[New Britain]], defeating a German contingent at the [[Battle of Bita Paka]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1916),The [[Quebec Bridge]]'s central span collapses, killing 11 men. The bridge previously collapsed completely on [[August 29]], [[1907]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1919),[[United States Marine Corps|U.S. Marines]] invade [[Honduras]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1921),[[Nahalal]], the first [[moshav]] in [[Mandatory Palestine|Palestine]], is settled as part of a [[Zionist]] plan to colonize Palestine and creating a Jewish state, later to be [[Israel]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1922),The [[Treaty of Kars]] is ratified in [[Yerevan]], [[Armenia]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1931),[[Salvatore Maranzano]] is murdered by [[Lucky Luciano]]'s hitmen.))
Some((Date(11,September,1932),[[Franciszek Żwirko]] and [[Stanisław Wigura]], Polish [[Challenge 1932]] winners, are killed when their [[RWD 6]] airplane crashes during a storm.))
Some((Date(11,September,1939),[[World War II]]: Canada declares war on Germany, the country's first [[Military history of Canada during World War II|independent declaration of war]]))
Some((Date(11,September,1940),[[George Stibitz]] performs the first remote operation of a computer.))
Some((Date(11,September,1941),Ground is broken for the construction of [[The Pentagon]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1943),World War II: [[Wehrmacht|German troops]] occupy [[Corsica]] and [[Kosovo]]-[[Metohija]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1944),World War II: The first [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] troops of the U.S. Army cross the western border of Germany.))
Some((Date(11,September,1945),World War II: [[9th Division (Australia)|Australian 9th Division]] forces liberate the Japanese-run [[Batu Lintang camp]], a POW and civilian internment camp on the island of [[Borneo]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1950),[[Korean War]]: President [[Harry S. Truman]] approved military operations north of the 38{{sup|th}} parallel.))
Some((Date(11,September,1954),[[Hurricane Edna]] hits [[New England]] as a [[Category 1 hurricane]], causing significant damage and 29 deaths.))
Some((Date(11,September,1961),[[Hurricane Carla]] strikes the [[Texas]] coast as a Category 4 hurricane, the second strongest storm ever to hit the state.))
Some((Date(11,September,1965),[[Indo-Pakistani War of 1965|Indo-Pakistani War]]: The [[Indian Army]] [[Battle of Burki|captures]] the town of [[Barki, Pakistan|Burki]], just southeast of [[Lahore]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1968),[[Air France Flight 1611]] crashes off [[Nice]], France, killing 89 passengers and six crew.))
Some((Date(11,September,1970),The [[Dawson's Field hijackings|Dawson's Field hijackers]] release 88 of their hostages. The remaining hostages, mostly Jews and Israeli citizens, are held until [[September 25]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1971),The [[History of the Egyptian Constitution|Egyptian Constitution]] becomes official.))
Some((Date(11,September,1972),The San Francisco [[Bay Area Rapid Transit]] system begins passenger service.))
Some((Date(11,September,1973),[[1973 Chilean coup d'état|A coup]] in [[Chile]] headed by General [[Augusto Pinochet]] topples the democratically elected president [[Salvador Allende]]. Pinochet exercises dictatorial power until ousted in [[Chilean national plebiscite, 1988|a referendum in 1988]], staying in power until 1990.))
Some((Date(11,September,1974),[[Eastern Air Lines Flight 212]] crashes in [[Charlotte, North Carolina|Charlotte]], [[North Carolina]], killing 69 passengers and two crew.))
Some((Date(11,September,1976),A group of Croatian nationalists plant a bomb in a coin locker at Grand Central Terminal. After stating political demands, they reveal the location and provided instructions for disarming the bomb. The disarming operation are not executed properly and the bomb explodes, killing one NYPD bomb squad specialist.))
Some((Date(11,September,1978),[[Janet Parker]] is the last person to die of [[smallpox]], in a laboratory-associated outbreak.))
Some((Date(11,September,1980),Voters approve a new [[Constitution of Chile]], later amended after the departure of president Pinochet.))
Some((Date(11,September,1982),The international forces that were guaranteeing the safety of [[Palestinian refugee]]s following [[Israel]]'s [[1982 Invasion of Lebanon]] leave [[Beirut]]. Five days later, several thousand refugees are massacred in the [[Sabra and Shatila massacre|Sabra and Shatila refugee camps]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1985),[[Pete Rose]] breaks [[Ty Cobb]]'s [[baseball]] record for most career hits with his 4,192nd hit.))
Some((Date(11,September,1988),The [[St. Jean Bosco massacre]] takes place in [[Port-au-Prince]], [[Haiti]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1989),Hungary announces that the [[East Germany|East German]] refugees who had been housed in temporary camps were free to leave for West Germany.))
Some((Date(11,September,1992),[[Hurricane Iniki]], one of the most damaging hurricanes in United States history, devastates the Hawaiian islands of [[Kauai]] and [[Oahu]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1997),[[NASA]]'s [[Mars Global Surveyor]] reaches [[Mars]].))
Some((Date(11,September,1998),Opening ceremony for the [[1998 Commonwealth Games]] in [[Kuala Lumpur]], [[Malaysia]]. Malaysia is the first Asian country to host the games.))
Some((Date(11,September,2000),[[Melbourne]] hosts [[World Economic Forum]] where [[S11 (protest)|S11]] protests also take place.))
Some((Date(11,September,2001),Two hijacked aircraft crash into the [[World Trade Center (1973–2001)|World Trade Center]] in New York City, while a third smashes into [[The Pentagon]] in [[Arlington County, Virginia]], and a fourth into a field near [[Shanksville, Pennsylvania]], in a [[September 11 attacks|series of coordinated suicide attacks]] by 19 members of [[al-Qaeda]]. In total 2,996 people are killed.))
Some((Date(11,September,2007),Russia tests the largest [[conventional weapon]] ever, the [[Father of All Bombs]].))
Some((Date(11,September,2008),A major [[2008 Channel Tunnel fire|Channel Tunnel fire]] broke out on a freight train, closed part of [[Channel Tunnel|tunnel]] for 6 months.))
Some((Date(11,September,2012),A total of 315 people are killed in [[2012 Pakistan garment factory fires|two garment factory fires]] in [[Pakistan]].))
Some((Date(11,September,2013),A 400&nbsp;km long [[human chain]] called [[Catalan Way]] is organized by the [[Assemblea Nacional Catalana]] for the [[independence of Catalonia]]))
Some((Date(11,September,2015),A [[Mecca crane collapse|crane collapses]] onto the [[Masjid al-Haram]] mosque in [[Saudi Arabia]] killing 111 people and injuring 394 others.

Some((Date(12,September,1857),The {{SS|Central America}} sinks about 160 miles east of [[Cape Hatteras]], [[North Carolina]], drowning a total of 426 passengers and crew, including Captain [[William Lewis Herndon]]. The ship was carrying 13–15 tons of gold from the [[California Gold Rush]].))
Some((Date(12,September,1885),[[Arbroath 36–0 Bon Accord]], a world record scoreline in professional Association football.))

Some((Date(12,September,1919),[[Adolf Hitler]] joins the [[German Workers' Party]] (later the [[Nazi Party]]).))
Some((Date(12,September,1923),[[Southern Rhodesia]], today called [[Zimbabwe]], is annexed by the [[United Kingdom]].))
Some((Date(12,September,1930),In [[cricket]] [[Wilfred Rhodes]] ends his 1110-game first-class career by taking 5 for 95 for H.D.G. Leveson Gower's XI against the [[Australia national cricket team|Australians]].))

Some((Date(12,September,1940),[[Cave painting]]s are discovered in [[Lascaux]], France.))

Some((Date(12,September,1944),World War II: The liberation of [[Serbia]] from [[Nazi Germany]] continues. [[Bajina Bašta]] in western Serbia is among those liberated cities. Near [[Trier]], American troops enter Germany for the first time.))

Some((Date(12,September,1980),Military [[1980 Turkish coup d'état|coup]] in [[Turkey]].))
Some((Date(12,September,1983),A [[Wells Fargo]] depot in [[West Hartford, Connecticut]], United States, is robbed of approximately US$7 million by [[Los Macheteros]].))
Some((Date(12,September,1984),[[Dwight Gooden]] sets the [[baseball]] record for [[strikeout]]s in a season by a rookie with 246, previously set by [[Herb Score]] in 1954. Gooden's 276 strikeouts that season, pitched in 218 innings, set the current record.))
Some((Date(12,September,1988),[[Hurricane Gilbert]] devastates [[Jamaica]]; it turns towards Mexico's Yucatán Peninsula 2 days later, causing an estimated $5 billion in damage.))
Some((Date(12,September,1990),The two German states and the [[Allied Control Council|Four Powers]] sign the [[Treaty on the Final Settlement with Respect to Germany]] in Moscow, paving the way for [[German reunification]].))
Some((Date(12,September,1992),[[NASA]] launches [[Space Shuttle Endeavour|Space Shuttle ''Endeavour'']] on [[STS-47]] which marked the 50th shuttle mission. On board are [[Mae Jemison|Mae Carol Jemison]], the first [[African-American]] woman in space, [[Mamoru Mohri]], the first Japanese citizen to fly in a US spaceship, and Mark Lee and Jan Davis, the first married couple in space.))
Some((Date(12,September,1994),[[Frank Eugene Corder]] crashes a single-engine [[Cessna]] 150 into the [[White House]]'s south lawn, striking the West wing and killing himself.))
Some((Date(12,September,1999),[[Indonesia]] announces it will allow international peace-keepers into [[East Timor]].))
Some((Date(12,September,2001),[[Ansett Australia]], Australia's first commercial interstate airline, collapses due to increased strain on the international airline industry, leaving 10,000 people unemployed.))
Some((Date(12,September,2003),The [[United Nations]] lifts [[International sanctions|sanctions]] against [[Libya]] after that country agreed to accept responsibility and recompense the families of victims in the [[1988]] [[bomb]]ing of [[Pan Am Flight 103]].))
Some((Date(12,September,2005),[[Hong Kong Disneyland]] opens in [[Penny's Bay]], [[Lantau Island]], Hong Kong.))
Some((Date(12,September,2007),Former Philippine President [[Joseph Estrada]] is convicted of the crime of plunder.))
Some((Date(12,September,2008),The [[2008 Chatsworth train collision]] in Los Angeles between a [[Metrolink (Southern California)|Metrolink]] commuter train and a [[Union Pacific]] freight train kills 25 people.))
Some((Date(12,September,2011),The [[9/11 Memorial Museum]] in New York City opens to the public.))
Some((Date(12,September,2014),[[Oscar Pistorius]] is [[Trial of Oscar Pistorius|found guilty]] of the [[culpable homicide]] of his girlfriend, [[Reeva Steenkamp]].))
Some((Date(12,September,2015),A series of [[Petlawad explosion|explosions]] involving [[propane]] triggering nearby illegally stored mining detonators in the Indian town of [[Petlawad]] in the state of [[Madhya Pradesh]] kills at least 105 people with over 150 injured.

Some((Date(13,September,1541),After three years of exile, [[John Calvin]] returns to [[Geneva]] to reform the church under a body of doctrine known as [[Calvinism]].))

Some((Date(13,September,1759),[[Battle of the Plains of Abraham]]: the British defeat the French near [[Quebec City]] in the [[Seven Years' War]], known in the United States as the [[French and Indian War]].))
Some((Date(13,September,1782),[[American Revolutionary War]]: Franco-Spanish troops launch the unsuccessful "grand assault" during the [[Great Siege of Gibraltar]].))
Some((Date(13,September,1788),The [[Philadelphia Convention]] sets the date for the first presidential election in the United States, and New York City becomes the country's temporary capital.))
Some((Date(13,September,1791),King [[Louis XVI of France]] accepts the [[French Constitution of 1791|new constitution]].))
Some((Date(13,September,1808),[[Finnish War]]: In the [[Battle of Jutas]], Swedish forces under Lieutenant General [[Georg Carl von Döbeln]] beat the [[Russian Empire|Russians]], making von Döbeln a Swedish war hero.))
Some((Date(13,September,1812),[[War of 1812]]: A supply wagon sent to relieve [[Siege of Fort Harrison|Fort Harrison]] is ambushed in the [[Siege of Fort Harrison#Attacks at the Narrows|Attack at the Narrows]].))
Some((Date(13,September,1814),In a turning point in the War of 1812, the British fail to capture [[Baltimore]]. During the battle, [[Francis Scott Key]] composes his poem "Defence of Fort McHenry", which is later set to music and becomes [[The Star-Spangled Banner|the United States' national anthem]].))
Some((Date(13,September,1843),The Greek Army [[3 September 1843 Revolution|rebels]] ([[Old Style and New Style dates|OS date]]: September 3) against the autocratic rule of king [[Otto of Greece]], demanding the granting of a constitution.))
Some((Date(13,September,1847),[[Mexican–American War]]: Six teenage military [[cadet]]s known as [[Niños Héroes]] die defending [[Chapultepec Castle]] in the [[Battle of Chapultepec]]. American troops under General [[Winfield Scott]] capture Mexico City in the Mexican–American War.))
Some((Date(13,September,1848),Vermont railroad worker [[Phineas Gage]] survives a 3-foot 7-inch (1.1{{nbsp}}m) iron rod being driven through his head; the reported effects on his behavior and personality stimulate thinking about the nature of the brain and its functions.))
Some((Date(13,September,1850),First ascent of [[Piz Bernina]], the highest summit of the eastern Alps.))
Some((Date(13,September,1862),[[American Civil War]]: [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] soldiers find a copy of [[Robert E. Lee]]'s battle plans in a field outside [[Frederick, Maryland]]. It is the prelude to the [[Battle of Antietam]].))
Some((Date(13,September,1882),[[Anglo-Egyptian War]]: The [[Battle of Tel el-Kebir]] is fought.))
Some((Date(13,September,1898),[[Hannibal Goodwin]] patents [[celluloid]] [[photographic film]].))
Some((Date(13,September,1899),[[Henry H. Bliss|Henry Bliss]] is the first person in the United States to be killed in an automobile accident.))
Some((Date(13,September,1900),[[Filipinos|Filipino]] resistance fighters defeat a small American [[Column (formation)|column]] in the [[Battle of Pulang Lupa]], during the [[Philippine–American War]].))

Some((Date(13,September,1968),[[People's Socialist Republic of Albania|Albania]] leaves the [[Warsaw Pact]].))
Some((Date(13,September,1971),State police and [[National Guard of the United States|National Guardsmen]] storm New York's [[Attica Prison]] to quell a [[Attica Prison riot|prison revolt]].))
Some((Date(13,September,1979),South Africa grants independence to the "homeland" of [[Venda]] (not recognised outside South Africa).))
Some((Date(13,September,1985),''[[Super Mario Bros.]]'' is released in Japan for the [[Nintendo Entertainment System|NES]], which starts the ''[[Super Mario]]'' series of platforming games.))
Some((Date(13,September,1987),[[Goiânia accident]]: A [[radioactive]] object is stolen from an abandoned hospital in [[Goiânia]], Brazil, contaminating many people in the following weeks and causing some to die from [[radiation poisoning]].))
Some((Date(13,September,1988),[[Hurricane Gilbert]] is the strongest recorded hurricane in the Western Hemisphere, later replaced by [[Hurricane Wilma]] in [[2005]] (based on [[barometric pressure]]).))

Some((Date(14,September,1943),World War II: The [[Wehrmacht]] starts a three-day [[Viannos massacres|retaliatory]] operation targeting several Greek villages in the region of [[Viannos]], whose death toll would eventually exceed 500 persons.))

Some((Date(16,September,1961),The United States [[National Hurricane Research Project]] drops eight cylinders of [[silver iodide]] into the eyewall of [[Hurricane Esther]]. Wind speed reduces by 10%, giving rise to [[Project Stormfury]].))

Some((Date(19,September,1863),American Civil War: The first day of the [[Battle of Chickamauga]], in northwestern Georgia, the bloodiest two-day battle of the conflict, and the only significant Confederate victory in the war's [[Western Theater of the American Civil War|Western Theater]].))
Some((Date(19,September,1864),American Civil War: [[Third Battle of Winchester]]: [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] troops under General [[Philip Sheridan]] defeat a [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] force commanded by General [[Jubal Early]]. With over 50,000 troops engaged it was the largest battle fought in the [[Shenandoah Valley]] and was not only militarily decisive in that region of [[Virginia]] but also played a role in securing [[Abraham Lincoln]]'s [[United States presidential election, 1864|election in 1864]].))

Some((Date(25,September,1974),The first ulnar collateral ligament replacement surgery ([[Tommy John surgery]]) performed, on baseball player [[Tommy John]].))

Some((Date(25,September,1978),[[PSA Flight 182]], a [[Boeing 727]], collides in mid-air with a [[Cessna 172]] and crashes in [[San Diego]], killing 144 people.))

Some((Date(25,September,1983),[[Maze Prison escape]]: Thirty-eight republican prisoners, armed with six handguns, hijack a prison meals lorry and smash their way out of [[HM Prison Maze|the Maze prison]]. It is the largest prison escape since World War II and in British history.))
Some((Date(25,September,1992),[[NASA]] launches the ''[[Mars Observer]]'', a $511 million probe to [[Mars]], in the first U.S. mission to the planet in 17 years. Eleven months later, the probe would fail.))

Some((Date(10,October,1980),A magnitude 7.3 [[1980 El Asnam earthquake|earthquake]] occurs in the [[Algeria]]n town of [[Chlef|El Asnam]]. Around 3,500 die and 300,000 are left homeless.))
Some((Date(10,October,1985),[[United States Navy]] [[Grumman F-14 Tomcat|F-14]] fighter jets intercept an [[Egypt]]ian plane carrying the [[wiktionary:Hijacking|hijackers]] of the ''[[MS Achille Lauro|Achille Lauro]]'' cruise ship, and force it to land at a [[NATO]] base in [[Sigonella]], [[Sicily]] where they are arrested.))
Some((Date(10,October,1986),The 5.7 Mw [[1986 San Salvador earthquake|San Salvador earthquake]] shook [[San Salvador]], [[El Salvador]] with a maximum [[Mercalli intensity scale|Mercalli intensity]] of IX (Violent). Up to 1,500 people were killed.))

Some((Date(11,October,1727),[[George II of Great Britain|George II]] and [[Caroline of Ansbach]] are crowned King and Queen of [[Kingdom of Great Britain|Great Britain]].))

Some((Date(13,October,2013),A [[2013 Madhya Pradesh stampede|stampede]] breaks out on a bridge near the Ratangarh Mata Temple in [[Datia district]], [[Madhya Pradesh]], India during the Hindu festival [[Navratri]], killing 115 people and injuring more than 110.

Some((Date(14,October,1066),[[Norman Conquest]]: [[Battle of Hastings]]: In England on [[Senlac Hill]], seven miles from [[Hastings]], the [[Normans|Norman]] forces of [[William the Conqueror]] defeat the [[Anglo-Saxons|English]] army and kill King [[Harold II of England]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1322),[[Robert the Bruce]] of Scotland defeats King [[Edward II of England]] at [[Battle of Old Byland|Byland]], forcing Edward to accept Scotland's independence.))
Some((Date(14,October,1465),[[Wallachia]]n [[voivode]] [[Radu cel Frumos]], younger brother of [[Vlad Ţepeş]], issues a [[writ]] from his residence in [[Bucharest]]))
Some((Date(14,October,1582),Because of the [[adoption of the Gregorian calendar]] this day does not exist in this year in Italy, Poland, Portugal and Spain.))
Some((Date(14,October,1586),[[Mary, Queen of Scots]], goes on trial for conspiracy against [[Elizabeth I of England]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1656),[[Massachusetts]] enacts the first punitive legislation against the [[Religious Society of Friends]] (Quakers). The marriage of church-and-state in [[Puritanism]] makes them regard the Quakers as spiritually apostate and politically subversive.))
Some((Date(14,October,1758),[[Seven Years' War]]: Austria defeats [[Prussia]] at the [[Battle of Hochkirch]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1773),The first recorded [[Ministry (government department)|Ministry]] of Education, the [[Commission of National Education]], is formed in the [[Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1805),[[Battle of Elchingen]], France defeats Austria.))
Some((Date(14,October,1806),[[Battle of Jena–Auerstedt]] France defeats [[Prussia]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1808),The [[Republic of Ragusa]] is annexed by France.))
Some((Date(14,October,1812),Work on London's [[Regent's Canal]] starts.))
Some((Date(14,October,1840),The [[Maronite]] leader [[Bashir II]] surrenders to the British Army and then is sent into exile on the islands of [[Malta]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1843),The British arrest the Irish nationalist [[Daniel O'Connell]] for conspiracy to commit crimes.))
Some((Date(14,October,1863),[[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Bristoe Station]]: [[Confederate States Army|Confederate troops]] under the command of General [[Robert E. Lee]] fail to drive the [[Union Army]] completely out of [[Virginia]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1880),Mexican soldiers kill [[Victorio]], one of the greatest [[Apache Tribe|Apache]] military strategists.))
Some((Date(14,October,1882),[[University of the Punjab]] is founded in a part of India that later became [[West Pakistan]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1884),The American inventor, [[George Eastman]], receives a U.S. Government [[patent]] on his new paper-strip [[photographic film]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1888),[[Louis Le Prince]] films first motion picture: ''[[Roundhay Garden Scene]]''.))
Some((Date(14,October,1898),The steamer ship {{SS|Mohegan}} sinks after impacting [[the Manacles]] near [[Cornwall]], United Kingdom, killing 106.))
Some((Date(14,October,1908),The [[Chicago Cubs]] defeat the [[Detroit Tigers]], 2–0, clinching the [[World Series]]. It would be their last one to date.))
Some((Date(14,October,1910),The English aviator [[Claude Grahame-White]] lands his [[Farman Aircraft]] biplane on Executive Avenue near the [[White House]] in Washington, D.C..))
Some((Date(14,October,1912),While campaigning in [[Milwaukee]], the former President of the United States, [[Theodore Roosevelt]], is shot and mildly wounded by [[John Schrank]], a mentally-disturbed saloon keeper. With the fresh wound in his chest, and the bullet still within it, Mr. Roosevelt still carries out his scheduled public speech.))
Some((Date(14,October,1913),[[Senghenydd Colliery Disaster]], the United Kingdom's worst coal mining accident, occurs, and it claims the lives of 439 [[miner]]s.))
Some((Date(14,October,1915),World War I: The [[Kingdom of Bulgaria]] joins the [[Central Powers]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1920),Part of [[Pechengsky District|Petsamo Province]] is ceded by the [[Soviet Union]] to Finland.))
Some((Date(14,October,1925),An Anti-French uprising in French-occupied [[Damascus, Syria]]. (All French inhabitants flee the city.)))
Some((Date(14,October,1926),The [[children's literature|children's book]] ''[[Winnie-the-Pooh]]'', by [[A. A. Milne]], is first published.))
Some((Date(14,October,1933),[[Nazi Germany]] withdraws from the [[League of Nations]] and [[World Disarmament Conference]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1938),The first flight of the [[Curtiss Aircraft Company]]'s [[P-40 Warhawk]] [[fighter plane]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1939),The {{GS|U-47|1938|6}} sinks the British battleship {{HMS|Royal Oak|08|6}} within her harbour at [[Scapa Flow]], Scotland.))
Some((Date(14,October,1940),[[Balham tube station#World War II|Balham underground station disaster]] in London, England, sixty-six people in the station were killed during the Nazi [[Luftwaffe]] [[The Blitz|air raids on Great Britain]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1943),Prisoners at the [[Nazi Germany|Nazi German]] [[Sobibór extermination camp]] in Poland revolt against the Germans, killing eleven SS guards, and wounding many more. About 300 of the Sobibor Camp's 600 prisoners escape, and about 50 of these survive the end of the war.))
Some((Date(14,October,1944),World War II: [[Athens]], Greece, is liberated by British Army troops entering the city as the [[Wehrmacht]] pulls out. This clears the way for the Greek government-in-exile to return to its historic capital city, with [[George Papandreou (senior)|George Papandreou, Sr.]], as the [[head of government]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1947),Captain [[Chuck Yeager]] of the [[United States Air Force]] flies a [[Bell X-1]] [[rocket]]-powered [[experimental aircraft]], the ''[[Glamorous Glennis]]'', faster than the [[speed of sound]] at Mach 1.06 (700 miles per hour (1,100&nbsp;km/h; 610 kn) over the high desert of [[Southern California]] and becomes the first pilot and the first airplane to do so in level flight.))
Some((Date(14,October,1949),Eleven leaders of the [[American Communist Party]] are convicted, after a nine-month trial in a [[Federal District Court]], of conspiring to advocate the violent overthrow of the [[U.S. Federal Government]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1952),[[Korean War]]: [[United Nations]] and South Korean forces launch [[Operation Showdown]] against Chinese strongholds at the [[Iron Triangle (Korea)|Iron Triangle]]. The resulting [[Battle of Triangle Hill]] is the biggest and bloodiest battle of 1952.))
Some((Date(14,October,1956),Dr. [[B. R. Ambedkar]], the Indian [[Dalit (outcaste)|Untouchable caste]] leader, converts to Buddhism along with 385,000 of his followers (see [[Neo-Buddhism]]).))
Some((Date(14,October,1957),Queen [[Elizabeth II]] becomes the first [[Monarchy in Canada|Canadian monarch]] to open up an annual session of the [[Parliament of Canada|Canadian Parliament]], presenting her [[Speech from the throne]] in [[Ottawa]], Canada.))
Some((Date(14,October,1958),The American [[U.S. Atomic Energy Commission|Atomic Energy Commission]], with supporting military units, carries out an underground [[nuclear weapon test]] at the [[Nevada Test Site]], just north of [[Las Vegas]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1962),The [[Cuban Missile Crisis]] begins: A U.S. Air Force [[Lockheed U-2|U-2 reconnaissance plane]] and its [[aviator|pilot]] fly over the island of [[Cuba]] and take photographs of [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] missiles capable of carrying [[nuclear warhead]]s being installed and erected in Cuba.))
Some((Date(14,October,1964),[[Martin Luther King, Jr.]] received the [[Nobel Peace Prize]] for combating racial inequality through nonviolence. ))
Some((Date(14,October,1966),The city of [[Montreal]] begins the operation of its underground [[Montreal Metro]] [[rapid-transit|rapid-transit system]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1967),[[Vietnam War]]: The folk singer [[Joan Baez]] is arrested concerning a physical blockade of the U.S. Army's induction center in [[Oakland, California]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1968),[[Vietnam War]]: Twenty-seven soldiers are arrested at the [[Presidio of San Francisco]] in [[California]] for their peaceful protest of stockade conditions and the Vietnam War.))
Some((Date(14,October,1969),The United Kingdom introduces the [[Fifty pence (British coin)|British fifty-pence coin]], which replaces, over the following years, the British [[ten-shilling note]], in anticipation of the [[Decimal Day|decimalization of the British currency]] in [[1971]], and the abolition of the shilling as a unit of currency anywhere in the world.))
Some((Date(14,October,1973),In the [[Thammasat student uprising]] over [[:th:เหตุการณ์ 14 ตุลา|100,000 people protest]] in [[Thailand]] against the [[Thanom Kittikachorn|Thanom]] military government, 77 are killed and 857 are injured by soldiers.))
Some((Date(14,October,1979),The first [[Gay Rights]] March on Washington, D.C., the [[National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights]], demands "an end to all social, economic, judicial, and legal oppression of lesbian and gay people", and draws 200,000 people.))
Some((Date(14,October,1981),Citing official misconduct in the investigation and trial, [[Amnesty International]] charges the U.S. Federal Government with holding [[Dickie Marshall|Richard Marshall]] of the [[American Indian Movement]] as a political prisoner.))
Some((Date(14,October,1982),U.S. President [[Ronald Reagan]] proclaims a [[War on Drugs]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1983),[[Maurice Bishop]], [[Prime Minister of Grenada]], is overthrown and later executed in a military [[coup d'état]] led by [[Bernard Coard]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1984),"[[Baby Fae]]" receives a [[heart transplant]] from a [[baboon]].))
Some((Date(14,October,1994),The Palestinian leader, [[Yasser Arafat]], The [[Prime Minister of Israel]], [[Yitzhak Rabin]], and the [[Foreign Minister of Israel]], [[Shimon Peres]], receive the [[Nobel Peace Prize]] for their role in the establishment of the [[Oslo Accords]] and the framing of the future Palestinian Self Government.))
Some((Date(14,October,1998),[[Eric Rudolph]] is charged with six bombings including the 1996 [[Centennial Olympic Park bombing]] in [[Atlanta|Atlanta, Georgia]].))
Some((Date(14,October,2003),[[Chicago Cubs]] fan [[Steve Bartman incident|Steve Bartman]] becomes infamously known as the scapegoat for the Cubs losing Game 6 of the [[2003 National League Championship Series]] to the [[Florida Marlins]].))
Some((Date(14,October,2006),The [[FIU–Miami football brawl|college football brawl between University of Miami and Florida International University]] leads to suspensions of 31 players of both teams.))
Some((Date(14,October,2014),A [[2014 Nepal snowstorm disaster|snowstorm]] and avalanche in the [[Nepal]]ese [[Himalayas]] triggered by the remnants of [[Cyclone Hudhud]] kills 43 people.))
Some((Date(14,October,2015),A [[Taunsa Sharif bombing|suicide bomb]] attack in Pakistan, kills at least seven people and injures 13 others.

Some((Date(15,October,1066),[[Edgar the Ætheling]] is proclaimed King of England, but is never crowned. He reigns until 10 December 1066.))
Some((Date(15,October,1211),[[Battle of the Rhyndacus (1211)|Battle of the Rhyndacus]]: The [[Latin emperor]] [[Henry of Flanders]] defeats the [[Nicaean emperor]] [[Theodore I Laskaris]].))
Some((Date(15,October,1529),The [[Siege of Vienna]] ends as the Austrians rout the invading Turks, turning the tide against almost a century of unchecked conquest throughout eastern and central Europe by the [[Ottoman Empire]].))
Some((Date(15,October,1582),[[Pope Gregory XIII]] implements the [[Gregorian calendar]]. In Italy, Poland, Portugal, and Spain, [[October 4]] of this year is followed directly by October 15.))
Some((Date(15,October,1764),[[Edward Gibbon]] observes a group of friars singing in the ruined [[Temple of Jupiter Optimus Maximus|Temple of Jupiter]] in Rome, which inspires him to begin work on ''[[The History of the Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire]]''.))
Some((Date(15,October,1783),The [[Montgolfier brothers]]' [[hot air balloon]] (tethered) makes the first human ascent, piloted by [[Jean-François Pilâtre de Rozier]].))
Some((Date(15,October,1793),Queen [[Marie Antoinette]] of France is tried and convicted in a swift, pre-determined trial in the Palais de Justice, Paris, and condemned to death the following day.))
Some((Date(15,October,1815),[[Napoleon I of France]] begins his exile on [[Saint Helena]] in the Atlantic Ocean.))
Some((Date(15,October,1863),[[American Civil War]]: The [[H. L. Hunley (submarine)|''H. L. Hunley'']], the first [[submarine]] to sink a ship, sinks during a test, killing its inventor, [[Horace Lawson Hunley|Horace L. Hunley]].))
Some((Date(15,October,1864),American Civil War: The [[Battle of Glasgow, Missouri|Battle of Glasgow]] is fought, resulting in the surrender of [[Glasgow, Missouri]] and its Union garrison, to the [[Confederate States of America|Confederacy]].))
Some((Date(15,October,1878),The [[Edison Electric Light Company]] begins operation.))
Some((Date(15,October,1888),The [[From Hell letter|"From Hell" letter]] allegedly sent by [[Jack the Ripper]] is received by investigators.))
Some((Date(15,October,1894),The [[Dreyfus affair]]: [[Alfred Dreyfus]] is arrested for spying.))
Some((Date(15,October,1904),The Russian [[Baltic Fleet]] leaves [[Reval]], [[Estonia]] for [[Lüshunkou|Port Arthur]] during the [[Russo-Japanese War]].))
Some((Date(15,October,1910),[[America (airship)|Airship America]] is launched from New Jersey in the first attempt to cross the Atlantic by a powered aircraft.))
Some((Date(15,October,1917),[[World War I]]: At [[Vincennes]] outside Paris, Dutch dancer [[Mata Hari]] is executed by [[firing squad]] for [[espionage|spying]] for the [[German Empire]].))
Some((Date(15,October,1923),The [[German Rentenmark]] is introduced in Germany to counter [[hyperinflation in the Weimar Republic]].))
Some((Date(15,October,1928),The airship, ''[[LZ 127 Graf Zeppelin|Graf Zeppelin]]'' completes its first trans-Atlantic flight, landing at [[Lakehurst, New Jersey]], United States.))
Some((Date(15,October,1932),Tata Airlines (later to become [[Air India]]) makes its first flight.))
Some((Date(15,October,1934),The [[Jiangxi Soviet|Soviet Republic of China]] collapses when [[Chiang Kai-shek]]'s [[National Revolutionary Army]] successfully encircles [[Ruijin]], forcing the fleeing [[Communist Party of China|Communists]] to begin the [[Long March]].))
Some((Date(15,October,1939),The New York Municipal Airport (later renamed [[LaGuardia Airport]]) is dedicated.))
Some((Date(15,October,1940),The [[President of the Generalitat of Catalonia|President]] of [[Catalonia]], [[Lluís Companys]], is executed by the Spanish dictatorship of Francisco Franco, making him the only European president to have been executed.))
Some((Date(15,October,1944),The [[Arrow Cross Party]] (very similar to [[Adolf Hitler|Hitler's]] NSDAP (Nazi party)) takes power in Hungary.))
Some((Date(15,October,1945),[[World War II]]: The former premier of [[Vichy France]] [[Pierre Laval]] is shot by a firing squad for [[treason]].))
Some((Date(15,October,1946),[[United Nations Security Council Resolution 9]] relating to [[International Court of Justice|ICJ]] is adopted.))
Some((Date(15,October,1951),Mexican chemist [[Luis E. Miramontes]] conducts the very last step of the first synthesis of [[norethisterone]], the [[progestin]] that would later be used in one of the first three [[combined oral contraceptive pill|oral contraceptive]]s.))
Some((Date(15,October,1953),British [[nuclear test]] ''Totem 1'' is detonated at [[Emu Field, South Australia]].))
Some((Date(15,October,1954),[[Hurricane Hazel]] devastates the eastern seaboard of North America, killing 95 and causing massive floods as far north as Toronto.  As a [[Saffir–Simpson hurricane wind scale|Category 4]] upon landfall, it is the strongest storm on record to strike as far south as [[North Carolina]].))
Some((Date(15,October,1956),[[Fortran]], the first modern computer language, is shared with the coding community for the first time.))
Some((Date(15,October,1965),[[Vietnam War]]: The [[Catholic Worker Movement]] stages an anti-war rally in Manhattan including a public [[Draft-card burning|burning of a draft card]]; the first such act to result in arrest under a new amendment to the Selective Service Act.))
Some((Date(15,October,1966),The [[Black Panther Party]] is created by [[Huey P. Newton]] and [[Bobby Seale]].))
Some((Date(15,October,1969),Vietnam War; The [[Moratorium to End the War in Vietnam]] is held in Washington D.C. and across the US. Over two million demonstrate nationally; about 250,000 in Washington D.C..))
Some((Date(15,October,1970),Thirty-five construction workers are killed when a section of the new [[West Gate Bridge]] in [[Melbourne]] collapses.))
Some((Date(15,October,1971),The start of the 2500-year celebration of [[Iran]], celebrating the birth of [[Persia]].))
Some((Date(15,October,1979),[[Black Monday (Malta)|Black Monday]] in [[Malta]]. The building of the ''Times of Malta'', the residence of the opposition leader [[Eddie Fenech Adami]] and several [[Nationalist Party (Malta)|Nationalist Party]] clubs are ransacked and destroyed by supporters of the [[Malta Labour Party]].))
Some((Date(15,October,1987),The [[Great Storm of 1987]] hits France and England.))
Some((Date(15,October,1989),[[Wayne Gretzky]] becomes the all-time leading points scorer in the [[NHL]].))
Some((Date(15,October,1990),Soviet Union leader [[Mikhail Gorbachev]] is awarded the [[Nobel Peace Prize]] for his efforts to lessen [[Cold War]] tensions and open up his nation.))
Some((Date(15,October,1995),[[Marco Campos]] is killed in an accident in a [[International Formula 3000]] race at the [[Circuit de Nevers Magny-Cours]] circuit, making him the only driver ever killed in the International Formula 3000 series.))
Some((Date(15,October,1997),The first supersonic [[land speed record]] is set by [[Andy Green]] in ''[[ThrustSSC]]'' (United Kingdom), 50 years and one day after [[Chuck Yeager]] first broke the [[sound barrier]] in the Earth's atmosphere.))
Some((Date(15,October,2001),[[NASA]]'s [[Galileo spacecraft]] passes within 112 miles of [[Jupiter]]'s moon [[Io (moon)|Io]].))
Some((Date(15,October,2003),China launches [[Shenzhou 5]], its first [[manned space mission]].))
Some((Date(15,October,2005),[[2005 Toledo riot|A riot]] in [[Toledo, Ohio]] breaks out during a [[Neo-Nazism|National Socialist/Neo-Nazi]] protest; over 100 are arrested.))
Some((Date(15,October,2006),[[2006 Hawaii earthquake|Hawaii earthquake]]: A magnitude 6.7 earthquake rocks Hawaii, causing property damage, injuries, [[landslide]]s, [[power outage]]s, and the closure of [[Honolulu International Airport]].))
Some((Date(15,October,2007),Seventeen activists in New Zealand are arrested in the country's first post 9/11 [[2007 New Zealand police raids|anti-terrorism raids]].))
Some((Date(15,October,2008),The [[Dow Jones Industrial Average]] closes down 733.08 points, or 7.87%, the second [[Black Monday (1987)|worst day in the Dow's history]] based on a percentage drop.))
Some((Date(15,October,2011),[[15 October 2011 global protests|Global protests]] break out in 120 cities in 48 countries.))
Some((Date(15,October,2013),A 7.2-[[Surface wave magnitude|magnitude]] [[2013 Bohol earthquake|earthquake strikes]] the [[Philippines]], resulting in more than 215 deaths.

Some((Date(16,October,1882),The [[New York, Chicago and St. Louis Railroad|Nickel Plate Railroad]] opens for business.))
Some((Date(16,October,1905),The [[Partition of Bengal (1905)|Partition of Bengal]] in India takes place.))

Some((Date(17,October,1940),The body of Communist propagandist [[Willi Münzenberg]] found in South France, starting a never-resolved mystery.))
Some((Date(17,October,1941),[[World War II]]: a [[German submarine U-568|German submarine]] attacks an [[USS Kearny (DD-432)|American ship]] for the first time in the war.))
Some((Date(17,October,1943),The [[Burma Railway]] (Burma–Thailand Railway) is completed.))
Some((Date(17,October,1945),A massive number of people, headed by [[Confederación General del Trabajo de la República Argentina|CGT]], gather in the [[Plaza de Mayo]] in [[Buenos Aires]], [[Argentina]] to demand [[Juan Perón]]'s release. It calls "el día de la lealtad peronista" ([[Loyalty Day (Argentina)|peronista loyalty day]])))

Some((Date(17,October,1964),[[Prime Minister of Australia]] [[Robert Menzies]] opens the artificial [[Lake Burley Griffin]] in the middle of the capital [[Canberra]].))
Some((Date(17,October,1965),The [[1964 New York World's Fair|1964–65 New York World's Fair]] closes after a two-year run. More than 51 million people had attended the event.))
Some((Date(17,October,1966),A fire at a building in New York City kills 12 firefighters, the [[New York City Fire Department|fire department]]'s deadliest day until the [[September 11, 2001 attacks]].))

Sixty-three people were killed.))
