Some((Date(21,October,1774),First display of the word "Liberty" on a flag, raised by colonists in [[Taunton, Massachusetts]] in defiance of British rule in [[Colonial America]].))
Some((Date(21,October,1797),In [[Boston Harbor]], the 44-gun United States Navy [[frigate]] {{USS|Constitution}} is launched.))
Some((Date(21,October,1805),[[Napoleonic Wars]]: [[Battle of Trafalgar]]: A British fleet led by [[Admiral (Royal Navy)|Vice Admiral]] [[Horatio Nelson, 1st Viscount Nelson|Lord Nelson]] defeats a combined French and Spanish fleet off the coast of Spain under [[Pierre-Charles Villeneuve|Admiral Villeneuve]], signaling almost the end of French maritime power and leaves Britain's navy unchallenged until the 20th century.))
Some((Date(21,October,1816),The [[Penang Free School]] is founded in [[George Town, Penang]], [[Malaysia]], by the Rev Hutchings, the oldest English-language school in Southeast Asia.))
Some((Date(21,October,1824),[[Joseph Aspdin]] [[patent]]s [[Portland cement]].))
Some((Date(21,October,1854),[[Florence Nightingale]] and a staff of 38 [[nurse]]s are sent to the [[Crimean War]].))
Some((Date(21,October,1861),[[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Ball's Bluff]]: [[United States|Union]] forces under Colonel [[Edward Dickinson Baker|Edward Baker]] are defeated by [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] troops in the second major battle of the war. Baker, a close friend of [[Abraham Lincoln]], is killed in the fighting.))
Some((Date(21,October,1867),[[Manifest destiny]]: [[Medicine Lodge Treaty]]: Near [[Medicine Lodge, Kansas|Medicine Lodge]], [[Kansas]] a landmark treaty is signed by southern [[Great Plains]] Indian leaders. The treaty requires [[Native Americans in the United States|Native American]] Plains tribes to relocate to a reservation in western [[Oklahoma]].))
Some((Date(21,October,1879),[[Thomas Edison]] invents a workable electric light bulb at his laboratory in Menlo Park, N.J. which was tested the next day and lasted 13.5 hours. This would be the invention of the first commercially practical incandescent light. Popular belief is that he invented the first light bulb, which he did not. ))
Some((Date(21,October,1888),Foundation of the [[Social Democratic Party of Switzerland|Swiss Social Democratic Party]].))
Some((Date(21,October,1892),Opening ceremonies for the [[World's Columbian Exposition]] are held in Chicago, though because construction was behind schedule, the exposition did not open until May 1, 1893.))
Some((Date(21,October,1895),The [[Republic of Formosa]] collapses as [[Empire of Japan|Japanese]] forces invade.))
Some((Date(21,October,1902),In the United States, a five-month [[Strike action|strike]] by [[United Mine Workers]] ends.))
Some((Date(21,October,1910),{{HMS|Niobe|1897|6}} arrives in [[Halifax Harbour]] to become the first ship of the [[Royal Canadian Navy]].))
Some((Date(21,October,1912),[[First Balkan War]]: [[Kardzhali]] is liberated by [[Kingdom of Bulgaria|Bulgarian]] forces.))
Some((Date(21,October,1921),President [[Warren G. Harding]] delivers the first speech by a sitting U.S. President against [[lynching]] in the deep South.))
Some((Date(21,October,1931),The [[Sakurakai]], a secret society in the [[Imperial Japanese Army]], launches an abortive [[October incident|coup d'état attempt]].))
Some((Date(21,October,1940),The first edition of the [[Ernest Hemingway]] novel ''[[For Whom the Bell Tolls]]'' is published.))
Some((Date(21,October,1943),The [[Azad Hind|Provisional Government of Free India]] is formally declared by [[Subhas Chandra Bose]].))
Some((Date(21,October,1944),World War II: The first [[kamikaze]] attack. A Japanese fighter plane carrying a {{convert|200|kg|lb|adj=on}} [[bomb]] attacks {{HMAS|Australia|D84|6}} off [[Leyte (island)|Leyte Island]], as the [[Battle of Leyte Gulf]] began.))
Some((Date(21,October,1945),[[Women's suffrage]]: Women are allowed to vote in France for the first time.))
Some((Date(21,October,1950),[[Korean War]]: Heavy fighting begins between British and Australian forces from the [[27th British Commonwealth Brigade]] and the North Korean 239th Regiment during the [[Battle of Yongju]].))
Some((Date(21,October,1956),[[Mau Mau Uprising]]: Kenyan rebel leader [[Dedan Kimathi]] is captured by the [[British Army]], signalling the ultimate defeat of the rebellion, and essentially ending the British military campaign.))
Some((Date(21,October,1959),In New York City, the [[Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum]], designed by [[Frank Lloyd Wright]], opens to the public.))
Some((Date(21,October,1965),[[Comet Ikeya–Seki]] approaches perihelion, passing 450,000 kilometers (279,617 miles) from the sun.))
Some((Date(21,October,1966),[[Aberfan disaster]]: A [[slag heap]] collapses on the village of [[Aberfan]] in Wales, killing 144 people, mostly schoolchildren.))
Some((Date(21,October,1967),[[Vietnam War]]: More than 100,000 war protesters gather in [[Washington, D.C.]]. A [[Protests against the Vietnam War|peaceful rally]] at the [[Lincoln Memorial]] is followed by a march to [[The Pentagon]] and clashes with soldiers and [[United States Marshal]]s protecting the facility. Similar demonstrations occurred simultaneously in Japan and [[Western Europe]].))
Some((Date(21,October,1969),A [[coup d'état]] in [[Somalia]] brings [[Siad Barre]] to power and establishes a [[Somali Democratic Republic|socialist republic in Somalia]].))
Some((Date(21,October,1971),A [[Clarkston explosion|gas explosion]] kills 22 people at a shopping center in [[Clarkston, East Renfrewshire]], near [[Glasgow]], Scotland.))
Some((Date(21,October,1973),[[John Paul Getty III]]'s ear is cut off by his kidnappers and sent to a newspaper in Rome; it doesn't arrive until [[November 8]].))
Some((Date(21,October,1977),The [[European Patent Institute]] is founded.))
Some((Date(21,October,1978),Australian civilian pilot [[Disappearance of Frederick Valentich|Frederick Valentich vanishes]] in a [[Cessna 182]] over the [[Bass Strait]] south of [[Melbourne]], after reporting contact with an unidentified aircraft.))
Some((Date(21,October,1979),[[Moshe Dayan]] resigns from the Israeli government because of strong disagreements with Prime Minister [[Menachem Begin]] over policy towards the Arabs.))
Some((Date(21,October,1981),[[Andreas Papandreou]] becomes [[Prime Minister of Greece]], ending an almost 50-year-long system of power dominated by conservative forces.))
Some((Date(21,October,1983),The [[metre]] is defined at the seventeenth [[General Conference on Weights and Measures]] as the distance light travels in a [[vacuum]] in 1/299,792,458 of a second.))
Some((Date(21,October,1986),In [[Lebanon]], pro-[[Iran]] kidnappers claim to have [[Iran–Contra affair|abducted]] American writer Edward Tracy (he is released in August 1991).))
Some((Date(21,October,1987),[[Jaffna hospital massacre]] is carried out by [[Indian Peace Keeping Force]] in [[Sri Lanka]] killing 70 ethnic [[Tamils|Tamil]] patients, doctors and nurses.))
Some((Date(21,October,1994),[[North Korea and weapons of mass destruction|North Korea nuclear weapons program]]: [[North Korea]] and the United States sign an agreement that requires North Korea to stop its [[nuclear weapon]]s program and agree to inspections.))
Some((Date(21,October,2005),Images of the [[dwarf planet]] [[136199 Eris|Eris]] are taken and subsequently used in documenting its discovery by the team of [[Michael E. Brown]], [[Chad Trujillo]], and [[David L. Rabinowitz]].))
Some((Date(21,October,2012),A [[2012 Azana Spa shootings|shooting]] at a spa in [[Brookfield, Wisconsin]], leaves four people dead, including the shooter.))
Some((Date(21,October,2013),[[2013 Northeastern China smog|Record smog]] closes schools, roadways, and the airport in [[Harbin]], China.

))
Some((Date(22,October,1383),The [[1383–85 Crisis]] in Portugal: King [[Ferdinand I of Portugal|Fernando]] dies without a male heir to the Portuguese throne, sparking a period of [[civil war]] and disorder.))
Some((Date(22,October,1575),Foundation of [[Aguascalientes City|Aguascalientes]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1633),[[Battle of Liaoluo Bay]]: The [[Ming dynasty]] defeats the [[Dutch East India Company]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1707),[[Scilly naval disaster of 1707|Scilly naval disaster]]: four British [[Royal Navy]] ships run aground near the [[Isles of Scilly]] because of faulty [[navigation]]. Admiral Sir [[Cloudesley Shovell]] and thousands of sailors drown.))
Some((Date(22,October,1730), Construction of the [[Ladoga Canal]] is completed.))
Some((Date(22,October,1746), The College of New Jersey (later renamed [[Princeton University]]) receives its charter.))
Some((Date(22,October,1777),[[American Revolutionary War]]: American defenders of [[Fort Mercer]] on the Delaware River repulse repeated [[Hessian (soldiers)|Hessian]] attacks in the [[Battle of Red Bank]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1784),[[Russian Empire|Russia]] founds a colony on [[Kodiak Island]], Alaska.))
Some((Date(22,October,1790),Warriors of the [[Miami people]] under Chief [[Little Turtle]] defeat United States troops under General [[Josiah Harmar]] at the site of present-day [[Fort Wayne, Indiana]], in the [[Northwest Indian War]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1797),[[André-Jacques Garnerin]] makes the first recorded [[parachute]] jump from one thousand meters (3,200 feet) above Paris.))
Some((Date(22,October,1836),[[Sam Houston]] is inaugurated as the first President of the [[Republic of Texas]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1844),The Great Anticipation: [[Millerites]], followers of [[William Miller (preacher)|William Miller]], anticipate the end of the world in conjunction with the Second Advent of Christ. The following day became known as the [[Great Disappointment]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1859),Spain declares war on [[Morocco]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1866),A plebiscite ratifies the annexion of [[Veneto]] and [[Mantua]] to Italy, occurred three days before, on [[October 19]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1875),First [[telegraph]]ic connection in [[Argentina]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1877),The [[Blantyre mining disaster]] in Scotland kills 207 miners.))
Some((Date(22,October,1878),The first [[rugby football|rugby]] match under floodlights takes place in [[Salford, Greater Manchester|Salford]], between Broughton and [[Swinton Lions|Swinton]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1879),Using a filament of [[carbon]]ized thread, [[Thomas Edison]] tests the first practical electric [[incandescent light bulb]] (it lasted 13½ hours before burning out).))
Some((Date(22,October,1883),The [[Metropolitan Opera House (39th Street)|Metropolitan Opera House]] in New York City opens with a performance of [[Charles Gounod|Gounod's]] ''[[Faust (opera)|Faust]]''.))
Some((Date(22,October,1884),[[Greenwich]], in London, England, is adopted as [[Universal Time]] meridian of longitude by the [[International Meridian Conference]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1895),In Paris an express train [[Montparnasse derailment|derails]] after overrunning the [[buffer stop]], crossing almost {{convert|30|m|ft|-1}} of concourse before crashing through a wall and falling {{convert|10|m}} to the road below.))
Some((Date(22,October,1907),[[Panic of 1907]]: A run on the stock of the [[Knickerbocker Trust Company]] sets events in motion that will lead to a [[depression (economics)|depression]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1910),[[Hawley Harvey Crippen|Dr. Crippen]] is convicted at the [[Old Bailey]] of poisoning his wife and is subsequently hanged at [[HM Prison Pentonville|Pentonville Prison]] in London.))
Some((Date(22,October,1923),The royalist [[Leonardopoulos–Gargalidis coup d'état attempt]] fails in Greece, discrediting the monarchy and paving the way for the establishment of the [[Second Hellenic Republic]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1924),[[Toastmasters International]] is founded.))
Some((Date(22,October,1926),[[J. Gordon Whitehead]] [[sucker punch]]es magician [[Harry Houdini]] in the stomach in Montreal, precipitating his death.))
Some((Date(22,October,1927),[[Nikola Tesla]] introduces six new inventions including a motor with onephase electricity))
Some((Date(22,October,1928),[[Phi Sigma Alpha]] fraternity is founded at the [[University of Puerto Rico, Río Piedras Campus]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1934),In [[East Liverpool, Ohio]], [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]] agents shoot and kill notorious [[bank robbery|bank robber]] [[Pretty Boy Floyd]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1941),[[World War II]]: French resistance member [[Guy Môquet]] and 29 other hostages are executed by the Germans in retaliation for the death of a German officer.))
Some((Date(22,October,1943),World War II: in the Second [[firestorm]] raid on Germany, the [[Royal Air Force]] [[Bombing of Kassel in World War II|conducts an air raid]] on the town of [[Kassel]], killing 10,000 and rendering 150,000 homeless.))
Some((Date(22,October,1946),[[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[Operation Osoaviakhim]] takes place, recruiting of thousands of military-related technical specialists from the Soviet occupation zone of post-World-War-II Germany for employment in the Soviet Union.))
Some((Date(22,October,1957),[[Vietnam War]]: First United States casualties in [[Vietnam]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1962),[[Cuban Missile Crisis]]: US President [[John F. Kennedy]], after internal counsel from [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]], announces that American reconnaissance planes have discovered Soviet [[nuclear weapon]]s in [[Cuba]], and that he has ordered a naval "quarantine" of the Communist nation.))
Some((Date(22,October,1963),A [[BAC One-Eleven]] prototype airliner crashes in UK with the loss of all on board.))
Some((Date(22,October,1964),[[Jean-Paul Sartre]] is awarded the [[Nobel Prize in Literature]], but turns down the honor.))
Some((Date(22,October,1966),[[The Supremes]] become the first all-female [[music]] group to attain a No. 1 selling album (''[[The Supremes A' Go-Go]]'').))
Some((Date(22,October,1968),[[Apollo program]]: ''[[Apollo 7]]'' safely splashes down in the Atlantic Ocean after orbiting the Earth 163 times.))
Some((Date(22,October,1972),[[Vietnam War]]: In [[Saigon]], [[Henry Kissinger]] and [[South Vietnam]]ese President [[Nguyễn Văn Thiệu]] meet to discuss a proposed cease-fire that had been worked out between Americans and [[North Vietnam]]ese in Paris.))
Some((Date(22,October,1973),[[United Nations Security Council Resolution 338]] calling for ceasefire of [[Yom Kippur War]] is adopted.))
Some((Date(22,October,1975),The Soviet unmanned space mission [[Venera 9]] lands on Venus.))
Some((Date(22,October,1976),Red Dye No. 4 is banned by the US [[Food and Drug Administration]] after it is discovered that it causes [[tumor]]s in the bladders of dogs. The dye is still used in Canada.))
Some((Date(22,October,1978),[[Papal inauguration]] of [[Pope John Paul II]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1981),The United States Federal Labor Relations Authority votes to decertify the [[Professional Air Traffic Controllers Organization (1968)|Professional Air Traffic Controllers Organization]] for its [[Strike action|strike]] the previous August.))
Some((Date(22,October,1983),Two [[Prison officer|correctional officers]] are killed by inmates at the [[United States Penitentiary, Marion|United States Penitentiary]] in [[Marion, Illinois]]. The incident inspires the [[Supermax]] model of prisons.))
Some((Date(22,October,1989),11-year-old [[Jacob Wetterling]] is kidnapped by a masked gunman as he rode his bike near his home in [[St. Joseph, Minnesota]].))
Some((Date(22,October,1999),[[Maurice Papon]], an official in the [[Vichy France]] government during World War II, is jailed for [[crimes against humanity]].))
Some((Date(22,October,2001),''[[Grand Theft Auto III]]'' was released, popularizing a genre of [[Grand Theft Auto clone|open-world, action-adventure]] video games as well as spurring [[video game controversies|controversy]] around violence in video games.))
Some((Date(22,October,2005),[[Tropical Storm Alpha (2005)|Tropical Storm Alpha]] forms in the Atlantic Basin, making the [[2005 Atlantic hurricane season]] the most active Atlantic hurricane season on record with 22 named storms.))
Some((Date(22,October,2006),A [[Panama Canal expansion proposal]] is approved by 77.8% of voters in a [[Panama Canal expansion referendum, 2006|National referendum]] held in [[Panama]].))
Some((Date(22,October,2007),[[Raid on Anuradhapura Air Force Base]] is carried out by 21 [[Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam|Tamil Tiger]] commandos. All except one died in this attack. Eight [[Sri Lanka Air Force]] planes are destroyed and 10 damaged.))
Some((Date(22,October,2008),India launches its first unmanned lunar mission [[Chandrayaan-1]].))
Some((Date(22,October,2013),The [[Australian Capital Territory]] becomes the first Australian jurisdiction to legalize [[same-sex marriage]] with the [[Marriage Equality (Same Sex) Act 2013]]))
Some((Date(22,October,2014),Michael Zehaf-Bibeau [[2014 shootings at Parliament Hill, Ottawa|attacks]] the [[Parliament of Canada]] in [[Ottawa|Ottawa, Canada]], killing a soldier and injuring three other people.))
Some((Date(22,October,2015),A teacher and a student are killed, and 2 students injured, in an [[Trollhättan school attack|attack]] at a high school in [[Trollhättan]], Sweden.

))
Some((Date(23,October,1086),At the [[Battle of Sagrajas]], the army of [[Yusuf ibn Tashfin]] defeats the forces of [[Kingdom of Castile|Castilian]] King [[Alfonso VI of León and Castile|Alfonso VI]].))
Some((Date(23,October,1157),The [[Battle of Grathe Heath]] ends the [[civil war]] in Denmark. King [[Sweyn III of Denmark|Sweyn III]] is killed and [[Valdemar I of Denmark|Valdemar I]] restores the country.))
Some((Date(23,October,1295),The first treaty forming the [[Auld Alliance]] between [[Kingdom of Scotland|Scotland]] and France against [[Kingdom of England|England]] is signed in Paris.))
Some((Date(23,October,1641),[[Irish Catholic]] gentry from [[Ulster]] tried to [[Irish Rebellion of 1641|seize control]] of [[Dublin Castle]], the seat of English rule in [[Ireland]], to force concessions to Catholics.))
Some((Date(23,October,1642),[[Battle of Edgehill]]: First major battle of the [[First English Civil War]].))
Some((Date(23,October,1694),British/American colonial forces, led by Sir [[William Phips]], fail to seize [[Quebec]] from the French.))
Some((Date(23,October,1707),The first [[Parliament of Great Britain]] meets.))
Some((Date(23,October,1739),[[War of Jenkins' Ear]] starts: British [[Prime Minister]] [[Robert Walpole]], reluctantly declares war on Spain.))
Some((Date(23,October,1812),[[Claude François de Malet]], a French general, [[Malet coup of 1812|begins a conspiracy]] to overthrow [[Napoleon I of France|Napoleon Bonaparte]], claiming that the Emperor died in Russia and that he is now the commandant of Paris.))
Some((Date(23,October,1850),The first [[National Women's Rights Convention]] begins in [[Worcester, Massachusetts]], United States.))
Some((Date(23,October,1861),U.S. President [[Abraham Lincoln]] suspends the writ of ''[[habeas corpus]]'' in Washington, D.C., for all military-related cases.))
Some((Date(23,October,1864),[[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Westport]]: [[Union Army|Union forces]] under General [[Samuel R. Curtis]] defeat [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] troops led by General [[Sterling Price]] at [[Westport, Kansas City, Missouri|Westport]], near [[Kansas City, Missouri|Kansas City]].))
Some((Date(23,October,1867),Seventy-two Senators are summoned by [[Royal Proclamation]] to serve as the first members of the [[Canadian Senate]].))
Some((Date(23,October,1870),[[Franco-Prussian War]]: The [[Siege of Metz (1870)|Siege of Metz]] concludes with a decisive [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussian]] victory.))
Some((Date(23,October,1906),[[Alberto Santos-Dumont]] flies an airplane in the first [[heavier-than-air flight]] in Europe at Champs de Bagatelle, Paris, France.))
Some((Date(23,October,1911),First use of aircraft in war: [[Italo-Turkish War]]: An Italian pilot takes off from [[Libya]] to observe [[Turkey|Turkish]] army lines.))
Some((Date(23,October,1912),[[First Balkan War]]: The [[Battle of Kumanovo]] between the [[Kingdom of Serbia|Serbian]] and [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] armies begins.))
Some((Date(23,October,1915),[[Women's suffrage]]: In New York City, 25,000–33,000 women march on [[Fifth Avenue]] to advocate their [[right to vote]].))
Some((Date(23,October,1917),[[Vladimir Lenin|Lenin]] calls for the [[October Revolution]].))
Some((Date(23,October,1929),[[Great Depression]]: After a steady decline in [[stock market]] prices since a peak in September, the [[New York Stock Exchange]] begins to show signs of panic.))
Some((Date(23,October,1935),[[Dutch Schultz]], Abe Landau, [[Otto Berman]], and [[Bernard Rosencrantz|Bernard "Lulu" Rosencrantz]] are fatally shot at a [[Bar (establishment)|saloon]] in [[Newark, New Jersey]] in what will become known as The Chophouse Massacre.))
Some((Date(23,October,1939),The Japanese [[Mitsubishi G4M]] twin-engine "Betty" Bomber makes its maiden flight.))
Some((Date(23,October,1941),[[World War II]]: Field Marshal [[Georgy Zhukov]] takes command of [[Red Army]] operations to prevent the further advance into [[Soviet Union|Russia]] of [[Nazi Germany|German]] forces and to prevent the [[Wehrmacht]] from capturing Moscow.))
Some((Date(23,October,1942),World War II: [[Second Battle of El Alamein]]: At [[El Alamein]] in northern [[Egypt]], the British [[Eighth Army (United Kingdom)|Eighth Army]] under [[Bernard Montgomery, 1st Viscount Montgomery of Alamein|Field Marshal Montgomery]] begins a critical offensive to expel the [[Axis powers|Axis]] armies from Egypt.))
Some((Date(23,October,1944),World War II: [[Battle of Leyte Gulf]]: The largest naval battle in history begins in the [[Philippines]].))
Some((Date(23,October,1946),The [[United Nations General Assembly]] convenes for the first time, at an [[auditorium]] in [[Flushing, Queens]], New York City.))
Some((Date(23,October,1955),Prime Minister [[Ngô Đình Diệm]] defeats former emperor [[Bảo Đại]] in a [[State of Vietnam referendum, 1955|referendum]] and founds the [[Republic of Vietnam]].))
Some((Date(23,October,1956),Thousands of [[Hungary|Hungarians]] protest against the government and [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] occupation.  (The [[Hungarian Revolution of 1956|Hungarian Revolution]] is crushed on November 4).))
Some((Date(23,October,1958),The [[Springhill Mine bump]]: An underground earthquake traps 174 miners in the No. 2 colliery at [[Springhill, Nova Scotia]], the deepest [[coal mine]] in North America at the time. By [[November 1]], rescuers from around the world had dug out 100 of the victims, marking the death toll at 74.))
Some((Date(23,October,1965),[[Vietnam War]]: The [[1st Cavalry Division (United States)]] (Airmobile), in conjunction with [[South Vietnam]]ese forces, launches a new operation seeking to destroy [[North Vietnam]]ese forces in [[Pleiku]] in the II Corps Tactical Zone (the Central Highlands).))
Some((Date(23,October,1970),[[Gary Gabelich]] sets a land speed record in a rocket-powered automobile called the [[Blue Flame (automobile)|Blue Flame]], fueled with natural gas.))
Some((Date(23,October,1972),[[Operation Linebacker]], a US bombing campaign against [[North Vietnam]] in response to its [[Easter Offensive]], ends after five months.))
Some((Date(23,October,1973),The [[Watergate scandal]]: US President [[Richard M. Nixon]] agrees to turn over subpoenaed audio tapes of his [[Oval Office]] conversations.))
Some((Date(23,October,1983),[[Lebanese Civil War]]: The [[United States Marine Corps|U.S. Marines]] barracks in [[Beirut]] is [[1983 Beirut barracks bombing|hit by a truck bomb]], killing 241 U.S. military personnel.  A French army barracks in [[Lebanon]] is also hit that same morning, killing 58 troops.))
Some((Date(23,October,1989),The [[Hungarian Republic]] is officially declared by president [[Mátyás Szűrös]], replacing the communist [[Hungarian People's Republic]].))
Some((Date(23,October,1993),[[The Troubles]]: A [[Provisional Irish Republican Army|Provisional IRA]] bomb [[Shankill Road bombing|prematurely detonates]] in the [[Shankill Road|Shankill]] area of [[Belfast]], killing the bomber and nine civilians. [[Ulster loyalism|Ulster loyalists]] retaliate a week later with the [[Greysteel massacre]].))
Some((Date(23,October,1995),[[Yolanda Saldívar]] is found guilty of [[first-degree murder]] in the shooting death of popular Latin singer [[Selena]]. Three days later, Saldívar was sentenced to life in prison, eligible for parole in [[2025]]))
Some((Date(23,October,1998),[[Israeli–Palestinian conflict]]: Israeli Prime Minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]] and Palestinian Chairman [[Yasser Arafat]] reach a "[[land for peace]]" agreement.))
Some((Date(23,October,2002),[[Moscow theater hostage crisis]]: [[Chechnya|Chechen]] [[terrorist]]s seize the House of Culture theater in Moscow and take approximately 700 theater-goers hostage.))
Some((Date(23,October,2004),A powerful [[2004 Chūetsu earthquake|earthquake]] and its aftershocks hit [[Niigata Prefecture]] in northern Japan, killing 35 people, injuring 2,200, and leaving 85,000 homeless or evacuated.))
Some((Date(23,October,2007),A powerful [[cold front]] in the [[Bay of Campeche]] causes the Usumacinta [[jackup rig]] to collide with [[Kab 101]], leading to the death and drowning of 22 people during rescue operations after evacuation of the rig.))
Some((Date(23,October,2011),A powerful 7.2 magnitude [[2011 Van earthquake|earthquake]] strikes Van Province, Turkey, killing 582 people and injuring thousands.))
Some((Date(23,October,2012),After 38 years, the world's first [[teletext]] service ([[BBC]]'s [[Ceefax]]) ceases broadcast due to Northern Ireland completing the [[digital switchover]].))
Some((Date(23,October,2015),The lowest sea-level pressure in the Western Hemisphere, and the highest reliably-measured non-tornadic sustained winds, are recorded in [[Hurricane Patricia]], which strikes [[Mexico]] hours later, killing at least 13 and causing over $280 million in damages.

))
Some((Date(24,October,1260),[[Chartres Cathedral]] is dedicated in the presence of King [[Louis IX of France]]; the cathedral is now a [[UNESCO]] [[World Heritage Site]].))
Some((Date(24,October,1360),The [[Treaty of Brétigny]] is ratified at [[Calais]], marking the end of the first phase of the [[Hundred Years' War]].))
Some((Date(24,October,1590),[[John White (colonist and artist)|John White]], the governor of the second [[Roanoke Colony]], returns to England after an unsuccessful search for the "lost" colonists.))
Some((Date(24,October,1648),The [[Peace of Westphalia]] is signed, marking the end of the [[Thirty Years' War]].))
Some((Date(24,October,1795),[[Partitions of Poland]]: The [[Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth]] is completely divided among Austria, [[Prussia]], and Russia.))
Some((Date(24,October,1812),[[Napoleonic Wars]]: The [[Battle of Maloyaroslavets]] takes place near Moscow.))
Some((Date(24,October,1851),[[William Lassell]] discovers the moons [[Umbriel (moon)|Umbriel]], and [[Ariel (moon)|Ariel]], orbiting [[Uranus]].))
Some((Date(24,October,1857),[[Sheffield F.C.]], the world's oldest association football club still in operation, is founded in [[Sheffield]], England.))
Some((Date(24,October,1861),The [[first transcontinental telegraph]] line across the United States is completed, spelling the end for the 18-month-old [[Pony Express]].))
Some((Date(24,October,1901),[[Annie Edson Taylor]] becomes the first person to go over [[Niagara Falls]] in a barrel.))
Some((Date(24,October,1911),[[Orville Wright]] remains in the air nine minutes and 45 seconds in a [[Wright Glider]] at [[Kill Devil Hills, North Carolina]].))
Some((Date(24,October,1912),[[First Balkan War]]: The [[Battle of Lozengrad]] concludes with the [[Kingdom of Bulgaria|Bulgarian]] victory against the [[Ottoman Empire]].))
Some((Date(24,October,1912),[[First Balkan War]]: The [[Battle of Kumanovo]] concludes with the [[Kingdom of Serbia|Serbian]] victory against the [[Ottoman Empire]].))
Some((Date(24,October,1917),[[Battle of Caporetto]]; Italy suffers a catastrophic defeat by the forces of [[Austria-Hungary]] and Germany on the Austro-Italian front of World War I (lasts until 19 November - also called Twelfth Battle of the Isonzo).))
Some((Date(24,October,1926),[[Harry Houdini]]'s last performance takes place at the [[Garrick Theatre]] in [[Detroit]].))
Some((Date(24,October,1929),"[[Wall Street Crash of 1929|Black Thursday]]" [[stock market crash]] on the [[New York Stock Exchange]].))

Among the dead is Field Marshal Mitrofan Nedelin, whose death is reported to have occurred in a plane crash.))
Some((Date(24,October,1964),[[Northern Rhodesia]] gains independence from the United Kingdom and becomes the [[Republic of Zambia]] ([[Southern Rhodesia]] remained a colony until the next year, with the [[Rhodesia's Unilateral Declaration of Independence|Unilateral Declaration of Independence]]).))
Some((Date(24,October,1973),The [[Yom Kippur War]] ends.))
Some((Date(24,October,1975),In [[Iceland]], 90% of women take part in a national strike, refusing to work in protest of gaps in gender equality.))
Some((Date(24,October,1977),[[Veterans Day]] is observed on the fourth Monday in October for the seventh and last time.  (The holiday is once again observed on [[November 11]] beginning the following year.)))
Some((Date(24,October,1980),The government of Poland legalizes the [[Solidarity (Polish trade union)|Solidarity trade union]]. ))
Some((Date(24,October,1986),[[Nezar Hindawi]] is sentenced to 45 years in prison, the longest sentence handed down by a British court, for the attempted bombing on an [[El Al]] flight at [[Heathrow Airport]]. After the verdict, the United Kingdom breaks diplomatic relations with [[Syria]], claiming that Hindawi is helped by Syrian officials.))
Some((Date(24,October,1990),Italian prime minister [[Giulio Andreotti]] reveals to the Italian parliament the existence of [[Operation Gladio|Gladio]], the Italian "[[stay-behind]]" clandestine paramilitary [[NATO]] army, which was implicated in [[false flag]] terrorist attacks implicating communists and anarchists as part of the [[strategy of tension]] from the late 1960s to early 1980s.))
Some((Date(24,October,1992),The [[Toronto Blue Jays]] become the first [[Major League Baseball]] team based outside the United States to win the [[World Series]].))
Some((Date(24,October,1998),Launch of [[Deep Space 1]] [[comet]]/[[asteroid]] mission.))
Some((Date(24,October,2002),Police arrest [[spree killer]]s [[John Allen Muhammad]] and [[Lee Boyd Malvo]], ending the [[Beltway sniper attacks]] in the area around Washington, D.C.))
Some((Date(24,October,2003),[[Concorde]] makes its last commercial flight.))
Some((Date(24,October,2004),[[Arsenal Football Club]] loses to [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], ending a row of unbeaten matches at 49 matches, which is the record in the [[Premier League]].))
Some((Date(24,October,2005),[[Hurricane Wilma]] makes landfall in [[Effects of Hurricane Wilma in Florida|Florida]] resulting in 35 direct 26 indirect fatalities and causing $20.6B USD in damage.))

Beckman]], denounces [[swing music]] as "a degenerated musical system… turned loose to gnaw away at the moral fiber of young people", warning that it leads down a "primrose path to [[hell]]". His warning is widely ignored.))

Some((Date(26,October,1977),[[Ali Maow Maalin]], the last natural case of [[smallpox]], develops rash in Merca district, [[Somalia]]. The [[World Health Organization]] and the [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]] consider this date the anniversary of the eradication of smallpox, the most spectacular success of [[vaccination]].))

The sinking was witnessed and photographed by passengers on {{RMS|Olympic}} sister ship of {{RMS|Titanic}}.))

Some((Date(28,October,1538),The first [[university]] in the [[New World]] (in present-day [[Dominican Republic]]), the [[Universidad Santo Tomás de Aquino]], is established.))
Some((Date(28,October,1628),[[French Wars of Religion]]: The [[Siege of La Rochelle]], which had lasted for 14 months, ends with the surrender of the [[Huguenot]]s.))
Some((Date(28,October,1636),A vote of the [[Great and General Court]] of the [[Massachusetts Bay Colony]] establishes the first [[college]] in what would become the United States, today known as [[Harvard University]].))
Some((Date(28,October,1664),The Duke of York and Albany's Maritime Regiment of Foot, later to be known as the [[Royal Marines]], is established.))
Some((Date(28,October,1707),The [[1707 Hōei earthquake]] causes more than 5,000 deaths in [[Honshu]], [[Shikoku]] and [[Kyūshū]], Japan))
Some((Date(28,October,1775),[[American Revolutionary War]]: A British proclamation forbids residents from leaving [[Boston]].))
Some((Date(28,October,1776),American Revolutionary War: [[Battle of White Plains]]: British Army forces arrive at [[White Plains, New York|White Plains]], attack and capture Chatterton Hill from the [[Continental Army|Americans]].))
Some((Date(28,October,1834),The [[Pinjarra massacre]] occurred in the [[Swan River Colony]] at present-day [[Pinjarra, Western Australia]]. An estimated 30 Noongar people were killed by British colonists.))
Some((Date(28,October,1835),The [[United Tribes of New Zealand]] is established with the signature of the [[Declaration of the Independence of New Zealand|Declaration of Independence]].))
Some((Date(28,October,1848),The first railroad in Spain between [[Barcelona]] and [[Mataró]] is opened.))
Some((Date(28,October,1864),[[American Civil War]]: The [[Battle of Fair Oaks & Darbytown Road]] (also known as the Second Battle of Fair Oaks) ends: [[Union Army|Union]] forces under General [[Ulysses S. Grant]] withdraw from [[Fair Oaks, Henrico County, Virginia|Fair Oaks, Virginia]], after failing to breach the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] defenses around [[Richmond, Virginia]].))
Some((Date(28,October,1886),In [[New York Harbor]], President [[Grover Cleveland]] dedicates the [[Statue of Liberty]]. The first [[ticker tape parade]] takes place in New York City when office workers spontaneously throw [[ticker tape]] into the streets as the statue is dedicated.))
Some((Date(28,October,1891),The [[1891 Mino–Owari earthquake|Mino–Owari earthquake]], the largest inland earthquake in Japan's history, strikes [[Gifu Prefecture]].))

Some((Date(28,October,1904),[[Panama]] and [[Uruguay]] establish [[Panama–Uruguay relations|diplomatic links]].))
Some((Date(28,October,1915),[[Richard Strauss]] conducts the first performance of his [[tone poem]] ''[[Eine Alpensinfonie]]'' in Berlin.))
Some((Date(28,October,1918),[[World War I]]: [[Czechoslovakia]] is granted independence from [[Austria-Hungary]] marking the beginning of an independent Czechoslovak state, after 300 years.))
Some((Date(28,October,1919),The [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] passes the [[Volstead Act]] over President [[Woodrow Wilson]]'s veto, paving the way for [[Prohibition in the United States|Prohibition]] to begin the following January.))
Some((Date(28,October,1922),[[March on Rome]]: Italian [[fascist]]s led by [[Benito Mussolini]] march on Rome and take over the Italian government.))
Some((Date(28,October,1928),Declaration of the [[Youth Pledge]] in [[Indonesia]], the first time [[Indonesia Raya]], now the national anthem, was sung.))
Some((Date(28,October,1929),[[Black Monday]], a day in the [[Wall Street Crash of 1929]], which also saw major stock market upheaval.))
Some((Date(28,October,1940),[[World War II]]: Greece [[Ohi Day|rejects]] Italy's ultimatum. So, [[Greco-Italian War]] began. [[Italy]] invades [[Greece]] through [[Albania]], marking Greece's entry into World War II.))
Some((Date(28,October,1942),The [[Alaska Highway]] (Alcan Highway) is completed through Canada to [[Fairbanks, Alaska]].))
Some((Date(28,October,1948),Swiss chemist [[Paul Hermann Müller|Paul Müller]] is awarded the [[Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine]] for his discovery of the insecticidal properties of [[DDT]].))

Some((Date(28,October,1964),[[Vietnam War]]: U.S. officials deny any involvement in bombing [[North Vietnam]].))
Some((Date(28,October,1965),''[[Nostra aetate]]'', the "Declaration on the Relation of the Church with Non-Christian Religions" of the [[Second Vatican Council]], is promulgated by [[Pope Paul VI]]; it absolves the Jews of [[Jewish deicide|responsibility for the death of Jesus]], reversing [[Pope Innocent III|Innocent III]]'s 760-year-old declaration.))
Some((Date(28,October,1971),Britain launches the [[satellite]] [[Prospero (satellite)|Prospero]] into [[low Earth orbit]] atop a [[Black Arrow]] [[carrier rocket]] from [[Woomera Launch Area 5|Launch Area 5B]] at [[Woomera, South Australia]], the only British satellite to date launched by a British rocket.))
Some((Date(28,October,1982),The [[Spanish Socialist Workers' Party]] wins elections, leading to the first Socialist government in Spain after death of [[Francisco Franco|Franco]].  [[Felipe González]] becomes Prime Minister-elect.))
Some((Date(28,October,1990),The [[Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic]] holds the first multiparty [[Supreme Council of the Republic of Georgia|legislature]] election in the country's history.))
Some((Date(28,October,1995),289 people are killed and 265 injured in [[1995 Baku Metro fire|Baku Metro fire]], the deadliest [[Rapid transit|subway]] disaster.))
Some((Date(28,October,1998),An [[Air China]] jetliner is hijacked by disgruntled pilot Yuan Bin and flown to [[Taiwan]].))
Some((Date(28,October,2005),[[Plame affair]]: [[Lewis Libby]], Vice-president [[Dick Cheney]]'s chief of staff, is indicted in the [[Valerie Plame]] case. Libby resigns later that day.))
Some((Date(28,October,2006),The funeral service takes place for those executed at [[Bykivnia]] forest, outside [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]]. Eight hundred seventeen Ukrainian civilians (out of some 100,000) executed by [[Bolsheviks]] at Bykivnia in 1930s – early 1940s are reburied.))
Some((Date(28,October,2007),[[Cristina Fernández de Kirchner]] becomes the first woman elected President of [[Argentina]].))
Some((Date(28,October,2009),The [[28 October 2009 Peshawar bombing]] kills 117 and wounds 213.))

Some((Date(31,October,1963),An explosion at the Indiana State Fair Coliseum (now [[Fairgrounds Coliseum|Pepsi Coliseum]]) in Indianapolis kills 74 people and injures another 400 during an ice skating show.  A faulty propane tank connection in a concession stand is blamed.))
Some((Date(31,October,1968),[[Vietnam War]] [[October surprise]]: Citing progress with the Paris peace talks, US President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] announces to the nation that he has ordered a complete cessation of "all air, naval, and artillery bombardment of [[North Vietnam]]" effective [[November 1]].))
Some((Date(31,October,1969),the [[Disappearance of Patricia Spencer and Pamela Hobley]] occurs.))
Some((Date(31,October,1973),[[Mountjoy Prison helicopter escape]]. Three [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] members escape from [[Mountjoy Prison]], [[Dublin]], [[Republic of Ireland]] aboard a hijacked helicopter that lands in the exercise yard.))
Some((Date(31,October,1984),Indian Prime Minister [[Indira Gandhi]] is [[assassination of Indira Gandhi|assassinated]] by two Sikh security guards. [[1984 anti-Sikh riots|Riots break out]] in New Delhi and other cities and nearly 10,000 Sikhs are killed.))
Some((Date(31,October,1994),[[American Eagle Flight 4184]] crashes near [[Roselawn, Indiana]], killing 68.))
Some((Date(31,October,1998),[[Iraq disarmament crisis]] begins: [[Iraq]] announces it would no longer cooperate with [[United Nations]] weapons inspectors.))
Some((Date(31,October,1999),[[Yachtsman]] [[Jesse Martin]] returns to [[Melbourne]] after 11 months of [[circumnavigation|circumnavigating]] the world, solo, non-stop and unassisted.))
Some((Date(31,October,2000),[[Soyuz TM-31]] launches, carrying the first resident crew to the [[International Space Station]]. The ISS has been crewed continuously since then.))
Some((Date(31,October,2002),A federal grand jury in [[Houston]], [[Texas]] indicts former [[Enron]] chief financial officer [[Andrew Fastow]] on 78 counts of [[wire fraud]], [[money laundering]], [[Conspiracy (criminal)|conspiracy]] and [[obstruction of justice]] related to the collapse of his ex-employer.))
Some((Date(31,October,2003),[[Mahathir bin Mohamad]] resigns as [[Prime Minister of Malaysia]] and is replaced by Deputy Prime Minister [[Abdullah Ahmad Badawi]], marking an end to Mahathir's 22 years in power.))
Some((Date(31,October,2011),The [[global population]] of humans reaches seven billion. This day is now recognized by the [[United Nations]] as [[Day of Seven Billion|Seven Billion Day]].))
Some((Date(31,October,2014),[[Virgin Galactic]]'s [[SpaceShipTwo]] [[2014 Virgin Galactic crash|crashes]] in the [[Mojave Desert]] during a test flight.))
Some((Date(31,October,2015),[[Metrojet Flight 9268]] is bombed over the northern [[Sinai Peninsula]], killing all 224 people on board.

Some((Date(1,November,1141),[[Empress Matilda]]'s reign as 'Lady of the English' ends with [[Stephen, King of England|Stephen of Blois]] regaining the title of King of England.))
Some((Date(1,November,1179),[[Philip II of France|Philip II]] is [[coronation|crowned]] King of France.))
Some((Date(1,November,1214),The port city of [[Sinop, Turkey|Sinope]] [[Siege of Sinope|surrenders]] to the [[Seljuq Turks]].))
Some((Date(1,November,1348),The anti-royalist [[Union of Valencia]] attacks the Jews of [[Murviedro]] on the pretext that they are [[serf]]s of the [[King of Valencia]] and thus "royalists".))
Some((Date(1,November,1503),[[Pope Julius II]] is elected.))
Some((Date(1,November,1512),The ceiling of the [[Sistine Chapel]], painted by [[Michelangelo]], is exhibited to the public for the first time.))
Some((Date(1,November,1520),The [[Strait of Magellan]], the passage immediately south of mainland South America connecting the Pacific and the Atlantic Oceans, is first discovered and navigated by European explorer [[Ferdinand Magellan]] during the first recorded [[circumnavigation]] voyage.))
Some((Date(1,November,1555),French [[Huguenot]]s establish the [[France Antarctique]] colony in present-day [[Rio de Janeiro]], Brazil.))
Some((Date(1,November,1570),The [[All Saints' Flood (1570)|All Saints' Flood]] devastates the Dutch coast.))
Some((Date(1,November,1604),[[William Shakespeare]]'s tragedy ''[[Othello]]'' is performed for the first time, at [[Whitehall Palace]] in London.))
Some((Date(1,November,1611),William Shakespeare's play ''[[The Tempest]]'' is performed for the first time, at Whitehall Palace in London.))
Some((Date(1,November,1612),([[22 October]] [[Old Style|O.S.]]) [[Time of Troubles]] in Russia: Moscow, [[Kitay-gorod]], is captured by Russian troops under command of [[Dmitry Pozharsky]]))
Some((Date(1,November,1683),The British Crown [[Province of New York|colony of New York]] is subdivided into 12 [[County (United States)|counties]].))
Some((Date(1,November,1688),[[William III of Orange]] sets out a second time from [[Hellevoetsluis]] in the Netherlands to seize the crowns of England, Scotland and Ireland from [[King James II of England]] during the [[Glorious Revolution]].))
Some((Date(1,November,1755),In Portugal, [[Lisbon]] is [[1755 Lisbon earthquake|totally devastated]] by a massive earthquake and [[tsunami]], killing between 60,000 and 90,000 people.))
Some((Date(1,November,1765),The British Parliament enacts the [[Stamp Act 1765|Stamp Act]] on the [[Thirteen Colonies]] in order to help pay for British military operations in North America.))
Some((Date(1,November,1790),[[Edmund Burke]] publishes ''[[Reflections on the Revolution in France]]'', in which he predicts that the [[French Revolution]] will end in a disaster.))
Some((Date(1,November,1800),[[John Adams]] becomes the first President of the United States to live in the Executive Mansion (later renamed the [[White House]]).))
Some((Date(1,November,1805),[[Napoleon I|Napoleon Bonaparte]] invades [[Austrian Empire|Austria]] during the [[War of the Third Coalition]].))
Some((Date(1,November,1814),[[Congress of Vienna]] opens to re-draw the European political map after the defeat of France in the [[Napoleonic Wars]].))
Some((Date(1,November,1848),In [[Boston]], [[Massachusetts]], the first [[medical school]] for women, The Boston Female Medical School (which later merged with the [[Boston University]] School of Medicine), opens.))
Some((Date(1,November,1859),The current [[Cape Lookout (North Carolina)|Cape Lookout, North Carolina]], [[lighthouse]] is lit for the first time. Its first-order [[Fresnel lens]] can be seen for about {{convert|19|mi|km}} in good conditions.))
Some((Date(1,November,1861),[[American Civil War]]: U.S. President [[Abraham Lincoln]] appoints [[George B. McClellan]] as the commander of the [[Union Army]], replacing General [[Winfield Scott]].))
Some((Date(1,November,1870),In the United States, the Weather Bureau (later renamed the [[National Weather Service]]) makes its first official [[Meteorology|meteorological]] forecast.))
Some((Date(1,November,1876),New Zealand's [[Provinces of New Zealand|provincial government]] system is dissolved.))
Some((Date(1,November,1884),The [[Gaelic Athletic Association]] is set up in Hayes's Hotel in [[Thurles]], [[County Tipperary]].))
Some((Date(1,November,1886),[[Ananda College]], a leading Buddhist school in [[Sri Lanka]] is established with 37 students.))
Some((Date(1,November,1894),[[Nicholas II of Russia|Nicholas II]] becomes the new (and last) [[Russian Empire|Tsar of Russia]] after his father, [[Alexander III of Russia|Alexander III]], dies.))
Some((Date(1,November,1896),A picture showing the bare breasts of a woman appears in ''[[National Geographic (magazine)|National Geographic]]'' magazine for the first time.))
Some((Date(1,November,1897),The first [[Library of Congress]] building opens its doors to the public. The Library had been housed in the Congressional Reading Room in the U.S. Capitol.))
Some((Date(1,November,1901),[[Sigma Phi Epsilon]], the largest national male collegiate [[Student fraternities and sororities in North America|fraternity]], is established at [[University of Richmond|Richmond College]], in [[Richmond, Virginia]].))
Some((Date(1,November,1911),The first dropping of a bomb from an aircraft in combat, during the [[Italo-Turkish War]].))
Some((Date(1,November,1914),World War I: The first British [[Royal Navy]] defeat of the war with Germany, the [[Battle of Coronel]], is fought off of the western coast of [[Chile]], in the Pacific, with the loss of {{HMS|Good Hope|1901|6}} and {{HMS|Monmouth|1901|6}}.))
Some((Date(1,November,1915),[[Parris Island]] is officially designated a [[United States Marine Corps]] Recruit Depot.))
Some((Date(1,November,1916),[[Pavel Milyukov]] delivers in the [[State Duma]] the famous "stupidity or treason" speech, precipitating the downfall of the [[Boris Stürmer]] government.))
Some((Date(1,November,1918),[[Malbone Street Wreck]]: The worst [[rapid transit]] accident in US history occurs under the intersection of Malbone Street and Flatbush Avenue, [[Brooklyn]], New York City, with at least 102 deaths.))
Some((Date(1,November,1920),American fishing schooner [[Esperanto (schooner)|Esperanto]] defeats the Canadian fishing schooner [[Delawana (schooner)|Delawana]] in the First International Fishing Schooner Championship Races in [[Halifax, Nova Scotia]].))
Some((Date(1,November,1922),[[Abolition of the Ottoman sultanate]]: The last sultan of the [[Ottoman Empire]], [[Mehmed VI]], abdicates.))
Some((Date(1,November,1928),The ''Law on the Adoption and Implementation of the [[Turkish alphabet|Turkish Alphabet]]'', replacing the version of the [[Arabic alphabet]] previously used with the [[Latin alphabet]], comes into force in [[Turkey]].))
Some((Date(1,November,1937),[[Stalinism|Stalinists]] execute Pastor Paul Hamberg and seven members of [[Azerbaijan Soviet Socialist Republic|Azerbaijan's]] [[Lutheran]] community.))
Some((Date(1,November,1938),[[Seabiscuit]] defeats [[War Admiral]] in an upset victory during a match race deemed "the match of the century" in horse racing.))
Some((Date(1,November,1939),The first [[rabbit]] born after [[artificial insemination]] is exhibited to the world.))
Some((Date(1,November,1941),American photographer [[Ansel Adams]] takes a [[Moonrise, Hernandez, New Mexico|picture of a moonrise]] over the town of [[Hernandez, New Mexico]] that would become one of the most famous images in the history of photography.))
Some((Date(1,November,1942),[[World War II]]: [[Matanikau Offensive]] begins during the [[Guadalcanal Campaign]] and ends three days later with an American victory.))

Some((Date(1,November,1944),World War II: Units of the British Army [[Battle of Walcheren Causeway|land]] at [[Walcheren]] in the Netherlands.))
Some((Date(1,November,1945),The official [[North Korea]]n newspaper, ''[[Rodong Sinmun]]'', is first published under the name ''Chongro''.))
Some((Date(1,November,1946),Karol Wojtyla, the future [[Pope John Paul II]], is ordained to the [[priesthood]] by [[Kraków]]'s [[archbishop]], [[Adam Sapieha]].))
Some((Date(1,November,1948),Off southern [[Manchuria]], 6,000 people die as a [[Republic of China (1912–49)|Chinese]] merchant ship explodes and sinks.))

Some((Date(1,November,1951),[[Operation Buster–Jangle]]: Six thousand five hundred American soldiers are exposed to 'Desert Rock' [[atom bomb|atomic explosion]]s for training purposes in [[Nevada]]. Participation is not voluntary.))
Some((Date(1,November,1952),[[Operation Ivy]]: The United States successfully detonates the first large [[hydrogen bomb]], codenamed "Mike" ["M" for megaton], in the [[Eniwetok]] atoll, located in the [[Marshall Islands]] in the central Pacific Ocean. The explosion had a yield of ten megatons.))
Some((Date(1,November,1953),[[Andhra Pradesh]] attains statehood, with Kurnool as its capital.))
Some((Date(1,November,1954),The [[National Liberation Front (Algeria)|Front de Libération Nationale]] fires the first shots of the [[Algerian War of Independence]].))
Some((Date(1,November,1955),The bombing of [[United Airlines Flight 629]] occurs near [[Longmont, Colorado]], killing all 39 passengers and five crew members aboard the [[Douglas DC-6]]B airliner.))

Some((Date(1,November,1957),The [[Mackinac Bridge]], the world's longest suspension bridge between anchorages at the time, opens to traffic connecting Michigan's upper and lower peninsulas.))
Some((Date(1,November,1959),[[Montreal Canadiens]] goaltender [[Jacques Plante]] wears a protective mask for the first time in an [[NHL]] game.))

Some((Date(1,November,1961),Fifty thousand women in 60 cities participate in the inaugural [[Women Strike for Peace]] (WSP) against [[nuclear proliferation]].))
Some((Date(1,November,1963),The [[Arecibo Observatory]] in [[Arecibo, Puerto Rico|Arecibo]], [[Puerto Rico]], with the largest [[radio telescope]] ever constructed, officially opens.))
Some((Date(1,November,1968),The [[Motion Picture Association of America]]'s [[Motion Picture Association of America film rating system|film rating system]] is officially introduced, originating with the ratings G, M, R, and X.))
Some((Date(1,November,1970),[[Club Cinq-Sept fire]] in [[Saint-Laurent-du-Pont]], France kills 146 young people.))
Some((Date(1,November,1973),[[Watergate scandal]]: [[Leon Jaworski]] is appointed as the new Watergate Special Prosecutor.))
Some((Date(1,November,1979),In Bolivia, Colonel [[Alberto Natusch]] executes a bloody [[coup d'état]] against the constitutional government of Dr. [[Wálter Guevara]].))
Some((Date(1,November,1981),[[Antigua and Barbuda]] gains independence from the United Kingdom.))

Some((Date(3,November,1868),[[John Willis Menard]] was the first African American elected to the [[United States Congress]].  Because of an electoral challenge, he was never seated.))

Some((Date(3,November,1964),Washington D.C. residents are able to vote in a [[presidential election]] for the first time.))
Some((Date(3,November,1967),[[Vietnam War]]: The [[Battle of Dak To]] begins.))
Some((Date(3,November,1969),Vietnam War: U.S. President [[Richard M. Nixon]] addresses the nation on television and radio, asking the "[[silent majority]]" to join him in solidarity on the Vietnam War effort and to support his policies.))

Some((Date(3,November,1978),[[Dominica]] gains its independence from the United Kingdom.))

Some((Date(3,November,1982),The [[Salang Tunnel fire]] in [[Afghanistan]] kills up to 2,000 people.))
Some((Date(3,November,1986),[[Iran–Contra affair]]: The [[Lebanon|Lebanese]] magazine ''[[Ash-Shiraa]]'' reports that the United States has been secretly selling weapons to [[Iran]] in order to secure the release of seven American [[hostage]]s held by pro-Iranian groups in Lebanon.))
Some((Date(3,November,1988),[[Sri Lanka]]n [[Tamil people|Tamil]] [[mercenary|mercenaries]] try to overthrow the [[Maldives|Maldivian]] government. At President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayoom]]'s request, the Indian military suppresses the [[coup]] attempt within 24 hours.))
Some((Date(3,November,1996),Death of [[Abdullah Çatlı]], leader of the Turkish ultra-nationalist organisation [[Grey Wolves (organization)|Grey Wolves]] in the [[Susurluk scandal|Susurluk car-crash]], which leads to the resignation of the [[Interior Minister (Turkey)|Turkish Interior Minister]], [[Mehmet Ağar]] (a leader of the [[True Path Party]], DYP).))
Some((Date(3,November,1997),The United States of America imposes [[economic sanctions]] against [[Sudan]] in response to [[Human rights in Sudan|its human rights abuses of its own citizens]] and its material and political assistance to [[Islamic extremism|Islamic extremist]] groups across the Middle East and [[East Africa|Eastern Africa]].))
Some((Date(3,November,2013),A [[Solar eclipse of November 3, 2013|solar eclipse]] sweeps across Africa, Europe and the Eastern United States.))

Some((Date(4,November,1576),[[Eighty Years' War]]: In [[Flanders]], Spain captures [[Antwerp]] (after three days the city is [[Sack of Antwerp|nearly destroyed]]).))
Some((Date(4,November,1677),The future [[Mary II of England]] marries [[William III of England|William, Prince of Orange]].  They would later jointly reign as [[William and Mary]].))

Some((Date(4,November,1847),Sir [[James Young Simpson]], a British physician, discovers the [[anaesthetic]] properties of [[chloroform]].))

Some((Date(4,November,1864),[[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Johnsonville]]: [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] troops bombard a [[Union Army|Union]] supply base and destroy millions of dollars in material.))
Some((Date(4,November,1868),[[Camagüey]], [[Cuba]] revolts against Spain during the [[Ten Years' War]].))
Some((Date(4,November,1890),[[City and South London Railway]]: London's first deep-level [[London Underground|tube]] railway opens between [[King William Street, London|King William Street]] and [[Stockwell tube station|Stockwell]].))
Some((Date(4,November,1912),[[First Balkan War]]: The [[First Battle of Çatalca]] begins - an attempt by [[Kingdom of Bulgaria|Bulgaria]] to break through the last defensive line before the Turkish capital [[Constantinople]].))
Some((Date(4,November,1918),[[World War I]]: The [[Armistice of Villa Giusti]] between Italy and [[Austria-Hungary]] is implemented.))
Some((Date(4,November,1921),The ''Saalschutz Abteilung'' (hall defense detachment) of the [[Nazi Party]] is renamed the ''[[Sturmabteilung]]'' (storm detachment) after a large riot in [[Munich]].))
Some((Date(4,November,1922),In [[Egypt]], British archaeologist [[Howard Carter]] and his men find the entrance to [[Pharaoh]] [[Tutankhamun]]'s tomb in the [[Valley of the Kings]].))
Some((Date(4,November,1924),[[Nellie Tayloe Ross]] of [[Wyoming]] is elected the first female governor in the United States.))
Some((Date(4,November,1939),[[World War II]]: U.S. President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] orders the [[United States Customs Service]] to implement the [[Neutrality Acts of 1930s|Neutrality Act of 1939]], allowing cash-and-carry purchases of weapons by belligerents.))
Some((Date(4,November,1942),World War II: [[Second Battle of El Alamein]]: Disobeying a direct order by [[Adolf Hitler]], General Field Marshal [[Erwin Rommel]] leads his forces on a five-month retreat.))

Some((Date(4,November,1952),The United States [[Federal government of the United States|government]] establishes the [[National Security Agency]], or NSA.))
Some((Date(4,November,1956),[[Soviet Union|Soviet]] troops enter [[Hungarian People's Republic|Hungary]] to end the [[Hungarian Revolution of 1956|Hungarian revolution]] against the Soviet Union, that started on [[October 23]]. Thousands are killed, more are wounded, and nearly a quarter million leave the country.))
Some((Date(4,November,1960),At the [[Kasakela Chimpanzee Community]] in [[Tanzania]], Dr. [[Jane Goodall]] observes [[Eastern chimpanzee|chimpanzee]]s creating tools, the first-ever observation in non-human animals.))
Some((Date(4,November,1962),The United States concludes [[Operation Fishbowl]], its final above-ground [[nuclear weapons testing]] series, in anticipation of the 1963 [[Partial Nuclear Test Ban Treaty]].))
Some((Date(4,November,1966),The [[Arno|Arno River]] [[1966 flood of the Arno River|floods]] [[Florence]], Italy, to a maximum depth of {{convert|6.7|m|ft|abbr=on}}, leaving thousands homeless and destroying millions of masterpieces of art and rare books. Also [[1966 Venice flood|Venice was submerged]] on the same day at its record all-time [[acqua alta]] of 194&nbsp;cm.))
Some((Date(4,November,1970),[[Vietnam War]]: [[Vietnamization]]: The United States turns control of the [[Binh Thuy Air Base]] in the [[Mekong Delta]] over to [[South Vietnam]].))
Some((Date(4,November,1973),The Netherlands experiences the first [[Car-Free Sunday]] caused by the [[1973 oil crisis]]. [[Highways]] are deserted and are used only by [[cyclist]]s and [[roller skaters]].))
Some((Date(4,November,1979),[[Iran hostage crisis]]: A mob of [[Iran]]ians, mostly students, overruns the US embassy in [[Tehran]] and takes 90 hostages (53 of whom are American).))
Some((Date(4,November,1993),The [[China Airlines Flight 605]], a [[Boeing 747]], overruns Runway 13 at Hong Kong's [[Kai Tak International Airport]] while landing during a [[typhoon]], injuring 22 people.))

Some((Date(5,November,1138),[[Lý Anh Tông]] is enthroned as emperor of [[Vietnam]] at the age of two, beginning a 37-year reign.))

This Breton-French-Latin dictionary was written in [[1464]] by Jehan Lagadeuc. It is the first [[Breton language|Breton]] dictionary as well as the first French dictionary.))

Some((Date(5,November,1862),[[American Civil War]]: [[Abraham Lincoln]] removes [[George B. McClellan]] as commander of the [[Army of the Potomac]].))
Some((Date(5,November,1872),[[Women's suffrage in the United States]]: In defiance of the law, suffragist [[Susan B. Anthony]] votes for the first time, and is later fined $100.))
Some((Date(5,November,1895),[[George B. Selden]] is granted the first U.S. [[patent]] for an automobile.))
Some((Date(5,November,1911),After declaring war on the [[Ottoman Empire]] on [[September 29]], 1911, Italy annexes [[Tripoli]] and [[Cyrenaica]].))

Some((Date(5,November,1925),[[Secret agent]] [[Sidney Reilly]], the first "super-spy" of the 20th century, is executed by the [[State Political Directorate|OGPU]], the [[secret police]] of the [[Soviet Union]].))

Some((Date(5,November,1970),The [[Military Assistance Command, Vietnam]] reports the lowest weekly American soldier death toll in five years (24).))
Some((Date(5,November,1983),[[Byford Dolphin]] [[diving bell]] accident kills five and leaves one severely injured.))
Some((Date(5,November,1986),{{USS|Rentz|FFG-46|6}}, {{USS|Reeves|DLG-24|6}} and {{USS|Oldendorf|DD-972|6}} visit [[Qingdao]] (Tsing Tao) China – the first US Naval visit to China since 1949.))
Some((Date(5,November,1987),[[Govan Mbeki]] is released from custody after serving 24 years of a life sentence for terrorism and treason.))

Some((Date(6,November,1869),In [[New Brunswick, New Jersey]], [[Rutgers College]] defeats [[Princeton University]] (then known as the College of New Jersey), 6–4, in the [[1869 college football season#First football game ever played|first official]] intercollegiate American [[College football|football]] game.))
Some((Date(6,November,1913),[[Mahatma Gandhi|Mohandas Gandhi]] is arrested while leading a march of Indian miners in South Africa.))
Some((Date(6,November,1917),[[World War I]]: [[Third Battle of Ypres]] ends: After three months of fierce fighting, Canadian forces take [[Passendale|Passchendaele]] in Belgium.))

Some((Date(6,November,1928),[[Arnold Rothstein]], the head of the Jewish mob in New York, was shot and mortally wounded on November 4, and died on November 6.  He was assassinated by George "Hump" McManus, for failing to pay a large gambling debt.))
Some((Date(6,November,1934),[[Memphis, Tennessee]] becomes the first major city to join the [[Tennessee Valley Authority]].))
Some((Date(6,November,1935),[[Edwin Armstrong]] presents his paper "[[FM broadcasting|A Method of Reducing Disturbances in Radio Signaling by a System of Frequency Modulation]]" to the New York section of the [[Institute of Radio Engineers]].))
Some((Date(6,November,1939),[[World War II]]: [[Sonderaktion Krakau]] takes place.))
Some((Date(6,November,1941),World War II: Soviet leader [[Joseph Stalin]] addresses the Soviet Union for only the second time during his 19-year rule (the first had been on July 2). He falsely states that even though 350,000 troops were killed in [[Nazi Germany|German]] attacks so far, the Germans had lost 4.5 million soldiers and that Soviet victory was near. He states that the [[United States]] has granted the Soviet Union a $ 1 billion loan in addition to supplying tanks and aircraft, and that the Soviet Union does not aim to impose its [[communist]] regime in European countries, but only to liberate them.))
Some((Date(6,November,1942),World War II: [[Carlson's patrol]] during the [[Guadalcanal Campaign]] begins.))
Some((Date(6,November,1943),World War II: The Soviet [[Red Army]] recaptures [[Kiev]]. Before withdrawing, the Germans destroy most of the city's ancient buildings.))
Some((Date(6,November,1944),[[Plutonium]] is first produced at the [[Hanford Site|Hanford Atomic Facility]] and subsequently used in the ''[[Fat Man]]'' [[atomic bomb]] dropped on [[Nagasaki]], Japan.))
Some((Date(6,November,1947),''[[Meet the Press]]'' makes its television debut (the show went to a weekly schedule on September 12, 1948).))
Some((Date(6,November,1948),Deputy commander-in-chief of the Eastern China Field Army General [[Su Yu]] launches a massive offensive toward [[Xuzhou]], defended by seven different armies under the [[General Suppression Headquarters of Xuzhou Garrison]], the [[Huaihai Campaign]]. The largest operational campaign of the [[Chinese Civil War]] begins. ))
Some((Date(6,November,1962),The [[United Nations General Assembly]] passes a resolution condemning South Africa's [[apartheid]] policies and calls for all UN member states to cease military and economic relations with the nation.))
Some((Date(6,November,1963),Following the [[1963 South Vietnamese coup|November 1 coup]] and execution of President [[Ngo Dinh Diem]], coup leader General [[Dương Văn Minh]] takes over leadership of [[South Vietnam]].))
Some((Date(6,November,1965),[[Cuba]] and the United States formally agree to begin an airlift for Cubans who want to go to the United States. By [[1971]], 250,000 Cubans had made use of this program.))
Some((Date(6,November,1971),The [[United States Atomic Energy Commission]] tests the largest U.S. underground [[hydrogen bomb]], code-named Cannikin, on [[Amchitka Island]] in the [[Aleutian Islands|Aleutians]].))
Some((Date(6,November,1975),[[Green March]] begins: Three hundred thousand unarmed [[Morocco|Moroccans]] converge on the southern city of [[Tarfaya]] and wait for a signal from King [[Hassan II of Morocco]] to cross into [[Western Sahara]].))
Some((Date(6,November,1977),The [[Kelly Barnes Dam]], located above [[Toccoa Falls Bible College]] near [[Toccoa, Georgia]], fails, killing 39.))
Some((Date(6,November,1985),In [[Colombia]], leftist [[guerrilla]]s of the [[19th of April Movement]] seize control of the [[Palace of Justice siege|Palace of Justice]] in [[Bogotá]], eventually killing 115 people, 11 of them Supreme Court justices.))
Some((Date(6,November,1986),[[Sumburgh disaster]]: A [[British International Helicopters]] [[Boeing 234LR Chinook]] crashes {{sortfrac|2|1|2}} miles east of [[Sumburgh Airport]] killing 45 people. It is the deadliest civilian helicopter crash on record.))
Some((Date(6,November,1991),The last [[Kuwaiti oil fires|Kuwaiti oil field fire]] is extinguished.))
Some((Date(6,November,1995),The [[Rova of Antananarivo]], home of the sovereigns of [[Madagascar]] from the 16th to 19th centuries, is destroyed by fire.))
Some((Date(6,November,1999),Australians vote to keep the [[Head of the Commonwealth]] as their [[head of state]] in the [[Australian republic referendum, 1999|Australian republic referendum]].))
Some((Date(6,November,2004),An [[Ufton Nervet rail crash|express train collides]] with a stationary car near the village of [[Ufton Nervet]], England, killing seven and injuring 150.))
Some((Date(6,November,2012),[[Tammy Baldwin]] becomes the first [[openly gay]] politician to be elected to the [[United States Senate]].))
Some((Date(6,November,2013),Several small [[2013 Taiyuan attack|bombs explode]] outside a provincial office of the [[Communist Party of China|Chinese Communist Party]] in the northern city of [[Taiyuan]], killing at least one person and wounding eight others.

Some((Date(7,November,1492),The [[Ensisheim (meteorite)|Ensisheim meteorite]], the oldest [[meteorite]] with a known date of impact, strikes the Earth around noon in a [[wheat]] field outside the village of [[Ensisheim]], [[Alsace]], France.))

Some((Date(7,November,1665),''[[The London Gazette]]'', the oldest surviving journal, is first published.))
Some((Date(7,November,1775),[[John Murray, 4th Earl of Dunmore|John Murray]], the [[Royal Governor of Virginia|Royal Governor]] of the [[Colony of Virginia]], starts the first mass emancipation of slaves in North America by issuing [[Dunmore's Proclamation|Lord Dunmore's Offer of Emancipation]], which offers freedom to slaves who abandoned their colonial masters in order to fight with Murray and the British.))
Some((Date(7,November,1786),The oldest musical organization in the United States is founded as the [[Stoughton Musical Society]].))
Some((Date(7,November,1811),[[Tecumseh's War]]: The [[Battle of Tippecanoe]] is fought near present-day [[Battle Ground, Indiana]], United States.))

Some((Date(7,November,1874),A [[cartoon]] by [[Thomas Nast]] in ''[[Harper's Weekly]]'', is considered the first important use of an [[elephant]] as a symbol for the [[Republican Party (United States)|United States Republican Party]].))
Some((Date(7,November,1885),The completion of Canada's first transcontinental railway is symbolized by the [[Last Spike (Canadian Pacific Railway)|Last Spike]] ceremony at [[Craigellachie, British Columbia]].))
Some((Date(7,November,1893),[[women's suffrage in the United States|Women's suffrage]]: Women in the U.S. state of [[Colorado]] are granted the right to vote, the second state to do so.))
Some((Date(7,November,1900),[[Battle of Leliefontein]], a battle during which the [[Royal Canadian Dragoons]] win three [[Victoria Cross]]es.))
Some((Date(7,November,1907),[[Delta Sigma Pi]] is founded at [[New York University]].))
Some((Date(7,November,1908),[[Butch Cassidy]] and the [[Sundance Kid]] are reportedly killed in San Vicente, Bolivia.))
Some((Date(7,November,1910),The first [[air freight]] shipment (from [[Dayton, Ohio]], to [[Columbus, Ohio]]) is undertaken by the [[Wright brothers]] and department store owner Max Moorehouse.))
Some((Date(7,November,1912),The Deutsche Opernhaus (now [[Deutsche Oper Berlin]]) opens in the Berlin neighborhood of [[Charlottenburg]], with a production of [[Ludwig van Beethoven|Beethoven]]'s ''[[Fidelio]]''.))
Some((Date(7,November,1913),The first day of the [[Great Lakes Storm of 1913]], a massive blizzard that ultimately killed 250 and caused over $5 million (about $118,098,000 in 2013 dollars) damage. Winds reach hurricane force on this date.))
Some((Date(7,November,1914),The first issue of ''[[The New Republic]]'' magazine is published.))
Some((Date(7,November,1916),[[Jeannette Rankin]] is the first woman elected to the [[United States Congress]].))
Some((Date(7,November,1917),The Gregorian calendar date of the [[October Revolution]], which gets its name from the Julian calendar date of [[25 October]]. On this date in 1917, the Bolsheviks storm the [[Winter Palace]].))
Some((Date(7,November,1918),The [[1918 influenza epidemic]] spreads to [[Western Samoa]], killing 7,542 (about 20% of the population) by the end of the year.))
Some((Date(7,November,1919),The first [[Palmer Raids|Palmer Raid]] is conducted on the second anniversary of the [[Russian Revolution]]. Over 10,000 suspected communists and anarchists are arrested in twenty-three different U.S. cities.))
Some((Date(7,November,1920),[[Patriarch Tikhon of Moscow]] issues a decree that leads to the formation of the [[Russian Orthodox Church Outside Russia]].))
Some((Date(7,November,1929),In New York City, the [[Museum of Modern Art]] opens to the public.))
Some((Date(7,November,1931),The [[Chinese Soviet Republic]] is proclaimed on the anniversary of the [[October Revolution]].))
Some((Date(7,November,1933),[[Fiorello H. La Guardia]] is elected the 99th [[mayor of New York City]].))
Some((Date(7,November,1940),In [[Tacoma, Washington]], the [[Tacoma Narrows Bridge (1940)|original Tacoma Narrows Bridge]] collapses in a [[windstorm]], a mere four months after the bridge's completion.))
Some((Date(7,November,1941),[[World War II]]: Soviet [[hospital ship]] ''[[Armenia (Soviet hospital ship)|Armenia]]'' is sunk by German planes while evacuating refugees and wounded military and staff of several [[Crimea]]n hospitals. It is estimated that over 5,000 people died in the sinking.))
Some((Date(7,November,1944),A [[Rail transport in Puerto Rico#Tragedy on election day in 1944|passenger train derails]] in [[Aguadilla, Puerto Rico]] from excessive speed when descending a hill. Sixteen people are killed and 50 are injured.))
Some((Date(7,November,1949),The first oil was taken in [[Neft Daşları|Oil Rocks (Neft Daşları)]], oldest offshore oil platform.))
Some((Date(7,November,1956),[[Suez Crisis]]: The [[United Nations General Assembly]] adopts a resolution calling for the United Kingdom, France and [[Israel]] to immediately withdraw their troops from [[Egypt]].))
Some((Date(7,November,1957),[[Cold War]]: The [[Gaither Report]] calls for more American missiles and [[fallout shelter]]s.))
Some((Date(7,November,1963),[[Wunder von Lengede]]: In Germany, eleven miners are rescued from a collapsed [[Mining|mine]] after 14 days.))
Some((Date(7,November,1967),[[Carl Stokes|Carl B. Stokes]] is elected as Mayor of [[Cleveland, Ohio]], becoming the first [[African American]] mayor of a major American city.))
Some((Date(7,November,1973),The [[United States Congress]] overrides President [[Richard M. Nixon]]'s veto of the [[War Powers Resolution]], which limits presidential power to wage war without congressional approval.))
Some((Date(7,November,1975),In [[Bangladesh]], a joint force of people and soldiers takes part in an uprising led by Colonel [[Abu Taher]] that ousts and kills Brigadier [[Khaled Mosharraf]], freeing the then [[House arrest|house-arrested]] [[Chief of Army Staff of the Bangladesh Army|army chief]] and future [[President of Bangladesh|president]] [[Major General|Maj-Gen.]] [[Ziaur Rahman]]. The day is occasionally observed as the [[National Revolution and Solidarity Day]].))
Some((Date(7,November,1983),[[1983 United States Senate bombing|United States Senate bombing]]: A bomb explodes inside the [[United States Capitol]]. No one is injured, but an estimated $250,000 in damage is caused.))
Some((Date(7,November,1987),In [[Tunisia]], president [[Habib Bourguiba]] is overthrown and replaced by Prime Minister [[Zine El Abidine Ben Ali]].))
Some((Date(7,November,1989),[[Douglas Wilder]] wins the governor's seat in [[Virginia]], becoming the first elected [[African American]] governor in the United States.))
Some((Date(7,November,1990),[[Mary Robinson]] becomes the first woman to be elected [[President of Ireland|President of the Republic of Ireland]].))
Some((Date(7,November,1991),[[Magic Johnson]] announces that he is infected with [[HIV]] and retires from the [[National Basketball Association|NBA]].))
Some((Date(7,November,1994),[[WXYC]], the student radio station of the [[University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill]], provides the world's first [[webcast|internet radio broadcast]].))
Some((Date(7,November,1996),[[NASA]] launches the [[Mars Global Surveyor]].))
Some((Date(7,November,2000),[[Hillary Rodham Clinton]] is elected to the [[United States Senate]], becoming the first [[First Lady of the United States|First Lady]] (former or current) to win a competitive election for public office in the United States.))
Some((Date(7,November,2001),[[Sabena|SABENA]], the national airline of Belgium, goes bankrupt.))
Some((Date(7,November,2002),[[Iran]] bans [[advertising]] of United States products.))
Some((Date(7,November,2004),[[Iraq War]]: The interim government of [[Iraq]] calls for a 60-day "[[state of emergency]]" as U.S. forces storm the insurgent stronghold of [[Fallujah]].))
Some((Date(7,November,2007),[[Jokela school shooting]] in Tuusula, Finland, resulting in the death of nine people.))
Some((Date(7,November,2012),An [[2012 Guatemala earthquake|earthquake]] off the Pacific coast of [[Guatemala]] kills at least 52 people.
