Some((Date(8,November,1278),[[Trần Thánh Tông]], the second emperor of the [[Trần dynasty]], decides to pass the throne to his crown prince [[Trần Khâm]] and take up the post of [[:vi:Thái thượng hoàng|Retired Emperor]].))
Some((Date(8,November,1519),[[Hernán Cortés]] enters [[Tenochtitlán]] and [[Aztec]] ruler [[Moctezuma II|Moctezuma]] welcomes him with a great celebration. ))
Some((Date(8,November,1520),[[Stockholm Bloodbath]] begins: A successful invasion of Sweden by Danish forces results in the execution of around 100 people.))
Some((Date(8,November,1576),[[Eighty Years' War]]: [[Pacification of Ghent]]: The [[States General of the Netherlands]] meet and unite to oppose Spanish occupation.))
Some((Date(8,November,1602),The [[Bodleian Library]] at the [[University of Oxford]] is opened to the public.))
Some((Date(8,November,1605),[[Robert Catesby]], ringleader of the [[Gunpowder Plot]]ters, is killed.))
Some((Date(8,November,1614),Japanese [[daimyo]] [[Dom Justo Takayama]] is exiled to the Philippines by shogun [[Tokugawa Ieyasu]] for being Christian.))
Some((Date(8,November,1620),The [[Battle of White Mountain]] takes place near [[Prague]], ending in a decisive [[Catholic]] victory in only two hours.))
Some((Date(8,November,1644),The [[Shunzhi Emperor]], the third emperor of the [[Qing dynasty]], is enthroned in Beijing after the collapse of the [[Ming dynasty]] as the first Qing emperor to rule over China.))
Some((Date(8,November,1745),[[Charles Edward Stuart]] invades England with an army of ~5000 that would later participate in the [[Battle of Culloden]].))
Some((Date(8,November,1837),[[Mary Lyon]] founds Mount Holyoke Female Seminary, which later becomes [[Mount Holyoke College]].))
Some((Date(8,November,1861),[[American Civil War]]: The "[[Trent Affair]]": The {{USS|San Jacinto|1850|6}} stops the British mail ship ''Trent'' and arrests two [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] envoys, sparking a diplomatic crisis between the UK and US.))
Some((Date(8,November,1889),[[Montana]] is admitted as the 41st [[U.S. state]].))
Some((Date(8,November,1892),The [[1892 New Orleans general strike|New Orleans general strike]] begins, uniting [[African American|black]] and [[White people|white]] American [[trade union]]ists in a successful four-day general [[strike action]] for the first time.))
Some((Date(8,November,1895),While experimenting with electricity, [[Wilhelm Röntgen]] discovers the [[X-ray]].))
Some((Date(8,November,1898),The [[Wilmington insurrection of 1898]], the only instance of an attempted [[coup d'état]] in American history.))
Some((Date(8,November,1901),Bloody clashes take place in [[Athens]] following the translation of the [[Gospel]]s into [[demotic Greek]].))
Some((Date(8,November,1917),The People's Commissars give authority to [[Vladimir Lenin]], [[Leon Trotsky]], and [[Joseph Stalin]].))
Some((Date(8,November,1923),[[Beer Hall Putsch]]: In [[Munich]], [[Adolf Hitler]] leads the [[Nazism|Nazis]] in an unsuccessful attempt to overthrow the German government.))
Some((Date(8,November,1933),[[Great Depression]]: [[New Deal]]: US President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] unveils the [[Civil Works Administration]], an organization designed to create jobs for more than 4 million unemployed. ))
Some((Date(8,November,1936),[[Spanish Civil War]]: [[Francoist Spain|Francoist]] troops fail in their effort to capture [[Madrid]], but begin the 3-year [[Siege of Madrid]] afterwards.))
Some((Date(8,November,1937),The [[Nazism|Nazi]] exhibition ''[[The Eternal Jew (art exhibition)|Der ewige Jude]]'' ("The Eternal Jew") opens in [[Munich]].))
Some((Date(8,November,1939),[[Venlo Incident]]: Two British agents of [[Secret Intelligence Service|SIS]] are captured by the Germans.))
Some((Date(8,November,1940),[[Greco-Italian War]]: The Italian invasion of Greece fails as outnumbered Greek units repulse the Italians in the [[Battle of Elaia–Kalamas]].))
Some((Date(8,November,1942),[[World War II]]: [[French Resistance]] coup in [[Algiers]], in which 400 civilian French patriots neutralize [[Vichy France|Vichyist]] XIXth Army Corps after 15 hours of fighting, and arrest several Vichyst generals, allowing the immediate success of [[Operation Torch]] in Algiers.))
Some((Date(8,November,1950),[[Korean War]]: [[United States Air Force]] Lt. Russell J. Brown, while piloting an [[F-80 Shooting Star]], shoots down two [[North Korea]]n [[Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-15|MiG-15]]s in the first [[jet aircraft]]-to-jet aircraft [[dogfight]] in history.))
Some((Date(8,November,1957),[[Operation Grapple#Grapple X|Operation Grapple X, Round C1]]: The United Kingdom conducts its first successful [[hydrogen bomb]] test over [[Kiritimati]] in the Pacific. ))
Some((Date(8,November,1960),[[John F. Kennedy]] defeats [[Richard Nixon]] in one of the [[United States presidential election, 1960|closest presidential elections]] of the twentieth century to become the 35th president of the United States.))
Some((Date(8,November,1965),The [[British Indian Ocean Territory]] is created, consisting of [[Chagos Archipelago]], [[Aldabra]], [[Farquhar Group|Farquhar]] and [[Des Roches]] islands.))
Some((Date(8,November,1966),Former [[Massachusetts]] Attorney General [[Edward Brooke]] becomes the first [[African American]] elected to the [[United States Senate]] since [[Reconstruction Era|Reconstruction]].))
Some((Date(8,November,1968),The [[Vienna Convention on Road Traffic]] is signed to facilitate international road traffic and to increase road safety by standardising the uniform traffic rules among the signatories.))
Some((Date(8,November,1972),[[HBO]] launches its programming, with the broadcast of the 1971 movie ''[[Sometimes a Great Notion (film)|Sometimes a Great Notion]]'', starring [[Paul Newman]] and [[Henry Fonda]].))
Some((Date(8,November,1973),The right ear of [[John Paul Getty III]] is delivered to a newspaper together with a ransom note, convincing his father to pay US$2.9 million.))
Some((Date(8,November,1976),A series of earthquakes spreads panic in the city of [[Thessaloniki]], which is evacuated.))
Some((Date(8,November,1977),[[Manolis Andronikos]], a Greek archaeologist and professor at the [[Aristotle University of Thessaloniki]], discovers the tomb of [[Philip II of Macedon]] at [[Vergina]].))
Some((Date(8,November,1987),[[Remembrance Day bombing]]: A [[Provisional Irish Republican Army|Provisional IRA]] bomb explodes in [[Enniskillen]], [[Northern Ireland]] during a ceremony honouring those who had died in wars involving British forces. Twelve people are killed and sixty-three wounded.))
Some((Date(8,November,2002),[[Iraq disarmament crisis]]: [[UN Security Council Resolution 1441]]: The [[United Nations Security Council]] unanimously approves a resolution on [[Iraq]], forcing [[Saddam Hussein]] to [[disarmament|disarm]] or face "serious consequences".))
Some((Date(8,November,2004),[[2003 invasion of Iraq|War in Iraq]]: More than 10,000 U.S. troops and a small number of [[Iraq]]i army units participate in a siege on the insurgent stronghold of [[Fallujah]].))
Some((Date(8,November,2011),The [[potentially hazardous asteroid]] [[2005 YU55]] passes 0.85 [[lunar distance (astronomy)|lunar distance]]s from Earth (about {{convert|324600|km|disp=or}}), the closest known approach by an asteroid of its [[Absolute magnitude#Solar system|brightness]] since {{mpl|2010 XC|15}} in 1976.))
Some((Date(8,November,2013),[[Typhoon Haiyan]], one of the [[List of tropical cyclone records|strongest tropical cyclones]] ever recorded, strikes the [[Visayas]] region of the [[Philippines]].  The storm left at least 6,340 people dead with over 1,000 still missing, and caused S$2.86 billion ([[US dollar|USD]]) in damage.

Some((Date(9,November,1979),[[North American Aerospace Defense Command#False alarms|Nuclear false alarm]]: The [[NORAD]] computers and the Alternate National Military Command Center in [[Fort Ritchie, Maryland]] detected purported massive [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] nuclear strike. After reviewing the raw data from satellites and checking the [[early-warning radar]]s, the alert is cancelled.))

Some((Date(9,November,1989),[[Cold War]]: [[Berlin Wall|Fall of the Berlin Wall]]. [[Communism|Communist]]-controlled [[East Germany]] opens [[Border checkpoint|checkpoint]]s in the Berlin Wall allowing its citizens to travel to West Germany. This key event led to the eventual [[German reunification|reunification of East and West Germany]], and [[fall of communism]] in eastern Europe including Russia.))
Some((Date(9,November,1993),[[Stari Most]], the "old bridge" in [[Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnia]]n [[Mostar]] built in [[1566]], collapses after several days of bombing.))

Some((Date(9,November,2007),The German [[Bundestag]] passes the controversial [[Telecommunications data retention|data retention bill]] mandating storage of citizens' telecommunications traffic data for six months without [[probable cause]].))
Some((Date(9,November,2012),A train carrying liquid fuel [[2012 Myanmar train crash|crashes and bursts into flames]] in northern [[Myanmar]], killing 27 people and injuring 80 others.))

Some((Date(10,November,2002),[[2002 Veterans Day Weekend tornado outbreak|Veteran's Day Weekend Tornado Outbreak]]: A tornado outbreak stretching from Northern [[Ohio]] to the Gulf Coast, one of the largest outbreaks recorded in November. The strongest tornado, an F4, hits [[Van Wert, Ohio|Van Wert]], Ohio during the early to mid afternoon and destroys a movie theater but the theater is evacuated prior to the hit.))

))
Some((Date(11,November,1100),[[Henry I of England]] marries [[Matilda of Scotland]], the daughter of [[Malcolm III of Scotland]] and a direct descendant of the Saxon king [[Edmund Ironside]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1215),The [[Fourth Lateran Council]] meets, defining the doctrine of [[transubstantiation]], the process by which bread and wine are, by that doctrine, said to transform into the body and blood of [[Christ]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1500),[[Treaty of Granada (1500)|Treaty of Granada]]: [[Louis XII of France]] and [[Ferdinand II of Aragon]] agree to divide the [[Kingdom of Naples]] between them.))
Some((Date(11,November,1620),The [[Mayflower Compact]] is signed in what is now [[Provincetown Harbor]] near [[Cape Cod]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1634),Following pressure from [[Anglican]] bishop [[John Atherton]], the [[Irish House of Commons]] passes ''An Act for the Punishment for the Vice of [[Buggery]]''.))
Some((Date(11,November,1673),Second [[Battle of Khotyn (1673)|Battle of Khotyn]] in [[Ukraine]]: [[Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth]] forces under the command of [[Jan III Sobieski|Jan Sobieski]] defeat the [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] army. In this battle, rockets made by [[Kazimierz Siemienowicz]] are successfully used.))
Some((Date(11,November,1675),[[Gottfried Leibniz]] demonstrates [[integral calculus]] for the first time to find the area under the graph of ''y'' = ''ƒ''(''x'').))
Some((Date(11,November,1724),[[Joseph Blake (criminal)|Joseph Blake]], alias Blueskin, a highwayman known for attacking "Thief-Taker General" (and thief) [[Jonathan Wild]] at the [[Old Bailey]], is hanged in London.))
Some((Date(11,November,1750),[[Lhasa riot of 1750|Riots break out]] in [[Lhasa]] after the murder of the [[Tibet]]an regent.))
Some((Date(11,November,1778),[[Cherry Valley massacre]]: [[Loyalist (American Revolution)|Loyalists]] and [[Seneca nation|Seneca]] Indian forces attack a fort and village in eastern New York during the [[American Revolutionary War]], killing more than forty civilians and soldiers.))
Some((Date(11,November,1805),[[Napoleonic Wars]]: [[Battle of Dürenstein]]: Eight thousand French troops attempt to slow the retreat of a vastly superior Russian and Austrian force.))
Some((Date(11,November,1813),[[War of 1812]]: [[Battle of Crysler's Farm]]: British and Canadian forces defeat a larger American force, causing the Americans to abandon their Saint Lawrence campaign.))
Some((Date(11,November,1831),In [[Jerusalem, Virginia]], [[Nat Turner]] is hanged after inciting a violent [[slave uprising]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1839),The [[Virginia Military Institute]] is founded in [[Lexington, Virginia]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1864),[[American Civil War]]: [[Sherman's March to the Sea]]: General [[William Tecumseh Sherman]] begins burning [[Atlanta in the American Civil War|Atlanta, Georgia]] to the ground in preparation for his march south.))
Some((Date(11,November,1865),[[Treaty of Sinchula]] is signed by which [[Bhutan]] cedes the areas east of the [[Teesta River]] to the [[British East India Company]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1869),The [[Victoria, Australia|Victorian]] [[Aboriginal Protection Act 1869|Aboriginal Protection Act]] is enacted in Australia, giving the government control of indigenous people's wages, their terms of employment, where they could live, and of their children, effectively leading to the [[Stolen Generations]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1880),Australian [[bushranger]] [[Ned Kelly]] is hanged at [[Melbourne Gaol]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1887),[[August Spies]], [[Albert Parsons]], [[Adolph Fischer]] and [[George Engel]] are [[Execution (legal)|executed]] as a result of the [[Haymarket affair]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1889),The State of [[Washington (state)|Washington]] is admitted as the 42nd [[U.S. state|state]] of the United States.))
Some((Date(11,November,1911),Many cities in the [[Midwestern United States]] [[The Great Blue Norther of 11/11/11|break their record highs and lows on the same day]] as a strong cold front rolls through.))
Some((Date(11,November,1918),[[World War I]]: Germany signs an [[First Armistice at Compiègne|armistice]] agreement with [[Allies of World War I|the Allies]] in a railroad car in the [[forest of Compiègne]], France. The fighting officially ends at 11:00&nbsp;a.m., (the eleventh hour of the eleventh day of the eleventh month) and this is commemorated annually with a [[two-minute silence]]. The war officially ends on the signing of the [[Treaty of Versailles]] on 28 June 1919.))
Some((Date(11,November,1919),The [[Centralia Massacre (Washington)|Centralia Massacre]] in [[Centralia, Washington]] results the deaths of four members of the [[American Legion]] and the lynching of a local leader of the [[Industrial Workers of the World]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1921),The [[Tomb of the Unknowns]] is dedicated by US President [[Warren G. Harding]] at [[Arlington National Cemetery]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1926),The [[United States Numbered Highways|United States Numbered Highway System]] is established.))
Some((Date(11,November,1930),[[Patent]] number US1781541 is awarded to [[Albert Einstein]] and [[Leó Szilárd]] for their invention, the [[Einstein refrigerator]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1934),The [[Shrine of Remembrance]] in [[Melbourne]], Australia is opened.))
Some((Date(11,November,1940),[[World War II]]: [[Battle of Taranto]]: The [[Royal Navy]] launches the first [[aircraft carrier]]-launched [[airstrike]] in history, on the Italian fleet at [[Taranto]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1942),World War II: The former [[zone libre]] is added to [[German military administration in occupied France during World War II]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1960),A military coup against [[President of Vietnam|President]] [[Ngo Dinh Diem]] of [[South Vietnam]] [[1960 South Vietnamese coup attempt|is crushed]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1961),Thirteen [[Italian Air Force]] servicemen, deployed to [[Republic of the Congo (Léopoldville)|the Congo]] as a part of the [[United Nations Operation in the Congo|UN peacekeeping force]] are massacred by a mob in the course of the [[Kindu atrocity]]. ))
Some((Date(11,November,1962),[[Kuwait]]'s National Assembly ratifies the [[Constitution of Kuwait]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1965),In [[Rhodesia]] (modern-day [[Zimbabwe]]), the white-minority government of [[Ian Smith]] [[Rhodesia's Unilateral Declaration of Independence|unilaterally declares independence]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1966),[[NASA]] launches [[Gemini 12]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1967),[[Vietnam War]]: In a propaganda ceremony in [[Phnom Penh]], [[Cambodia]], three American prisoners of war are released by the [[Viet Cong]] and turned over to "new left" antiwar activist [[Tom Hayden]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1968),Vietnam War: [[Operation Commando Hunt]] initiated. The goal is to interdict men and supplies on the [[Ho Chi Minh trail]], through [[Laos]] into [[South Vietnam]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1972),Vietnam War: [[Vietnamization]]: The United States Army turns over the massive [[Long Binh military base]] to [[South Vietnam]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1975),[[Australian constitutional crisis of 1975]]: Australian [[Governor-General of Australia|Governor-General]] Sir [[John Kerr (governor-general)|John Kerr]] dismisses the government of [[Gough Whitlam]], appoints [[Malcolm Fraser]] as caretaker [[Prime Minister of Australia|Prime Minister]] and announces a general election to be held in early [[December]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1981),[[Antigua and Barbuda]] joins the [[United Nations]].))
Some((Date(11,November,1992),The [[General Synod of the Church of England]] votes to allow women to become priests.))
Some((Date(11,November,1993),A sculpture honoring women who served in the [[Vietnam War]] is dedicated at the [[Vietnam Veterans Memorial]] in Washington, D.C.))
Some((Date(11,November,1999),The [[House of Lords Act 1999|House of Lords Act]] is given [[Royal Assent]], restricting membership of the [[House of Lords|British House of Lords]] by virtue of a hereditary peerage.))
Some((Date(11,November,2000),[[Kaprun disaster]]: One hundred fifty-five skiers and snowboarders die when a [[Funicular|cable car]] catches fire in an alpine tunnel in [[Kaprun]], Austria.))
Some((Date(11,November,2001),Journalists [[Pierre Billaud]], [[Johanne Sutton]] and [[Volker Handloik]] are killed in [[Afghanistan]] during an attack on the convoy they are traveling in.))
Some((Date(11,November,2004),[[New Zealand Tomb of the Unknown Warrior]] is dedicated at the [[National War Memorial (New Zealand)|National War Memorial]], [[Wellington]].))
Some((Date(11,November,2006),[[Queen Elizabeth II]] unveils the [[New Zealand War Memorial, London|New Zealand War Memorial]] in London, United Kingdom, commemorating the loss of soldiers from the [[New Zealand Army]] and the [[British Army]].))
Some((Date(11,November,2008),{{RMS|Queen Elizabeth 2}} (QE2) sets sail on her final voyage to [[Dubai]].))
Some((Date(11,November,2012),A [[2012 Shwebo earthquake|strong earthquake]] with the [[Moment magnitude scale|magnitude]] 6.8 hits northern [[Burma]], killing at least 26 people.))
Some((Date(11,November,2014),Fifty-eight people are killed in a [[2014 Khairpur bus crash|bus crash]] in the [[Sukkur District]] in southern [[Pakistan]]'s [[Sindh]] province.

Some((Date(12,November,1028),Future [[Byzantine emperor|Byzantine empress]] [[Zoe Porphyrogenita|Zoe]] takes the throne as empress consort to [[Romanos III Argyros]].))
Some((Date(12,November,1330),[[Battle of Posada]], Wallachian Voievode [[Basarab I]] defeats the Hungarian army in an ambush.))
Some((Date(12,November,1439),[[Plymouth]], England, becomes the first town incorporated by the [[Parliament of England|English Parliament]].))
Some((Date(12,November,1555),The [[Second Statute of Repeal]] re-establishes [[Catholicism]] in England.))
Some((Date(12,November,1793),[[Jean Sylvain Bailly]], the first [[Mayor of Paris]], is [[guillotine]]d.))
Some((Date(12,November,1892),[[William Heffelfinger|William "Pudge" Heffelfinger]] becomes the first professional [[American football]] player on record, participating in his first paid game for the [[Allegheny Athletic Association]].))
Some((Date(12,November,1893),The treaty of the [[Durand Line]] delineating the border between present day [[Pakistan]] and [[Afghanistan]] is signed by Sir Mortimer Durand, a British diplomat in British India, and the Afghan Amir Abdur Rahman Khan; the Durand Line has gained international recognition as an international border between the two nations.))
Some((Date(12,November,1905),Norway holds [[Norwegian monarchy plebiscite, 1905|a referendum]] resulting in popular approval of the [[Parliament of Norway|Storting's]] decision to in authorise the government to make the offer of the throne of the newly-independent country))
Some((Date(12,November,1912),King [[George I of Greece]] makes a triumphal entry into [[Thessaloniki]] after its liberation from 482 years of Ottoman rule.))
Some((Date(12,November,1918),Austria becomes a [[First Austrian Republic|republic]].))
Some((Date(12,November,1920),Italy and the [[Kingdom of Yugoslavia|Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes]] sign the [[Treaty of Rapallo (1920)|Treaty of Rapallo]].))
Some((Date(12,November,1927),[[Leon Trotsky]] is expelled from the [[Soviet Communist Party]], leaving [[Joseph Stalin]] in undisputed control of the [[Soviet Union]].))
Some((Date(12,November,1928),{{SS|Vestris}} sinks approximately {{convert|200|mi|km}} off [[Hampton Roads, Virginia]], killing at least 110 passengers, mostly women and children who die after the vessel is abandoned.))
Some((Date(12,November,1933),Hugh Gray takes the first known photos alleged to be of the [[Loch Ness Monster]].))
Some((Date(12,November,1936),In California, the [[San Francisco–Oakland Bay Bridge]] opens to traffic.))
Some((Date(12,November,1940),[[World War II]]: The [[Battle of Gabon]] ends as [[Free French Forces]] take [[Libreville]], [[Gabon]], and all of [[French Equatorial Africa]] from [[Vichy France|Vichy French]] forces.))
Some((Date(12,November,1941),World War II: Temperatures around Moscow drop to -12&nbsp;°C as the [[Soviet Union]] launches [[ski troops]] for the first time against the freezing German forces near the city.))
Some((Date(12,November,1942),World War II: [[Naval Battle of Guadalcanal]] between Japanese and American forces begins near [[Guadalcanal]]. The battle lasts for three days and ends with an American victory.))
Some((Date(12,November,1944),World War II: The [[Royal Air Force]] launches 29 [[Avro Lancaster]] bombers, which sink the German [[battleship]] ''[[German battleship Tirpitz|Tirpitz]]'', with 12,000&nbsp;lb [[Tallboy bomb]]s off [[Tromsø]], Norway.))
Some((Date(12,November,1945),[[Sudirman]] is elected the first commander-in-chief of the [[Indonesian Armed Forces]].))
Some((Date(12,November,1948),In Tokyo, an international [[war crime]]s tribunal sentences seven Japanese military and government officials, including General [[Hideki Tojo]], to death for their roles in World War II.))
Some((Date(12,November,1956),[[Morocco]], [[Sudan]] and [[Tunisia]] join the United Nations.))
Some((Date(12,November,1958),A team of rock climbers led by [[Warren Harding (climber)|Warren Harding]] completes the first ascent of [[The Nose (El Capitan)|The Nose]] on [[El Capitan]] in [[Yosemite Valley]].))
Some((Date(12,November,1968),[[Equatorial Guinea]] joins the United Nations.))
Some((Date(12,November,1969),[[Vietnam War]]: [[My Lai Massacre]]: Independent investigative journalist [[Seymour Hersh]] breaks the [[My Lai]] story.))
Some((Date(12,November,1970),The [[Oregon Highway Division]] attempts to destroy a rotting beached [[Sperm whale]] with explosives, leading to the now infamous [[Exploding whale#Oregon|"exploding whale"]] incident.))
Some((Date(12,November,1971),Vietnam War: As part of [[Vietnamization]], US President [[Richard Nixon]] sets February 1, 1972 as the deadline for the removal of another 45,000 American troops from [[Vietnam]].))
Some((Date(12,November,1975),The [[Comoros]] joins the United Nations.))
Some((Date(12,November,1978),[[Pope John Paul II]] takes possession of his Cathedral Church, the [[Basilica of St. John Lateran]], as the [[Bishop (Catholicism)|Bishop]] of Rome.))
Some((Date(12,November,1979),[[Iran hostage crisis]]: In response to the hostage situation in [[Tehran]], US President [[Jimmy Carter]] orders a halt to all petroleum imports into the United States from [[Iran]].))
Some((Date(12,November,1980),The [[NASA]] space probe ''[[Voyager I]]'' makes its closest approach to [[Saturn]] and takes the first images of its [[Rings of Saturn|rings]].))
Some((Date(12,November,1981),[[Space Shuttle program]]: Mission [[STS-2]], utilizing the [[Space Shuttle]] ''[[Space Shuttle Columbia|Columbia]]'', marks the first time a manned spacecraft is launched into space twice.))
Some((Date(12,November,1982),In the [[Soviet Union]], [[Yuri Andropov]] becomes the [[General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union|General Secretary]] of the [[Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union|Communist Party's Central Committee]], succeeding [[Leonid I. Brezhnev]].))
Some((Date(12,November,1990),[[Crown Prince]] [[Akihito]] is formally installed as Emperor Akihito of Japan, becoming the 125th Japanese monarch.))
Some((Date(12,November,1991),[[Santa Cruz massacre]]: Indonesian forces open fire on a crowd of student protesters in [[Dili]], East Timor.))
Some((Date(12,November,1993),The first [[Ultimate Fighting Championship]] event, [[UFC 1]], is held in Denver, Colorado.))
Some((Date(12,November,1995),[[Erdut Agreement]] regarding the peaceful resolution to the [[Croatian War of Independence]] was reached.))
Some((Date(12,November,1996),A [[Saudi Arabian Airlines]] [[Boeing 747]] and a Kazakh [[Ilyushin Il-76]] cargo plane [[Charkhi Dadri mid-air collision|collide in mid-air]] near New Delhi, killing 349. The deadliest mid-air collision to date.))
Some((Date(12,November,1997),[[Ramzi Yousef]] is found guilty of masterminding the [[1993 World Trade Center bombing]].))
Some((Date(12,November,1999),The [[Düzce earthquake]] strikes [[Turkey]] with a magnitude of 7.2 on the [[Richter magnitude scale|Richter scale]].))
Some((Date(12,November,2001),In New York City, [[American Airlines Flight 587]], an [[Airbus A300]] ''en route'' to the [[Dominican Republic]], crashes minutes after takeoff from [[John F. Kennedy International Airport]], killing all 260 on board and five on the ground.))
Some((Date(12,November,2003),[[Iraq War]]: In [[Nasiriyah]], Iraq, at least 23 people, among them the first Italian casualties of the [[2003 invasion of Iraq]], are killed in a suicide bomb attack on an Italian police base.))
Some((Date(12,November,2011),[[Silvio Berlusconi]] tenders his resignation as Prime Minister of Italy, effective November 16, due in large part to the [[European sovereign debt crisis]].))
Some((Date(12,November,2014),The [[Philae (spacecraft)|Philae lander]], deployed from the [[European Space Agency]]'s [[Rosetta (spacecraft)|Rosetta probe]], reaches the surface of Comet [[67P/Churyumov–Gerasimenko]].

Some((Date(13,November,1002),English king [[Æthelred II]] orders the killing of all [[Danes (ancient people)|Dane]]s in England, known today as the [[St. Brice's Day massacre]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1160),[[Louis VII of France]] marries [[Adela of Champagne]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1553),[[Archbishop of Canterbury]] [[Thomas Cranmer]] and four others, including [[Lady Jane Grey]], are accused of high treason and sentenced to death under Catholic [[Mary I of England|Queen "Bloody" Mary I]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1642),[[First English Civil War]]: [[Battle of Turnham Green]]: The [[Cavalier|Royalist]] forces withdraw in the face of the [[Roundhead|Parliamentarian]] army and fail to take London.))
Some((Date(13,November,1775),[[American Revolutionary War]]: Patriot revolutionary forces under Gen. [[Richard Montgomery]] occupy [[Montreal]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1841),[[James Braid (surgeon)|James Braid]] first sees a demonstration of ''animal magnetism'', which leads to his study of the subject he eventually calls ''[[hypnotism]]''.))
Some((Date(13,November,1851),The [[Denny Party]] lands at [[Alki Point, Seattle|Alki Point]], before moving to the other side of Elliott Bay to what would become [[Seattle]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1864),The new [[Greek Constitution of 1864|Constitution of Greece]] is adopted.))
Some((Date(13,November,1887),[[Bloody Sunday (1887)|Bloody Sunday]] clashes in central London.))
Some((Date(13,November,1901),The [[1901 Caister Lifeboat Disaster]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1914),[[Zaian War]]: Berber tribesmen inflict the heaviest defeat of French forces in Morocco at the [[Battle of El Herri]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1916),[[Prime Minister of Australia]] [[Billy Hughes]] is expelled from the [[Australian Labor Party|Labor Party]] over his support for [[conscription]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1918),[[Allies of World War I|Allied troops]] [[Occupation of Constantinople|occupy Constantinople]], the capital of the [[Ottoman Empire]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1927),The [[Holland Tunnel]] opens to traffic as the first [[Hudson River]] vehicle tunnel linking [[New Jersey]] to New York City.))
Some((Date(13,November,1940),[[Walt Disney]]'s animated musical film ''[[Fantasia (1940 film)|Fantasia]]'' is first released, on the first night of a roadshow at New York's [[Broadway Theatre (53rd Street)|Broadway Theatre]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1941),[[World War II]]: The [[aircraft carrier]] {{HMS|Ark Royal|91|6}} is torpedoed by {{GS|U-81|1941|2}}, sinking the [[November 14|following day]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1942),World War II: [[Naval Battle of Guadalcanal]]: U.S. and Japanese ships engage in an intense, close-quarters surface naval engagement during the [[Guadalcanal Campaign]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1947),The [[Soviet Union]] completes development of the [[AK-47]], one of the first proper [[assault rifle]]s.))
Some((Date(13,November,1950),General [[Carlos Delgado Chalbaud]], [[President of Venezuela]], is assassinated in [[Caracas]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1954),[[Great Britain national rugby league team|Great Britain]] defeats [[France national rugby league team|France]] to capture the first ever [[Rugby League World Cup]] in Paris in front of around 30,000 spectators.))
Some((Date(13,November,1956),The [[Supreme Court of the United States]] declares [[Alabama]] laws requiring segregated buses illegal, thus ending the [[Montgomery Bus Boycott]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1965),The {{SS|Yarmouth Castle}} burns and sinks 60 miles off [[Nassau, Bahamas|Nassau]] with the loss of 90 lives.))
Some((Date(13,November,1966),In response to [[Fatah]] raids against Israelis near the [[West Bank]] border, Israel [[Samu Incident|launches an attack]] on the village of [[As-Samu]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1969),[[Vietnam War]]: Anti-war protesters in Washington, D.C. stage a symbolic ''March Against Death''.))
Some((Date(13,November,1970),[[1970 Bhola cyclone|Bhola cyclone]]: A 150-mph [[tropical cyclone]] hits the densely populated [[Ganges Delta]] region of [[East Pakistan]] (now [[Bangladesh]]), killing an estimated 500,000 people in one night. This is regarded as the 20th century's worst natural disaster.))
Some((Date(13,November,1974),[[Ronald DeFeo, Jr.]] murders his entire family in Amityville, Long Island in the house that would become known as [[The Amityville Horror]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1982),[[Ray Mancini]] defeats [[Duk Koo Kim]] in a [[boxing]] match held in [[Las Vegas]]. Kim's subsequent death (on November 17) leads to significant changes in the sport.))
Some((Date(13,November,1985),The volcano [[Nevado del Ruiz]] erupts and melts a [[glacier]], causing a [[lahar]] (volcanic mudslide) that buries [[Armero, Colombia]], killing approximately 23,000 people.))
Some((Date(13,November,1986),The [[Compact of Free Association]] becomes law, granting the [[Federated States of Micronesia]], the [[Marshall Islands]] independence from the United States.))
Some((Date(13,November,1988),[[Mulugeta Seraw]], an Ethiopian law student in [[Portland, Oregon]] is beaten to death by members of the [[Neo-Nazi]] group East Side White Pride.))
Some((Date(13,November,1989),[[Hans-Adam II, Prince of Liechtenstein|Hans-Adam II]], the present [[Prince of Liechtenstein]], begins his reign on the death of his father.))
Some((Date(13,November,1990),In [[Aramoana]], New Zealand, David Gray shoots dead 13 people in [[Aramoana massacre|a massacre]] before being tracked down and killed by police the next day.))
Some((Date(13,November,1992),The [[High Court of Australia]] rules in ''[[Dietrich v The Queen]]'' that although there is no absolute right to have publicly funded counsel, in most circumstances a judge should grant any request for an adjournment or stay when an accused is unrepresented.))
Some((Date(13,November,1994),In a [[Referendums in Sweden|referendum]], voters in Sweden decide to join the [[European Union]].))
Some((Date(13,November,1995),A truck-bomb explodes outside of a US-operated [[Saudi Arabian National Guard]] training center in [[Riyadh]], killing five Americans and two Indians. A group called the Islamic Movement for Change claims responsibility.))
Some((Date(13,November,2000),[[Philippines|Philippine]] House Speaker [[Manny Villar]] passes the articles of impeachment against [[Philippine President]] [[Joseph Estrada]].))
Some((Date(13,November,2001),[[War on Terror]]: In the first such act since World War II, US President [[George W. Bush]] signs an [[executive order]] allowing [[military tribunal]]s against foreigners suspected of connections to terrorist acts or planned acts on the United States.))
Some((Date(13,November,2002),[[Iraq disarmament crisis]]: [[Iraq]] agrees to the terms of the [[UN Security Council Resolution 1441]].))
Some((Date(13,November,2007),Russia officially withdraws from the Soviet-era [[Batumi]] military base, [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]].))
Some((Date(13,November,2015),A set of [[November 2015 Paris attacks|coordinated terror attacks]] in [[Paris]], [[France]] including multiple shootings, explosions, and a [[hostage]] crisis in the [[10th arrondissement of Paris]] and the [[11th arrondissement of Paris]] kill 130 people, seven attackers, and injured 368 others, with at least 80 critically wounded.

Some((Date(14,November,1851),''[[Moby-Dick]]'', a novel by [[Herman Melville]], is published in the United States.))

Some((Date(14,November,1889),Pioneering female journalist [[Nellie Bly]] (aka Elizabeth Cochrane) begins a successful attempt to travel around the world in less than 80 days. She completes the trip in 72 days.))
Some((Date(14,November,1910),[[Aviator]] [[Eugene Burton Ely]] performs the first [[takeoff]] from a ship in [[Hampton Roads]], [[Virginia]]. He took off from a makeshift deck on the [[USS Birmingham (CL-2)|USS ''Birmingham'']] in a [[Curtiss Model D|Curtiss pusher]].))
Some((Date(14,November,1914),The [[Ottoman Empire]] declares war against Britain, France, Russia, Serbia and Montenegro during the early months of [[World War I]].))

Some((Date(14,November,1921),Foundation of the [[Communist Party of Spain]].))
Some((Date(14,November,1922),The [[British Broadcasting Company]] begins radio service in the United Kingdom.))
Some((Date(14,November,1932),[[Al Shorta SC]], one of [[Iraq]]'s biggest football clubs, are founded as ''Montakhab Al Shorta''.))
Some((Date(14,November,1938),The [[Lions Gate Bridge]] (a [[National Historic Site of Canada]]) connecting [[Vancouver]] to the [[North Shore (Greater Vancouver)|North Shore]] region, opens to traffic.))
Some((Date(14,November,1940),World War II: In England, [[Coventry Blitz|Coventry]] is heavily bombed by German [[Luftwaffe]] bombers. [[Coventry Cathedral]] is almost completely destroyed.))
Some((Date(14,November,1941),World War II: The [[aircraft carrier]] {{HMS|Ark Royal|91|6}} sinks due to torpedo damage from the {{GS|U-81|1941|6}} sustained on November 13.))
Some((Date(14,November,1952),The first regular [[UK Singles Chart]] published by the ''[[NME|New Musical Express]]''.))
Some((Date(14,November,1957),The [[Apalachin Meeting]] outside [[Binghamton, New York]] is raided by law enforcement, and many high level Mafia figures are arrested.))
Some((Date(14,November,1960),[[Ruby Bridges]] becomes the first black child to attend an all-white elementary school in [[Louisiana]].))
Some((Date(14,November,1967),The [[Congress of Colombia]], in commemoration of the 150 years of the death of [[Policarpa Salavarrieta]], declares this day as "Day of the Colombian Woman".))
Some((Date(14,November,1969),[[Apollo program]]: [[NASA]] launches ''[[Apollo 12]]'', the second [[Space exploration|crewed mission]] to the surface of the Moon.))
Some((Date(14,November,1970),[[Soviet Union]] enters [[International Civil Aviation Organization|ICAO]], making Russian the fourth official language of organization.))
Some((Date(14,November,1971),Enthronment of [[Pope Shenouda III of Alexandria|Pope Shenouda III]] as [[Pope of the Coptic Orthodox Church of Alexandria|Pope of Alexandria]].))
Some((Date(14,November,1973),In the United Kingdom, [[Anne, Princess Royal|Princess Anne]] marries [[Captain (British Army and Royal Marines)|Captain]] [[Mark Phillips]], in [[Westminster Abbey]].))
Some((Date(14,November,1975),With the signing of the [[Madrid Accords]], Spain abandons [[Western Sahara]].))
Some((Date(14,November,1979),[[Iran hostage crisis]]: US President [[Jimmy Carter]] issues [[Executive order]] 12170, freezing all Iranian assets in the United States in response to the [[Iran hostage crisis|hostage crisis]].))
Some((Date(14,November,1982),[[Lech Wałęsa]], the leader of Poland's outlawed [[Solidarity (Polish trade union)|Solidarity]] movement, is released after eleven months of [[internment]] near the Soviet border.))
Some((Date(14,November,1984),[[Zamboanga City]] mayor [[Cesar Climaco]], a prominent critic of the government of Philippine President [[Ferdinand Marcos]], is assassinated in his home city.))
Some((Date(14,November,1990),After [[German reunification]], the [[Germany|Federal Republic of Germany]] and Poland sign a treaty confirming the [[Oder–Neisse line]] as the border between Germany and Poland.))
Some((Date(14,November,1991),American and British authorities announce indictments against two Libyan [[Intelligence assessment|intelligence]] officials in connection with the downing of the [[Pan Am Flight 103]].))
Some((Date(14,November,1995),A budget standoff between [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrats]] and [[Republican Party (United States)|Republicans]] in the [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] forces the [[Federal government of the United States|federal government]] to [[United States federal government shutdowns of 1995 and 1995–96|temporarily close]] national parks and museums and to run most government offices with skeleton staffs.))
Some((Date(14,November,2001),[[War in Afghanistan (2001–14)|War in Afghanistan]]: Afghan [[Northern Alliance]] fighters take over the capital [[Kabul]].))
Some((Date(14,November,2003),Astronomers [[Michael E. Brown]], [[Chad Trujillo]], and [[David L. Rabinowitz]] discover [[90377 Sedna]], a [[Trans-Neptunian object]].))

Some((Date(14,November,2010),Germany's [[Sebastian Vettel]] of [[Red Bull Racing]] wins [[Formula One]]'s Drivers Championship to become the sport's youngest champion.))
Some((Date(14,November,2012),[[Israel]] launches a [[Operation Pillar of Defense|major military operation]] in the [[Gaza Strip]], as hostilities with [[Hamas]] escalate.

Some((Date(15,November,1806),[[Pike expedition]]: Lieutenant [[Zebulon Pike]] sees a distant mountain peak while near the [[Colorado]] foothills of the [[Rocky Mountains]]. (It is later named [[Pikes Peak]].)))

Some((Date(15,November,1914),[[Harry Turner (American football)|Harry Turner]] becomes the first player to die from game-related injuries in the "[[Ohio League]]", the direct predecessor to the [[National Football League]].))
Some((Date(15,November,1915),[[Winston Churchill]] resigns from [[Liberal Government 1905–15|his Government]], and soon commands the 6th Battalion of the [[Royal Scots Fusiliers]] on the [[Western Front (World War I)|Western Front]].))

Some((Date(15,November,1926),The [[NBC]] radio network opens with 24 stations.))
Some((Date(15,November,1928),The [[Royal National Lifeboat Institution|RNLI]] lifeboat [[RNLB Mary Stanford (ON 661)|''Mary Stanford'']] capsized in [[Rye Harbour]] with the loss of the entire 17-man crew.))

Some((Date(15,November,1966),[[Project Gemini]]: ''[[Gemini 12]]'' completes the program's final mission, when it splashes down safely in the Atlantic Ocean.))

Some((Date(15,November,1978),A chartered [[Douglas DC-8]] [[Aviation accidents and incidents|crashes]] near [[Colombo]], Sri Lanka, killing 183.))

Some((Date(16,November,1849),A Russian court sentences writer [[Fyodor Dostoyevsky]] to death for anti-government activities linked to a radical intellectual group; his sentence is later commuted to hard labor.))

Some((Date(16,November,1920),[[Qantas]], Australia's national airline, [[History of Qantas|is founded]] as Queensland and Northern Territory Aerial Services Limited.))

Some((Date(16,November,1965),[[Venera program]]: The [[Soviet Union]] launches the ''[[Venera 3]]'' space probe toward [[Venus]], which will be the first [[spacecraft]] to reach the surface of another [[planet]].))
Some((Date(16,November,1973),[[Skylab]] program: [[NASA]] launches ''[[Skylab 4]]'' with a crew of three [[astronaut]]s from [[Cape Canaveral, Florida]] for an 84-day mission.))
Some((Date(16,November,1974),The [[Arecibo message]] is broadcast from the [[Arecibo Radio Telescope]] in [[Puerto Rico]]. It was aimed at the current location of the globular star cluster [[Messier 13]] some 25,000 light years away. The message will reach empty space by the time it finally arrives since the cluster will have changed position.  ))

Some((Date(16,November,1997),After nearly 18 years of incarceration, the People's Republic of China releases [[Wei Jingsheng]], a pro-democracy dissident, from jail for medical reasons.

Some((Date(17,November,1939),Nine [[Czechs|Czech]] students are executed as a response to anti-[[Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia|Nazi]] demonstrations prompted by the death of [[Jan Opletal]]. In addition, all Czech universities are shut down and over 1200 Czech students sent to [[concentration camp]]s. Since this event, [[International Students' Day]] is celebrated in many countries, especially in the Czech Republic.))

This is seen by the [[German Confederation]] as a violation of the [[London Protocol (1852)|London Protocol]] and leads to the [[Second Schleswig War|German–Danish war of 1864]].))

Some((Date(18,November,1918),[[Latvia]] declares its independence from Russia.))
Some((Date(18,November,1926),[[George Bernard Shaw]] refuses to accept the money for his [[Nobel Prize]], saying, "I can forgive [[Alfred Nobel]] for inventing [[dynamite]], but only a fiend in human form could have invented the Nobel Prize."))
Some((Date(18,November,1928),Release of the animated short ''[[Steamboat Willie]]'', the first fully synchronized sound [[cartoon]], directed by [[Walt Disney]] and [[Ub Iwerks]], featuring the third appearances of cartoon characters [[Mickey Mouse]] and [[Minnie Mouse]]. This is considered by the Disney corporation to be Mickey's birthday.))
Some((Date(18,November,1929),[[1929 Grand Banks earthquake|Grand Banks earthquake]]: Off the south coast of [[Newfoundland (island)|Newfoundland]] in the Atlantic Ocean, a [[Richter magnitude]] 7.2 submarine earthquake, centered on the  [[Grand Banks of Newfoundland|Grand Banks]], breaks 12 submarine [[transatlantic telegraph cable]]s and triggers a [[tsunami]] that destroys many south coast communities in the [[Burin Peninsula]].))
Some((Date(18,November,1930),Soka Kyoiku Gakkai, a Buddhist association later renamed [[Soka Gakkai]], is founded by Japanese educators [[Tsunesaburō Makiguchi]] and [[Jōsei Toda]].))
Some((Date(18,November,1938),[[Trade union]] members elect [[John L. Lewis]] as the first president of the [[Congress of Industrial Organizations]].))
Some((Date(18,November,1940),[[World War II]]: German leader [[Adolf Hitler]] and Italian Foreign Minister [[Galeazzo Ciano]] meet to discuss [[Benito Mussolini]]'s disastrous [[Italian invasion of Greece]].))
Some((Date(18,November,1943),World War II: [[Battle of Berlin (RAF campaign)|Battle of Berlin]]: Four hundred and forty [[Royal Air Force]] planes bomb Berlin causing only light damage and killing 131. The RAF loses nine aircraft and 53 air crew.))
Some((Date(18,November,1944),The [[Popular Socialist Youth]] is founded in [[Cuba]].))
Some((Date(18,November,1947),The [[Ballantyne's fire|Ballantyne's Department Store fire]] in [[Christchurch]], New Zealand, kills 41; it is the worst fire disaster in the history of New Zealand.))
Some((Date(18,November,1949),The [[Iva Valley]] Shooting occurs after the coal miners of [[Enugu]] in [[Nigeria]] go on [[Strike action|strike]] over withheld wages; 21 miners are shot dead and 51 are wounded by police under the supervision of the [[Colonial Nigeria|British colonial administration of Nigeria]].))
Some((Date(18,November,1961),United States President [[John F. Kennedy]] sends 18,000 military advisors to [[South Vietnam]].))
Some((Date(18,November,1963),The first [[push-button telephone]] goes into service.))
Some((Date(18,November,1970),U.S. President [[Richard Nixon]] asks the [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] for $155 million in supplemental aid for the [[Cambodia]]n government.))
Some((Date(18,November,1978),In [[Jonestown]], [[Guyana]], [[Jim Jones]] led his [[Peoples Temple]] to a mass [[murder–suicide]] that claimed 918 lives in all, 909 of them in Jonestown itself, including over 270 children. Congressman [[Leo Ryan]] is murdered by members of the Peoples Temple hours earlier.))
Some((Date(18,November,1987),[[King's Cross fire]]: In London, 31 people die in a fire at the city's busiest [[London Underground|underground]] station, [[King's Cross St. Pancras tube station|King's Cross St Pancras]].))
Some((Date(18,November,1988),[[War on Drugs]]: U.S. President [[Ronald Reagan]] signs a bill into law allowing the [[Capital punishment|death penalty]] for [[drug trafficking|drug traffickers]].))
Some((Date(18,November,1991),[[Shiite]] Muslim kidnappers in [[Lebanon]] release [[Anglican Communion|Anglican Church]] envoys [[Terry Waite]] and [[Thomas Sutherland (academic)|Thomas Sutherland]].))
Some((Date(18,November,1993),In the United States, the [[North American Free Trade Agreement]] (NAFTA) is approved by the [[United States House of Representatives|House of Representatives]].))
Some((Date(18,November,1996),A [[1996 Channel Tunnel fire|fire]] occurs on a train traveling through the [[Channel Tunnel]] from France to England causing several injuries and damaging approximately 500 metres (1,600&nbsp;ft) of tunnel.  ))
Some((Date(18,November,2002),[[Iraq disarmament crisis]]: [[United Nations]] weapons inspectors led by [[Hans Blix]] arrive in [[Iraq]].))
Some((Date(18,November,2003),In the United Kingdom, the [[Local Government Act 2003]], repealing controversial anti-gay amendment [[Section 28]], becomes effective.))
Some((Date(18,November,2012),[[Pope Tawadros II of Alexandria]] becomes the [[List of Coptic Orthodox Popes of Alexandria|118th]] [[Pope of the Coptic Orthodox Church of Alexandria]].))
Some((Date(18,November,2013),[[NASA]] launches the [[MAVEN]] probe to [[Mars]].

Some((Date(19,November,1256),[[Rukn al-Din Khurshah]] surrenders the [[Assassins|Assassin]] stronghold at [[Alamut Castle|Alamut]] to a [[Mongols|Mongol]] army under the command of [[Hulagu Khan]].))
Some((Date(19,November,1493),[[Christopher Columbus]] goes ashore on an island he first saw the day before. He names it San Juan Bautista (later renamed [[Puerto Rico]]).))
Some((Date(19,November,1794),The United States and the Kingdom of Great Britain sign [[Jay Treaty|Jay's Treaty]], which attempts to resolve some of the lingering problems left over from the [[American Revolutionary War]].))
Some((Date(19,November,1802),The [[Garinagu]] arrive at British Honduras (Present day [[Belize]])))
Some((Date(19,November,1816),[[Warsaw University]] is established.))
Some((Date(19,November,1847),The second Canadian railway line, the [[Montreal]] and [[Lachine, Quebec|Lachine]] Railway, is opened.))
Some((Date(19,November,1863),[[American Civil War]]: U.S. President [[Abraham Lincoln]] delivers the [[Gettysburg Address]] at the dedication ceremony for the military cemetery at [[Gettysburg, Pennsylvania]].))
Some((Date(19,November,1881),A [[meteorite]] [[Meteorite fall#Importance|lands]] near the village of Grossliebenthal, southwest of [[Odessa]], Ukraine.))
Some((Date(19,November,1885),[[Serbo-Bulgarian War]]: Bulgarian victory in the [[Battle of Slivnitsa]] solidifies the unification between the [[Principality of Bulgaria]] and [[Eastern Rumelia]].))
Some((Date(19,November,1911),The [[Doom Bar]] in [[Cornwall]] claimed two ships, ''Island Maid'' and ''Angele'', the latter killing the entire crew except the captain.))
Some((Date(19,November,1912),[[First Balkan War]]: The Serbian Army [[Battle of Monastir|captures]] [[Bitola]], ending the five-century-long Ottoman rule of [[Macedonia (region)|Macedonia]].))
Some((Date(19,November,1916),[[Samuel Goldwyn]] and [[Edgar Selwyn]] establish [[Goldwyn Pictures]].))
Some((Date(19,November,1941),[[World War II]]: [[Battle between HMAS Sydney and German auxiliary cruiser Kormoran|Battle between HMAS ''Sydney'' and HSK ''Kormoran'']]. The two ships sink each other off the coast of Western Australia, with the loss of 645 Australians and about 77 [[Nazi Germany|German]] seamen.))
Some((Date(19,November,1942),World War II: [[Battle of Stalingrad]]: [[Soviet Union]] forces under General [[Georgy Zhukov]] launch the [[Operation Uranus]] [[counterattack]]s at [[Stalingrad]], turning the tide of the battle in the USSR's favor.))
Some((Date(19,November,1943),Holocaust: [[Nazis]] liquidate [[Janowska concentration camp]] in Lemberg ([[Lviv]]), western Ukraine, murdering at least 6,000 Jews after a failed uprising and mass escape attempt.))
Some((Date(19,November,1944),World War II: U.S. President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] announces the 6th War Loan Drive, aimed at selling US$14&nbsp;billion in [[war bond]]s to help pay for the war effort.))
Some((Date(19,November,1946),[[Afghanistan]], [[Iceland]] and Sweden join the [[United Nations]].))
Some((Date(19,November,1950),US General [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]] becomes Supreme Commander of [[NATO|NATO-Europe]].))
Some((Date(19,November,1952),Greek Field Marshal [[Alexander Papagos]] becomes the 152nd [[List of Prime Ministers of Greece|Prime Minister of Greece]].))
Some((Date(19,November,1954),[[Télé Monte Carlo]], Europe's oldest private television channel, is launched by Prince [[Rainier III, Prince of Monaco|Rainier III]].))
Some((Date(19,November,1955),''[[National Review]]'' publishes its first issue.))
Some((Date(19,November,1959),The [[Ford Motor Company]] announces the discontinuation of the unpopular [[Edsel]].))
Some((Date(19,November,1967),The establishment of [[TVB]], the first wireless commercial [[television station]] in Hong Kong.))
Some((Date(19,November,1969),[[Apollo program]]: [[Apollo 12]] astronauts [[Pete Conrad]] and [[Alan Bean]] land at ''[[Oceanus Procellarum]]'' (the "Ocean of Storms") and become the third and fourth [[human]]s to walk on the [[Moon]].))
Some((Date(19,November,1977),[[TAP Portugal Flight 425]] crashes in the [[Madeira Islands]], killing 131.))
Some((Date(19,November,1979),[[Iran hostage crisis]]: [[Iran]]ian leader [[Ayatollah]] [[Ruhollah Khomeini]] orders the release of 13 female and black American hostages being held at the [[US Embassy in Tehran]].))
Some((Date(19,November,1984),[[San Juanico disaster]]: A series of explosions at the [[Pemex]] [[petroleum]] storage facility at San Juan Ixhuatepec in Mexico City starts a major fire and kills about 500 people.))
Some((Date(19,November,1985),[[Cold War]]: In [[Geneva]], U.S. President [[Ronald Reagan]] and [[Soviet Union]] leader [[Mikhail Gorbachev]] [[Geneva Summit (1985)|meet]] for the first time.))
Some((Date(19,November,1988),[[Serbia]]n communist representative and future Serbian and [[Yugoslavia|Yugoslav]] president [[Slobodan Milošević]] publicly declares that [[Serbia]] is under attack from [[Albanians|Albanian]] separatists in [[Kosovo]] as well as internal treachery within [[Yugoslavia]] and a foreign conspiracy to destroy Serbia and Yugoslavia.))
Some((Date(19,November,1994),In the United Kingdom, the first [[National Lottery (United Kingdom)|National Lottery]] draw is held. A £1 ticket gave a one-in-14-million chance of correctly guessing the winning six out of 49 numbers.))
Some((Date(19,November,1996),Lt. Gen. [[Maurice Baril]] of Canada arrives in Africa to lead a multi-national policing force in [[Zaire]].))
Some((Date(19,November,1998),[[Lewinsky scandal]]: The [[United States House Committee on the Judiciary|United States House of Representatives Judiciary Committee]] begins [[impeachment]] hearings against U.S. President [[Bill Clinton]].))
Some((Date(19,November,1999),[[Shenzhou 1]]: The People's Republic of China launches its first [[Shenzhou spacecraft]].))
Some((Date(19,November,2002),The Greek [[oil tanker]] ''[[Prestige (oil tanker)|Prestige]]'' splits in half and sinks off the coast of [[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]], releasing over 20 million US gallons (76,000 m³) of oil in the [[Prestige oil spill|largest environmental disaster]] in Spanish and Portuguese history.))
Some((Date(19,November,2004),The [[Malice at the Palace]]: The worst brawl in NBA history, [[Ron Artest]] suspended 86 games (rest of season), [[Stephen Jackson]] suspended 30 games))
Some((Date(19,November,2010),The first of [[Pike River Mine disaster|four explosions]] takes place at the [[Pike River Mine]] in New Zealand; 29 people are killed in the nation's worst mining disaster since 1914.))
Some((Date(19,November,2013),A [[2013 Iranian embassy bombing|double suicide bombing]] at the [[List of diplomatic missions of Iran|Iranian embassy]] in [[Beirut]] kills 23 people and injures 160 others.

Some((Date(20,November,1194),[[Palermo]] is conquered by [[Henry VI, Holy Roman Emperor]].))

Some((Date(20,November,1695),[[Zumbi]], the last of the leaders of [[Palmares (quilombo)|Quilombo dos Palmares]] in early [[Brazil]], is executed by the forces of Portuguese [[bandeirante]] [[Domingos Jorge Velho]].))
Some((Date(20,November,1739),Start of the [[Battle of Porto Bello]] between British and Spanish forces during the [[War of Jenkins' Ear]].))
Some((Date(20,November,1776),[[American Revolutionary War]]: British forces land at [[The Palisades (Hudson River)|the Palisades]] and then attack [[Battle of Fort Lee|Fort Lee]]. The [[Continental Army]] starts to retreat across [[New Jersey]].))
Some((Date(20,November,1789),[[New Jersey]] becomes the first U.S. state to ratify the [[United States Bill of Rights|Bill of Rights]].))
Some((Date(20,November,1805),[[Ludwig van Beethoven|Beethoven's]] only opera, [[Fidelio]] premieres in [[Vienna]].))
Some((Date(20,November,1820),An 80-ton [[sperm whale]] attacks the ''[[Essex (whaleship)|Essex]]'' (a [[whaling]] ship from [[Nantucket, Massachusetts]]) 2,000 miles from the western coast of South America. ([[Herman Melville]]'s 1851 novel ''[[Moby-Dick]]'' is in part inspired by this story.)))
Some((Date(20,November,1845),[[Anglo-French blockade of the Río de la Plata]]: [[Battle of Vuelta de Obligado]].))
Some((Date(20,November,1861),[[American Civil War]]: A secession ordinance is filed by [[Kentucky]]'s Confederate government.))
Some((Date(20,November,1910),[[Mexican Revolution]]: [[Francisco I. Madero]] issues the [[Plan of San Luis Potosí|Plan de San Luis Potosí]], denouncing Mexican President [[Porfirio Díaz]], calling for a [[revolution]] to overthrow the [[Federal government of the United Mexican States|government of Mexico]], effectively starting the Mexican Revolution.))
Some((Date(20,November,1917),[[World War I]]: [[Battle of Cambrai (1917)|Battle of Cambrai]] begins: British forces make early progress in an attack on German positions but are later pushed back.))
Some((Date(20,November,1936),[[José Antonio Primo de Rivera]], founder of the [[Falange]], is killed by a republican execution squad.))
Some((Date(20,November,1940),[[World War II]]: [[Kingdom of Hungary|Hungary]] becomes a signatory of the [[Tripartite Pact]], officially joining the [[Axis powers#Hungary|Axis powers]].))
Some((Date(20,November,1943),World War II: [[Battle of Tarawa]] ([[Operation Galvanic]]) begins: [[United States Marines]] land on [[Tarawa Atoll]] in the [[Gilbert Islands]] and suffer heavy fire from Japanese shore guns and machine guns.))
Some((Date(20,November,1945),[[Nuremberg trials]]: Trials against 24 [[Nazism|Nazi]] [[war crime|war criminals]] start at the [[Palace of Justice, Nuremberg|Palace of Justice]] at [[Nuremberg]].))
Some((Date(20,November,1947),[[Elizabeth II|The Princess Elizabeth]] marries [[Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh|Lieutenant Philip Mountbatten]], who becomes the [[Duke of Edinburgh]], at [[Westminster Abbey]] in London.))
Some((Date(20,November,1952),[[Slánský trials]]: A series of Stalinist and anti-Semitic show trials in Czechoslovakia.))
Some((Date(20,November,1959),United Nations General Assembly adopts the [[Declaration of the Rights of the Child]]; annual anniversary observed as [[Universal Children's Day]]. ))
Some((Date(20,November,1962),[[Cuban Missile Crisis]] ends: In response to the [[Soviet Union]] agreeing to remove its missiles from [[Cuba]], U.S. President [[John F. Kennedy]] ends the quarantine of the Caribbean nation.))
Some((Date(20,November,1968),A total of 78 miners are killed in an explosion at the Consolidated Coal Company’s No. 9 mine in Farmington, West Virginia in the [[Farmington Mine disaster]]))
Some((Date(20,November,1969),[[Vietnam War]]: ''[[The Plain Dealer]]'' publishes explicit photographs of dead villagers from the [[My Lai Massacre]] in [[Vietnam]].))
Some((Date(20,November,1974),The [[United States Department of Justice]] files its final anti-trust suit against [[AT&T Corporation]]. This suit later leads to the breakup of AT&T and its [[Bell System]].))
Some((Date(20,November,1977),[[Egypt]]ian President [[Anwar Sadat]] becomes the first [[Arab]] leader to officially visit [[Israel]], when he meets Israeli prime minister [[Menachem Begin]] and speaks before the [[Knesset]] in [[Jerusalem]], seeking a permanent peace settlement.))
Some((Date(20,November,1979),[[Grand Mosque seizure]]: About 200 Sunni Muslims revolt in [[Saudi Arabia]] at the site of the [[Kaaba]] in [[Mecca]] during the pilgrimage and take about 6000 hostages. The Saudi government receives help from Pakistani special forces to put down the uprising.))
Some((Date(20,November,1980),[[Lake Peigneur]] drains into an underlying salt deposit. A misplaced [[Texaco]] oil probe had been drilled into the Diamond Crystal Salt Mine, causing water to flow down into the mine, eroding the edges of the hole. ))
Some((Date(20,November,1982),The [[General Union of Ecuadorian Workers]] (UGTE) is founded.))
Some((Date(20,November,1985),[[Microsoft]] [[Windows 1.0]] is released.))
Some((Date(20,November,1989),[[Velvet Revolution]]: The number of protesters assembled in [[Prague]], [[Czechoslovakia]] swells from 200,000 the day before to an estimated half-million.))
Some((Date(20,November,1991),An [[Azerbaijan]]i [[Mil Mi-8|MI-8]] helicopter carrying 19 peacekeeping mission team with officials and journalists from Russia, [[Kazakhstan]] and [[Azerbaijan]] is [[1991 Azerbaijani Mil Mi-8 shootdown|shot down by Armenian military forces]] in [[Khojavend District]] of Azerbaijan.))
Some((Date(20,November,1992),In England, [[1992 Windsor Castle fire|a fire breaks out in Windsor Castle]], badly damaging the castle and causing over £50&nbsp;million worth of damage.))
Some((Date(20,November,1993),[[Savings and loan crisis]]: The [[United States Senate Ethics Committee]] issues a stern censure of [[California]] senator [[Alan Cranston]] for his "dealings" with savings-and-loan executive [[Charles Keating]].))
Some((Date(20,November,1994),The [[Angola]]n government and [[UNITA]] rebels sign the [[Lusaka Protocol]] in [[Zambia]], ending 19 years of [[civil war]]. (Localized fighting resumes the next year.)))
Some((Date(20,November,1998),A court in [[Taliban]]-controlled [[Afghanistan]] declares accused terrorist [[Osama bin Laden]] "a man without a sin" in regard to the [[1998 U.S. embassy bombings]] in [[Kenya]] and [[Tanzania]].))
Some((Date(20,November,2001),In Washington, D.C., U.S. President [[George W. Bush]] dedicates the [[United States Department of Justice]] headquarters building as the Robert F. Kennedy Justice Building, honoring the late [[Robert F. Kennedy]] on what would have been his 76th birthday.))

(Reports conflict on this subject.)))
Some((Date(21,November,1902),The [[Philadelphia Athletics (NFL)|Philadelphia Football Athletics]] defeated the [[Kanaweola Athletic Club]] of [[Elmira, New York]], 39–0, in the first ever professional [[American football]] [[night game]].))
Some((Date(21,November,1905),[[Albert Einstein]]'s paper, "Does the Inertia of a Body Depend Upon Its Energy Content?", is published in the journal ''Annalen der Physik''. This paper reveals the relationship between energy and mass. This leads to the [[mass–energy equivalence]] formula ''E''&nbsp;=&nbsp;''mc''².))
Some((Date(21,November,1910),Sailors onboard Brazil's most powerful military units, including the brand-new warships {{Ship|Brazilian battleship|Minas Geraes||2}}, {{Ship|Brazilian battleship|São Paulo||2}}, and {{Ship|Brazilian cruiser|Bahia||2}}, violently rebel in what is now known as the ''Revolta da Chibata'' ([[Revolt of the Lash]]).))
Some((Date(21,November,1916),World War I: A mine explodes and sinks {{ship|HMHS|Britannic||6}} in the [[Aegean Sea]], killing 30 people.))
Some((Date(21,November,1918),The [[Flag of Estonia]], previously used by pro-independence activists, is formally adopted as the national flag of the [[Republic of Estonia]].))
Some((Date(21,November,1920),[[Irish War of Independence]]: In [[Dublin]], 31 people are killed in what became known as "[[Bloody Sunday (1920)|Bloody Sunday]]". This included fourteen British informants, fourteen Irish civilians and three [[Irish Republican Army]] prisoners.))
Some((Date(21,November,1922),[[Rebecca Latimer Felton]] of [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]] takes the oath of office, becoming the first female [[United States Senate|United States Senator]].))
Some((Date(21,November,1927),[[Columbine Mine massacre]]: [[Strike action|Striking]] coal miners are allegedly attacked with [[machine gun]]s by a detachment of state police dressed in civilian clothes.))
Some((Date(21,November,1942),The completion of the [[Alaska Highway]] (also known as the Alcan Highway) is celebrated (however, the highway is not usable by general vehicles until 1943).))
Some((Date(21,November,1945),The [[United Auto Workers]] strike 92 General Motors plants in 50 cities to back up worker demands for a 30-percent raise.))
Some((Date(21,November,1950),Two [[Canadian National Railway]] trains collide in northeastern [[British Columbia]] in the [[Canoe River train crash]]; the death toll is 21, with 17 of them Canadian troops bound for Korea.))
Some((Date(21,November,1953),The [[Natural History Museum, London]] announces that the "[[Piltdown Man]]" [[human skull|skull]], initially believed to be one of the most important fossilized hominid skulls ever found, is a hoax.))
Some((Date(21,November,1959),American disc jockey [[Alan Freed]], who had popularized the term "[[rock and roll]]" and music of that style, is fired from [[WABC (AM)|WABC-AM]] radio for refusing to deny allegations that he had participated in the [[payola]] scandal.))
Some((Date(21,November,1962),The Chinese [[People's Liberation Army]] declares a unilateral [[ceasefire]] in the [[Sino-Indian War]].))
Some((Date(21,November,1964),The [[Verrazano–Narrows Bridge]] opens to traffic. (At the time it is the world's longest [[suspension bridge]].)))
Some((Date(21,November,1967),[[Vietnam War]]: American General [[William Westmoreland]] tells news reporters: "I am absolutely certain that whereas in 1965 the enemy was winning, today he is certainly losing."))
Some((Date(21,November,1969),U.S. President [[Richard Nixon]] and Japanese Premier [[Eisaku Satō]] agree in Washington, D.C., on the return of [[Okinawa]] to Japanese control in 1972. Under the terms of the agreement, the U.S. is to retain its rights to bases on the island, but these are to be nuclear-free.))
Some((Date(21,November,1970),Vietnam War: [[Operation Ivory Coast]]: A joint United States Air Force and Army team raids the [[Sơn Tây (Hanoi)|Sơn Tây]] [[prisoner-of-war camp]] in an attempt to free American prisoners of war thought to be held there.))
Some((Date(21,November,1971),Indian troops, partly aided by [[Mukti Bahini]] ([[Bengal]]i [[guerrilla warfare|guerrilla]]s), defeat the Pakistan army in the [[Battle of Garibpur]].))
Some((Date(21,November,1972),Voters in South Korea overwhelmingly approve a new constitution, giving legitimacy to [[Park Chung-hee]] and the [[Fourth Republic of South Korea|Fourth Republic]].))
Some((Date(21,November,1974),The [[Birmingham pub bombings]] kill 21 people. The [[Birmingham Six]] are sentenced to life in prison for the crime but subsequently acquitted.))
Some((Date(21,November,1977),[[Minister of Internal Affairs (New Zealand)|Minister of Internal Affairs]] [[Allan Highet]] announces that the [[national anthem]]s of New Zealand shall be the traditional anthem "[[God Save the Queen]]" and "[[God Defend New Zealand]]", by [[Thomas Bracken]] (lyrics) and [[John Joseph Woods]] (music), both being of equal status as appropriate to the occasion.))
Some((Date(21,November,1979),The United States Embassy in [[Islamabad]], Pakistan, is attacked by a mob and [[1979 U.S. embassy burning in Islamabad|set on fire]], killing four.))
Some((Date(21,November,1980),A [[MGM Grand fire|deadly fire]] breaks out at the MGM Grand Hotel in [[Paradise, Nevada]] (now [[Bally's Las Vegas]]). Eighty-seven people are killed and more than 650 are injured in the worst disaster in Nevada history.))
Some((Date(21,November,1983),US military campaign in [[Grenada]] ends.))
Some((Date(21,November,1985),United States Navy intelligence analyst [[Jonathan Pollard]] is arrested for [[espionage|spying]] after being caught giving [[Israel]] classified information on [[Arab]] nations. He is subsequently sentenced to life in prison.))
Some((Date(21,November,1986),[[Iran–Contra affair]]: National Security Council member [[Oliver North]] and his secretary start to shred documents allegedly implicating them in the sale of weapons to [[Iran]] and channeling the proceeds to help fund the [[Contras|Contra]] rebels in [[Nicaragua]].))
Some((Date(21,November,1992),A major [[tornado]] strikes the [[Houston]], [[Texas]] area during the afternoon. Over the next two days the largest [[tornado outbreak]] ever to occur in the US during November spawns over 100 tornadoes before ending on the 23rd.))
Some((Date(21,November,1995),The [[Dayton Agreement]] is initialed at the [[Wright-Patterson Air Force Base]], near [[Dayton, Ohio]], ending three and a half years of war in [[Bosnia and Herzegovina]]. The agreement is formally ratified in Paris, on [[December 14]] that same year.))
Some((Date(21,November,1996),[[Humberto Vidal explosion]]: Thirty-three people die when a Humberto Vidal shoe shop explodes.))
Some((Date(21,November,2002),[[NATO]] invites [[Bulgaria]], [[Estonia]], [[Latvia]], [[Lithuania]], [[Romania]], [[Slovakia]] and [[Slovenia]] to become members.))
Some((Date(21,November,2004),The second round of the [[Ukrainian presidential election, 2004|Ukrainian presidential election]] is held, giving rise to massive protests and controversy over the election's integrity.))
Some((Date(21,November,2006),Anti-Syrian Lebanese Minister and MP [[Pierre Amine Gemayel|Pierre Gemayel]] is assassinated in suburban [[Beirut]].))
Some((Date(21,November,2009),A [[2009 Heilongjiang mine explosion|mine explosion]] in [[Heilongjiang]] province, northeastern China, kills 108.))
Some((Date(21,November,2012),At least 28 are wounded after a [[2012 Tel Aviv bus bombing|bomb is thrown onto a bus]] in [[Tel Aviv]].))
Some((Date(21,November,2013),A supermarket [[Zolitūde shopping centre roof collapse|roof collapse]] in [[Riga]], Zolitude, Latvia killing 54 people.))
Some((Date(22,November,1307),[[Pope Clement V]] issues the papal bull ''[[Pastoralis Praeeminentiae]]'' which instructed all Christian monarchs in Europe to arrest all [[Knights Templar|Templars]] and seize their assets.))
Some((Date(22,November,1574),Discovery of the [[Juan Fernández Islands]] off [[Chile]].))
Some((Date(22,November,1635),[[Dutch Formosa|Dutch colonial forces]] on [[Taiwan]] launch a [[Dutch pacification campaign on Formosa|pacification campaign]] against [[Taiwanese aborigines|native villages]], resulting in Dutch control of the middle and south of the island.))
Some((Date(22,November,1718),Off the coast of [[North Carolina]], British pirate Edward Teach (best known as "[[Blackbeard]]") is killed in battle with a boarding party led by [[Royal Navy]] Lieutenant [[Robert Maynard]].))
Some((Date(22,November,1812),[[War of 1812]]: Seventeen Indiana Rangers are killed at the [[Battle of Wild Cat Creek]].))
Some((Date(22,November,1837),Canadian journalist and politician [[William Lyon Mackenzie]] calls for a [[Upper Canada Rebellion|rebellion]] against the United Kingdom in his essay "To the People of [[Upper Canada]]", published in his newspaper ''The Constitution''.))
Some((Date(22,November,1858),[[Denver|Denver, Colorado]], is founded.))
Some((Date(22,November,1864),[[American Civil War]]: [[John Bell Hood]] begins the [[Franklin–Nashville Campaign]] in an unsuccessful attempt to draw [[William Tecumseh Sherman]] back out of [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]].))
Some((Date(22,November,1869),In [[Dumbarton]], Scotland, the [[clipper]] ''[[Cutty Sark]]'' is launched and is one of the last clippers ever built, and the only one still surviving today.))
Some((Date(22,November,1908),The [[Congress of Manastir]] establishes the [[Albanian alphabet]].))
Some((Date(22,November,1928),The premier performance of [[Maurice Ravel|Ravel]]'s ''[[Boléro]]'' takes place in Paris.))
Some((Date(22,November,1931),[[Al-Mina'a SC]] was founded in [[Iraq]].))
Some((Date(22,November,1935),The ''[[China Clipper]]'' inaugurates the first commercial transpacific air service, connecting [[China Clipper flight departure site|Alameda, California]] with [[Manila]].))
Some((Date(22,November,1940),[[World War II]]: Following the initial [[Greco-Italian War|Italian invasion]], [[Kingdom of Greece|Greek]] troops counterattack into [[Albanian Kingdom (1939–43)|Italian-occupied Albania]] and capture [[Korçë|Korytsa]].))
Some((Date(22,November,1942),World War II: [[Battle of Stalingrad]]: General [[Friedrich Paulus]] sends [[Adolf Hitler]] a [[Telegraphy|telegram]] saying that the German [[6th Army (Wehrmacht)|6th Army]] is surrounded.))
Some((Date(22,November,1943),World War II: [[Cairo Conference]]: U.S. President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]], British Prime Minister [[Winston Churchill]], and Chinese Premier [[Chiang Kai-shek]] meet in [[Cairo]], Egypt, to discuss ways to defeat Japan.))
Some((Date(22,November,1954),[[The Humane Society of the United States]] is founded.))
Some((Date(22,November,1963),In [[Dallas|Dallas, Texas]], US President [[John F. Kennedy]] is [[Assassination of John F. Kennedy|assassinated]] and [[Texas]] Governor [[John Connally]] is seriously wounded. Suspect [[Lee Harvey Oswald]] is captured that day and charged with the murder of both the President and [[police officer]] [[J. D. Tippit]]. Vice President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] becomes President upon Kennedy's death.))
Some((Date(22,November,1967),[[United Nations Security Council Resolution 242|UN Security Council Resolution 242]] is adopted, establishing a set of the principles aimed at guiding negotiations for an [[Arab people|Arab]]–[[Israel]]i peace settlement.))
Some((Date(22,November,1968),[[The Beatles]] release ''[[The Beatles (album)|The Beatles]]'' (known popularly as ''The White Album'').))
Some((Date(22,November,1973),The Italian Fascist organization [[Ordine Nuovo]] is disbanded.))
Some((Date(22,November,1974),The [[United Nations General Assembly]] grants the [[Palestine Liberation Organization]] observer status.))
Some((Date(22,November,1975),[[Juan Carlos I of Spain|Juan Carlos]] is declared [[List of Spanish monarchs|King of Spain]] following the death of [[Francisco Franco]].))
Some((Date(22,November,1977),[[British Airways]] inaugurates a regular London to New York City supersonic [[Concorde]] service.))
Some((Date(22,November,1986),[[Mike Tyson]] defeats [[Trevor Berbick]] to become youngest Heavyweight champion in boxing history.))
Some((Date(22,November,1987),Two Chicago television stations are [[Max Headroom broadcast signal intrusion|hijacked]] by an unknown pirate dressed as [[Max Headroom (character)|Max Headroom]].))
Some((Date(22,November,1988),In [[United States Air Force Plant 42|Palmdale, California]], the first prototype [[Northrop Grumman B-2 Spirit|B-2 Spirit]] stealth bomber is revealed.))
Some((Date(22,November,1989),In West [[Beirut]], a bomb explodes near the motorcade of Lebanese President [[René Moawad]], killing him.))
Some((Date(22,November,1990),British [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|Prime Minister]] [[Margaret Thatcher]] withdraws from the [[Conservative Party (UK) leadership election, 1990|Conservative Party leadership election]], confirming the end of her Prime-Ministership.))
Some((Date(22,November,1995),''[[Toy Story]]'' is released as the first feature-length film created completely using computer-generated imagery. ))
Some((Date(22,November,2002),In [[Nigeria]], more than 100 people are killed at an attack aimed at the contestants of the [[Miss World]] contest.))
Some((Date(22,November,2003),[[2003 Baghdad DHL attempted shootdown incident|Baghdad DHL attempted shootdown incident]]: Shortly after takeoff, a [[DHL Express]] cargo plane is struck on the left wing by a surface-to-air missile and forced to land. ))

Some((Date(23,November,1174),[[Saladin]] enters [[Damascus]], and adds it to his domain.))
Some((Date(23,November,1248),Conquest of [[Seville]] by Christian troops under King [[Ferdinand III of Castile]].))
Some((Date(23,November,1499),Pretender to the throne [[Perkin Warbeck]] is hanged for reportedly attempting to escape from the [[Tower of London]]. He had invaded England in [[1497]], claiming to be the lost son of King [[Edward IV of England]].))
Some((Date(23,November,1510),First campaign of the [[Ottoman Empire]] against the [[Kingdom of Imereti]] (modern western Georgia). Ottoman armies sack the capital [[Kutaisi]] and burn [[Gelati Monastery]]. ))

Some((Date(23,November,1644),[[John Milton]] publishes ''[[Areopagitica]]'', a pamphlet decrying [[censorship]].))
Some((Date(23,November,1733),The start of the [[1733 slave insurrection on St. John]] in what was then the [[Danish West Indies]].))

Some((Date(23,November,1810),[[Sarah Booth]] debuts at the [[Royal Opera House]].))

Grant]] reinforce troops at [[Chattanooga, Tennessee]], and counter-attack [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] troops.))
Some((Date(23,November,1867),The [[Manchester Martyrs]] are hanged in [[Manchester]], England, for killing a police officer while freeing two Irish nationalists from custody.))
Some((Date(23,November,1876),Corrupt [[Tammany Hall]] leader William Magear Tweed (better known as [[Boss Tweed]]) is delivered to authorities in New York City after being captured in Spain.))
Some((Date(23,November,1889),The first [[jukebox]] goes into operation at the Palais Royale Saloon in [[San Francisco]].))
Some((Date(23,November,1890),King [[William III of the Netherlands]] dies without a male heir and a special law is passed to allow his daughter [[Wilhelmina of the Netherlands|Princess Wilhelmina]] to succeed him.))
Some((Date(23,November,1910),[[Johan Alfred Ander]] becomes the last person [[Capital punishment in Sweden|to be executed in Sweden]].))
Some((Date(23,November,1914),[[Mexican Revolution]]: The last of U.S. forces withdraw from [[United States occupation of Veracruz|Veracruz]], occupied seven months earlier in response to the [[Tampico Affair]].))
Some((Date(23,November,1918),[[Heber J. Grant]] succeeds [[Joseph F. Smith]] as the seventh [[President of the Church (LDS Church)|president]] of [[The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints]].))
Some((Date(23,November,1924),[[Edwin Hubble]]'s discovery that the [[Andromeda Galaxy|Andromeda nebula]] is actually another [[galaxy|island universe]] far outside of [[Milky Way|our own]] was first published in [[The New York Times]].))
Some((Date(23,November,1934),An Anglo-Ethiopian boundary commission in the [[Ogaden]] discovers an Italian garrison at [[Walwal]], well within [[Ethiopia]]n territory. This leads to the [[Abyssinia Crisis]].))
Some((Date(23,November,1936),[[Life (magazine)|''Life'' magazine]] is reborn as a photo magazine and enjoys instant success.))
Some((Date(23,November,1939),[[World War II]]: {{HMS|Rawalpindi}} is sunk by the German [[battleship]]s {{ship|German battleship|Scharnhorst||2}} and {{ship|German battleship|Gneisenau||2}}.))
Some((Date(23,November,1940),World War II: [[Kingdom of Romania|Romania]] becomes a signatory of the [[Tripartite Pact]], officially joining the [[Axis powers#Romania|Axis powers]].))
Some((Date(23,November,1943),World War II: The [[Deutsche Opernhaus]] on Bismarckstraße in the Berlin neighborhood of [[Charlottenburg]] is destroyed. It will eventually be rebuilt in [[1961]] and be called the [[Deutsche Oper Berlin]].))
Some((Date(23,November,1946),French naval bombardment of [[Hai Phong]], [[Vietnam]], kills thousands of civilians. This was to lead to the [[First Indochina War]].))
Some((Date(23,November,1955),The [[Cocos Islands]] are transferred from the control of the United Kingdom to that of Australia.))
Some((Date(23,November,1959),[[President of France|French President]] [[Charles de Gaulle]] declares in a speech in [[Strasbourg]] his vision for "[[European integration|Europe, from the Atlantic to the Urals]]".))
