Some((Date(23,November,1971),Representatives of the People's Republic of China [[China and the United Nations|attend]] the [[United Nations]], including the [[United Nations Security Council]], for the first time.))
Some((Date(23,November,1972),The Soviet Union makes its final attempt at successfully launching the [[N1 (rocket)|N1 rocket]]. ))
Some((Date(23,November,1974),Sixty Ethiopian politicians, aristocrats, military officers, and other persons are [[Massacre of the Sixty|executed by the provisional military government]].))
Some((Date(23,November,1976),[[Apneist]] [[Jacques Mayol]] is the first man to reach a depth of 100&nbsp;m undersea without breathing equipment.))
Some((Date(23,November,1978),[[1978 Sri Lanka cyclone|Cyclone]] kills about 1000 people in Eastern Sri Lanka.))
Some((Date(23,November,1979),In [[Dublin]], Ireland, [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] member [[Thomas McMahon (Irish republican)|Thomas McMahon]] is sentenced to life in prison for the assassination of [[Louis Mountbatten, 1st Earl Mountbatten of Burma|Lord Mountbatten]].))
Some((Date(23,November,1980),[[1980 Irpinia earthquake|A series of earthquakes]] in southern Italy kills approximately 3,000 people.))
Some((Date(23,November,1981),[[Iran–Contra affair]]: [[Ronald Reagan]] signs the top secret National Security Decision Directive 17 (NSDD-17), giving the [[Central Intelligence Agency]] the authority to recruit and support [[Contras|Contra]] rebels in [[Nicaragua]].))
Some((Date(23,November,1985),Gunmen [[Aircraft hijacking|hijack]] [[EgyptAir Flight 648]] while en route from [[Athens]] to [[Cairo]]. When the plane lands in [[Malta]], [[Egypt]]ian commandos storm the aircraft, but 60 people die in the raid.))
Some((Date(23,November,1992),The first smartphone, the [[IBM Simon]], is introduced at [[COMDEX]] in [[Las Vegas]], [[Nevada]].))
Some((Date(23,November,1993),[[Rachel Whiteread]] wins both the £20,000 [[Turner Prize]] award for best British modern artist and the £40,000 [[K Foundation art award]] for the worst artist of the year.))
Some((Date(23,November,1996),[[Ethiopian Airlines Flight 961]] is hijacked, then crashes into the Indian Ocean off the coast of [[Comoros]] after running out of fuel, killing 125.))

Some((Date(23,November,2003),[[Rose Revolution]]: [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]]n president [[Eduard Shevardnadze]] resigns following weeks of mass protests over flawed elections.))
Some((Date(23,November,2004),The [[Holy Trinity Cathedral of Tbilisi]], the largest religious building in [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]], is consecrated.  ))
Some((Date(23,November,2005),[[Ellen Johnson Sirleaf]] is [[Liberian general election, 2005|elected]] [[president of Liberia]] and becomes the first woman to lead an African country.))
Some((Date(23,November,2006),A [[23 November 2006 Sadr City bombings|series of bombings]] kills at least 215 people and injures 257 others in [[Sadr City]], making it the second deadliest sectarian attack since the beginning of the Iraq War in 2003.))
Some((Date(23,November,2007),{{MS|Explorer|1969|6}}, a cruise liner carrying 154 people, sinks in the Antarctic Ocean south of [[Argentina]] after hitting an [[iceberg]] near the [[South Shetland Islands]]. There are no fatalities.))

Some((Date(23,November,2010),[[Bombardment of Yeonpyeong]]: North Korean artillery attack kills two civilians and two marines on Yeonpyeong Island, South Korea.))

Grant]] capture [[Lookout Mountain]] and begin to break the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] siege of the city led by General [[Braxton Bragg]].))
Some((Date(24,November,1877),[[Anna Sewell]]'s [[animal welfare]] novel ''[[Black Beauty]]'' is published.))
Some((Date(24,November,1906),A 13–6 victory by the [[Massillon Tigers]] over their rivals, the [[Canton Bulldogs]], for the "[[Ohio League]]" Championship, leads to accusations that the championship series was [[Match fixing|fixed]] and results in [[Canton Bulldogs–Massillon Tigers betting scandal|the first major scandal]] in professional [[American football]].))
Some((Date(24,November,1917),In [[Milwaukee]], nine members of the [[Milwaukee Police Department]] are killed by a bomb, the most deaths in a single event in U.S. police history until the [[September 11 attacks]] in [[2001]]. ))
Some((Date(24,November,1922),Nine [[Irish Republican Army]] members are [[Executions during the Irish Civil War#The first executions and reprisals|executed]] by an [[Irish Free State]] firing squad. Among them is author [[Robert Erskine Childers]], who had been arrested for illegally carrying a revolver.))
Some((Date(24,November,1932),In Washington, D.C., the [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] Scientific Crime Detection Laboratory (better known as the [[FBI Crime Lab]]) officially opens.))
Some((Date(24,November,1935),The [[Senegalese Socialist Party]] holds its second congress.))

Some((Date(24,November,1943),World War II: The {{USS|Liscome Bay|CVE-56|6}} is torpedoed near [[Tarawa]] and sinks, killing 650 men.))
Some((Date(24,November,1944),World War II: The [[73d Air Division|73rd Bombardment Wing]] launches the first [[Bombing of Tokyo|attack on Tokyo]] from the [[Northern Mariana Islands]].))
Some((Date(24,November,1950),The "[[Great Appalachian Storm of November 1950|Storm of the Century]]", a violent snowstorm, takes shape on this date before paralyzing the [[northeastern United States]] and the [[Appalachians]] the next day, bringing winds up to 100 mph and sub-zero temperatures. Pickens, West Virginia, records 57 inches of snow. Three hundred fifty-three people would die as a result of the storm.))
Some((Date(24,November,1962),The [[West Berlin]] branch of the [[Socialist Unity Party of Germany]] forms a separate party, the [[Socialist Unity Party of West Berlin]].))
Some((Date(24,November,1963),In the first live, televised murder, [[Lee Harvey Oswald]], the assassin of President [[John F. Kennedy]], is murdered two days after the assassination, by [[Jack Ruby]] in the basement of [[Dallas]] police department headquarters.))
Some((Date(24,November,1965),[[Mobutu Sese Seko|Joseph-Désiré Mobutu]] seizes power in the [[Republic of the Congo (Léopoldville)|Democratic Republic of the Congo]] and becomes [[Heads of state of the Democratic Republic of the Congo|President]]; he rules the country (which he renames [[Zaire]] in 1971) for over 30 years, until being overthrown by rebels in 1997.))
Some((Date(24,November,1966),Bulgarian [[TABSO Flight 101]] crashes near [[Bratislava]], [[Czechoslovak Socialist Republic|Czechoslovakia]], killing all 82 people on board.))
Some((Date(24,November,1969),[[Apollo program]]: The [[Apollo 12]] command module splashes down safely in the Pacific Ocean, ending the second manned mission to land on the Moon.))
Some((Date(24,November,1971),During a severe thunderstorm over [[Washington (state)|Washington]] state, a [[Aircraft hijacking|hijacker]] calling himself Dan Cooper (aka [[D. B. Cooper]]) parachutes from a [[Northwest Orient Airlines]] plane with $200,000 in ransom money. He has never been found.))
Some((Date(24,November,1973),A national speed limit is imposed on the [[Autobahn]] in Germany because of the [[1973 oil crisis]]. The speed limit lasts only four months.))
Some((Date(24,November,1974),[[Donald Johanson]] and Tom Gray discover the 40% complete ''[[Australopithecus afarensis]]'' skeleton, nicknamed "[[Lucy (Australopithecus)|Lucy]]" (after [[The Beatles]] song "[[Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds]]"), in the [[Awash Valley]] of [[Ethiopia]]'s [[Afar Depression]].))
Some((Date(24,November,1976),The [[1976 Çaldıran–Muradiye earthquake|Çaldıran–Muradiye earthquake]] in eastern Turkey kills between 4,000 and 5,000 people.))
Some((Date(24,November,2012),[[2012 Dhaka fire|A fire]] at a clothing factory in [[Dhaka]], [[Bangladesh]], kills at least 112 people.))
Some((Date(24,November,2013),[[Iran]] signs an interim [[Geneva interim agreement on the Iranian nuclear program|agreement]] with the [[P5+1|P5+1 countries]], limiting its [[Nuclear program of Iran|nuclear program]] in exchange for reduced [[Sanctions against Iran|sanctions]].))
Some((Date(24,November,2015),A [[Russian Air Force]] [[Sukhoi Su-24]] fighter jet is [[2015 Russian Sukhoi Su-24 shootdown|shot down]] by the [[Turkish Air Force]] over the [[Syria&ndash;Turkey border]], killing one of the two pilots; a Russian marine is also killed during a subsequent rescue effort.

Some((Date(25,November,-571),[[Servius Tullius]], king of [[Ancient Rome|Rome]], celebrates a [[Roman triumph|triumph]] for his victory over the [[Etruscans]].))

Some((Date(25,November,1120),The ''[[White Ship]]'' sinks in the [[English Channel]], drowning [[William Adelin]], son and heir of [[Henry I of England]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1177),[[Baldwin IV of Jerusalem]] and [[Raynald of Châtillon]] defeat [[Saladin]] at the [[Battle of Montgisard]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1343),A [[tsunami]], caused by an [[Earthquake of 1343|earthquake]] in the [[Tyrrhenian Sea]], devastates [[Naples]] (Italy) and the [[Amalfi|Maritime Republic of Amalfi]], among other places.))
Some((Date(25,November,1487),[[Elizabeth of York]] is crowned [[list of English consorts|Queen of England]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1491),The [[siege of Granada]], the last [[Moors|Moorish]] stronghold in Spain, ends with the [[Treaty of Granada]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1667),A deadly [[1667 Shamakhi earthquake|earthquake]] rocks [[Shemakha]] in the [[Caucasus]], killing 80,000 people.))
Some((Date(25,November,1755),King [[Ferdinand VI of Spain]] grants royal protection to the Beaterio de la Compañia de Jesus, now known as the Congregation of the [[Religious of the Virgin Mary]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1758),[[French and Indian War]]: British forces capture [[Fort Duquesne]] from French control. Later, [[Fort Pitt (Pennsylvania)|Fort Pitt]] will be built nearby and grow into modern [[Pittsburgh]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1759),An [[Near East earthquakes of 1759|earthquake]] hits the Mediterranean destroying [[Beirut]] and [[Damascus]] and killing 30,000-40,000.))
Some((Date(25,November,1783),[[American Revolutionary War]]: The last British troops [[Evacuation Day (New York)|leave New York City]] three months after the signing of the [[Treaty of Paris (1783)|Treaty of Paris]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1795),[[Partitions of Poland]]: [[Stanisław August Poniatowski]], the last king of independent Poland, is forced to [[abdication|abdicate]] and is exiled to Russia.))
Some((Date(25,November,1826),The [[Greek frigate Hellas|Greek frigate ''Hellas'']] arrives in [[Nafplion]] to become the first [[flagship]] of the [[Hellenic Navy]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1833),A massive undersea [[1833 Sumatra earthquake|earthquake]], estimated magnitude between 8.7-9.2, rocks [[Sumatra]], producing a massive [[tsunami]] all along the Indonesian coast.))
Some((Date(25,November,1839),A [[Pre-1980 North Indian Ocean cyclone seasons#November 1839 Coringa cyclone|cyclone]] slams India with high winds and a 40-foot [[storm surge]], destroying the port city of [[Coringa, Andhra Pradesh|Coringa]] (which has never been completely rebuilt). The storm wave sweeps inland, taking with it 20,000 ships and thousands of people. An estimated 300,000 deaths result from the disaster.))
Some((Date(25,November,1863),[[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Missionary Ridge]]: At [[Missionary Ridge]] in [[Tennessee]], [[United States|Union]] forces led by General [[Ulysses S. Grant]] break the [[Siege of Chattanooga]] by routing [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] troops under General [[Braxton Bragg]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1864),American Civil War: A group of Confederate operatives calling themselves the [[Confederate Army of Manhattan]] starts fires in more than 20 locations in an unsuccessful attempt to burn down New York City.))
Some((Date(25,November,1874),The United States [[Greenback Party]] is established as a [[political party]] consisting primarily of farmers affected by the [[Panic of 1873]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1876),[[American Indian Wars]]: In retaliation for the American defeat at the [[Battle of the Little Bighorn]], [[United States Army]] troops sack [[Chief Dull Knife]]'s sleeping [[Cheyenne]] village at the headwaters of the [[Powder River (Montana)|Powder River]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1905),Prince Carl of Denmark arrives in Norway to become [[Haakon VII of Norway|King Haakon VII of Norway]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1915),[[Albert Einstein]] presents the [[Einstein field equations|field equations]] of [[Introduction to general relativity|general relativity]] to the [[Prussian Academy of Sciences]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1917),[[World War I]]: German forces [[Battle of Ngomano|defeat]] Portuguese army of about 1200 at [[Negomano]] on the border of modern-day [[Mozambique]] and [[Tanzania]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1918),[[Vojvodina]], formerly [[Austria–Hungary|Austro-Hungarian]] crown land, proclaims its secession from Austria–Hungary to join the [[Kingdom of Serbia]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1926),The deadliest November [[tornado]] outbreak in U.S. history strikes on [[Thanksgiving (United States)|Thanksgiving Day]]. Twenty-seven twisters of great strength are reported in the [[Midwest]], including the strongest November tornado, an estimated F4, that devastates [[Heber Springs, Arkansas]]. There are 51 deaths in [[Arkansas]] alone, 76 deaths and over 400 injuries in all.))
Some((Date(25,November,1936),In [[Berlin]], [[Nazi Germany|Germany]] and Japan sign the [[Anti-Comintern Pact]], agreeing to consult on measures "to safeguard their common interests" in the case of an unprovoked attack by the [[Soviet Union]] against either nation.  The pact is renewed on the same day five years later with additional signatories.))
Some((Date(25,November,1940),[[World War II]]: First flight of the [[de Havilland Mosquito]] and [[Martin B-26 Marauder]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1941),{{HMS|Barham|04|6}} is sunk by a German torpedo during World War II.))
Some((Date(25,November,1943),World War II: Statehood of [[Bosnia and Herzegovina]] is re-established at the [[State Anti-fascist Council for the National Liberation of Bosnia and Herzegovina]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1947),[[Second Red Scare|Red Scare]]: The "[[Hollywood Ten]]" are [[blacklisted]] by [[Hollywood]] [[movie studio]]s.))
Some((Date(25,November,1950),The [[Great Appalachian Storm of November 1950]], known at the time as the "Storm of the Century", strikes New England with hurricane force winds resulting in massive forest blow-downs and storm surge damage along the Northeast coast including New York City. This storm also brings blizzard conditions to the [[Appalachian Mountains]] and [[Ohio Valley]], becoming one of the worst storms of all time. Three hundred fifty-three people die in the event.))
Some((Date(25,November,1952),[[Agatha Christie]]'s murder-mystery play ''[[The Mousetrap]]'' opens at the [[Ambassadors Theatre]] in London.  It will become the [[West End theatre#Long-running shows|longest continuously-running play]] in history.))
Some((Date(25,November,1958),[[French Sudan]] gains [[Autonomous entity|autonomy]] as a self-governing member of the [[French Community]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1960),The [[Mirabal sisters]] of the [[Dominican Republic]] are assassinated.))
Some((Date(25,November,1970),In Japan, author [[Yukio Mishima]] and one compatriot commit ritualistic [[seppuku]] after an unsuccessful coup attempt.))
Some((Date(25,November,1973),[[George Papadopoulos]], head of the military [[Greek military junta of 1967–74|Regime of the Colonels]] in Greece, is ousted in a hardliners' coup led by Brigadier General [[Dimitrios Ioannidis]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1975),[[Suriname]] gains independence from the Netherlands.))
Some((Date(25,November,1977),Former Senator [[Benigno Aquino, Jr.]], is found guilty by the Philippine [[Military tribunal|Military Commission No. 2]] and is sentenced to death by [[firing squad]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1981),[[Pope John Paul II]] appoints Joseph Cardinal Ratzinger (the future [[Pope Benedict XVI]]) [[Prefect of the Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1984),Thirty-six top musicians gather in a [[Notting Hill]] studio and record [[Band Aid (band)|Band Aid]]'s "[[Do They Know It's Christmas?]]" in order to raise money for [[famine relief]] in [[Ethiopia]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1986),[[Iran–Contra affair]]: U.S. Attorney General [[Edwin Meese]] announces that profits from covert weapons sales to [[Iran]] were illegally diverted to the anti-communist [[Contras|Contra]] rebels in [[Nicaragua]].))
Some((Date(25,November,1987),[[Typhoon Nina (1987)|Typhoon Nina]] pummels the [[Philippines]] with [[Saffir–Simpson hurricane wind scale|category 5 winds]] of 165 mph and a surge that destroys entire villages. At least 1,036 deaths are attributed to the storm.))
Some((Date(25,November,1992),The [[Federal Assembly of Czechoslovakia]] votes to split the country into the [[Czech Republic]] and [[Slovakia]], with effect from January 1, 1993.))
Some((Date(25,November,1996),An [[ice storm]] strikes the central U.S., killing 26 people. A powerful windstorm affects [[Florida]] and winds gust over 90 mph, toppling trees and flipping trailers.))
Some((Date(25,November,1999),A 5-year-old Cuban boy, [[Elian Gonzalez]], is rescued by fishermen while floating in an inner tube off the Florida coast. ))
Some((Date(25,November,2000),The [[2000 Baku earthquake]], with a Richter magnitude of 7.0, leaves 26 people dead in [[Baku]], [[Azerbaijan]], and becomes the strongest earthquake in the region in 158 years.))
Some((Date(25,November,2008),[[Cyclone Nisha (2008)|Cyclone Nisha]] strikes northern [[Sri Lanka]], killing 15 people and displacing 90,000 others while dealing the region the highest rainfall in nine decades.))
Some((Date(25,November,2009),[[2009 Jeddah floods|Jeddah floods]]: Freak rains swamp the city of [[Jeddah]], [[Saudi Arabia]], during an ongoing Hajj pilgrimage. Three thousand cars are swept away and 122 people perish in the torrents, with 350 others missing.

))
Some((Date(26,November,1161),[[Battle of Caishi]]: A [[Song dynasty]] fleet fights a naval engagement with [[Jin dynasty (1115–1234)|Jin dynasty]] ships on the [[Yangtze]] river during the [[Jin–Song Wars]].))
Some((Date(26,November,1476),[[Vlad the Impaler]] defeats [[Basarab Laiotă cel Bătrân|Basarab Laiota]] with the help of [[Stephen the Great]] and [[Stephen V Báthory]] and becomes the ruler of [[Wallachia]] for the third time.))
Some((Date(26,November,1778),In the [[Hawaiian Islands]], Captain [[James Cook]] becomes the first European to visit [[Maui]].))
Some((Date(26,November,1784),The Catholic [[Apostolic Prefecture]] of the United States established.))
Some((Date(26,November,1789),A national [[Thanksgiving (United States)|Thanksgiving Day]] is observed in the United States as proclaimed by President [[George Washington]] at the request of [[United States Congress|Congress]].))
Some((Date(26,November,1805),Official opening of [[Thomas Telford]]'s [[Pontcysyllte Aqueduct]].))
Some((Date(26,November,1812),The [[Battle of Berezina]] begins during [[Napoleon]]'s retreat from [[Russia]].))
Some((Date(26,November,1825),At [[Union College]] in [[Schenectady, New York]], a group of college students form the [[Kappa Alpha Society]], the first [[college]] social [[Fraternities and sororities|fraternity]].))
Some((Date(26,November,1842),The [[University of Notre Dame]] is founded.))
Some((Date(26,November,1863),United States President [[Abraham Lincoln]] proclaims November 26 as a national [[Thanksgiving (United States)|Thanksgiving Day]], to be celebrated annually on the final Thursday of November. (Since 1941, it has been on the fourth Thursday.)))
Some((Date(26,November,1865),[[Battle of Papudo]]: A Spanish navy schooner is defeated by a Chilean corvette north of [[Valparaíso]], Chile.))
Some((Date(26,November,1917),The [[National Hockey League]] is formed, with the [[Montreal Canadiens]], [[Montreal Wanderers]], [[Ottawa Senators (original)|Ottawa Senators]], [[Quebec Bulldogs]], and [[Toronto Arenas]] as its first teams.))
Some((Date(26,November,1918),The Montenegran [[Podgorica Assembly]] votes for a "union of the people", declaring assimilation into the Kingdom of [[Serbia]].))
Some((Date(26,November,1922),[[Howard Carter]] and [[George Herbert, 5th Earl of Carnarvon|Lord Carnarvon]] become the first people to enter the tomb of [[Pharaoh]] [[Tutankhamun]] in over 3000 years.))
Some((Date(26,November,1939),[[Shelling of Mainila]]: The [[Soviet Army]] orchestrates an incident which is used to justify the start of the [[Winter War]] with Finland four days later.))
Some((Date(26,November,1942),World War II: [[Yugoslav Partisans]] convene the first meeting of the [[Anti-Fascist Council for the National Liberation of Yugoslavia]] at [[Bihać]] in northwestern [[Bosnia (region)|Bosnia]].))
Some((Date(26,November,1943),World War II: [[HMT Rohna]] is sunk by the [[Luftwaffe]] in an air attack in the [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean]] north of [[Béjaïa]], [[Algeria]].))
Some((Date(26,November,1944),World War II: A [[Nazi Germany|German]] [[V-2 rocket]] [[Woolworths Group#Disasters|hits a Woolworth's shop]] in London, United Kingdom, killing 168 people.))
Some((Date(26,November,1949),The [[Constituent Assembly of India]] adopts the [[Constitution of India|constitution]] presented by Dr. [[B. R. Ambedkar]].))
Some((Date(26,November,1950),[[Korean War]]: Troops from the People's Republic of China launch a massive [[counterattack]] in [[North Korea]] against South Korean and [[United Nations]] forces ([[Battle of the Ch'ongch'on River]] and [[Battle of Chosin Reservoir]]), ending any hopes of a quick end to the conflict.))
Some((Date(26,November,1965),In the [[Hammaguir]] launch facility in the [[Sahara Desert]], France launches a [[Diamant|Diamant-A]] rocket with its first [[satellite]], ''[[Asterix-1]]'', on board.))
Some((Date(26,November,1968),[[Vietnam War]]: [[United States Air Force]] helicopter pilot [[James P. Fleming]] rescues an Army Special Forces unit pinned down by [[Viet Cong]] fire. He is later awarded the [[Medal of Honor]].))
Some((Date(26,November,1970),In [[Basse-Terre]], [[Guadeloupe]], 1.5 inches (38.1&nbsp;mm) of rain fall in a minute, the heaviest rainfall ever recorded.))
Some((Date(26,November,1977),An unidentified hijacker named [[Vrillon]], claiming to be the representative of the "Ashtar Galactic Command", takes over Britain's [[Southern Television]] for six minutes, starting at 5:12 pm.))
Some((Date(26,November,1983),[[Brink's-Mat robbery]]: In London, 6,800 gold bars worth nearly £26 million are stolen from the Brink's-Mat vault at [[Heathrow Airport]].))
Some((Date(26,November,1986),[[Iran–Contra affair]]: U.S. President [[Ronald Reagan]] announces the members of what will become known as the [[Tower Commission]].))
Some((Date(26,November,1990),The [[Delta II]] rocket makes its maiden flight.))
Some((Date(26,November,1991),[[National Assembly of Azerbaijan]] [[Law on Abolishment of Nagorno-Karabakh Autonomous Oblast|abolishes the autonomous status of Nagorno-Karabakh Autonomous Oblast]] of [[Azerbaijan]] and renames several cities back to their original names.))
Some((Date(26,November,1998),[[Tony Blair]] becomes the first [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom]] to address the [[Oireachtas]], the parliament of the [[Republic of Ireland]].))
Some((Date(26,November,2000),[[George W. Bush]] is certified the winner of Florida's electoral votes by [[Katherine Harris]], going on to win the [[United_States_presidential_election,_2000|United States presidential election]], despite losing in the national popular vote.))
Some((Date(26,November,2003),[[Concorde]] makes its final flight, over [[Bristol]], England.))
Some((Date(26,November,2004),[[Ruzhou School massacre]]: A man stabs and kills eight people and seriously wounds another four in a school dormitory in [[Ruzhou]], China.))
Some((Date(26,November,2008),[[2008 Mumbai attacks|Mumbai attacks]] by Pakistan-sponsored Lashkar-e-Taiba.))
Some((Date(26,November,2011),[[2011 NATO attack in Pakistan|NATO attack in Pakistan]]: NATO forces in Afghanistan attack a Pakistani checkpost in a friendly fire incident, killing 24 soldiers and wounding 13 others.))
Some((Date(27,November,1095),[[Pope Urban II]] declares the [[First Crusade]] at the [[Council of Clermont]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1703),The first [[Eddystone Lighthouse]] is destroyed in the [[Great Storm of 1703]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1727),The foundation stone to the [[Jerusalem Church (Berlin)|Jerusalem Church]] in Berlin is laid.))
Some((Date(27,November,1807),The Portuguese Royal Family [[History of Portugal (1777–1834)#Napoleonic invasions|leaves Lisbon to escape from Napoleonic troops]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1810),The [[Berners Street hoax]] was perpetrated by [[Theodore Hook]] in the [[City of Westminster]], London.))
Some((Date(27,November,1815),Adoption of [[Constitution of the Kingdom of Poland]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1830),Saint [[Catherine Labouré]] experiences a vision of the Blessed Virgin standing on a globe, crushing a serpent with her feet, and emanating rays of light from her hands.))
Some((Date(27,November,1835),[[James Pratt and John Smith]] are hanged in London; they are the last two to be executed for sodomy in England.))
Some((Date(27,November,1839),In [[Boston]], [[Massachusetts]], the [[American Statistical Association]] is founded.))
Some((Date(27,November,1856),The [[Luxembourg Coup of 1856|Coup of 1856]] leads to [[Luxembourg]]'s unilateral adoption of a new, reactionary [[Constitution of Luxembourg|constitution]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1863),[[American Civil War]]: [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] cavalry leader [[John Hunt Morgan]] and several of his men escape the [[Ohio Penitentiary]] and return safely to the [[Confederate States of America|South]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1868),[[American Indian Wars]]: [[Battle of Washita River]]: [[United States Army]] [[Lieutenant Colonel]] [[George Armstrong Custer]] leads an attack on [[Cheyenne]] living on reservation land.))
Some((Date(27,November,1886),German judge [[Emil Hartwich]] sustains fatal injuries in a [[duel]], which would become the background for [[Theodor Fontane]]'s ''[[Effi Briest]]''.))
Some((Date(27,November,1895),At the Swedish–Norwegian Club in Paris, [[Alfred Nobel]] signs his [[last will and testament]], setting aside his estate to establish the [[Nobel Prize]] after he dies.))
Some((Date(27,November,1896),[[Also sprach Zarathustra (Strauss)|Also sprach Zarathoustra]] by [[Richard Strauss]] is first performed.))
Some((Date(27,November,1901),The [[U.S. Army War College]] is established.))
Some((Date(27,November,1912),[[Spain]] declares a protectorate over the north shore of [[Morocco]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1924),In New York City, the first [[Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade]] is held.))
Some((Date(27,November,1940),In [[Kingdom of Romania|Romania]], the ruling [[Iron Guard]] fascist party assassinates over 60 of arrested King [[Carol II of Romania]]'s aides and other political dissidents, including former [[Prime Minister of Romania|Prime Minister]] [[Nicolae Iorga]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1942),World War II: At [[Toulon]], the French navy [[Scuttling of the French fleet in Toulon|scuttles its ships and submarines]] to keep them out of [[Nazism|Nazi]] hands.))
Some((Date(27,November,1944),World War II: [[RAF Fauld explosion]]: An explosion at a [[Royal Air Force]] ammunition dump in [[Staffordshire]] kills seventy people.))
Some((Date(27,November,1945),[[CARE (relief agency)|CARE]] (then the Cooperative for American Remittances to Europe) was founded to a send [[CARE Package]]s of food relief to Europe after World War II.))
Some((Date(27,November,1954),[[Alger Hiss]] is released from prison after serving 44 months for [[perjury]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1963),The [[Convention on the Unification of Certain Points of Substantive Law on Patents for Invention]] is signed at [[Strasbourg]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1965),[[Vietnam War]]: [[The Pentagon]] tells U.S. President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] that if planned operations are to succeed, the number of American troops in [[Vietnam]] has to be increased from 120,000 to 400,000.))
Some((Date(27,November,1968),[[Penny Ann Early]] became the first woman to play major professional basketball, for the [[Kentucky Colonels]] in an [[American Basketball Association|ABA]] game against the [[Los Angeles Stars]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1971),The [[Soviet space program]]'s [[Mars probe program|''Mars 2'']] orbiter releases a descent module. It malfunctions and crashes, but it is the first man-made object to reach the surface of [[Mars]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1973),[[Twenty-fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution|Twenty-fifth Amendment]]: The [[United States Senate]] votes 92–3 to confirm [[Gerald Ford]] as [[Vice President of the United States]]. (On [[December 6]], the [[United States House of Representatives|House]] will confirm him 387–35).))
Some((Date(27,November,1975),The [[Provisional IRA]] assassinates [[Ross McWhirter]], after a [[news conference|press conference]] in which McWhirter had announced a reward for the capture of those responsible for multiple bombings and shootings across [[England]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1978),In [[San Francisco]], city mayor [[George Moscone]] and openly [[gay]] [[city supervisor]] [[Harvey Milk]] are [[Moscone–Milk assassinations|assassinated]] by former supervisor [[Dan White]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1983),[[Avianca Flight 011]]: A [[Boeing 747]] crashes near [[Madrid]]'s [[Barajas Airport]], killing 181.))
Some((Date(27,November,1984),Under the [[Brussels Agreement, 1984|Brussels Agreement]] signed between the governments of the United Kingdom and Spain, the former agreed to enter into discussions with Spain over [[Gibraltar]], including sovereignty.))
Some((Date(27,November,1987),On a routine flight between [[Taiwan]] and [[Mauritius]], [[South African Airways Flight 295]] experiences an in-flight fire, apparently starting at around 23:48 on the 27th. After just under 16 minutes (leading into the early hours of [[November 28]]), the plane crashes and kills all 159 on board. ))
Some((Date(27,November,1989),[[Avianca Flight 203]]: A [[Boeing 727]] explodes in mid-air over [[Colombia]], killing all 107 people on board and three people on the ground. The [[Medellín Cartel]] will claim responsibility for the attack.))
Some((Date(27,November,1991),The [[United Nations Security Council]] adopts [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 721|Security Council Resolution 721]], leading the way to the establishment of [[peacekeeping]] operations in [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1992),For the second time in a year, [[Armed forces|military forces]] try to overthrow president [[Carlos Andrés Pérez]] in [[Venezuela]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1997),Twenty-five are killed in the second [[Souhane massacre]] in [[Algeria]].))
Some((Date(27,November,1999),The left-wing [[New Zealand Labour Party|Labour Party]] takes control of the [[New Zealand]] government with leader [[Helen Clark]] becoming the first elected female Prime Minister in New Zealand's history.))
Some((Date(27,November,2001),A [[hydrogen]] [[Celestial body atmosphere|atmosphere]] is discovered on the [[extrasolar planet]] [[Osiris (planet)|Osiris]] by the [[Hubble Space Telescope]], the first atmosphere detected on an extrasolar planet.))
Some((Date(27,November,2004),[[Pope John Paul II]] returns the relics of Saint [[John Chrysostom]] to the [[Eastern Orthodox Church]].))
Some((Date(27,November,2005),The first partial human [[face transplant]] is completed in [[Amiens]], France.))
Some((Date(27,November,2006),The [[House of Commons of Canada|Canadian House of Commons]] approves a motion tabled by [[Canadian Prime Minister|Prime Minister]] [[Stephen Harper]] recognizing [[Québécois nation motion|the Québécois as a nation]] within Canada.))
Some((Date(27,November,2009),[[2009 Nevsky Express bombing|Nevsky Express bombing]]: A bomb explodes on the [[Nevsky Express]] train between [[Moscow]] and [[Saint Petersburg]], derailing it and causing 28 deaths and 96 injuries.

Some((Date(28,November,1520),After navigating through [[Strait of Magellan|a strait at the southern end of South America]], three ships under the command of Portuguese explorer [[Ferdinand Magellan]] reach the Pacific Ocean, becoming the first European ships to sail from the Atlantic Ocean to the Pacific.))
Some((Date(28,November,1582),In [[Stratford-upon-Avon]], [[William Shakespeare]] and [[Anne Hathaway (Shakespeare's wife)|Anne Hathaway]] pay a £40 bond for their [[marriage licence]].))
Some((Date(28,November,1627),The [[Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth Navy]] has its greatest and last victory in the [[Battle of Oliwa]].))
Some((Date(28,November,1660),At [[Gresham College]], twelve men, including [[Christopher Wren]], [[Robert Boyle]], [[John Wilkins]], and Sir [[Robert Moray]] decide to found what is later known as the [[Royal Society]].))

Some((Date(28,November,1785),The [[Treaty of Hopewell]] is signed.))
Some((Date(28,November,1811),[[Beethoven]]'s [[Piano Concerto No. 5 (Beethoven)|Piano Concerto No. 5 in E-flat major, Op. 73]], premieres at the [[Gewandhaus]] in [[Leipzig]].))
Some((Date(28,November,1814),''[[The Times]]'' in London is for the first time printed by automatic, [[steam-power]]ed presses built by the German inventors [[Friedrich Koenig]] and [[Andreas Friedrich Bauer]], signaling the beginning of the availability of newspapers to a mass audience.))
Some((Date(28,November,1821),[[Public holidays in Panama|Panama Independence Day]]: Panama separates from Spain and joins [[Gran Colombia]].))
Some((Date(28,November,1828),[[Greek War of Independence]]: The French [[Morea expedition]] to recapture Morea (now the [[Peloponnese]]) ends when the last Ottoman forces depart the peninsula.))
Some((Date(28,November,1843),[[Kingdom of Hawaii#Anglo-Franco Proclamation|Ka Lā Hui (Hawaiian Independence Day)]]: The [[Kingdom of Hawaii]] is officially recognized by the United Kingdom and France as an independent nation.))
Some((Date(28,November,1862),[[American Civil War]]: In the [[Battle of Cane Hill]], [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] troops under General [[James G. Blunt]] defeat General [[John Marmaduke]]'s Confederates.))
Some((Date(28,November,1885),Bulgarian victory in the [[Serbo-Bulgarian War]] preserves the [[Unification of Bulgaria]].))
Some((Date(28,November,1893),New Zealand becomes the first country in which women vote in a national election.))
Some((Date(28,November,1895),The [[Chicago Times-Herald race|first American automobile race]] takes place over the 54 miles from Chicago's [[Jackson Park (Chicago)|Jackson Park]] to [[Evanston, Illinois]]. [[Frank Duryea]] wins in approximately 10 hours.))
Some((Date(28,November,1899),The [[Second Boer War]]: a British column is engaged by [[Boer]] forces at the [[Battle of Modder River]]; although the Boers withdraw, the British suffer heavy casualties.))
Some((Date(28,November,1905),Irish nationalist [[Arthur Griffith]] founds [[History of Sinn Féin|Sinn Féin]] as a [[political party]] with the main aim of establishing a dual monarchy in Ireland.))
Some((Date(28,November,1907),In [[Haverhill, Massachusetts]], scrap-metal dealer [[Louis B. Mayer]] opens his first [[movie theater]].))
Some((Date(28,November,1908),A mine explosion in [[Marianna, Pennsylvania]], kills 154 men, leaving only one survivor.))
Some((Date(28,November,1909),[[Sergei Rachmaninoff]] makes the debut performance of his [[Piano Concerto No. 3 (Rachmaninoff)|Piano Concerto No. 3]], considered to be one of the most technically challenging [[piano concerto]]s in the standard [[classical music|classical]] repertoire.))
Some((Date(28,November,1910),The Liberal Party, led by [[Eleftherios Venizelos]], wins the [[Greek legislative election, November 1910|second Greek general election of the year]]. ))

Some((Date(28,November,1918),[[Bukovina]] votes for union with the [[Kingdom of Romania]].))
Some((Date(28,November,1919),[[Nancy Astor, Viscountess Astor|Lady Astor]] is elected as a Member of the [[Parliament of the United Kingdom]]. She is the first woman to sit in the [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom|House of Commons]]. ([[Constance Markievicz|Countess Markievicz]], the first to be elected, refused to sit.)))
Some((Date(28,November,1920),[[Irish War of Independence]]: [[Kilmichael Ambush]]: The [[Irish Republican Army]] ambush a convoy of British [[Auxiliary Division|Auxiliaries]] and kill seventeen.))
Some((Date(28,November,1925),The [[Grand Ole Opry]] begins broadcasting in [[Nashville, Tennessee]], as the ''WSM Barn Dance''.))
Some((Date(28,November,1942),In [[Boston, Massachusetts]], a fire in the [[Cocoanut Grove fire|Cocoanut Grove]] nightclub kills 492 people.))

Roosevelt]], British [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|Prime Minister]] [[Winston Churchill]] and Soviet [[Premier of the Soviet Union|Premier]] [[Joseph Stalin]] meet in [[Tehran, Iran]], to discuss war strategy.))

Some((Date(28,November,1964),[[Mariner program]]: [[NASA]] launches the [[Mariner 4]] probe toward [[Mars]].))

Some((Date(28,November,1971),Fred Quilt, a leader of the [[Tsilhqot'in]] [[First Nation]] [[Fred Quilt inquiry|suffers severe abdominal injuries]] allegedly caused by [[Royal Canadian Mounted Police]] officers; he dies two days later.))
Some((Date(28,November,1972),Last executions in Paris: [[Claude Buffet]] and Roger Bontems are guillotined at [[La Santé Prison]]. The chief executioner is [[André Obrecht]]. (Bontems had been found innocent of murder, but as Buffet's accomplice was condemned to death anyway)))
Some((Date(28,November,1975),[[East Timor]] declares its independence from Portugal.))
Some((Date(28,November,1979),[[Air New Zealand Flight 901]], a [[McDonnell Douglas DC-10|DC-10]] sightseeing flight over Antarctica, crashes into [[Mount Erebus]], killing all 257 people on board.))
Some((Date(28,November,1980),[[Iran–Iraq War]]: [[Operation Morvarid]]: The bulk of the [[Iraqi Navy]] is destroyed by the [[Islamic Republic of Iran Navy|Iranian Navy]] in the [[Persian Gulf]]. (Commemorated in Iran as [[Navy Day#Iran|Navy Day]].)))
Some((Date(28,November,1981),[[Our Lady of Kibeho]]: Schoolchildren in [[Kibeho]], [[Rwanda]], experience the first of a series of [[Marian apparition]]s.))
Some((Date(28,November,1987),[[South African Airways Flight 295]] crashes into the Indian Ocean, killing all 159 people on board.))
Some((Date(28,November,1989),[[Cold War]]: [[Velvet Revolution]]: In the face of protests, the [[Communist Party of Czechoslovakia]] announces it will give up its [[monopoly]] on political power.))
Some((Date(28,November,1991),[[South Ossetia]] declares independence from [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]].))
Some((Date(28,November,2002),Suicide bombers [[2002 Mombasa attacks|blow up]] an Israeli-owned hotel in [[Mombasa]], [[Kenya]]; their colleagues fail in their attempt to bring down [[Arkia Israel Airlines Flight 582]] with surface-to-air missiles.))
Some((Date(28,November,2013),A [[2013 Borazjan earthquake|5.6 earthquake]] in [[Iran]] kills seven people and injures 45 others.))
Some((Date(28,November,2014),Gunmen [[2014 Kano bombing|set off three bombs]] at the central mosque in the northern city of [[Kano]] killing at least 120 people.

Some((Date(29,November,1394),The Korean king [[Taejo of Joseon|Yi Seong-gye]], founder of the [[Joseon dynasty]], moves the capital from [[Kaesŏng]] to Hanyang, today known as [[Seoul]].))

Some((Date(29,November,1612),The [[Battle of Swally]] takes place, which loosens the [[Portuguese Empire]]'s hold on India.))
Some((Date(29,November,1729),[[Natchez people|Natchez Indians]] [[Natchez revolt|massacre]] 138 Frenchmen, 35 French women, and 56 children at [[Fort Rosalie]], near the site of modern-day [[Natchez, Mississippi]].))
Some((Date(29,November,1776),[[American Revolutionary War]]: The [[Battle of Fort Cumberland]], [[Nova Scotia]], comes to an end with the arrival of British reinforcements.))
Some((Date(29,November,1777),[[San Jose, California]], is founded as ''Pueblo de San José de Guadalupe'' by [[José Joaquín Moraga]]. It is the first civilian settlement, or ''pueblo'', in [[Alta California]].))
Some((Date(29,November,1781),The crew of the British slave ship ''Zong'' [[Zong massacre|murders 133 Africans]] by dumping them into the sea to claim [[insurance]].))
Some((Date(29,November,1783),A [[1783 New Jersey earthquake|5.3 magnitude earthquake]] strikes [[New Jersey]].))
Some((Date(29,November,1807),[[Transfer of the Portuguese Court to Brazil]]: [[John VI of Portugal]] flees Lisbon from advancing Napoleonic forces during the [[Peninsular War]], transferring the Portuguese court to Brazil.))

Some((Date(29,November,1847),The [[Sonderbund]] is defeated by the joint forces of other Swiss cantons under General [[Guillaume-Henri Dufour]].))
Some((Date(29,November,1850),The treaty, [[Punctation of Olmütz]], is signed in [[Olomouc]]. [[Prussia]] capitulates to [[Austrian Empire|Austria]], which will take over the leadership of the [[German Confederation]].))
Some((Date(29,November,1872),American Indian Wars: The [[Modoc War]] begins with the [[Battle of Lost River]].))

Some((Date(29,November,1899),[[FC Barcelona]] [[Association football]] club is founded.))

Some((Date(29,November,1929),U.S. Admiral [[Richard E. Byrd]] leads the first expedition to fly over the [[South Pole]].))

Some((Date(29,November,1945),The [[Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia]] is declared.))
Some((Date(29,November,1946),The [[Sentral Organisasi Buruh Seluruh Indonesia|All Indonesia Centre of Labour Organizations]] (SOBSI) is founded in [[Jakarta]].))
Some((Date(29,November,1947),[[United Nations Partition Plan for Palestine|Partition Plan]]: The [[United Nations General Assembly]] approves a plan for the partition of [[Mandatory Palestine|Palestine]].))
Some((Date(29,November,1950),[[Korean War]]: [[North Korea]]n and Chinese troops force [[United Nations]] forces to retreat from North Korea.))
Some((Date(29,November,1952),Korean War: U.S. President-elect [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]] fulfills a campaign promise by traveling to Korea to find out what can be done to end the conflict.))
Some((Date(29,November,1963),U.S. President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] establishes the [[Warren Commission]] to investigate the [[assassination]] of President [[John F. Kennedy]].))
Some((Date(29,November,1963),[[Trans-Canada Air Lines Flight 831]] crashes shortly after takeoff from [[Montréal–Pierre Elliott Trudeau International Airport|Montreal-Dorval International Airport]], killing all 118 people on board.))
Some((Date(29,November,1965),The [[Canadian Space Agency]] launches the satellite [[Alouette 2]].))
Some((Date(29,November,1967),[[Vietnam War]]: [[United States Secretary of Defense|U.S. Secretary of Defense]] [[Robert McNamara]] announces his resignation.))
Some((Date(29,November,1972),[[Atari, Inc.|Atari]] announces the release of ''[[Pong]]'', the first commercially successful [[video game]].))
Some((Date(29,November,1975),[[Graham Hill]] and [[Tony Brise]], along with four other members of the [[Embassy Hill]] F1 team, were killed when their plane crashed at [[Arkley]] golf course, England, in thick fog.))
Some((Date(29,November,1986),The [[Military of Suriname|Surinamese military]] attacks the village of [[Moiwana]] during the [[Suriname Guerrilla War]], killing at least 39 civilians, mostly women and children. ))
Some((Date(29,November,1987),[[Korean Air Flight 858]] explodes over the Thai–Burmese border, killing 115.))
Some((Date(29,November,1990),[[Gulf War]]: The [[United Nations Security Council]] passes two resolutions to restore international peace and security if [[Iraq]] does not withdraw its forces from [[Kuwait]] and free all foreign hostages by January 15, 1991.))
Some((Date(29,November,2007),The [[Armed Forces of the Philippines]] lay siege to [[the Peninsula Manila]] after soldiers led by Senator [[Antonio Trillanes]] stage a [[Manila Peninsula Mutiny|mutiny]].))

Some((Date(29,November,2013),[[LAM Mozambique Airlines Flight 470]] crashes in [[Namibia]], killing 33 people.

Some((Date(30,November,1864),[[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Franklin (1864)|Battle of Franklin]]: The Confederate [[Army of Tennessee]] led by General [[John Bell Hood]] mounts a dramatically unsuccessful frontal assault on [[United States|Union]] positions commanded by [[John McAllister Schofield]] around [[Franklin, Tennessee]], with Hood losing six generals and almost a third of his troops. ))

Some((Date(30,November,1954),In [[Sylacauga, Alabama]], United States, the [[Hodges meteorite]] crashes through a roof and hits a woman taking an afternoon nap. This is the only documented case in the [[Western Hemisphere]] of a [[human]] being hit by a rock from space.))

Some((Date(3,December,1912),[[Bulgaria]], Greece, [[Montenegro]], and [[Serbia]] (the [[Balkan League]]) sign an armistice with the [[Ottoman Empire]], temporarily halting the [[First Balkan War]]. (The armistice will expire on February 3, 1913, and hostilities will resume.)))
Some((Date(3,December,1919),After nearly 20 years of planning and construction, including two collapses causing 89 deaths, the [[Quebec Bridge]] opens to traffic.))
Some((Date(3,December,1925),[[World War I]] aftermath: The final [[Locarno Treaties|Locarno Treaty]] is signed in London, establishing post-war territorial settlements.))
Some((Date(3,December,1927),''[[Putting Pants on Philip]]'', the first [[Laurel and Hardy]] film, is released.))
Some((Date(3,December,1944),[[Greek Civil War]]: [[Dekemvriana|Fighting]] breaks out in [[Athens]] between the [[Greek People's Liberation Army|ELAS]] and government forces supported by the British Army.))
Some((Date(3,December,1953),[[United Nations Security Council Resolution 102]] and [[United Nations Security Council Resolution 103]] relating to ICJ is adopted.))
Some((Date(3,December,1959),The current [[flag of Singapore]] is adopted, six months after [[Singapore]] became self-governing within the [[British Empire]].))
Some((Date(3,December,1960),The musical ''[[Camelot (musical)|Camelot]]'' debuts at the [[Majestic Theatre (Broadway)|Majestic Theatre]] on [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]]. It will become associated with the [[John F. Kennedy|Kennedy administration]].))
Some((Date(3,December,1964),[[Free Speech Movement]]: Police arrest over 800 students at the [[University of California, Berkeley]], following their takeover and sit-in at the administration building in protest of the [[Regents of the University of California|UC Regents]]' decision to forbid protests on UC property.))
Some((Date(3,December,1967),At [[Groote Schuur Hospital]] in [[Cape Town]], South Africa, a transplant team headed by [[Christiaan Barnard]] carries out the first [[heart transplant]] on a human (53-year-old [[Louis Washkansky]]).))
Some((Date(3,December,1971),[[Indo-Pakistani War of 1971]]: Pakistan launches [[Operation Chengiz Khan|a pre-emptive strike]] against India and a full-scale war begins claiming hundreds of lives.))
Some((Date(3,December,1973),[[Pioneer program]]: [[Pioneer 10]] sends back the first close-up images of [[Jupiter]].))
Some((Date(3,December,1976),An assassination attempt is made on [[Bob Marley]]. He is shot twice, and plays a [[Smile Jamaica Concert|concert]] two days later.))
Some((Date(3,December,1979),In [[Cincinnati]], 11 fans are suffocated in [[The Who concert disaster|a crush for seats]] on the concourse outside [[Riverfront Coliseum]] before a [[The Who|Who]] concert.))
Some((Date(3,December,1982),A soil sample is taken from [[Times Beach, Missouri]], that will be found to contain 300 times the safe level of [[Polychlorinated dibenzodioxins|dioxin]].))
Some((Date(3,December,1984),[[Bhopal disaster]]: A [[methyl isocyanate]] leak from a [[Union Carbide]] pesticide plant in [[Bhopal]], India, kills more than 3,800 people outright and injures 150,000–600,000 others (some 6,000 of whom would later die from their injuries) in one of the worst industrial disasters in history.))
Some((Date(3,December,1989),[[Cold War]]: In a meeting off the coast of [[Malta]], U.S. President [[George H. W. Bush]] and Soviet leader [[Mikhail Gorbachev]] release statements indicating that the [[Cold War]] between [[NATO]] and the [[Soviet Union]] may be coming to an end.))
Some((Date(3,December,1990),The [[1990 Wayne County Airport runway collision]] kills seven passengers and one crew member.))
Some((Date(3,December,1992),The Greek [[oil tanker]] ''Aegean Sea'', carrying 80,000 tonnes of [[crude oil]], runs aground in a storm while approaching [[A Coruña]], Spain, and [[Aegean Sea oil spill|spills much of its cargo]].))
Some((Date(3,December,1994),The [[PlayStation (console)|PlayStation]] was released in Japan))
Some((Date(3,December,1997),In [[Ottawa]], Canada, representatives from 121 countries sign the [[Ottawa Treaty]] prohibiting manufacture and deployment of [[anti-personnel landmine]]s. The United States, People's Republic of China, and Russia do not sign the treaty, however.))
Some((Date(3,December,1999),[[NASA]] loses radio contact with the [[Mars Polar Lander]] moments before the spacecraft enters the [[Mars|Martian]] atmosphere.))
Some((Date(3,December,2005),[[XCOR Aerospace]] makes the [[Rocket mail#Reusable launch vehicles|first manned rocket aircraft delivery of U.S. Mail]] in [[Kern County, California]].))
Some((Date(3,December,2007),Winter storms cause the [[Chehalis River (Washington)|Chehalis River]] to flood many cities in [[Lewis County, Washington]], and close a 20-mile portion of [[Interstate 5 in Washington|Interstate 5]] for several days.  At least eight deaths and billions of dollars in damages are blamed on the floods.))
Some((Date(3,December,2009),A [[2009 Hotel Shamo bombing|suicide bombing]] at a hotel in [[Mogadishu]], [[Somalia]], kills 25 people, including three ministers of the [[Transitional Federal Government]].))
Some((Date(3,December,2012),At least 475 people are killed after [[Typhoon Bopha]] makes landfall in the [[Philippines]].))
Some((Date(3,December,2014),The Japanese space agency, [[JAXA]], launches the space explorer [[Hayabusa 2]] from the [[Tanegashima Space Center]] on a six-year round trip mission to an [[162173 Ryugu|asteroid]] to collect rock samples.

))
Some((Date(4,December,1110),The [[Kingdom of Jerusalem]] captures [[Siege of Sidon|Sidon]].<!-- Other than a brief reference in the History of Sidon there is no other reference in this site to this event. Reference added - Recommend its review for accuracy. -->))
Some((Date(4,December,1259),Kings [[Louis IX of France]] and [[Henry III of England]] agree to the [[Treaty of Paris (1259)|Treaty of Paris]], in which Henry renounces his claims to French-controlled territory on continental Europe (including [[Normandy]]) in exchange for Louis withdrawing his support for English rebels.))
Some((Date(4,December,1563),The final session of the [[Council of Trent]] is held. (It had opened on December 13, 1545.)))
Some((Date(4,December,1619),Thirty-eight [[colony|colonists]] arrive at [[Berkeley Hundred]], [[Colony of Virginia|Virginia]]. The group's charter proclaims that the day "be yearly and perpetually kept holy as a day of thanksgiving to Almighty God."))
Some((Date(4,December,1674),Father [[Jacques Marquette]] founds a mission on the shores of [[Lake Michigan]] to minister to the [[Illiniwek]]. (The mission would later grow into the city of [[Chicago]].)))
Some((Date(4,December,1676),[[Battle of Lund]]: A Danish army under the command of King [[Christian V of Denmark|Christian V]] engages the Swedish army commanded by Field Marshal [[Simon Grundel-Helmfelt]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1745),[[Charles Edward Stuart]]'s army reaches [[Derby]], its furthest point during the [[Jacobite rising of 1745|Second Jacobite Rising]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1783),At [[Fraunces Tavern]] in New York City, U.S. General [[George Washington]] [[Fraunces Tavern#Washington's farewell to his officers|bids farewell to his officers]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1786),[[Mission Santa Barbara]] is dedicated (on the feast day of [[Saint Barbara]]).))
Some((Date(4,December,1791),The first edition of ''[[The Observer]]'', the world's first Sunday newspaper, is published.))
Some((Date(4,December,1829),In the face of fierce local opposition, British [[Governor-General of India|Governor-General]] [[Lord William Bentinck]] issues a regulation declaring that anyone who abets ''[[suttee]]'' in [[Bengal Presidency|Bengal]] is guilty of [[culpable homicide]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1864),[[American Civil War]]: [[Sherman's March to the Sea]]: At [[Waynesboro, Georgia]], forces under [[United States|Union]] General [[Judson Kilpatrick]] prevent troops led by [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] General [[Joseph Wheeler]] from interfering with Union General [[William T. Sherman]]'s campaign destroying a wide swath of the South on his march to the Atlantic Ocean from [[Atlanta]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1867),Former [[Minnesota]] farmer [[Oliver Hudson Kelley]] founds the Order of the Patrons of Husbandry (better known today as [[National Grange of the Order of Patrons of Husbandry|the Grange]]).))
Some((Date(4,December,1872),The crewless American ship {{ship||Mary Celeste}} is found by the Canadian brig ''Dei Gratia''. The ship had been abandoned for nine days but was only slightly damaged.))
Some((Date(4,December,1875),Notorious New York City politician [[Boss Tweed]] escapes from prison. He will later be recaptured in Spain.))
Some((Date(4,December,1881),The first edition of the ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' is published.))
Some((Date(4,December,1893),[[First Matabele War]]: A patrol of 34 [[British South Africa Company]] soldiers is [[Shangani Patrol|ambushed and annihilated]] by more than 3,000 [[Northern Ndebele people|Matabele]] warriors on the [[Shangani River]] in [[Matabeleland]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1906),[[Alpha Phi Alpha]] the first black intercollegiate Greek lettered fraternity was founded at Cornell University in Ithaca, New York.))
Some((Date(4,December,1909),In [[Canadian football]], the [[1st Grey Cup|First Grey Cup]] game is played. The [[University of Toronto]] [[Toronto Varsity Blues|Varsity Blues]] defeat the [[Toronto Parkdale Canoe Club]], 26–6.))
Some((Date(4,December,1918),U.S. President [[Woodrow Wilson]] sails for the World War I peace talks in [[Palace of Versailles|Versailles]], becoming the first US president to travel to Europe while in office.))
Some((Date(4,December,1921),The first [[Virginia Rappe]] [[manslaughter]] trial against [[Roscoe Arbuckle|Roscoe "Fatty" Arbuckle]] ends in a [[hung jury]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1937),The first issue of the children's comic ''[[The Dandy]]'' is published.))
Some((Date(4,December,1939),[[World War II]]: {{HMS|Nelson|28|6}} is struck by a [[naval mine|mine]] (laid by {{GS|U-31|1936|2}}) off the Scottish coast and is laid up for repairs until August 1940.))
Some((Date(4,December,1942),World War II: [[Carlson's patrol]] during the [[Guadalcanal Campaign]] ends.))
Some((Date(4,December,1943),World War II: In [[Kingdom of Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]], resistance leader Marshal [[Josip Broz Tito]] proclaims a provisional democratic Yugoslav government in-exile.))
Some((Date(4,December,1945),By a vote of 65–7, the [[United States Senate]] approves United States participation in the [[United Nations]]. (The UN had been established on October 24, 1945.)))
Some((Date(4,December,1954),The first [[Burger King]] is opened in [[Miami]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1956),The [[Million Dollar Quartet]] ([[Elvis Presley]], [[Jerry Lee Lewis]], [[Carl Perkins]], and [[Johnny Cash]]) get together at [[Sun Studio]] for the first and last time.))
Some((Date(4,December,1963),[[Pope Paul VI]] promulgates the first two documents approved by the [[Second Vatican Council]]: the [[Sacrosanctum Concilium|Constitution on the Sacred Liturgy]] and the [[Inter mirifica|Decree on the Media of Social Communications]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1967),[[Vietnam War]]: U.S. and [[South Vietnam]]ese forces engage [[Viet Cong]] troops in the [[Mekong Delta]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1969),[[Black Panther Party]] members [[Fred Hampton]] and [[Mark Clark (Black Panther)|Mark Clark]] are shot and killed in their sleep during a raid by 14 Chicago police officers.))
Some((Date(4,December,1971),The [[United Nations Security Council]] calls an emergency session to consider the deteriorating situation between India and [[Pakistan]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1975),[[Suriname]] joins the [[United Nations]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1977),[[Jean-Bédel Bokassa]], president of the [[Central African Republic]], crowns himself Emperor Bokassa I of the [[Central African Empire]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1978),Following the murder of Mayor [[George Moscone]], [[Dianne Feinstein]] becomes [[San Francisco]]'s first female mayor. (She will serve until January 8, 1988.)))
Some((Date(4,December,1979),The Hastie fire in [[Kingston upon Hull|Hull]] kills three schoolboys and eventually leads police to arrest [[Bruce George Peter Lee]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1980),English rock group [[Led Zeppelin]] officially disbands, following the death of drummer [[John Bonham]] on September 25.))
Some((Date(4,December,1981),South Africa grants independence to the [[Ciskei]] "homeland" (not recognized by any government outside South Africa).))
Some((Date(4,December,1982),The People's Republic of China adopts its current [[constitution of the People's Republic of China|constitution]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1984),[[Sri Lankan Civil War]]: [[Sri Lankan Army]] soldiers [[1984 Mannar massacre|kill]] 107–150 civilians in [[Mannar, Sri Lanka|Mannar]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1991),Journalist [[Terry A. Anderson]] is released after seven years in captivity as a hostage in [[Beirut]]. He is the last and longest-held American hostage in [[Lebanon]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1992),[[Somali Civil War]]: President [[George H. W. Bush]] orders 28,000 U.S. troops to [[Somalia]] in [[Horn of Africa|Northeast Africa]].))
Some((Date(4,December,1993),A truce is concluded between the government of [[Angola]] and [[UNITA]] rebels.))
Some((Date(4,December,1998),The ''[[Unity Module]]'', the second module of the [[International Space Station]], is launched.))
Some((Date(4,December,2005),Tens of thousands of people in Hong Kong [[December 2005 protest for democracy in Hong Kong|protest for democracy]] and call on the [[Hong Kong Government|government]] to allow [[universal suffrage|universal and equal suffrage]].))
Some((Date(4,December,2006),[[Jena Six|Six black youths]] assault a white teenager in [[Jena, Louisiana]].))
Some((Date(4,December,2013),[[Xavier Bettel]] becomes [[Luxembourg]]'s first [[openly gay]] [[Prime Minister]].

Some((Date(5,December,1560),[[Charles IX of France|Charles IX]] becomes king of France.))
Some((Date(5,December,1766),In London, [[James Christie (auctioneer)|James Christie]] holds his first sale.))

Some((Date(5,December,1815),Foundation of [[Maceió]], Brazil.))

Some((Date(5,December,1847),[[Jefferson Davis]] is elected to the U.S. senate.))
Some((Date(5,December,1848),[[California Gold Rush]]: In a message to the [[United States Congress]], U.S. President [[James K. Polk]] confirms that large amounts of gold had been discovered in [[California]].))
Some((Date(5,December,1865),[[Chincha Islands War]]: [[Peru]] allies with [[Chile]] against Spain.))
Some((Date(5,December,1876),The [[Brooklyn Theatre fire]] kills at least 278 people in [[Brooklyn]], New York.))
Some((Date(5,December,1916),[[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|British premier]] [[H. H. Asquith]] resigns from his post.))
Some((Date(5,December,1920),[[Dimitrios Rallis]] forms a government in [[Kingdom of Greece|Greece]].))
Some((Date(5,December,1931),[[Cathedral of Christ the Saviour]] in [[Moscow]] was destroyed by an order of [[Joseph Stalin]].))
Some((Date(5,December,1932),German-born Swiss [[physicist]] [[Albert Einstein]] is granted an American [[visa (document)|visa]].))
Some((Date(5,December,1933),[[Prohibition in the United States]] ends: [[Utah]] becomes the 36th U.S. state to ratify the [[Twenty-first Amendment to the United States Constitution]], thus establishing the required 75% of states needed to enact the amendment. (This overturned the [[Eighteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution|18th Amendment]] which had made the manufacture, sale, or transportation of alcohol illegal in the United States.)))
Some((Date(5,December,1934),[[Abyssinia Crisis]]: [[Kingdom of Italy|Italian]] troops attack Wal Wal in [[Ethiopia|Abyssinia]], taking four days to capture the city.))
Some((Date(5,December,1936),The [[Soviet Union]] adopts a new [[1936 Soviet Constitution|constitution]] and the [[Kirghiz Soviet Socialist Republic]] is established as a full [[Republics of the Soviet Union|Union Republic]] of the [[Soviet Union|USSR]].))
Some((Date(5,December,1941),[[World War II]]: In the [[Battle of Moscow]], [[Georgy Zhukov]] launches a massive Soviet counter-attack against the German army, with the biggest offensive launched against Army Group Centre.))
Some((Date(5,December,1943),World War II: Allied air forces begin attacking Germany's secret weapons bases in [[Operation Crossbow]].))
Some((Date(5,December,1945),[[Flight 19]] is lost in the [[Bermuda Triangle]].))
Some((Date(5,December,1952),[[Great Smog]]: A cold fog descends upon London, combining with air pollution and killing at least 12,000 in the weeks and months that follow.))
Some((Date(5,December,1955),The [[American Federation of Labor]] and the [[Congress of Industrial Organizations]] merge and form the [[AFL–CIO]].))
Some((Date(5,December,1957),[[Sukarno]] expels all Dutch people from [[Indonesia]].))
Some((Date(5,December,1958),[[Subscriber trunk dialling|Subscriber Trunk Dialling (STD)]] is inaugurated in the United Kingdom by Queen [[Elizabeth II]] when she speaks to the [[Lord Provost]] in a call from [[Bristol]] to [[Edinburgh]].))
Some((Date(5,December,1964),[[Vietnam War]]: For his heroism in battle earlier in the year, Captain [[Roger Donlon]] is awarded the first [[Medal of Honor]] of the war.))
Some((Date(5,December,1969),The four node [[ARPANET]] network is established.))
Some((Date(5,December,1977),[[Egypt]] breaks diplomatic relations with [[Syria]], [[Libya]], [[Algeria]], [[Iraq]] and [[South Yemen]]. The move is in retaliation for the Declaration of Tripoli against Egypt.))
Some((Date(5,December,1978),The [[Soviet Union]] signs a "friendship treaty" with the [[Democratic Republic of Afghanistan]].))
Some((Date(5,December,1983),Dissolution of the [[National Reorganization Process|Military Junta]] in [[Argentina]].))
Some((Date(5,December,1993),The mayor of [[Vienna]], [[Helmut Zilk]], is injured by a [[letter bomb]].))
Some((Date(5,December,1995),[[Sri Lankan Civil War]]: The [[Sri Lanka]]n government announces the conquest of the [[Tamil people|Tamil]] stronghold of [[Jaffna]].))
Some((Date(5,December,2004),The [[Civil Partnership Act 2004|Civil Partnership Act]] comes into effect in the United Kingdom, and the first [[Civil partnership in the United Kingdom|civil partnership]] is registered there.))
Some((Date(5,December,2005),The [[2005 Lake Tanganyika earthquake|Lake Tanganyika earthquake]] causes significant damage, mostly in the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]].))
Some((Date(5,December,2006),Commodore [[Frank Bainimarama]] overthrows the government in [[Fiji]].))
Some((Date(5,December,2007),[[Westroads Mall shooting]]: A gunman opens fire with a [[semi-automatic rifle]] at an [[Omaha, Nebraska]], mall, killing eight people before taking his own life.))

Some((Date(6,December,1648),Colonel [[Thomas Pride]] of the [[New Model Army]] purges the [[Long Parliament]] of MPs sympathetic to King [[Charles I of England]], in order for the King's trial to go ahead; came to be known as "[[Pride's Purge]]".))
Some((Date(6,December,1704),[[Battle of Chamkaur (1704)]]: During the Mughal-Sikh Wars, an outnumbered [[Khalsa|Sikh Khalsa]] defeats a [[Mughal Empire|Mughal]] army.))

Some((Date(6,December,1904),[[Theodore Roosevelt]] articulated his [[Roosevelt Corollary|"Corollary" to the Monroe Doctrine]], stating that the U.S. would intervene in the Western Hemisphere should Latin American governments prove incapable or unstable.))
Some((Date(6,December,1907),A [[Monongah mining disaster|coal mine explosion]] at [[Monongah, West Virginia]], kills 362 workers.))

Some((Date(6,December,1917),[[Finnish Declaration of Independence|Finland declares independence]] from Russia.))
Some((Date(6,December,1921),The [[Anglo-Irish Treaty]] is signed in London by British and Irish representatives.))
Some((Date(6,December,1922),One year to the day after the signing of the Anglo-Irish Treaty, the [[Irish Free State]] comes into existence.))
Some((Date(6,December,1928),The government of Colombia [[Banana massacre|sends military forces]] to suppress a month-long [[strike action|strike]] by [[United Fruit Company]] workers, resulting in an unknown number of deaths.))
Some((Date(6,December,1933),U.S. federal judge [[John M. Woolsey]] rules that [[James Joyce]]'s novel ''[[Ulysses (novel)|Ulysses]]'' is not obscene.))
Some((Date(6,December,1941),World War II:  The United Kingdom and Canada declare war on Finland in support of the Soviet Union during the [[Continuation War]]. [[Camp X]] opens in [[Canada]] to begin training Allied Secret Agents for the War.))
Some((Date(6,December,1947),The [[Everglades National Park]] in [[Florida]] is dedicated.))
Some((Date(6,December,1953),[[Vladimir Nabokov]] completes his controversial novel ''[[Lolita]]''.))
Some((Date(6,December,1956),A violent [[Blood in the Water match|water polo match]] between Hungary and the USSR takes place during the [[1956 Summer Olympics]] in [[Melbourne]], against the backdrop of the [[Hungarian Revolution of 1956]].))
Some((Date(6,December,1957),[[Project Vanguard]]: A [[Launch pad|launchpad]] explosion of [[Vanguard TV3]] thwarts the first United States attempt to launch a [[satellite]] into Earth orbit.))
Some((Date(6,December,1967),[[Adrian Kantrowitz]] performs the first human heart transplant in the United States.))
Some((Date(6,December,1969),[[Meredith Hunter]] is killed by [[Hells Angels]] during a [[Rolling Stones]] concert at the [[Altamont Speedway]] in [[California]].))
Some((Date(6,December,1971),Pakistan severs diplomatic relations with India, initiating the [[Indo-Pakistani War of 1971]].))
Some((Date(6,December,1973),[[Twenty-fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution|The Twenty-fifth Amendment]]: The [[United States House of Representatives]] votes 387 to 35 to confirm [[Gerald Ford]] as [[Vice President of the United States]]. (On [[November 27]], the [[United States Senate|Senate]] confirmed him 92 to 3.)))

Some((Date(6,December,1977),South Africa grants independence to [[Bophuthatswana]], although it is not recognized by any other country.))
Some((Date(6,December,1978),Spain approves [[Spanish Constitution of 1978|its latest constitution]] in a referendum.))
Some((Date(6,December,1982),The Troubles: The [[Irish National Liberation Army]] [[Droppin Well bombing|bombed a pub]] frequented by British soldiers in [[Ballykelly, County Londonderry|Ballykelly, Northern Ireland]]. It killed eleven soldiers and six civilians.))
Some((Date(6,December,1988),The [[history of the Australian Capital Territory|Australian Capital Territory]] is granted self-government.))
Some((Date(6,December,1989),The [[École Polytechnique massacre]] (or Montreal Massacre): [[Marc Lépine]], an anti-feminist gunman, murders 14 young women at the [[École Polytechnique de Montréal|École Polytechnique]] in [[Montreal]].))
Some((Date(6,December,1991),In [[Croatia]], forces of the [[Yugoslav People's Army]] bombard [[Dubrovnik]] after laying siege to the city since [[May]].))
Some((Date(6,December,1992),The [[Babri Masjid]] in [[Ayodhya]], India, is [[Demolition of the Babri Masjid|demolished]], leading to widespread riots causing the death of over 1,500 people.))
Some((Date(6,December,1997),A Russian [[Antonov An-124]] cargo plane crashes into an apartment complex near [[Irkutsk]], [[Siberia]], killing 67.))
Some((Date(6,December,1998),in [[Venezuela]], [[Hugo Chavez]] is victorious in presidential elections.))
Some((Date(6,December,2005),Several villagers are shot dead during [[Dongzhou protests|protests in Dongzhou]], China.))
Some((Date(6,December,2006),[[NASA]] reveals photographs taken by [[Mars Global Surveyor]] suggesting the presence of liquid [[water on Mars]].))
Some((Date(6,December,2008),The [[2008 Greek riots]] break out upon the killing of a 15-year-old boy, Alexandros Grigoropoulos, by a police officer.))
Some((Date(6,December,2015),[[Venezuela]]n elections are held. For the first time in 17 years the [[United Socialist Party of Venezuela]] loses its majority in parliament.

Some((Date(7,December,1703),The [[Great Storm of 1703]], the greatest windstorm ever recorded in the southern part of Great Britain, makes landfall. Winds gust up to 120&nbsp;mph, and 9,000 people die.))

Some((Date(7,December,1869),American outlaw [[Jesse James]] commits his first confirmed bank robbery in [[Gallatin, Missouri]].))
Some((Date(7,December,1917),[[World War I]]: The United States declares war on [[Austria-Hungary]].))
Some((Date(7,December,1930),[[W1WX|W1XAV]] in [[Boston|Boston, Massachusetts]] telecasts video from the [[CBS]] radio orchestra program, ''The Fox Trappers''. The telecast also includes the first [[Television advertisement|television commercial]] in the United States, an advertisement for I.J. Fox Furriers, who sponsored the radio show.))
Some((Date(7,December,1936),Australian [[cricket]]er [[Jack Fingleton]] becomes the first player to score [[century (cricket)|centuries]] in four consecutive [[Test cricket|Test]] innings.))
Some((Date(7,December,1946),[[Winecoff Hotel fire|A fire at the Winecoff Hotel]] in [[Atlanta|Atlanta, Georgia]], kills 119 people, the deadliest hotel fire in U.S. history.))
Some((Date(7,December,1949),[[Chinese Civil War]]: The [[Government of the Republic of China]] moves from [[Nanjing|Nanking]] to [[Taipei]], [[Taiwan]].))
Some((Date(7,December,1962),Prince [[Rainier III, Prince of Monaco|Rainier III]] of [[Monaco]] revises the [[principality]]'s [[Constitution of Monaco|constitution]], devolving some of his power to advisory and legislative councils.))
Some((Date(7,December,1963),[[Instant replay]] makes its debut during an American [[Army Black Knights football|Army]]–[[Navy Midshipmen football|Navy]] football game.))
Some((Date(7,December,1965),[[Pope Paul VI]] and [[Athenagoras I of Constantinople|Patriarch Athenagoras I]] [[Catholic–Orthodox Joint Declaration of 1965|simultaneously revoke]] mutual [[excommunication]]s that had been in place since [[1054]].))
Some((Date(7,December,1971),[[Pakistan]] President [[Yahya Khan]] announces the formation of a coalition government with [[Nurul Amin]] as Prime Minister and [[Zulfikar Ali Bhutto]] as Deputy Prime Minister.))
Some((Date(7,December,1972),[[Imelda Marcos]] survives an assassination attempt using a [[bolo knife]] against her.   ))
Some((Date(7,December,1975),[[Warschauer Kniefall]] - German Chancellor [[Willy Brandt]] makes a gesture of humility towards the victims of the [[Warsaw Ghetto Uprising]].))
Some((Date(7,December,1982),In [[Texas]], [[Charles Brooks, Jr.]], becomes the first person to be [[capital punishment|executed]] by [[lethal injection]] in the United States.))
Some((Date(7,December,1983),An [[Iberia (airline)|Iberia Airlines]] [[Boeing 727]] collides with an [[Aviaco]] [[McDonnell Douglas DC-9|DC-9]] in dense fog while the two airliners are taxiing down the runway at [[Madrid–Barajas Airport]], killing 93 people.))
Some((Date(7,December,1987),[[Pacific Southwest Airlines Flight 1771]] crashes near [[Paso Robles, California]], killing all 43 on board, after a disgruntled passenger shoots his ex-boss traveling on the flight, then shoots both pilots and himself.))
Some((Date(7,December,1988),[[1988 Armenian earthquake|Spitak earthquake]]: In [[Armenia]] an earthquake measuring 6.8 ([[surface wave magnitude]]) kills more than 25,000, injures 30,000 and leaves 500,000 homeless out of a population of 3,500,000.))
Some((Date(7,December,1993),The Long Island Rail Road massacre: Passenger [[Colin Ferguson (mass murderer)|Colin Ferguson]] murders six people and injures 19 others on the [[Long Island Rail Road|LIRR]] in [[Nassau County, New York]].))
Some((Date(7,December,1995),The [[Galileo (spacecraft)|Galileo spacecraft]] arrives at [[Jupiter]], a little more than six years after it was launched by [[Space Shuttle Atlantis]] during [[STS-34|Mission STS-34]].))
Some((Date(7,December,1999),''[[A&M Records, Inc. v. Napster, Inc., 114 F.Supp.2d 896|A&M Records, Inc. v. Napster, Inc.]]'': The [[Recording Industry Association of America]] sues the [[peer-to-peer]] [[file sharing|file-sharing]] service [[Napster]], alleging [[copyright infringement]].))
Some((Date(7,December,2003),The [[Conservative Party of Canada]] is officially registered, following the merger of the [[Canadian Alliance]] and the [[Progressive Conservative Party of Canada]].))
Some((Date(7,December,2005),[[Rigoberto Alpizar]], a passenger on American Airlines Flight 924 who allegedly claimed to have a bomb, is shot and killed by a team of U.S. [[Federal Air Marshal Service|federal air marshals]] at [[Miami International Airport]].))
Some((Date(7,December,2006),A [[2006 London tornado|tornado]] strikes [[Kensal Green]], North West London, seriously damaging about 150 properties.))
Some((Date(7,December,2007),The [[2007 South Korea oil spill|''Hebei Spirit'' oil spill]] begins in South Korea after a crane barge that had broken free from a tug collides with the [[Oil tanker#Size categories|Very Large Crude Carrier]], ''Hebei Spirit''.

Some((Date(8,December,1660),A woman (either [[Margaret Hughes]] or [[Anne Marshall]]) appears on an English public stage for the first time, in the role of [[Desdemona]] in a production of Shakespeare's play ''[[Othello]]''.))
Some((Date(8,December,1813),Premiere of [[Symphony No. 7 (Beethoven)|Beethoven's Seventh Symphony]].))

Some((Date(8,December,1927),The [[Brookings Institution]], one of the United States' oldest [[think tank]]s, is founded through the merger of three organizations that had been created by philanthropist [[Robert S. Brookings]].))

Some((Date(8,December,1962),Workers at four New York City newspapers (this later increases to nine) [[1962–63 New York City newspaper strike|go on strike]] for 114 days.))
Some((Date(8,December,1963),[[Pan Am Flight 214]], a [[Boeing 707]], is struck by [[lightning]] and crashes near [[Elkton, Maryland]], killing all 81 people on board.))
Some((Date(8,December,1966),The Greek ship {{SS|Heraklion}} sinks in a storm in the [[Aegean Sea]], killing over 200.))
Some((Date(8,December,1969),An [[Olympic Airways]] [[Douglas DC-6]] [[Olympic Airways Flight 954|strikes a mountain]] outside of [[Keratea]], Greece, killing 90&mdash;the worst crash of a DC-6.))
Some((Date(8,December,1971),[[Indo-Pakistani War of 1971|Indo-Pakistani War]]: The [[Indian Navy]] [[Operation Python|launches an attack]] on [[West Pakistan]]'s port city of [[Karachi]].))
Some((Date(8,December,1972), [[United Airlines Flight 553]], a [[Boeing 737]], crashes after aborting its landing attempt at [[Chicago Midway International Airport]], killing 45.  The crash is the first-ever loss of a Boeing 737.))
Some((Date(8,December,1974),A [[Greek republic referendum, 1974|plebiscite]] results in the abolition of [[Monarchy of Greece|monarchy in Greece]].))
Some((Date(8,December,1980),[[John Lennon]] [[Death of John Lennon|is murdered]] by [[Mark David Chapman]] in front of [[The Dakota]] in New York City.))
Some((Date(8,December,1982),In [[Suriname]], [[December murders|several opponents of the military government are killed]].))
Some((Date(8,December,1987),The [[Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty]] is signed.))

Rogers]] proposes [[Rogers Plan|his plan]] for a ceasefire in the [[War of Attrition]]; Egypt and Jordan accept it over the objections of the [[Palestine Liberation Organization|PLO]], which leads to [[Black September in Jordan|civil war in Jordan]] in September 1970.))

Some((Date(10,December,1508),The [[War of the League of Cambrai|League of Cambrai]] is formed by [[Pope Julius II]], [[Louis XII of France]], [[Maximilian I, Holy Roman Emperor]] and [[Ferdinand II of Aragon]] as an alliance against [[Venice]].))
Some((Date(10,December,1510),[[Portuguese conquest of Goa]]: Portuguese naval forces under the command of [[Afonso de Albuquerque]], and local mercenaries working for privateer [[Timoji]], seize Goa from the [[Adil Shahi dynasty|Bijapur Sultanate]], resulting in 451 years of Portuguese colonial rule.))

Some((Date(10,December,1817),[[Mississippi]] becomes the 20th [[U.S. state]].))

Some((Date(10,December,1868),The first [[traffic light]]s are installed, outside the [[Palace of Westminster]] in London. Resembling [[railway signal]]s, they use [[Railway semaphore signal|semaphore]] arms and are illuminated at night by red and green [[gas lamp]]s.))
Some((Date(10,December,1869),The [[Kappa Sigma]] Fraternity is founded at the University of Virginia.))
Some((Date(10,December,1877),[[Russo-Turkish War (1877–78)]]: The Russian Army [[Siege of Plevna|captures Plevna]] after a 5-month siege. The garrison of 25,000 surviving [[Ottoman Empire|Turks]] surrenders. The Russian victory is decisive for the outcome of the war and the [[Liberation of Bulgaria]].))
Some((Date(10,December,1884),[[Mark Twain]]'s ''[[Adventures of Huckleberry Finn]]'' is published.))

Some((Date(10,December,1898),[[Spanish–American War]]: The [[Treaty of Paris (1898)|Treaty of Paris]] is signed, officially ending the conflict.))
